The pool adults only, was not clearly indicated, so there were kids and the lifeguard doesn’t say anything. The good  seats were blocked  early morning, and the lifeguard did not do anything against it, as he was also blocking for some people. Obviously not enough room for the many people in the hotel.

The hotel is huge rooms are very nice ..plenty of swimming pools on the beachfront...security is good no one can walk on the hotel grounds if they are staying here..was on all inclusive package so buffet had a huge selection of choice..staff are friendly and helpful.

reviews.review_title: incredible stay at Jaz Tour Khalef in Sousse
reviews.review_text: The staff were warm and welcoming from the start, and the service throughout was excellent. The room was clean, comfortable, and had a beautiful sea view😍The hotel itself is stunning—lush gardens, a large pool, and direct access to a clean, sandy beach. The food was fresh and varied, with delicious Tunisian and international options at every meal,  the entertainment team did a fantastic job keeping the atmosphere fun without being intrusive.Overall, a perfect mix of relaxation and hospitality. I highly recommend it to anyone visiting Tunisia👌

Amazing place. Friendly staff and great food. Lovely beach area with lots of great views. Definitely recommend it in the summer when the water is hot in the swimming pools and the sea. We stayed more in the indoor pool  We cannot wait to get back there next year.

First time on family holiday and have had the best time.  10/10 hotel to stay in.  Staff exceptionally good and helpful with everything and will always be there for anything you need. Rooms 10/10 Top staff and 10/10 to. Willy, Alex, Faro (lifeguard) & Malek.

Amazing place to stay. Staff are very welcoming and friendly always smiling and helping us  Great food great service lovely view amazing activities to   Pool lovely and seaside outside the hotel amazing place   Room was amazing very homely  Love it

The services are not of quality! Food, hygiene, quality of service inside the hotel there is nothing extraordinary! The hotel does not deserve its stars it is a hotel that deserves 3 stars simply! Don't waste your money!

Animation staff are brilliant, always smiling and happy and make you feel welcome and special, all the staff are lovely and attentive. Room view was not the best and room dated but it clean, fresh towels.  Lots of sun beds, pool clean and tidy and bar staff always lovely. Food good enough choice.

Good hotel but food could be better as there is a very low variety of options to choose from . Overall the hospitality by the staff is good and welcoming and service was good . The rooms could have better light and AC Facility. Staff over all is amazing

This is not a 5 star hotel. It’s 3 stars. It’s a very basic all inclusive resort. Not luxury but if you are happy with that and set your expectations then you could have a great holiday here.   However based on other reviews that I read prior to going on this holiday. I’ve since understood why there are so many 5 star reviews. The hotel staff have a review day once per week and will come over to you to ask you to leave a review and watch whilst you do it - they also ask again at check out hence why there are so many 5* reviews. It’s not a very honest representation of the hotel. So here is an honest representation-   Hotel-   The hotel itself is nice. The reception area is grand and decorated well, incorporating the Tunisian vibe. However this changes when you get to the floors where the rooms are. Hallways are drab, carpets old, very outdated and you could easily get lost as the room number signs are not signposted very well.  We were on 5th floor at the far end of the hallway and above the staff entrance and beside the staff lift. It was very noisy from 5am onwards and our room/corridor often smelled of smoke from workers having cigarette breaks.   Staff -   For the most part, the staff were nice. I am a blonde female so noticed heightened attention and male staff wanting to converse more when my partner was not by my side. This made me uncomfortable but I wasn’t ever left on my own for too long.   Pool waiters were great. If you tip them then they will continue to come back every so often to ask if you need anything else. I did notice the complete difference when we did not tip.   At the Dining Hall. There was a lovely older man called Hassan who reserved a table for us at every lunch and dinner, as well as pouring our usual drinks for our arrival.   Food -   The food was very basic. The fresh pizza and pasta counter saved the day for me. However, that did mean I ate the same pizza and pasta everyday for a week and I wouldn’t describe myself as a fussy eater.  A lot of the time the food wasn’t labelled properly or in English, or at all. It was a lucky dip for what you were actually eating.  I had picked up what I assumed was meatballs and they were actually tuna balls. The utensils are also contaminated as they seem to share a set of tongs for a few different dishes. Worth knowing if you have fish allergies etc.   Drinks-   Drinks on all inclusive weren’t great. Local alcohol only. Cocktails didn’t taste particularly nice and were always too strong. The drinks menu was also very basic and it would have been nice to have more variety or even for the cocktails to just taste as expected. They seemed to have a strong chemical taste to them.  The option to even upgrade to all inclusive plus to allow nicer drinks would have been welcomed.   Entertainment-   The entertainment was pretty poor to be honest. Most shows were put on by the animation team, they seemed unorganised and were not particularly crowd pleasers.  The interactive entertainment such as karaoke, bingo and competitions were better received.  However, the hotel should definitely invest in the entertainment and spend more money to get outside entertainment in for a few days a week as after dinner time there is not much else to do.  If there was some music in the lobby bar then that would have made the atmosphere better.   Animation Team -   The Animation Team were always fine with me, but like I said - I was with my partner. I was made aware of issues that separate groups holidaying at the same time (young girls, holidaying without their boyfriends) had issues. They were pestered and felt uncomfortable by some comments and actions. They were cornered and followed by some members of the animation team and I’m sure there were explicit comments made to them. So this changed my view on the animation team as it’s a bit unsettling that they assume that behaviour is okay!  I’m sure this issue was brought to the attention of management at the time and nothing was seen to be done about it.   Although Freddie on the animation team was a sweet boy and I only ever heard nice things about him. I think the actions of a few members on the team are a liability for the hotel and that should be addressed.   Room -   Basic room, nothing extravagant but always clean and the maid always left a nice display with the towels and some flowers.  Annoyed that there was no air-con. One of the days was 34 degrees. We asked at the reception for our air-con to be switched on and were told it wouldn’t come on for anyone until 15th June. We later discovered this was false information and a few other holidaymakers got the air-con turned on. Which was annoying, as when you pay for a service you expect it in its entirety and not for other guests to receive preferential treatment.   Trying to sleep in the heat with no air-con was not exactly a comfortable experience.   Little things as well - such as, the tv didn’t connect to wifi so could not be used as a smart tv - so if the entertainment was rubbish (most nights) then you couldn’t even go back to the room to watch a film.  And - I don’t know what genius designed the bathroom but in our room the door stop was placed directly where you would step out of the shower.   Excursions at the hotel -  We booked to do quad biking, jet skis and dolphin spotting with the hotel.  They were good experiences- but just make sure you have travel insurance before partaking.   We were a little disappointed in the dolphin trip as we only saw one or two from a far distance but I think the staff that run the excursion could have taken some food for the dolphins to attract them to the boat. Instead they just drove around looking for one in the distance and then chase it. Overall was nice to see a dolphin but I’m sure a better experience could have been had.   In conclusion - we paid around £850 per person for a week here and I do not think it was worth it. I feel like we could have got better elsewhere for the money we spent and I do not think I would return.

good quality hotel , good food ... good location Mahdia is a very safe and residential city , we especially appreciated the really impeccable and very welcoming staff , the smile of Mrs Fapen and her good humor   Thank you and see you soon

The hotel is very big and clean. The food was a amazing and delicious , I like the fresh fish , today is my24 birthday and the staff make my birthday very special and they are happy for me , the restaurant staff decorat my table and the room was very lovely decorated , thanks for the bar staff for the good service .

C is a 3 stars and not a 5 Everything sucks  Never go there  Only the servers are good I Reception is null Animations suck  Food esy infected Everything fake Shame on TunisiaThe beach service could be sweet when we need them The location is shabby Quality zero price No atmosphere

reviews.review_title: Best place to stay in Tunisia
reviews.review_text: Hotel was amazing, much more than welcome expected. The staff can't do enough to ensure you have the best holiday. Food excellent, and a beautiful place to stay. Not to forget the amazing cleaning staff, everyday a new creation made for us from towels. Reception staff always eager to please. I will definitely return

This is a lovely hotel. From the moment you enter the cavanus highly decorated and carved reception area you are so warmly welcomed by the staff. Everything about this hotel was so clean we were actually rather taken as we're very used to Egypt where hygiene is not, generally, so good. We had a Superior Double room but made an error on booking! We had booked a 'city view' by mistake which meant looking out over rooftops with a busy road right outside. This meant the noise of mopeds at all hours. Due to this we paid for an upgrade the following day to a sea view which we absolutely loved. Both rooms were immaculate and very spacious. Housekeeping was great and we loved the towel art. We generally tip every couple of days and we reap the rewards of above average service, which we feel is appropriate though we know some don't believe in doing this!   We booked 2x Al a carte while we were there (Italian and Tunisian) - the Italian was very bland unseasoned and no taste. No menus are offered so you don't know what each part of your fixed menu was and the food was just dumped on the table with no explanation of what was served. At the start I asked for a vodka and tonic and just received a stern reply of 'beer of wine'. I went to the bar to get my own drink. Such an awful experience we walked out past way through and cancelled the second booking. We spoke to other couples who had the same issues and also walked out!   Rim (lady server) on the main bar was very nice and always had a smile.   Abdala who served around the the pool was, again, always happy, smiling and he was always joking around with us and making our stay fun.   Worst white wine we've ever had in any hotel. We couldn't believe how bad the white wine was.   Sahara on reception was another team member worthy of note as she was very helpful.   Tea and coffee and water in room. There wasn't any unless you asked. Well, you got one bottle of water to stay but it wasn't replenished. You had to get your own water from the bar. Such a basic for a 5* hotel and really needs to be addressed.   Shower was very inconsistent and even getting an engineer in to fix it didn't work. Nothing worse than a shower that keeps going from hot to cold even after getting an engineer to our room.   No dressing table area with mirror and light in either room. Again, such a basic for a 5* hotel.   Animation team wear very drab colours and look like bar staff and waiters so it wasn't obvious who was who. They are really active but just don't stand out.   Real fresh juice in breakfast was a lovely bonus. And the general choices for all meals was very high and very fresh.   Love the music by the pool and in the bar. Classics sung in a totally new ballad way.   There is nothing outside this hotel other than a restaurant a few hundred yards away (which is awsome). All in all we found this to be a lovely hotel but definitely not a 5* experience

My review as a British Asian Muslim (Halal dietary requirements) family with a 3 year old toddler:  Room (Standard Double Room) Pros: •	Room is clean, spacious, very happy with it. •	Bed was firm but nice since I liked firm beds, I slept well. •	Sofa bed was nice (firm) •	Balcony •	TV is great and modern with all the apps you need •	Small drying rack - albeit it's good that there is one •	Plug is 2 round pin euro style Cons: •	A/C is too weak for the size of the rooms. Luckily it wasn't too hot when we went but if it was hotter I wouldn’t know what I'd do.  •	The beds are two mattresses which are joined together which are common in hotels, so they can come apart sometimes if you move around a lot. It didn't bother me, but some people find it annoying. You just have to make sure nobody is sleeping in the middle of the separation between mattresses, as when someone is on the separation then the beds come apart. •	Housekeeping don’t replace water in rooms by default, had to call reception and ask.   Food & Drink Pros: •	Restaurant food was great – tasty and the quality is high. •	The local Tunisian food options were interesting and nice. •	They served freshly grilled lamb chops on one of the days which were delicious •	The desserts are better than other all-inclusive restaurants I’ve stayed at – but the desserts are mostly the same every day. •	Overall – the variety is somewhat a little lower than other places I’ve stayed, but it didn’t bother me as there is still a decent amount of variety and the food that they do have is of high quality and tasty. •	The non-alcoholic drinks at the bars are good •	They serve slush which is nice on a hot day! Cons: •	Nothing to eat outside of restaurant hours so didn’t feel fully all inclusive - I think this is due to the beach bar being closed and the snack bars in general not being open till late. When I called reception, they just said that I need to order room service. •	No tea and coffee at restaurant during lunch and dinner (only breakfast) •	Some of the drinks are a little strong on syrup/sugar in particular the mocha. It’s funny because most all-inclusive places are too watered down, but this place did the opposite it seems! •	Even though the food was nice, there wasn’t as much variety as we have seen in other all-inclusive resorts in other countries. My wife got a bit bored by the end (I was fine). It would be nice to have more variation over the week. Something like steak or burger night would be quite cool. Also, if the Tunisian dishes varied a little more during the week it would be nice. •	Beach bar was closed until June which was a big negative for us since we like having the option of eating lunch by the sea instead of having to go to the restaurant   Beach & Pools Pros: •	Beach is really nice in general, white sands and a nice breeze, very relaxing. The water is quite rough in May it seems, but that’s of no fault of the hotel obviously. But couldn’t go in with my child and swim etc. •	Not a huge number of sunbeds but we didn’t struggle to find any since we went off season. Not sure how this would be in the busy season. •	Beach Touters (please don’t judge them, and please be empathetic towards them!) are nowhere near as aggressive as other countries I’ve visited. They are respectful. I really enjoyed conversing with them and bought lots of stuff I didn’t need from them just to help them out to be honest. They were selling some cool scarves, so we bought those. I personally have a lot of respect for them even if they can come across a little pushy since they are usually poor and are doing their best to feed their families walking up and down a baking hot beach all day. •	There is a really nice heated indoor pool which we spent a lot of our time in. They keep the water really warm, and my child absolutely loved it. In May it wasn’t too busy, but I can imagine in busy months it could get busier. •	We didn’t try the outdoor pool as it was a little cool and we preferred the heated indoor pool, but it looked gorgeous, and a lot of people were really enjoying it. Cons: •	Can be a little unkept in some parts with seaweed. In other 5-star hotels we've been to as they usually have someone cleaning up things like seaweed to neaten it up. •	Beach touters: they [the beach touters] are 10 times less aggressive and more respectful than beach touters I’ve come across in other countries.    Amenities Pros: •	Laundry is affordable •	Children's playroom was great, my daughter loved it •	Not all signs have English, but that is Mahdia in general and not just the hotel Cons: •	No iron in the whole hotel •	Towel deposits cost 50 dinars for each towel and since you can't take the money out of Tunisia it becomes tricky to do anything with it except give it away in tips (seems dishonestly convenient from their side... doesn’t look good). Since you’ll be returning the towels just before leaving the hotel and that doesn't give you time to do anything with it. •	Deposits for a beach towel doesn't seem like a 5-star hotel sort of thing to do and doesn't really give a good impression to be honest but I understand that maybe these towels keep going “missing” and maybe that is why they have to enforce it. •	But if they must do it, they should allow you to do it in a different more convenient way such as paying with your own currency and not dinar or do it via bank funds so it can just be refunded or released back into your bank account. Otherwise, it just looks like a money grab for tips...   Staff & Service Pros: •	Housekeeping to a great job at keeping the room and hotel very clean •	Check-in process itself was fine even though we didn’t really get an early check in and had to wait an hour for our room to be ready. •	The staff in general are professional and really friendly. •	The staff do mostly speak English, but there will be sometimes where you may need to get Google Translate out since they are more Arabic/French speakers which make sense since those are the languages spoken in the country. •	The hotel in general is very popular with French people. •	If you want to tip, I suggest 5 dinars per tip. I gave 10 most of the time as I didn’t have 5 dinars in change, but a 5-dinar tip is sufficient. •	The best thing about the staff is they don’t expect it or act funny if you don’t tip. And you feel as though it isn’t necessary to tip - which is how it should be. And they are super grateful if you do tip as it is a lot for them. They are nice and respectful to you regardless which is not the same for other countries I've visited in the same region of the world. Cons: •	If you arrive early before check-in you may have to wait a while like we did to get your room. We arrived at about 1.30pm and had to wait about an hour for our room to be ready. •	One guy at the reception was extremely rude. He called me over aggressively when he mistook me for a different guest, and when he realised it wasn’t the guest he was looking for, he didn’t apologise or anything. Wish I got his name, but I didn’t. I only ever saw him that once to be fair, thankfully. •	Bad Iberostar app - hasn't updated with the latest information such as the beach bar being closed. Functionality like chat with reception doesn’t work. •	Signing in to the Iberostar App is a huge pain, you need to input all your details for every guest including things like passport number.   Cleanliness & Maintenance Pros: •	The hotel rooms and grounds are kept very clean and look impressive. Cons: •	Beach could do with a little more maintenance with seaweed. •	Maintenance staff were lazy and didn’t want to address our bath/sink blockage properly.   Toiletries & Bathroom Pros: •	Our bathroom was very clean and nice to use overall. Had a bath with shower which some people don’t like – but it didn’t bother me. Cons: •	Our bath and sink plug for some reason didn’t fit, and when it was inserted into the basins it ended up completely blocking the sink. So had to leave it them plugs completely removed which wasn’t very nice as you can see into the sink holes. I called maintenance and the guy basically just dismissed me and said to keep it off and there’s nothing wrong with it. He said that it’s ‘OK’ that the bath and sink get blocked. Not very 5-star at all. Very lazy behaviour from the maintenance team. •	Body cream is heavily fragranced - not good for sensitive skin. Should use non-fragranced cream instead. •	Toilet paper is very thin.   Location Pros: •	The resort is very close to Mahdia’s old historical town. A 30 min walk or 5 min taxi (10 dinar we paid, but I didn’t haggle since it’s cheap as it is, but you might be able to go cheaper if you haggle more). The old town is gorgeous and quaint. Quiet. Relaxing to walk around and look at the beautiful buildings and beach. Pottery shops are so cool and beautiful, although I read on the internet that they may be finished with lead-based paint so probably shouldn’t use it for food, just decoration. But not sure if that’s true. There are a few beautiful things to see such as the Burj al-Kebir, the lighthouse, the archaeological museum, ancient sea gate of Mahdia, Great Fatimid Mosque, Shifa al-Kahla. In terms of the shopping, the vendors in general do inflate their prices, but in my experience it’s nowhere near as bad as other countries. And they are way less pushy. Just a much better environment in general and haggling is more fun than other countries I’ve been to since the vendors are more respectful (even if they are trying to rip you off a little) Cons: •	Cobblestone not great for travel prams •	The closest international airport is Enfidha which is a 1.5-2-hour drive away so it is a little far.  •	The surrounding area is a little run down, but it didn’t bother me.  •	Even though the surrounding area is probably fine and the people are nice enough, I wouldn’t walk around the local areas with family etc. I only ever ventured out on my own when walking through the local areas. There are poor people around and sometimes they will follow you and ask for money etc which in itself doesn’t bother me myself, but I didn’t feel comfortable exposing my family to that.   Airport & Transfer Pros: •	Enfidha airport on arrival was simple, quick. Good experience. Cons: •	For your inbound return flight, go a little earlier than you would normally (we went 2.5 hours early) since they inconveniently do not allow you to check in online. You must queue to check in manually at the airport, which took about 30 minutes for us. Factor this exra time into your travels. •	On inbound journey back to the UK, staff at Enfidha airport security are very rude, rushing you along etc. •	Airport transfer takes 2 hours without toll, and 1.5 hours through the M’saken toll. If you book a private transfer, make sure you tell them you want to go through the toll since on the way to the hotel my driver ended up going the long way... don’t know why... maybe to save a few dinars. This really annoyed me since I paid good money for that transfer and they still cheaped out. So, make sure you specify that you want to go the quicker way. Recommended Local Taxi Driver: •	My taxi driver which was reliable and really nice:   Name: Fakri   Number: 0021626796965

Just back from a week long stay, here is my honest review.  From landing at Enfidha Airport we were around 3 hours to the hotel which was a long journey but we knew when we booked it that this would be the case which is a shame as Monastir Airport is relatively closer but there were no flights to there from Scotland.  We were greeted by the staff who took our bags up to our room for us, the rooms were lovely and we had a sea view which was outstanding. The maids changed our towels and beds everyday but went the extra mile with the lovely towel art. Can’t fault the rooms.  The pool was lovely and spacious and the service round the pool was amazing, before we had finished our drinks the bar staff would come over with fresh drinks all day long, possibly some of the best service I’ve ever had. The animation team done a great job keeping everyone entertained and a special mention to the water polo which was very competitive but lots of fun.  The food at lunch and dinner was nice, not exceptional but really good and lots on offer if you are a fussy eater.   The night time entertainment was a laugh and the animation team done a good job at the comedy nights by the getting the crowd up and involved. Once again as soon as You finished a drink they were over asking if you wanted more drinks.  Only a couple of negatives to take away from our trip:  The breakfast, it wasn’t to our taste which does not mean it is bad but it’s a lot more continental which included pastries, fresh fruit and vegetables. We lived on omelets and scrambled eggs all week😂.   The cocktails were sometimes non drinkable and tasted nothing like what they should have been. These are vodka and then they are put into a machine and the machine adds the mixers. We ordered strawberry daiquiris and pina coladas, these tasted nothing like what they should have but again this may be because they are poured out of a machine.  And last of all was the horse and carriage outside the hotel, I love animals and was saddened to see the horse stand outside in the heat with no constant water supply, I actually did not see the horse receive water once and I would regularly check. I just hope the horses are looked after.  These are the only downfalls to take away.   Apart from these it was a magnificent stay and I would 100% return as the service was excellent.

All the staff are friendly and kind, room and pool area is welcoming and lovely, very close to the beach and amazing food!! The staff make sure everyone is included and with brilliant entertainment. The room service is also very personal and well done.

reviews.review_title: First and not last time in Tunisia
reviews.review_text: The hotel is very big and clean  All the staff arw freindly  Iam here with my brother and his wife we realy have a great time this is our first time in tunisia and we just love this beautiful county we stayed a week here and we just stayed at the hotel because thers all activities to enjoy here we stay on the beach on the pool we do activities with the animations team they are lovely thanks for every one who help to make our holiday amazing and lovely . See you soon Tunisia

We had a great stay at this hotel. Upon arrival, we were greeted with a smile by a warm and professional team. The room was spacious, very clean and nicely decorated, with very comfortable bedding.  The meal was varied and hearty, with fresh and quality products. We particularly enjoyed "the view from the terrace"  Many thanks to all the staff for their availability and kindness throughout the stay. We highly recommend this property and will be back with pleasure!

reviews.review_title: Exceptional stay at the hotel mansour mahdia
reviews.review_text: We highly recommend the hotel mansour mahdia , Exceptional stay in this property that deserves all its stars. Excellent welcome, comfortable rooms, tasty food and impeccable facilities. An experience to be repeated very soon.

A warm and very professional welcome, the staff, all requests are well taken care of and with a smile on top. A big bravo to all the staff. Hygiene is there, the animation is dynamic and the meals are good.

The location of the hotel is excellent by the sea. panoramic views of the pool and the sea. The food is really delicious. Restaurant employees at the top .really hotel to recommend for families and couples .a big thank you for the staff

Great hotel thank you. qA big thank you to all the Royal Mansour Mahdia team for an unforgettable stay! Special mention to the animation team which was exceptional: always smiling, dynamic and with little care, especially with the children. Our little ones had fun every day thanks to the varied and well supervised activities. A real plus for families! A special thank you to Maya (Mimi) for her kindness, energy and attention to the children — she created a real complicity with them, and it is priceless.

We are just back from the Iberostar Waves Averroes we had a great time the hotel was just great the staff couldn’t do enough for you. The entertainments team work hard at keeping everyone happy without being too pushy.  The restaurant and food were outstanding and you can also go to the Tunisian A’ la Carte which we absolutely loved.  The all inclusive drinks package covers enough different drinks to keep most folks happy, the bar staff turn to a couple of times a week and have cocktails poolside and in foyer.  The rooms are a decent size and the cleaning staff work hard to keep everything extremely clean and tidy.  They were replacing all the carpets on all floors while we were there it was not intrusive and they worked hard to cause minimal disruption.

The service was top, welcoming and kind all over the StarFriends team, the bar waiters for the meal was vast and delicious, the friendly entourage, when we arrived the welcome service was kind and already waiting for us , the room is already prepared and clean , the pools clean and easy access to the sea, the only negative was the absence of the shower at the sanitary level.

reviews.review_title: Nice holiday with very good value for money
reviews.review_text: Rooms are big and clean maid very attentive.Service in restaurant great.All staff very nice and warm. Best of all, the guys from the pool bar are very good and very service oriented.Especially Achmed best man.

Been back home for about a week now haven't had the chance to do a review until now, never done a review before but I'll try my best for you if you're going here or thinking about it, me and my girlfriend went here for a week I'll try to give our overall experience not just the hotel.  The airport is probably the worst I've ever been too arriving was fine waited a while for cases but departure is even worse one shop to buy a drink and the queue was a mile long. easyJet was great for the transfer no issues there got us on the coach quick only downside was the driver begging us for a tip when we got to the hotel and I mean proper begging then storming off when we explained we had no cash yet. It's a closed currency so our plan was to find a cash machine when we got there which we did it's only around the corner from the hotel. The hotel is lovely and the receptionists are great we got checked in by Aymen and he was brilliant even gave us a discount for a trip we booked always smiling too. We had to wait a little bit for the room to be ready we had a first floor room with a garden view, the garden and flowers are lovely but privacy wasn't great gardeners were often outside working away so we had to keep the curtains closed a lot of the time sometimes a cleaner would randomly appear at the doors too picking all the flowers which im guessing they're using for decorating the bed for people that tip them. The best thing about the hotel is the staff they're all brilliant and lovely especially the waiters they work very hard. The food is nice at first but it gets a bit boring and you notice that some of yesterday's dinner has become the next days lunch but that's cheap all inclusive I suppose, I also came back home slightly unwell but I was fine for the time I was there just the last day and journey home I didn't feel too great. The outside restaurant by the pool is very nice if you're just sunbathing and don't want to rush in for lunch, it's open for a while so can go over whenever you fancy but I noticed the sauces had quite a few dead bugs in them so avoid them. Tunisian night in the main restaurant was brilliant probably when I ate the most, breakfast is very nice too kind of the same stuff every day but the Tunisian doughnuts are amazing you just have to be quick because they're very popular especially with the kids. Desserts are brilliant too always some nice cakes and pastries, drinks are good too proper stuff in glass bottles. Outside the hotel was pretty much hell for us when you leave and turn right to go to a cash machine or the sunflower shop there's guys with horses and carriages that pester you so you have to get past them, we had two people walk up to us claiming to work in the hotel and when I laughed and said no you don't they ran off which is a bit strange. The shop people don't leave you alone they do anything to draw you into a conversation touching my tattoos or asking about my trainers (don't wear nice expensive shoes just wear sliders I learnt the hard way), I did actually need some little bit so I went into a couple of shops and one guy was just trying to rip me off constantly so make sure you know the exchange rates, they offer things for free aswell just to try rope you into buying more stuff he was walking around just filling up carrier bags with stuff and didn't stop even when I said I'm not interested and don't want any of it. In another shop the guy gave us a big sob story about how it's low season and they're really struggling which I understand but his shop is tiny and didn't have much so we left and for the rest of our trip he would stand on the corner whenever he seen us and would stare at us I'm a big guy too so not sure why he was trying to be intimidating 😂, if you're going to go to any shops stick to the sunflower you'll see it it's blue and got massive signs its just a bit tricky to get there as you have to get past all the pestering shops and the quick way to it is blocked off for some strange reason guessing the locals have done it so you've got no choice but to go past the pesterers but the sunflower has everything the same stuff as the other shops and snacks drinks sweets etc and it's all fixed price no pestering just get your stuff and go the till. We booked a couple of trips whilst we were there one was with a guy who walks around in the morning calling himself "the captain" because apparently he's the captain of his boats which turned out to be not true he's just the salesman, he gave us two options action or relax we wanted a chill holiday so chose relax he said nice catamaran trip no less the 5 people with drinks and lunch included and guess what? It wasn't relaxing there was about 25 of us on the catamaran and most were french teenagers going absolutely crazy im surprised none of them ended up overboard, the sea was not calm we was getting bounced around for ages and a few people felt sick. Drinks included Fanta coke and sprite which came in a little plastic cup every hour. Lunch was a slice of melon. Once we had stopped and people had a swim the way back was a lot calmer and enjoyable we even seen a dolphin. Theres another guy that sells quad bike and camel ride trips but we weren't interested in that.  We also booked a trip to sidi bou said, Carthage and Tunis Medina through the hotel, we had a private driver that took us to all places and took us back to the hotel. Carthage was absolutely brilliant seeing the old Roman ruins and they had actual mosaics still intact it was great would recommend it if that's you're kind of thing. Tunis Medina was absolute hell I had people following me for ages trying to sell me sunglasses trying to put them on me and not taking no for an answer, everything in the Medina is the same stuff you can buy in most shops so nothing special, I didn't feel safe there one bit. Sidi bou said is beautiful but it's very busy and the pestering is also non stop we climbed to the top I was sweating and short of breath and I had 5 guys trying to put falcons on me I nearly started throwing punches they would take no for an answer. Our driver was lovely but for most of the driving he kept talking about his Spanish friend that lives in sidi bou said and how hilarious he is he's a painter and we should learn some Spanish bla bla bla and guess what? We get to sidi bou said and taken to the Spanish friend and amazingly he owns a shop 😂 so they all stood there watching us walk around the shop I felt like a hostage and had to buy something but luckily my girlfriend needed an ashtray so she bought one and they even tried selling us more stuff. Those were the only trips we did and I'd only recommend Carthage. The entertainment team in the hotel were all nice and funny besides one who I won't name we had been out on a trip all day got back knackered and just wanted to chill by the pool he came over asking us to do archery or something I explained we've been out all day we're tired and for the rest of my time there I'd get snidey remarks about how tired I am. The beach is very nice and the lifeguards are great they look after you I didn't go in the sea though my girlfriend did and she said it was a bit dirty but we preferred to be by the pool anyway the pool is brilliant but a bit cold. Overall we had a decent time we chose this place because of the reviews and it's nice but I don't understand all the amazing reviews it's not that great in my opinion, if you're looking for a cheap all inclusive holiday I'd definitely recommend this place it's nice but it's not mind blowing like a lot of the reviews say, if I was on a budget I'd go back but I'm not rushing back I think another country for me next. This was my 2nd time in Tunisia the first time I went to Djerba and I enjoyed Djerba a lot more than hammamet, Tunisia is a beautiful country and most of the people are very nice there's definitely a lot of potential for the country to be amazing but the pestering is just insane if you leave people alone you're more likely to have more people wandering around your shop, I feel like the niceness is just fake to get you to buy something but the normal people that don't work in shops etc are lovely they always say welcome to Tunisia I hope you're having a nice time but some people warn you about scammers and then try to scam you like our private driver. But hopefully I've given a good review, if you're looking for a cheap all inclusive holiday with nice weather and you just wanna chill by the pool or on the beach definitely go here you can't go wrong but the second you leave the hotel be prepared but it's not nice. Also want to mention 90% of the guests in the hotel are french I found a lot of them quite rude and a lot of them smoke constantly so I did get a bit annoyed by the pool when I'm trying to chill and all I could hear is french and the smell of smoke but most probably wouldn't care it just got a bit annoying for me, the other 10% are British/Dutch/polish and polish people from the UK they were great we had a laugh with them, we spoke to some Spanish and Portuguese people too but vast majority are french

- [ ] There was no iron in the room so we had to ask for it. And we had it for the duration of our trip.  - [ ] No water unless all inclusive despite being 4 starts.  - [ ] Food alright same all the time. They did have chips and nuggets at one point which did save me.  - [ ] Decent location with shops and bazar close by. Also 20 min walk and you’re near the Maxi center where there are more food places and shops.  - [ ] We experienced our first carnival  - [ ] Booked excursion and tourist stuff through hotel as it was more reliable.  - [ ] The hotels spa rooms were being refurbed so we were able to go to another hotel and use their facilities. There is a guy there who works at iberostar and takes people to the spa place (2 min drive)  - [ ] Customer service went above and beyond 10/10. We booked 2 sea view rooms which we did and had a door connecting the rooms. We weren’t happy with the bathroom or the bedding. They kindly moved us to the opposite room for the night and said they’ll sort it in the morning. They kindly gave us water when we spoke to them about the room and there not being any water. In the morning they said they’re doing everything they can, made sure whatever room we got it had a sea view and they made sure of it. They let us check out the rooms before they moved us to make sure we were happy and we were. Again the bathroom wasn’t the greatest but it was bearable - [ ] For a 4 star hotel I expected more. Interior a little outdated.  - [ ] Wish the pool hours were a little longer so after a long day of being out we could’ve spent time in the pool. Maybe because of the season it’s 9am-6pm.  - [ ] No air con doesn’t come on until June…let’s just say sometimes it did get a little warm but nothing too bad.  -[ ] 24/7 security outside the hotel and its gates and they do security checks on each and every vehicle.  - [ ] Overall the stay, hospitality and people there were amazing.

Traveled as friends we stayed at this hotel for 4 nights as a little getaway and it was brilliant. The service from staff at this hotel was amazing the hotel itself is lovely there’s a big pool with a swim up bar which the drinks were good, very good from the barman Mtir. The food in the dining hall was nice I would say it’s abit repetitive but there was every meat you could want and more, the food stations don’t always have signs on to tell you what dish it is maybe that could be improved but still delicious as was dessert and fruit options. The entertainment team were fantastic always making sure you’re happy around the pool asking you to get involved with activities and teaching you dances etc. Big shout out to Yuma & Alpha they were brilliant. Evening entertainment was okay could’ve been abit more on and didn’t finish too early. The rooms are spacious with 2 wardrobes comes with a fridge and separate toilet to the bathroom, beds were comfy however pillows were abit hard.. the corridors to the rooms were a abit outdated and could do with a little touch up but nothing big. Our time at this hotel was lovely and I would recommend it if you’re looking for a quiet place to stay! Right on a sandy beach. Thanks to all the lovely staff / entertainment staff.

reviews.review_title: An unforgettable family holiday in Hammamet ✨
reviews.review_text: I stayed at the Iberostar Waves Averroes from May 8 to 12 with my mother, aunt and cousin to celebrate my mom’s birthday. This trip had great sentimental value for us, as we came to discover our grandmother’s homeland. And this hotel has made our stay even more special.  Upon arrival, we were greeted with warmth and kindness. The staff was simply adorable, always attentive, attentive and available at all times. So much so that they have come to call us “the family”, which perfectly sums up the friendly and caring atmosphere that prevails in the hotel.  The setting is idyllic: a large swimming pool, beautiful gardens perfectly maintained, a private beach with direct access... A real little corner of paradise. The cleaning team also touched us with its delicate attention: folded towels in adorable shapes, small flowers on the bed... simple gestures that were always pleasure 🌸  The most beautiful memory is undoubtedly our meeting with the animation team. Thanks from the bottom of my heart to Faty, Djappa, Alpha and the whole team for their good humor, humor and communicative energy. Thanks to them, we participated in lots of activities, laughed and created memories engraved forever. You can see that they really love what they do, and it’s a real joy to see them convey so much joy.  The icing on the cake, we also met great people during our stay, with whom we immediately sympathized. Many shared laughs, simple but sincere moments that made our experience even more beautiful.  As for the restaurant, the buffet was well supplied and varied: international dishes, fresh fruit at will, and a small stand of local specialities. A big thank you to the catering team, always available and attentive. The only downside would be the lack of typical Tunisian dishes throughout the buffet, and a little disappointment regarding the restaurant “L’Olivier”.  But overall, Miss France leaves with stars full of eyes 👑✨ A huge thank you to the entire Iberostar Waves Averroes team for these precious moments. We leave with a light heart, a calm mind and with memories full of head 💛

So to begin with the entire food station was cross contaminated. Not enough utensils to pick food up at the food station leaving people to use one utensil to mix in various foods. Best of luck if you have any food allergies as you are screwed from day one.  To mention not a single person asked if we had any allergies or intolerances which I do.  Over 60% of the food station have no food labels so much of the food was unidentified.   which leads me nicely to the “ox tail and peppers.” This dastardly dish was a mix of beef and liver which had no mention on the food label of liver and caused my partner to be sick in the toilets that night as she has intolerances to offal. A daring deceitful tactic to fool the public to robust a dish by adding liver. When I mentioned this to the manager his first reaction was to laugh and think it was funny.  On multiple occasions there were subtleties of sexism by the bar staff in particular the shisha man where he found it appropriate to mock my partner and pull a face. A barman found it okay to insist we gave him a 5 star rating and then had the audacity to address me as “good boy,” how offensive. This was all mentioned to the hotel manager the following night along with all my food concerns.  Despite all of this  I was still served RAW chicken from the cook station. Pink, cold and bloody. What an absolute disgrace. Despite having a meeting with the Hotel Manager and the Sous Chef about this the very next night I was yet AGAIN served RAW CHICKEN!!!! I have no words left for my experience that we booked an early flight and cancelled the rest of our holiday 3 days early and now are seeking formal resolve with Easyjet for one of the worst experiences I can recall in 20 years.  On to the gym, those who are interested. There was no air conditioning, no tissues to wipe equipment or a water station to use. So it was absolutely baking in there not to mention the constant smell of dust from the building work just next door.   Cocktails as you can imagine were pretty basic. Don’t expect anything other than mixing drinks together.   One other thing to mention is the dated saxophone lift music played on repeat throughout the day. Goodness gracious it gets annoying.   So to mention a few positives as promised. The tennis court was good. Rackets and balls supplied. Some of the evening entertainment was good.  The weather held up nicely for May. The fruit station was good and the chocolate fountain was nice.   To conclude this establishment is a disgrace to Tunisia and cannot fairly represent Tunisian food or culture. I would not set foot in this dump ever again even if you paid me nor would I ever return to this country when I have Italy across the sea.  My verdict AVOID AVOID, Heavens AVOID.

Beautiful property. Great service, all staff very attentive, friendly and helpful. Our housekeeper Afifa kept our room spotless and well supplied.  Very good location, walking distance to many restaurants. Overall, great experience.

We just come back from Tunisia,  we had a really nice time there. The hotel was well located with direct access to the beach, not far from Medina.  The staff was really nice and welcoming.  At the restaurant, there was a large variety of choices.  The room was very spacious and clean.  I would definitely recommend this hotel.

The staff are so friendly no matter who you come across, room size is amazing and clean, the food it so repetitive, I've always seen reviews saying this but always found something, not here this was a massive disappointment, the same everyday and not very nice in our opinion. The lifeguard pictured couldn't do enough for us he went above and beyond.

My husband and I stayed for one week at the end of April early May. The hotel was well maintained and clean throughout, with security on the gate making it feel a safe place to relax.   The reception staff were welcoming and helpful answering any questions we had regarding taxi prices and destination advice.  The entertainment team were really friendly, encouraging everyone to participate in the activities.  We played petanque on the beach, darts around the pool and Yoga every morning. Bingo, Tunisia night and cocktail evenings where just a few of the evening entertainment activities.   The Laurier buffet restaurant was spacious and offered a wide selection of foods. We also used the La Palmier the beach buffet area most lunch times. Waiters at both were very welcoming, attentive and polite.  Abdul was our main waiter in the Fleurs Dr Lys lounge bar. He was great, surprising us with delicious cocktails every evening.  Amhed was our main pool bar waiter, again fabulous service remembering our drinks orders and ensuring we had plenty of bottled water for our room.    Our housekeeper, unfortunately we didn't catch her name, was great. Always making sure we had clean towels etc and surprising us with fabulous towel origami each day.   Tunisia it's self is a beautiful place with white sandy beaches and a clear blue sea. However, it is a very poor part of the world and you can see this in the upkeep of some of the buildings and empty hotels

reviews.review_title: Great stay at Iberostar waves Averroes
reviews.review_text: Had a really good time. Would recommend. A few issues, but for the price, manageable. Firstly: food was amazing, loved it. Fresh fish daily. I had planned to cycle everywhere, but due to Ramadan, the local bike shops were closed. The hotel sorted a hire car for the next day ( cheaper than up the road). The reception staff were very efficient. I booked a quad biking excursion at the Hotel ( cheaper than prebooking in the uk), great fun. I enjoyed the Arabic lessons at the hotel and the pottery demonstration. Darts & archery - not for me. It rained 4/7 days. The topography was so green on the flight in. I booked this hotel for the spa, but this was closed for refurbishment and I liked the idea of kayaking & using the pedalo, but being March, it was too windy and still "winter" season. I booked using love holidays, which was the cheapest & booked the Carthage excursion with them, it was amazing. Went to Hammamet, a bit of hassle to buy stuff( kasbar), didn't stay long. Walked to  Pupput Roman site, ok, only £1.20. Overgrown at the time. Visited Dar Sebastian villa and Gardens ( where Rommel stayed, then Montgomery and Churchill wrote his memoirs). I drove to Enfidaville to find my Grandfather in the CWGC. A bit of hassle there, but worth it. I really liked the Isle of fish by the Yasmin Hammamet marina. ( boats, bikes, fishing gear available in the summer). Finally, if you've read this far : I arrived on the beach on day 1 : despite strong winds and few people, I was approached by camel man, then jewelry man, as I walked along the beach, I was aware of a vehicle following me...yes one jumped out and told me to go to the bizarre with him. In 2km I was hassled 6 times ( I'm 6 foot 3 !). I guess they are desperate for sales. A regular chat up is " I work at your hotel & I'm out of uniform" so be warned, their dental work should give them away ! I now fully understand why people stay at the hotel. In summary the staff & hotel were great. Have your wits about you when venturing out.

reviews.review_title: Very satisfied to discover this hotel,
reviews.review_text: Very satisfied to find Tunisia of its inhabitants so respectful so smiling, after 7 years absence I returned to Hammamet South in this beautiful hotel. I am very happy to have been very well received at Iberostar Averroes and well considered. I hope I can return to this hotel

We stayed a week in all inclusive at this hotel in early April. The hotel is well located, with direct access to the beach, and not far from the Medina. Nothing to say about the reception and service, all the staff, whether at the reception, restaurant or activities, is helpful and inviting. It wasn't the full season yet so the hotel was quiet, I guess there must be more people later in the season. On the other hand, the pool bar was not open yet, and the entertainment a little light, no or few people attended, so it was always a bit the same every night despite the efforts of the whole animation team who were passing really nice and with whom we had very good times. At the restaurant level, the buffet for all meals is complete, varied and really good, we ate very (too) well all week. The drinks offered as part of the package are enough, we did not have to add to get what we wanted. The rooms are rather spacious for 2, maybe a little more just for 3 (we were 5 and we had 2 connecting rooms of identical size, one for 2 and one for 3), on the other hand the shower was large and well designed, it is rare to be able to take a shower in a hotel without having to water the whole bathroom. A small downside, however, on the maintenance, we could see that several elements were patched together, such as the toilet-paper support, like the somewhat capricious flush, or like the bathroom door that did not close because she had worked. We had a great week and would recommend this hotel.

We stayed at the end of April we were 8 with family in this hotel you can close eyes hotel on top very clean spacious room restaurant various choices and excellent the awesome bar activities at the top (little thought of djappa de dj evan’s) outdoor and awesome pool and especially all the staff is at the small care and service of its guests  I recommend this hotel you will not be disappointed

We do not have a single bad thing to say about this hotel.   When we arrived the gardens were filled with a flurry of butterflies which made it all feel very magical. The gardens and flowers are stunning and the flowers beautiful, a credit to all of the hardworking gardeners and groundsmen.   The staff were at the door ready to meet us and we were checked in quickly. We paid approximately £50 in tourist tax and for the safe for the 7 day stay.   The bar staff are so attentive. We would like to give an extra special mention to Hamza. From the moment we arrived and sat down at the outside terrace he did everything he could, over and above, to make us feel special and welcome. I will miss his “special” iced coffees. He is an absolute ray of sunshine and always has a smile on his face. We would have taken him home with us if we could! All of the bar staff were amazing especially Abderrahmet, who put the football on the big screen for my husband (and made him a very happy man!). I don’t think there was a single cocktail I didn’t enjoy and my husband was more than happy with the local beer.   Ben the Lifeguard Manager is an absolute superstar as well, thank you for getting us the perfect spot in the sunshine. Thank you to Ahmed for looking after us, checking we were okay and for constantly bringing us drinks, beautifully decorated with flowers and lemon slice hearts. He is a diamond and yet another member of staff who made us feel so welcome and special.   It’s been a pleasure meeting you all. You all made us feel so welcome and like family. For this reason we have already booked to come back next year!   The hotel is immaculate. Staff are constantly cleaning, tidying, and sprucing up the place. Our room was cleaned daily and the cleaning staff are so lovely.   The food was also amazing, there was always a varied choice. A big shout out to all of the chefs and kitchen staff who are so talented. The puddings always looked like works of art, too beautiful to eat! Kamal our waiter in the main restaurant was always ready and waiting to greet us with a big smile, an “alright” and a hi-five. All of the staff are dressed impeccably and so well mannered and polite. They always have a smile on their face and say hello and wave when they see you.   We enjoyed breakfast and lunch most days at the BBQ at the outside restaurant. Sofienna always had our table ready for us and decorated with beautiful flowers. He brought us bread rolls and butter for every meal and treated us like royalty! He is an absolute credit to the hotel. We will really miss him! Jabeur is also a little sweetheart, he has the cutest smile and cannot do enough for you! Both Sofienna and Jabeur worked at the Al a carte restaurant, which was traditional Tunisian cuisine. The food was delicious and we felt like we were dining in a 5 star restaurant. As always we felt like the staff could not do enough for us.   The WiFi was fantastic, we had no issues at all during our stay. The beach was clean and tidy and the sea was just beautiful. It was so relaxing just to sit and listen to the waves crashing whilst enjoying a cocktail.   The animation team were all lovely, and didn’t pressure you into getting involved in the activities. My husband played beach bowls, archery and darts and really enjoyed himself. Alpha was especially friendly and polite. Like everyone else he always had a smile on his face and entertained us with his dance moves.   We booked a trip on a pirate ship through the hotel rep which was great fun and we would highly recommend doing this!   There are a couple of shops outside the hotel, we got some lovely gifts from the Sunflower and some home comforts like coke and red bull (all at reasonable prices).   I am one of those people who get bitten every-time we go away and I didn’t get bitten once. I only saw about three mosquitoes to be absolutely honest.   As a side note the airport, although small, was a doddle. From landing to getting to our transfer took about half an hour!   This was an amazing holiday. Perfect for couples who just want to sunbathe and relax. We cannot recommend this hotel or its staff more highly. Thank you for an unforgettable holiday! We can’t wait to see you all again next year!

Since 2020, we were the 12th. Let's go to this wonderful hotel. This time with the whole family as we had GOLDEN WEDDING.  The hotel management gave us a big beautiful bouquet of roses. In the evening our table was very festively set with candles and flowers. All the employees made this day special. Again, a huge thank you to everyone ❣️❣️❣️ The weather was great, of the 2 weeks 11 days sun lounger was trendy. Ahmed has brought us very accommodating the drinks to the loungers!  Food as always very tasty and attractively decorated. We are already looking forward to the next holiday in September and counting the days until then

The best thing about the hotel was the breakfast, very complete and varied and the service of tooooooo all employees including the entertainment (very happy people, nice and always at the service to help). At lunch as at dinner there was a lot of variety but it was really guessing that you ate because there were either no signs or they were not in their correct order. Then if you want to eat something between lunch and dinner, basically make do with what's left of lunch. Regarding the cleanliness leaves enough to be desired, at one time we arrived in the afternoon and had not yet cleaned the room. The hotel lacks much maintenance and better ventilation especially on the first floor where the restaurant windows are... Oh, and the heated pool is just the mbiebte, not the water.  Read more

reviews.review_title: To be done again with great pleasure
reviews.review_text: I can't think of anything better. Beautiful buffet hotel very well stocked. Room nickel animation at the top Thank you very much to the staff and especially Nesrine who knows her work very well. Many thanks to all the iberostar team.

We’ve stayed in resorts across Mexico, Cape Verde, India, Asia, Greece and Turkey but this was one of our best holidays for overall value, food, and service.  The food was excellent most days, with generous seafood options the prawns in particular were a highlight. We never struggled to find something delicious, and appreciated the variety on offer.  We were also really impressed by how welcoming the staff were towards our autistic teenager. He felt genuinely included, joined in with the evening shows, and even participated on a few occasions , something that doesn’t happen often. That made a huge difference to us as a family, and we’re really grateful.  Our suite was surprisingly spacious , much larger than we expected. We actually spent more time in the room than we typically would on holiday, simply because it was so comfortable and relaxing.  We’ve already decided to return in October!  If we had one small suggestion, it would be for the gym , it would be helpful to have water and cups available early in the morning. There were a couple of days where the water dispenser hadn’t been topped up. But that’s a very minor point in what was otherwise a fantastic experience.  Highly recommended and a special thank you to the staff for making us feel so at home.

Just returned from a wonderful week at this hotel with all the family.  We have nothing to complain about, we were so well looked after by the staff across all areas of the hotel. From the maid in our room to the waiters in the restaurant, pool and main bar and the animation team. Nothing was too much trouble and they were all so friendly and great with the grandchildren.  It’s a larger hotel than we are used to but there was always sunbeds round the pool and  beach and somewhere to sit in the evening. As we were a party of nine a table was saved for us in the dining room by our lovely waiter Khaled everyday.  Food was lovely, great selection every night, so plenty to choose from and something for everybody. First visit to this hotel but 8th to Tunisia, we will return again

Everything was nice during the holiday for all my family and friends because of all the staff in the hotel 🏨  The entertainment team was very friendly and fun, the activities were great and kept us occupied, thank you Mira, Speedy, Lou Lou and Cristiano for all the fun activities during the days and at night. The staff in the hotel was all together friendly and helpful at the bar, restaurants and reception. The rooms were clean properly and we had no problems during our stay.

Everythig was amazing at the hotel. The service were great, the activities and entertainment team made our stay here better, especially Speedy, who was very friendly to all of US 🏝🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰

reviews.review_text: This hotel location is very good for beach holiday and relaxing. Their welcoming was not that great, as no one came to us to show the hotel and introduce us every thing, we had to find and look for all the facilities. Other than that the room was very clean, the lady Farida was very nice and hardworking. She is very helpful and friendly.  Food was very good and organised. Waiters were friendly and polite. Sea water pool was amazing but not enough sit for everyone.  All the staff in the hotel were very nice and friendly. I will recommend this hotel for relaxing coz it bit far from the madina or souk.
