reviews.review_text: Best hotel lovely entertainment team and lovely food the pool is lovely and the rooms are lovely all the mira lulu christiano and kita Steve and speedy and very friendly and very professional work and the staff were very hands on and the entertainment staff are very happy all the time!!

The best entertainers LouLou is crazy, good food nice rooms lovely pools and comfortable  Good trip people who arrange safe trips such as quads and boat trips like Bassam the Camel man   Nice area been told a couple stories but we went out a lot and was quite safe and except from harrasment to buy stuff but you just tell them no or ignore them.

reviews.review_title: Animation team were great - Mira was amazing!
reviews.review_text: This was our first time staying at this hotel and we had the best time! The staff were all so friendly and helpful and took care of us. Mira on the animation team was great and got everyone involved with the daily activities and the evening show! We will defo be coming back again soon!

Hotel 5 stars. Immaculate rooms.  General cleanliness of the room impeccable, even a small gesture of the maid every day cheer us. Always careful with guests.  Always varied food, amazing buffet.  The beach 5 stars, great water. We adore

This was my first ever experience of staying in an all inclusive, beach front resort and I must say that Iberostar Selection Kantaoui Bay has set a high standard that I think a lot of other hotels cannot reach. I stayed with my husband and 2 young children for 9 days.  When you first step in to the building, you will immediately know that you're in good hands. The security staff and reception staff are very warm and professional. RAHMA was very efficient at dealing with our enquiries and clearly takes pride in doing her job to the best if her ability. My son had an accident and RAHMA was great in swiftly dealing with the issue. The security guard on shift at the time (he is tall with glasses) kindly came over to reassure my son, which was a lovely touch and reflects the family orientated mentality of the Tunisian people, which I love.  Moreover, the staff are what make this hotel great: there is no slacking here and everyone is putting 100% into what they do. I am fussy about cleanliness and my housekeeper,  NADA was fantastic. She is very warm and friendly and did a spectacular job at keeping our family room clean everyday. It's the first hotel I've stayed in where the cleaning looks as good everyday as the first day you step in to your room.  I had a family room facing the entrance. If you really value peace at night, I don't recommend this side of the building as there was a lot of noise at night with people coming and going, barking guard dogs and lively birds (I actually enjoyed the birdsong, but it may not be for everyone). I had to leave my windows open because of the lack of AC (mentioned later).  My only issue with cleanliness and maintenance would be the gym area, which is currently looking rather neglected which a lot of equipment not working and not a great selection of lower end weights. It also doesn't appear to be as clean as the rest of the hotel. However,  I raised my concerns with the hotel manager (regrettably, I didn't get his name) and he is aware of this and explained that this area is in a process of change. The manager, who is undoubtedly very busy running such a big resort, was always very pleasant, approachable and willing to listen.  I also didn't like that AC is not available in Tunisian hotels from the winter until June due to a government mandate. Again, the manager offered a different room that would be in a cooler part of the building, so he was understanding.   Having a very sensitive digestive system, I was apprehensive about the hotel food. The food is varied daily, there is something for all tastes and it is overall very healthy, with the majority of dishes being grilled and plenty of fruit and veg options are available. I am a real foodie and felt spoilt for choice everyday. I would like to add though that if the selection could include a wider range of flavours (e.g. spiced food not just from the Tunisian section), it would create an even better variety.  The restaurant manager does an excellent job keeping the space pleasant and orderly. The waiters and waitresses are very attentive. JALAL, OUMAYMA, DHAWI and many others are great at their job, but to be honest in the restaurant,  I couldn't fault any of the staff and their work ethic.   My children regularly stayed in the kids club and the talented MAYA did an excellent job keeping them entertained.   For the price we paid, I didn't expect true 5* quality but we certainly received it. There were people of all backgrounds staying in the hotel and I highly recommend it. If you're going with a family, it's perfect,  but if you're in a couple only or just looking for a fun few days with friends it's great too.  The location is OK. We walked along the beach to the port and it took us 50 minutes (we walked with children, so would be quicker if you're young and fit with no kids!). There are some shops selling souvenirs, a pharmacy, money exchange and a few eateries within walking distance. There are, however, a number of excursions available and dedicated staff who can help to advise you and book this for you.  Finally, we got the best exchange rate at the bank at the port (banks offer the best exchange (post office in Tunisia is ok, too. We were told it's the same rate everywhere, but that's not true!).  I really recommend this hotel, you won't be disappointed!

I can't express enough how amazing all the staff were. Every morning we would be greeted with the most amazing and friendly people. Our cleaner Sonia always put a smile on our face and looked after us well.   Nothing was too much for her or Marva. The room was cleaned everyday to perfection. Drinks were always topped up by Ali without fail. I enjoyed seeing them everyday, they would always stop for a chat no matter how busy they were.   The staff at the dining hall were just as good. Nothing was too much. Always served with a smile. The waiters were amazing..we had a toddler with us so as soon as they would see us enter they would get a high chair ready at the table for us. To name a few Khalid and illyas became our regular waiters. They would honour of their way to entertain the toddler (who could sometimes be hard work)  The bar also went the extra mile. We don't drink alcohol they were happy to make alternative drinks. Meeda Meena in particular became very familiar and would soon have non alcoholic drinks ready for us when we went to the bar.  The entertainment team always tried to get everyone involved. They had different entertainment every night to cater for different needs.   Overall from reception staff to each and every staff there I cannot fault the customer service and would definitely return.

The hotel was clean and the staff were very friendly and welcoming. I had booked a standard room, but since we were celebrating a special occasion, I emailed the hotel in advance and asked if it would be possible to get a sea view. They kindly upgraded our room for free, which I really appreciated.  We were a family of three , my husband, our 8-year-old daughter, and I. The beach had beautiful white sand and was perfect for relaxing. There was also a marina about a 30-minute walk away along the beach, which made for a nice outing.  Breakfast, lunch, and dinner were served buffet-style. In addition to the buffet, the hotel had two à la carte restaurants — Italian and Tunisian  which required advance booking. Unfortunately, our experience at the Italian restaurant was very disappointing. Despite the restaurant not being particularly busy, there was nearly a one-hour wait between the starter and the main course. We had ordered our steak well-done, but it arrived medium after all that time. While the staff did apologize and replaced it, the delay made it very difficult — especially with a young child.  Other aspects of the hotel also fell short of expectations. The bathtubs in the rooms had been removed and replaced with standing showers, and we were only informed of this a day before our trip. The service overall didn’t feel like five-star quality. While the food offered a lot of variety, it was quite average in taste. Towels were changed daily, but they were old and worn out.  There was a hair salon in the hotel that I definitely do not recommend. I had my hair braided, as I often do on holidays, but the braids started coming undone after just two days. They charged £50, which was expensive, and the next day told me they had undercharged me and asked for more money very unprofessional.  There were entertainment programs every night, but they were very basic and not particularly engaging. The alcoholic drinks were poorly made and low quality.  So, would I return to this hotel? Honestly, no. While there were a few positive aspects, overall it did not meet the standards of a true five-star experience.

I’ll start by saying the hotel is not perfect, it’s certainly not 5 star and is in need of some refurb.   That aside we thoroughly enjoy our stay and there’s a lot on offer for families, this is our 2nd stay and we would come back again.  All staff are amazing, it’s a shame we can’t name everyone individually, but special shout to animation team : Yaya and Maya for the kids club / activities and Mira,Lou Lou, Speedy, Cristiano and not forgetting the DJ Steve all deserve 5 stars they make the stay fun and you can’t help but attached to them, it’s sad to say bye but we’ll be back.  As mentioned the room’s need some refurb, cracked tiles etc, but that can be a good overlooked as the cleaning staff keep the rooms very clean and tidy, “Sonia” was our cleaner and greeted us with her wonderful smile daily and the service from her and her team was 5 stars.  Thanks to all the staff bar staff and waiters can’t name you all we felt truly well looked after.  Tesh, Hena & Ethan

the room was very nicely cleaned, nice and pleasant service, we are in room 226 and we are very pleased with the lady who cleaned our room, the hotel service is very nice, the waiters are smiling, everywhere is clean, the food is delicious, there is plenty to choose from, I recommend this hotel

What an absolutely fabulous hotel and stay. We would highly recommend it and hope to return.   What we enjoyed:   EVERYTHING!   FOOD: was delicious, huge variety for lunch and dinner. Breakfast was decent, and still enjoyable. The best cappuccino I’ve had anywhere (I’m not a coffee drinker). They had several fresh cooking stations, which was a pleasant touch. Lots of space and stations. Something for everyone. They had two other restaurants onsite, a Tunisian and Italian one, which we didn't try, because we really enjoyed the buffets!   ROOM: beautiful, spacious and clean room. Our housekeeping lady Radhia (room 476) was lovely. Always made our room look fresh, with fresh linen and flowers every day. Very comfortable bed and plush pillows.   POOL: was FREEZING lol but that’s to be expected with it being sea water. Go in HOT weather to be able to enjoy the pool. We got good temperature for most our stay. Majid who works poolside serving drinks at sunbeds, was absolutely awesome. Great service with a smile for everyone regardless of background. A very pleasant human.   ENTERTAINMENT: The entertainment team were absolutely fabulous! I absolutely rate their energy considering they run fun activities throughout the day, change, and then run evening entertainment. We really enjoyed the games throughout the day which brought people together from all over for some light-hearted fun and competition. We played darts and French ball. A lot more fun than they sounds! They had so much more. Ask for the entertainment timetable upon check in so you don't miss out on anything you'd fancy.    HOTEL: was beautiful. Clean, comfortable, friendly staff, welcoming and helpful. Private beach access, which was very clean with plenty of beds, and food service nearby, if you don’t want to trek it back to the restaurant inside.   This was our first trip to Tunisia. It’s a very serene, calm and peaceful place from our experience. There’s not lots to do, so you can really kick back and relax in an all inclusive and not feel FOMO. If you do want to explore a little, we would recommend Port El Kantoui, which is a pretty Port area, very close to the hotel. You can go for a stroll along the parade of shops, or take a boat ride. Also would recommend Sousse Grand Mosque and Sousse Medina. A lovely place to visit, and you can pick up a traditional dress at a good price - a traditional LINEN knee length dress is 25 Dinar. Ignore the invites to go into the shops, and you'll save yourself some hassle.   TAXI PRICE GUIDE FROM HOTEL: a 5 minute taxi journey should cost no more than 7 – 10 Dinar. To the Medina, taxi is 20 Dinar. From the airport we paid £25 (UK pound). We got the number of our driver off here. Came recommended. His name is Lassaad. A very respectful and decent honest man. We would highly recommend him too. His contact number is +216 54 463 377. If he is not available, he will send his brother, but sets the price himself so you will not get ripped off.   HOTEL IMPROVEMENTS:  	Temperature of the food could have been better. Sometimes it was even cold like the donner kebab and roast chicken that were at the live stations  	Two of the lifeguards we very unnecessarily rude to us. Once when we asked for mattresses and moments later, we got a very huffy puffy lifeguard when we asked for an umbrella. Note, they provide these services to everyone, but chose to be rude to us for no reason at all, which was very upsetting  	There is a clear difference between staff hospitality for the white folk over everyone else, to the point of being obvious. We don’t care for all the excessiveness they do with White folk, if we get our service. But at dinner, you will notice the stark difference. Several times, we had to flag someone down for fizzy drinks, while watching excessive table service for White folk. Not very pleasant to watch  	Tip culture. You almost feel forced to give tips for bits of information you didn’t ask for. As a couple, we actually are generous tippers, but it’s not nice to see people loitering, or holding you back to give you information you didn’t ask for, and then standing there hoping for a tip. Made us uncomfortable on many occasions. Happened across the hotel. We quickly learned to ignore it 	The hotel is very quality driven. If you give anything less than 5* on any question in the survey at dinner (they bring the tablet to you), expect the staff to get a grilling, which I thought was a bit harsh  	Water sports team were horrible in their attitude, approach and quite mean, rude and hostile once you’ve purchased an activity. Very cold poker faced approach, which made us uncomfortable considering the had to ensure our safety for the paragliding we did!   We stayed for 5 nights and aside of two bottles of drink upon arrival, and water daily, our mini bar was not filled once.   They put two single beds and mattresses together to make a double. Not ideal if you're travelling as a couple  Hope they take the improvements on board, because it really is an awesome hotel. We loved it otherwise, and hope to return InshaAllah (“.)

The animation team were a wonderful addition to the stay, I wasn't completely happy with all the aspects of the hotel itself, but they worked hard all day everyday to keep me entertained. Cristiano, Speedy and LouLou are the few I can name that really highlighted the experience.

Really enjoyed my stay here, the entertainment team are all very fun especially Speedy, Loulou and Cristiano. Worked hard all day everyday, made my stay there very enjoyable, we're all very helpful. The hotel was very clean and had a very calm atmosphere.

Beautiful hotel, wonderful architecture. Very accommodating staff.  The supervisors from the animation team were the highlight of the stay, working hard all day everyday to provide entertainment and comfort. Cristiano, Speedy, Lou Lou, to just name a few.

Check in smooth and without fuss. Thanks to Makram for organising a beautiful room and to our cleaning lady Halima for keeping our room spotless and doing some lovely bed decoration. Ben Zid,Ismail,Rania and Ouymima for looking after us in the dining room. Also thanks to the chef and his team for providing delicious and varied food.In the bar a big thank you to Rania, always served us with a smile and had the next drink on the table just as I was finishing the last one. Khamais,Gassen and the pool team for getting the beds,pads and towels as soon as we came down. Well done the entertainment team on your hard work providing activities throughout the day and putting on shows at night. After 20 years of coming to the hotel,the service is always five star and we look forward to our next visit.

Thoroughly enjoyed from the moment we arrived. Reception were friendly and helpful   The staff were great, especially Ismail in the buffet restaurant, Firas, Fakher and Bassem at the bar. Whatever they're paid, they don't get paid enough! They were superb from day one  The food was fresh and delicious with plenty of variety  The room was spacious and always clean  Lots of activities available with Bassem the quad man and the guys on the beach   The entertainment was fun with different shows each night  We will definitely be back!

We’ve stayed in resorts across Mexico, Cape Verde, India, Asia, Greece and Turkey but this was one of our best holidays for overall value, food, and service.  The food was excellent most days, with generous seafood options the prawns in particular were a highlight. We never struggled to find something delicious, and appreciated the variety on offer.  We were also really impressed by how welcoming the staff were towards our autistic teenager. He felt genuinely included, joined in with the evening shows, and even participated on a few occasions , something that doesn’t happen often. That made a huge difference to us as a family, and we’re really grateful.  Our suite was surprisingly spacious , much larger than we expected. We actually spent more time in the room than we typically would on holiday, simply because it was so comfortable and relaxing.  We’ve already decided to return in October!  If we had one small suggestion, it would be for the gym , it would be helpful to have water and cups available early in the morning. There were a couple of days where the water dispenser hadn’t been topped up. But that’s a very minor point in what was otherwise a fantastic experience.  Highly recommended and a special thank you to the staff for making us feel so at home.

Just returned from a wonderful week at this hotel with all the family.  We have nothing to complain about, we were so well looked after by the staff across all areas of the hotel. From the maid in our room to the waiters in the restaurant, pool and main bar and the animation team. Nothing was too much trouble and they were all so friendly and great with the grandchildren.  It’s a larger hotel than we are used to but there was always sunbeds round the pool and  beach and somewhere to sit in the evening. As we were a party of nine a table was saved for us in the dining room by our lovely waiter Khaled everyday.  Food was lovely, great selection every night, so plenty to choose from and something for everybody. First visit to this hotel but 8th to Tunisia, we will return again

Everything was nice during the holiday for all my family and friends because of all the staff in the hotel 🏨  The entertainment team was very friendly and fun, the activities were great and kept us occupied, thank you Mira, Speedy, Lou Lou and Cristiano for all the fun activities during the days and at night. The staff in the hotel was all together friendly and helpful at the bar, restaurants and reception. The rooms were clean properly and we had no problems during our stay.

Everythig was amazing at the hotel. The service were great, the activities and entertainment team made our stay here better, especially Speedy, who was very friendly to all of US 🏝🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰

reviews.review_text: This was our first time staying at this hotel and we had the best time! The staff were all so friendly and helpful and took care of us. Mira on the animation team was great and got everyone involved with the daily activities and the evening show! We will defo be coming back again soon!

Hotel 5 stars. Immaculate rooms.  General cleanliness of the room impeccable, even a small gesture of the maid every day cheer us. Always careful with guests.  Always varied food, amazing buffet.  The beach 5 stars, great water. We adore

This was my first ever experience of staying in an all inclusive, beach front resort and I must say that Iberostar Selection Kantaoui Bay has set a high standard that I think a lot of other hotels cannot reach. I stayed with my husband and 2 young children for 9 days.  When you first step in to the building, you will immediately know that you're in good hands. The security staff and reception staff are very warm and professional. RAHMA was very efficient at dealing with our enquiries and clearly takes pride in doing her job to the best if her ability. My son had an accident and RAHMA was great in swiftly dealing with the issue. The security guard on shift at the time (he is tall with glasses) kindly came over to reassure my son, which was a lovely touch and reflects the family orientated mentality of the Tunisian people, which I love.  Moreover, the staff are what make this hotel great: there is no slacking here and everyone is putting 100% into what they do. I am fussy about cleanliness and my housekeeper,  NADA was fantastic. She is very warm and friendly and did a spectacular job at keeping our family room clean everyday. It's the first hotel I've stayed in where the cleaning looks as good everyday as the first day you step in to your room.  I had a family room facing the entrance. If you really value peace at night, I don't recommend this side of the building as there was a lot of noise at night with people coming and going, barking guard dogs and lively birds (I actually enjoyed the birdsong, but it may not be for everyone). I had to leave my windows open because of the lack of AC (mentioned later).  My only issue with cleanliness and maintenance would be the gym area, which is currently looking rather neglected which a lot of equipment not working and not a great selection of lower end weights. It also doesn't appear to be as clean as the rest of the hotel. However,  I raised my concerns with the hotel manager (regrettably, I didn't get his name) and he is aware of this and explained that this area is in a process of change. The manager, who is undoubtedly very busy running such a big resort, was always very pleasant, approachable and willing to listen.  I also didn't like that AC is not available in Tunisian hotels from the winter until June due to a government mandate. Again, the manager offered a different room that would be in a cooler part of the building, so he was understanding.   Having a very sensitive digestive system, I was apprehensive about the hotel food. The food is varied daily, there is something for all tastes and it is overall very healthy, with the majority of dishes being grilled and plenty of fruit and veg options are available. I am a real foodie and felt spoilt for choice everyday. I would like to add though that if the selection could include a wider range of flavours (e.g. spiced food not just from the Tunisian section), it would create an even better variety.  The restaurant manager does an excellent job keeping the space pleasant and orderly. The waiters and waitresses are very attentive. JALAL, OUMAYMA, DHAWI and many others are great at their job, but to be honest in the restaurant,  I couldn't fault any of the staff and their work ethic.   My children regularly stayed in the kids club and the talented MAYA did an excellent job keeping them entertained.   For the price we paid, I didn't expect true 5* quality but we certainly received it. There were people of all backgrounds staying in the hotel and I highly recommend it. If you're going with a family, it's perfect,  but if you're in a couple only or just looking for a fun few days with friends it's great too.  The location is OK. We walked along the beach to the port and it took us 50 minutes (we walked with children, so would be quicker if you're young and fit with no kids!). There are some shops selling souvenirs, a pharmacy, money exchange and a few eateries within walking distance. There are, however, a number of excursions available and dedicated staff who can help to advise you and book this for you.  Finally, we got the best exchange rate at the bank at the port (banks offer the best exchange (post office in Tunisia is ok, too. We were told it's the same rate everywhere, but that's not true!).  I really recommend this hotel, you won't be disappointed!

I can't express enough how amazing all the staff were. Every morning we would be greeted with the most amazing and friendly people. Our cleaner Sonia always put a smile on our face and looked after us well.   Nothing was too much for her or Marva. The room was cleaned everyday to perfection. Drinks were always topped up by Ali without fail. I enjoyed seeing them everyday, they would always stop for a chat no matter how busy they were.   The staff at the dining hall were just as good. Nothing was too much. Always served with a smile. The waiters were amazing..we had a toddler with us so as soon as they would see us enter they would get a high chair ready at the table for us. To name a few Khalid and illyas became our regular waiters. They would honour of their way to entertain the toddler (who could sometimes be hard work)  The bar also went the extra mile. We don't drink alcohol they were happy to make alternative drinks. Meeda Meena in particular became very familiar and would soon have non alcoholic drinks ready for us when we went to the bar.  The entertainment team always tried to get everyone involved. They had different entertainment every night to cater for different needs.   Overall from reception staff to each and every staff there I cannot fault the customer service and would definitely return.

The hotel was clean and the staff were very friendly and welcoming. I had booked a standard room, but since we were celebrating a special occasion, I emailed the hotel in advance and asked if it would be possible to get a sea view. They kindly upgraded our room for free, which I really appreciated.  We were a family of three , my husband, our 8-year-old daughter, and I. The beach had beautiful white sand and was perfect for relaxing. There was also a marina about a 30-minute walk away along the beach, which made for a nice outing.  Breakfast, lunch, and dinner were served buffet-style. In addition to the buffet, the hotel had two à la carte restaurants — Italian and Tunisian  which required advance booking. Unfortunately, our experience at the Italian restaurant was very disappointing. Despite the restaurant not being particularly busy, there was nearly a one-hour wait between the starter and the main course. We had ordered our steak well-done, but it arrived medium after all that time. While the staff did apologize and replaced it, the delay made it very difficult — especially with a young child.  Other aspects of the hotel also fell short of expectations. The bathtubs in the rooms had been removed and replaced with standing showers, and we were only informed of this a day before our trip. The service overall didn’t feel like five-star quality. While the food offered a lot of variety, it was quite average in taste. Towels were changed daily, but they were old and worn out.  There was a hair salon in the hotel that I definitely do not recommend. I had my hair braided, as I often do on holidays, but the braids started coming undone after just two days. They charged £50, which was expensive, and the next day told me they had undercharged me and asked for more money very unprofessional.  There were entertainment programs every night, but they were very basic and not particularly engaging. The alcoholic drinks were poorly made and low quality.  So, would I return to this hotel? Honestly, no. While there were a few positive aspects, overall it did not meet the standards of a true five-star experience.

I’ll start by saying the hotel is not perfect, it’s certainly not 5 star and is in need of some refurb.   That aside we thoroughly enjoy our stay and there’s a lot on offer for families, this is our 2nd stay and we would come back again.  All staff are amazing, it’s a shame we can’t name everyone individually, but special shout to animation team : Yaya and Maya for the kids club / activities and Mira,Lou Lou, Speedy, Cristiano and not forgetting the DJ Steve all deserve 5 stars they make the stay fun and you can’t help but attached to them, it’s sad to say bye but we’ll be back.  As mentioned the room’s need some refurb, cracked tiles etc, but that can be a good overlooked as the cleaning staff keep the rooms very clean and tidy, “Sonia” was our cleaner and greeted us with her wonderful smile daily and the service from her and her team was 5 stars.  Thanks to all the staff bar staff and waiters can’t name you all we felt truly well looked after.  Tesh, Hena & Ethan

the room was very nicely cleaned, nice and pleasant service, we are in room 226 and we are very pleased with the lady who cleaned our room, the hotel service is very nice, the waiters are smiling, everywhere is clean, the food is delicious, there is plenty to choose from, I recommend this hotel

What an absolutely fabulous hotel and stay. We would highly recommend it and hope to return.   What we enjoyed:   EVERYTHING!   FOOD: was delicious, huge variety for lunch and dinner. Breakfast was decent, and still enjoyable. The best cappuccino I’ve had anywhere (I’m not a coffee drinker). They had several fresh cooking stations, which was a pleasant touch. Lots of space and stations. Something for everyone. They had two other restaurants onsite, a Tunisian and Italian one, which we didn't try, because we really enjoyed the buffets!   ROOM: beautiful, spacious and clean room. Our housekeeping lady Radhia (room 476) was lovely. Always made our room look fresh, with fresh linen and flowers every day. Very comfortable bed and plush pillows.   POOL: was FREEZING lol but that’s to be expected with it being sea water. Go in HOT weather to be able to enjoy the pool. We got good temperature for most our stay. Majid who works poolside serving drinks at sunbeds, was absolutely awesome. Great service with a smile for everyone regardless of background. A very pleasant human.   ENTERTAINMENT: The entertainment team were absolutely fabulous! I absolutely rate their energy considering they run fun activities throughout the day, change, and then run evening entertainment. We really enjoyed the games throughout the day which brought people together from all over for some light-hearted fun and competition. We played darts and French ball. A lot more fun than they sounds! They had so much more. Ask for the entertainment timetable upon check in so you don't miss out on anything you'd fancy.    HOTEL: was beautiful. Clean, comfortable, friendly staff, welcoming and helpful. Private beach access, which was very clean with plenty of beds, and food service nearby, if you don’t want to trek it back to the restaurant inside.   This was our first trip to Tunisia. It’s a very serene, calm and peaceful place from our experience. There’s not lots to do, so you can really kick back and relax in an all inclusive and not feel FOMO. If you do want to explore a little, we would recommend Port El Kantoui, which is a pretty Port area, very close to the hotel. You can go for a stroll along the parade of shops, or take a boat ride. Also would recommend Sousse Grand Mosque and Sousse Medina. A lovely place to visit, and you can pick up a traditional dress at a good price - a traditional LINEN knee length dress is 25 Dinar. Ignore the invites to go into the shops, and you'll save yourself some hassle.   TAXI PRICE GUIDE FROM HOTEL: a 5 minute taxi journey should cost no more than 7 – 10 Dinar. To the Medina, taxi is 20 Dinar. From the airport we paid £25 (UK pound). We got the number of our driver off here. Came recommended. His name is Lassaad. A very respectful and decent honest man. We would highly recommend him too. His contact number is +216 54 463 377. If he is not available, he will send his brother, but sets the price himself so you will not get ripped off.   HOTEL IMPROVEMENTS:  	Temperature of the food could have been better. Sometimes it was even cold like the donner kebab and roast chicken that were at the live stations  	Two of the lifeguards we very unnecessarily rude to us. Once when we asked for mattresses and moments later, we got a very huffy puffy lifeguard when we asked for an umbrella. Note, they provide these services to everyone, but chose to be rude to us for no reason at all, which was very upsetting  	There is a clear difference between staff hospitality for the white folk over everyone else, to the point of being obvious. We don’t care for all the excessiveness they do with White folk, if we get our service. But at dinner, you will notice the stark difference. Several times, we had to flag someone down for fizzy drinks, while watching excessive table service for White folk. Not very pleasant to watch  	Tip culture. You almost feel forced to give tips for bits of information you didn’t ask for. As a couple, we actually are generous tippers, but it’s not nice to see people loitering, or holding you back to give you information you didn’t ask for, and then standing there hoping for a tip. Made us uncomfortable on many occasions. Happened across the hotel. We quickly learned to ignore it 	The hotel is very quality driven. If you give anything less than 5* on any question in the survey at dinner (they bring the tablet to you), expect the staff to get a grilling, which I thought was a bit harsh  	Water sports team were horrible in their attitude, approach and quite mean, rude and hostile once you’ve purchased an activity. Very cold poker faced approach, which made us uncomfortable considering the had to ensure our safety for the paragliding we did!   We stayed for 5 nights and aside of two bottles of drink upon arrival, and water daily, our mini bar was not filled once.   They put two single beds and mattresses together to make a double. Not ideal if you're travelling as a couple  Hope they take the improvements on board, because it really is an awesome hotel. We loved it otherwise, and hope to return InshaAllah (“.)

The animation team were a wonderful addition to the stay, I wasn't completely happy with all the aspects of the hotel itself, but they worked hard all day everyday to keep me entertained. Cristiano, Speedy and LouLou are the few I can name that really highlighted the experience.

Really enjoyed my stay here, the entertainment team are all very fun especially Speedy, Loulou and Cristiano. Worked hard all day everyday, made my stay there very enjoyable, we're all very helpful. The hotel was very clean and had a very calm atmosphere.

Beautiful hotel, wonderful architecture. Very accommodating staff.  The supervisors from the animation team were the highlight of the stay, working hard all day everyday to provide entertainment and comfort. Cristiano, Speedy, Lou Lou, to just name a few.

Check in smooth and without fuss. Thanks to Makram for organising a beautiful room and to our cleaning lady Halima for keeping our room spotless and doing some lovely bed decoration. Ben Zid,Ismail,Rania and Ouymima for looking after us in the dining room. Also thanks to the chef and his team for providing delicious and varied food.In the bar a big thank you to Rania, always served us with a smile and had the next drink on the table just as I was finishing the last one. Khamais,Gassen and the pool team for getting the beds,pads and towels as soon as we came down. Well done the entertainment team on your hard work providing activities throughout the day and putting on shows at night. After 20 years of coming to the hotel,the service is always five star and we look forward to our next visit.

Thoroughly enjoyed from the moment we arrived. Reception were friendly and helpful   The staff were great, especially Ismail in the buffet restaurant, Firas, Fakher and Bassem at the bar. Whatever they're paid, they don't get paid enough! They were superb from day one  The food was fresh and delicious with plenty of variety  The room was spacious and always clean  Lots of activities available with Bassem the quad man and the guys on the beach   The entertainment was fun with different shows each night  We will definitely be back!

reviews.review_title: Restful and sunny holidays in Tunisia.
reviews.review_text: A really great stay as a couple. Pleasant staff with an animation team at the top. Close to the new Medina and easy access via bus and taxi to Hammamet.  The meals are diverse and varied with a buffet and the restaurant upstairs is great. Clean hotel and caring housekeepers

reviews.review_title: I recommend this hotel to have a great holiday
reviews.review_text: Very good stay in the hotel Lella Baya, the staff is very helpful, the animation from morning to evening, the restaurant, the pool bar but also the massages that are top, maximum relaxation! I would definitely return to this hotel,

Hotel on top. Meal to the animators. A young and dynamic team. They come to you and make you participate everything All day long. Meals sound good there's a lot to choose from. The hotel is clean with great charm. In the theme. I advise.

reviews.review_title: A hotel with good value for money
reviews.review_text: Nice clean hotel with beautiful architecture. A little pity for the exteriors which could be a little better maintained. The big plus of this hotel is the very pleasant entertainment team, a team at the top, we never get bored!  You can also trust Faysel for the excursions to the hotel, we did the quad and catamaran with him and it was great! He didn’t lie, we saw the dolphins 🐬🩵 Small negative for some waiters especially at the central bar which are not all pleasant. We didn’t like the buffet of the restaurant either... the meals are good unfortunately the buffet was never full enough and / or too repetitive. The Tunisian restaurant upstairs is really to avoid, I’m sorry but it was really not good!  Value for money but be careful it is not a real all inclusive for me: some drinks are extra (mojito, pressed orange juice, perpermint...) the gym is also paid, safe deposit box...

Atypical hotel, very clean The animation team at the professional tooooop with incredible talent  Very good activities: darts, pétanque, aqua gym, dance...... I highly recommend thank you for all the pool too beautiful  Close to the beach Catering is variable and tasty  Everything is combined to spend a pleasant holiday

reviews.review_title: Super experience Animations at the top I had a pleasant stay
reviews.review_text: Yes great everything was perfect! 👍 atmosphere extra awesome animations! Good value for money! Impeccable service waiters always with a smile...! Cleanliness impeccable! I recommend and hotel..! Good variety of meals..! Animators all nice and really adorable

Thank you for the hospitality of all the hotel staff at the top catering servers, room service, bar, reception, swimming pool the animation team Aladdin, Lorenzo and Achref,Pika, Sisi and hafsa and Nino. 2nd stay in a month and not the last 🥂😜

Perfect hotel very beautiful exotic architecture,restful  Very good room  Diversified and quality restaurant  Very helpful and available staff  Animation at the top Pleasant environment  One week of disconnection Thank you.

Great Holiday!  Me and my mother visited for 1 week.    The entertainment team was amazing!  So welcoming, always so polite and fun made every day great.  Looked forward to seeing the team every day.  Great shows every evening and great activities in the day.   ( Darts, pool activities, dancing, aqua aerobics and yoga. )   Will definitely come back again!   Food was great! Lots of variety.  Cocktails not good.  Wine was lovely.   Hotel very clean

Welcome on arrival, beautiful architecture of the hotel. Very nice and large room with sea view. varied restoration. Very efficient housekeepers. l denimation team Very pleasant a multitude of activities we have a good stay and invite you to discover it.

Beautiful team anlmation.beautiful establishment.framework agreablle.beautiful room sea view.light flat for restoration.multitude of activity. The staff are kind and very professional smiles constantly. I have you stay there.

Good stay at the hotel lella baya Yasmine Hammamet  Good atmosphere with all the animation team day and night thank youiii to the whole team.. The architecture is beautiful  The top room is clean  Restaurant very good  Kind and pleasant staff 💞💞💞 I recommend ❤️❤️❤️

Very pleasant stay with a great team of animators who creates a very good dynamic. The little care of the holidaymakers. Animation every day  Very nice and beautiful spectacular hotel right at the lobby entrance. Very good service. Very good value for money.

Good stay at the hotel lella baya yasmine hammamet  Architecture at the top very beautiful  Animation: dynamic team smiling thank you for all the animation team for all the atmosphere day and evening 🥰🥰🥰🫣  The room is clean .. the smiling housewives   The restaurant is good but lacks a little more choice  The hotel staff is very attentive  Thanks to everyone  I recommend❤️❤️❤️

reviews.review_title: Hotel to escape for a good holiday
reviews.review_text: So there's a big bravo tourism 👏👏👏 This is ironic null null null!!!! Then a hotel to escape if you have already traveled a minimum  Warm food when buffets are not empty.... The waiters hide to not set you a table .... They serve you in a dirty glass seen with my eyes recovering at the storage table behind us... When there is the welcome cocktail do not expect to have a drink at the bar there are more.... When you have two bedrooms and in both the towels are missing to shower and you manage to have other ones but the moor when the maid makes the room she does not replace her .... No outdoor bar and overall cleanliness very very limited from any point of view. No bar at the beach it is dismantled throughout our stay nor deckchair. When all the staff in general are not friendly and I find a waiter from an old hotel I stayed at the previous year who tells me that he quits because the atmosphere is very bad. Even after worldwide claim tourism does not believe its guests but believe the hotel this is the last time I leave with them no consideration and hotel has fled apsokuously to spend a good family holiday.

Great stay! The staff is very welcoming, the hotel is beautiful. Everything is nearby. We are delighted with our holiday and will come back. Thanks to momo the host for his kindness!!! I recommend this hotel to make a good experience

Thank you for your welcome it was great the animators the hotel everything was super top I would return with pleasure with my family and I would talk about it around me. The town of hammamet is also well located a lot of shop around

Very good hotel, lovely staff, very clean premises and beautiful and atypical room. There are many very good activities and the facilitators are great and very professional. The choice of food and varied and well presented. I will go back!!

Good stay at the hotel lella baya Hammamet  The architecture is too beautiful  Very good atmosphere with the animation team day and evening thank you very much to the entire animation team  The room is clean  Perfect restoration  The staff is friendly  I recommend ❤️❤️❤️🇹🇳🇹🇳🇹🇳🇳🇹🇳

Lella beya   is great hotel we loved our  room with a pool and sea view the service is a 5 star hotel service reception team are very friendly and the food is excellent the bar team is so professional and make really good cocktail... we would like to give a big thanks to the assistant manager Mr mohamed yehya who is making sure all the guests have a perfect stay at the hotel lella beya and have the best holiday of their life.

Stayed at the Bel Azur from 10th May for 10 nights with my husband.    First the good, certain bar staff, in fact just one young man who was really nice, we tipped him of course so that may have had something to do with it, the rest of the bar staff were just plain rude, a few staff in the restaurant were nice but thats it I'm afraid, the reception staff were the worst we have ever come across whilst on holiday, so rude and dismissive.    The beach was lovely although we had to clean the sunbeds and table before we sat down each day, no beach snacks available which was a real pain as we didn't want to go in the restaurant for lunch, we wanted to stay on the beach and the pool snack bar only opened at 3pm!! What good is that to anyone??  The food was terrible, cold and the same choice every single day, this is the 1st holiday where we lost weight when we returned home, both of us!....the room was awful, insects in the bed, yes actually between the bedsheets, ants and these small beetle type things all around the floor and in the bathroom, I complained loads of times to reception and I think they did spray the room but they were back hours later so I gave up.  It was disgusting.   The all inclusive was a joke. We couldn't even get a bottle of water without having an argument first, they had water machines with small cups but we wanted a bottle of water to keep in the fridge in our room and another one to take to the beach, it was virtually impossible to get this, as I have said earlier there were no snack bars open at meal times, 3pm is not lunch time! Tea & coffee facilities in the room were also a joke, 2 satchets of coffee per day, so we could only have 1 coffee each per day!! 2 sugar satchets only, No milk provided at all, this was another argument with reception and we ended up with a litre carton of milk, but we shouldn't have to beg for this stuff, WE HAVE ALREADY PAID FOR IT!! when will these hotels realise this??  We definitely would not recommend this hotel, it is nowhere near 4 star, maybe 2 at the most, go to Turkey instead, they do know how to do all inclusive.  Finally,  this hotel is not disabled friendly, there are steps everywhere (52 from reception to the beach), if you are in a wheelchair there is no way you can get to the beach so please bear this in mind.

reviews.review_title: Beautiful Beach, Great Food – But Bar Staff Let It Down
reviews.review_text: We recently stayed at this hotel and had mixed feelings about our experience. On the positive side, the food was very good, the rooms were clean, and the pool was lovely. The beach was absolutely stunning – definitely the highlight of our stay.  Unfortunately, what really let the hotel down was the attitude of the bar staff. Every time my family and I ordered a drink, we were met with rudeness, especially when speaking English. It felt like we were being treated differently, which was upsetting and really affected our holiday experience.  It’s a shame because the hotel itself has a lot going for it. With better customer service at the bar, this could have been a five-star review.

reviews.review_title: Nice Hotel & Location, But Extremely Rude Staff – Especially at the BarThe hotel is clean, the food is good, the pools a
reviews.review_text: The hotel is clean, the food is good, the pools are beautiful, and the location is perfect. Unfortunately, the experience was completely ruined by the attitude of the staff—especially those working at the bar.  The bar staff were incredibly rude and dismissive, particularly toward English-speaking guests. Basic manners seemed reserved only for those speaking French or Arabic. I felt unwelcome and disrespected every time I tried to order a drink. It was as if serving English speakers was a bother to them.Despite the nice facilities, I would never return or recommend this hotel to anyone who expects respectful, professional service—especially if you speak English.(we are so many nations speaking English)

I stayed at this hotel for 7 days and unfortunately, my experience was very disappointing. The staff at both the bar and the reception were generally unfriendly and seemed like they didn’t want to be there. It often felt as though you were invisible unless you gave a tip — only then did the attitude and service noticeably improve.  During our entire stay, the bed linen was never changed — only the towels were replaced. This lack of basic hygiene and attention to housekeeping was unacceptable for a hotel of this standard.  We also reported a leaking tap in the bathroom that was dripping onto the floor. While it was noted by staff, no one ever came to fix it. At night, the floor became dangerously wet, creating a serious slipping hazard. It was only a matter of time before someone could have gotten hurt.  Overall, I wouldn’t recommend this hotel. Poor service, lack of maintenance, and disregard for guest comfort and safety made our stay far below expectations.

I had a wonderful stay in the bel azur hammamet hotel. The food is amazing with various choices. Our room had a nice view on the beach and the sea. And a big thanks to the entertainment team which was our favorite part of this holiday especially the entertainer Mimo who was very kind and funny.

reviews.review_title: Amazing and Professional Animation Team, Thanks Roger!
reviews.review_text: We've recently arrived home from Bel Azur (A group of 4). From the moment we arrived to the moment we left we fully enjoyed our stay here. The hotel was clean, the pool was very inviting. There were a good selection of food to choose from at meal times, as well as pool side snacks during the day. And drinks were very well measured if you like to get tipsy - very easily.  But I'm a lightweight.  All staff couldn't do enough for you. Always greeting you with a smile. You could walk alone within the grounds and beach feeling safe without any worry.   Personally the Animation Team made my holiday. There were plenty going on during the day to join in with. They made their way around the pool to say good morning  to all guests which set your day up feeling happy. A  good personal touch! In the evenings their shows were performed to a high standard, very energetic and fun to watch.  Plenty of dancing too!  I have to say a massive thanks to Roger for all of his hard work. Always putting in 100% and with the running of his team.  A true professional!

Just back from this hotel, must admit didn’t know what to expect after reading some reviews. However, it exceeded my expectations first visit to Tunisia. I will definitely be back and to the bel azur had a fabulous experience friendly chatty staff go out their way to help we did tip so this help keep our glasses full. They recognise you more and will be attentive.  The grounds and outlook to the beach was marvellous plenty to explore in the grounds alone and private beach, this was a chill out holiday and we did just  pool very nice snacks good etc The food was lovely always plenty of choice you will always find something even if a nice salad or pizza and chips but I especially liked the beef dishes. Breakfast was ok omelette freshly made crepes etc fried eggs boiled eggs cereals fruit or continetal meats cheese etc.  The rooms were spacious and clean. Cleaned every day with lovely staff . Overall I had a wonderful time and hope to return next year

reviews.review_title: A memorable holiday, thanks Bel Azur, Tunisia.
reviews.review_text: I've only gone and booked to go back again. What a fantastic hotel, all the staff are friendly, polite and couldn't do enough for you. A big shout out to Simon yet again he made my holiday memorable putting me at ease to join in on the activities, he is a real credit to the hotel. I had so much fun, I'd like to thank Simon,  Naz, Zizu, Mimo, Dido and Paulina  from the entertainment team, they made my holiday special.  Wow Tunisia is gorgeous. The food was really enjoyable, plenty to choose from, never went hungry.  Can't wait to go back. Bye for now.

Absolutely wonderful hotel. From the food to the animations!!! Wonderful, friendly people, very willing to help and answer any questions. The food was fresh, very varied and delicious. Lots of fruit and sweets. Fantastic animators!!!!!! both for children and adults. Great fun for everyone in a nice atmosphere both by the pool and in the hotel. Evening shows are great, something different every day, lots of laughter and fun. Great swimming pools: both outdoors and an indoor pool with a jacuzzi inside. Beautiful beach, clean, well-kept rooms. My son and I are delighted and will definitely go back there .Thank you very much for the best holiday in years.

I had an amazing time at this hotel. I can't write a bad word about the hotel. They truly catered and looked after me so well. Even in middle of the night I woke up hungry the receptionist wrnt to the kitchen and found me something to eat 😄. The entertainment team were amazing. Especially Simon he was so outgoing and full of energy. 10/10. They were amazing with the children as well as the adults so thankyou Simon for making my holiday so special. Also want to mention Sammy. He looked after me so much whilst staying. Always making sure I had everything I wanted. So caring. Highly recommend.

I chose this hotel as I needed an A/I resort not far from Tunis. My wife and teenage son remained at the resort whilst I travelled to Saudi for a few days. I thought she would be safe and relaxed. I was wrong. She was pestered by Simon the entertainment guy, who was rude, aggressive and unwelcome. I emailed Hotel Guest Relations and was reassured my wife would be safe. When I returned to the hotel, Simon was no longer there, and we were informed he would not return. They offered us some complimentary spa tickets which we didn't use. I notice now on other reviews that Simon is back! Be careful Ladies, watch out for him. His advances are not pleasant. I would never return to this hotel or one of the sister hotels, they seem to employ untrustworthy individuals. The safety of guests not being a concern. This is a shame as I must admit some of the staff were excellent. (Kamil the barman for example)

The Hotel is amazing, the food and hospitality was great, the facilities were amazing, we was made to feel very welcome by the entertainment team especially by zizou, abir, Mimo and Dido who always made sure we was having the best time, Enjoyed very much

Had an amazing stay, hotel was clean and tidy, always found something to eat, only thing that could be improved was the labelling of the food especially for those with allergies! The reception staff could be more approachable but I didn’t go on holiday to talk to reception so wasn’t a big problem.  The entertainment team were amazing and attentive and put on a variety if activities suited for everyone and the shows in the evening. There was always something going on! Special shout out to Simon, who interacted well with everyone and made all the activities even more fun! Very attentive and made was such a positive and friendly person who made us feel very welcome and safe even when going outside the hotel! Don’t think I saw him without a smile on his face! Would definitely return

I'm really looking forward to my next vacation in July! It will be the 4th time for me at Bel Azur, but the first time there with my daughter. We are really looking forward to seeing Simon and his team again, as we have known him from another hotel for almost two years! We are so happy to have met him and feel welcome and supported and would travel anywhere he goes. He has such a friendly, unobtrusive and very helpful manner...my daughter is always very happy about the animation team's t-shirts :)!  All day long you can take part in activities such as Zumba and yoga and dance classes...or table tennis and darts...also volleyball in the summer. But if you just want to watch or relax, you won't be pressured, but it will be accepted and you can watch or just enjoy the peace and quiet.  The special highlight is always the evening shows, in which the team can show off their skills! The management is also very accommodating and helpful. For example, I contacted the hotel in advance to get a specific bungalow with a sea view and was very pleased that it went smoothly. If there were any problems, everyone was very helpful. You just feel very welcome.  I would immediately recommend the hotel to anyone who wants to spend a nice, relaxing holiday, in a very beautiful spot, with a wonderful sea view and with great, friendly staff!❤️

A little disappointed with the bad reviews about this hotel , as I have been visiting with my family for more than 20 years each year , I have seen the evolution of this beautiful establishment and if there is one thing that has not changed it is the warm welcome of the staff , the kindness and energy of the entertainment team, the good humor of the lifeguards, the self-calming that the establishment brings ,  I see a lot of complaining about the behavior of the animators things that is totally false, especially the animator Simon who is really a big-hearted and respectful animator, you have to understand that these people remain humans who feel feelings like all of us , sometimes fatigue or personal worries that they can not talk about it we know nothing we are not in their places, I have seen with my own eyes some customers approach the animators in unpleasant ways and especially the animator Simon so we should not expect them to answer you with a smile or be at your command, they are humans and feel things, go in polite ways and with a smile believe me that they will make it x10 and make you have an incredible stay, we have our share of responsibility when we go to an establishment, their job is to entertain us and ours is to facilitate their work and be pleasant, I would like you to learn how to put yourself in the shoes of these people , because working in such a top establishment is not that easy , be smiling at the staff who are in the kitchen , entertainment , reception and beach .  Can’t wait to return this summer so you can spend a pleasant family holiday! And live your own experience without listening to negative reviews!  I would like to tell the Animators to stay as they are and especially the Animator Simon thank you for all these pleasant moments and the time you gave to my family and especially my sister who is autistic as well as the laughter you brought us.

Had an amazing holiday at this hotel. The hotel itself is a little dated and could use a refurb and some more toilets !!  The food is a bit hit and miss but we generally found something to eat. The waiting staff were amazing and kept us a table every night and our glasses topped up!  The animation team are the best I’ve ever come across. The evening entertainment shows are brilliant and wonderfully choreographed.  The guys work so hard and are so friendly but not pushy if you don’t want to join in, they don’t push you to. Special mention to Simon who was so friendly and always stopped to have a chat an a laugh with us. He was always happy to help with any problems, generally a great guy!   Definitely recommend this hotel and we would return  ❤️

Went for a family holiday, food was great and rooms were lovely. Entertainment was amazing and the staff tried to get everyone involved especially Simon and another gent whose name begins with M I can’t remember it unfortunately. Will definitely go back we all loved it

reviews.review_title: Good but scared of drunken aggressive guests.
reviews.review_text: We arrived at hotel topd room not ready till 3 go have a drink food. We went back later to be told you have choice of 2 rooms 1st no balcony so 2nd was over looking pool and sea. Room was dated but clean.   Food was ok found something every day. I didn't like the papper cups at breakfast for juices. Lunch and evening meal you had bottle water. For myself not enough serving spoons food was getting picked up by closest server spoon tongs. Bread is hard for toast. Also labeling is not correct says chicken and ws cheese 1 day. Choice between red white wine beer or pop. Plenty salad soups wasnt to my liking bit bland.  Drinks vodka i liked no issues hubby liked beer, they did diet drinks as well as full sugar.   Entertainment was good day and night they didn't pester you if you said no. The animation team are good ..   1 massive thing was they allowed a very ignorent man in hotel always drunk and was swearing and threatening people. I reported him to head manager after a issue.  I was not only person to complain but was over looked and they still gave him beer when he was threatening people and bad language. I was looking over my shoulders all time.   Reception staff need to be addredsing ressed rude and don't speak or understand lot of English.   I personally will never return to this hotel.

We had a great time in Bel Azur. The highlight for me was the staff and their attitude towards guests - Sofienne at reception, Riadh, Fawzi, Karim, Mohammed, Yassin at the buffet and bars, among a few other staff members made sure that we were always well attended and happy! The entertainment team - Paulina and the others made sure they created a fun environment, I really enjoyed the yoga and Zumba classes. Our room had a great sea view where we could enjoy the sound of the waves. The Bio Azur Spa was amazing, we wish we could spend more time there!

reviews.review_title: Hotel bel azur hamamet and a great hotel and great view , great service , beautiful beach and good pool , extremely good meal , j
reviews.review_text: Hamza super cool , super nice , welcoming top of the top best animator and information of all the hotels we made , great service in the hotel and all super welcoming, I recommend this hotel. Beautiful beach and great view , impeccable service

The staff is very friendly and they all give their very best. The hotel is good and the beach is amazing.  Our room is in good shape and always very clean. I have to mention here one women!  Najoua is the most lovely staff, she always cleans the room perfect and makes the nicest figures out of towels. Every morning she greets us and has the most beautiful smile. I've never had such a heart warming women at a vacation. Her ability to clean the room, the creative ideas for the towel figures is amazing.   Thank you so much! You always made our day at our vacation!   Lots of love to you - Room 471 ❤️

Really relaxing holiday with very hard working staff. Hotel was calm and suited what we wanted. Buffet was good with choice and not hectic staff excellent at wanting to help. We also got moved to a more suitable room due to my wife breaking a bone in her foot just before arriving. Our maid was brilliant going above and beyond (Farida and our room was/still is at present 115) she always has a smile on her face and works very hard. Entertainment team good and remembered our names which means a lot to children.

I booked this hotel based on the numerous positive reviews, but was disappointed in almost every aspect. The service leaves much to be desired. While the staff appears to make an effort, there is a lack of genuine attentiveness and professionalism. Waiting times for service are often long, and inquiries are sometimes ignored or answered reluctantly. The service staff is  friendly.  The food is mediocre at best. The selection is limited, many dishes are bland, and the overall quality feels like mass-produced catering. The atmosphere in the dining area was particularly disturbing: during meals, there was often a lot of noise and unrest. Muslim children ran around the buffet area unsupervised, throwing food on the floor and playing loudly. Unfortunately, the staff did nothing to address the situation, even though it was clearly unpleasant for many guests.  We booked an upgrade for the Starprestigue Room and additional space in the hotel and outside. But even with the upgrade (€€) we felt like a normal guest or even less seen than others. Sure we understand that tips are very common and seen and we also give more when the service ist good at the start (first looking how good the service is). It was not really relaxing sadly. We were like transparent. You don't give since day one something youre out. Sadly. But even with an upgrade - which costs extra - you have no "extra" Extra.  In addition, the hotel is in urgent need of renovation. Many areas feel outdated and do not match the standard advertised.  Anyone seeking peace, relaxation, and a premium vacation experience will likely be disappointed. I cannot recommend this hotel and will advise my travel agency to stop recommending it as well.

We stayed in room no 394. It is our last day today. From the start to the end, there was nothing but amazing service by hotel management and staff members. I want to give special credit to the Rawdha room cleaner, who gave us amazing service with a smile. My check-in reception  staff, Salava and Marvin, was very professional and polite. Snack bar near the swimming pool Nadia and her manager were excellent.  Nada worked very hard and constantly provided good service and her men  manager who look after us ist day with issue staff placing used serving spoon after eating  from dish which was on display for guest. That was unacceptable; I think this member of staff may have been given a break to eat and decided to help himself. I am sorry for mentioning that as it does matter to all the guests.  At restaurant  waiter I took picture with was excellent  above and beyond of any expectation. I forgot name sorry. Special mention to Abdul , the one always with smile and helpful. My ring donut lady made special effort to make yummy ring donut for me. Tall men at omlate station went extra mile to give good service.   In short most of staff is gems to  hotel. Just want to let everybody to be aware they serve only local alcoholic drinks if one is fussy they bring their own. Waiter who served us drinks yesterday need special mention for his service.  Well done Ibrostar, we will be back.

Brilliant Holiday Fantastic hotel room spacious clean and always tidy clean towels every day Meals fantastic choice unbelievable choice and brilliant staff   Evenings in very large lounge, entertainment every evening all drinks brought to you by an army of waiters Pools 2 always beds available, beach front the softest white sand stretched for miles crystal clear blue sea   Short walk to harbor area the locals always friendly and polite  would give this holiday 11/10 no complaints what so ever

reviews.review_title: Staff are so good they made our holiday memorable. Hope to return soon.
reviews.review_text: My husband and I returned last week from an enjoyable holiday. Staff were very attentive helpful and friendly.  We stayed in room 172 nothing was to much for the staff.Food in restaurant was excellent. Lots of choice. Had ground floor room with garden view .

reviews.review_title: A very good stay to do again.
reviews.review_text: A Hotel access on customer service, room (207) is very clean , Thank you Nadia. The complex is great, excellent food.  All the staff is very attentive to you. At the pool level if you need a deckchair or umbrella we place it for you. Waiters come to serve around the pool. We feel VIP. Thanks. Christel and Matthew.

I stayed here in April with my Mum for her birthday.   From the moment we arrived through to checkout the service was exceptional. Marwen the manager we spoke with and all staff went over and above  and surpassed our expectations.   The beach was lovely.   The food and show cooking was fabulous.  We did have dinner in Tunisian al a carte but this wasn’t as good as the food on the buffet restaurant.   The terrace waiters constantly brought us drinks.   The bedding and rooms cleaned to a very high standard.   We will definitely be back. Thank you for a lovely time

A beautiful place, made for people with reduced mobility bravo! A pearl named Farida that makes us our impeccable room always with a note of fancy chbre 110.A big thank you for your smile!!! See you soon.

reviews.review_title: Hotel looks a little tired however………
reviews.review_text: We’ve had a lovely relaxing stay. Not on par with other 5* hotels and Iberostar could do with injecting some money to bring it up to the standard of its sister hotel the Kuriat Palace however some of the staff exceed 5*. Najua our housekeeper kept our room very clean with beautiful bed art. Kamel in the star prestige area deserves a shoutout along with Raouf (bartender), MedAli (waiter), Marwen (front desk), Ayman (bar tender in lobby) and Lassad (bar manager), these people have made our holiday and have shown consistency in there service to ensure us a fabulous stay. Thank you, we will be back.

reviews.review_title: We had such a wonderful time we’re coming back next year
reviews.review_text: Trip advisor  This was our annual girl’s trip away. On arriving at the hotel we were greeted by Houseem who took care of us during the whole trip. We upgraded to a star prestige room which was lovely. The room had a super king bed, coffee machine, mini bar and had been beautifully cleaned and prepared by Rahma. A Star Prestige room gave you free sun-bed towels, 25% off the spa, private sunbathing area and access to a roof top sunbathing terrace, this also had a hot tub and there were a selection of pastries and sandwiches to help yourself to. Mohamad was on bar duty on the rooftop and looked after all the guests amazingly.   In the buffet restaurant we were looked after by zadine who found us a table each afternoon and evening. The food was great with a variety of different cuisines to choose from. There is also a restaurant which serves Italian or Tunisian menus on different nights, this can get busy so best to book on arrival.  There were a couple of organised trips you could go on- to the Madina, on a catamaran or quad biking. We went on the catamaran. We pre booked the spa in advance as last year it was fully booked and had 2 treatments during our stay and made full use of the gym and swimming pool.  Each evening a different cocktail was served in the bar and entertainment was put on.  A huge shout out to our waiters Aymen and Oussama, they were great and looked after us during our stay  A huge thank you to the staff. This was the second year we have stayed here and  yet again we had an amazing time. We have already started looking for our visit for next year. See you all in 2026 xx

I would like to warmly thank all the hotel staff for your exceptional welcome, professionalism and kindness throughout my stay. You have contributed greatly to making this experience enjoyable and memorable.   A huge thank you to Leïla, who took care of our rooms (290/292) throughout our stay. Thanks to you, we found her every day impeccable, welcoming and full of little touches that made all the difference. Your kindness, discretion and professionalism were greatly appreciated. Thank you for your outstanding work and dedication!

Perfect hotel, very welcoming staff, our housekeeper LEILA exceptional, attentive, we were in room 286, our room always very clean. We came with family and friends for an unforgettable birthday 🎂  A big THANK YOU ☺️ to all the staff

reviews.review_title: Just a fabulous laid back hotel set on a stunning bit of beach sea is amazing and the staff make this hotel what it is x
reviews.review_text: Superb hotel stayed in room 434 a prestige room was fabulous the cleaner was excellent in fact all the staff are so lovely waiter service in all the areas pool beach and hotel bars cannot do enough for you definitely coming back next year xxxxxc

Great hotel. Everyone is super welcoming and warm. Very good atmosphere, with entertainment throughout the day and evening. All staff are available and service at any request. Beach 2min walk, superb pool. Room service at the top, with pretty decorations every day on the bed (room 474, Thanks to Najoua) Cleanliness at the top, sea view from the balcony. I highly recommend.

Our first visit to Tunisia and wow we were impressed. Firstly we want to thank the staff, we stayed in room 339 and Saeeda our housekeeper kept our room clean and spotless. Second, Yassine by the pool looked after us and kept bringing us drinks without even asking. Next was Abdelaziz and Hitchem in the restaurant who were lovely and so friendly. Next we want to mention the food, the chefs really cooked outstanding food, we were amazed how the lamb, beef and chicken were cooked perfectly especially when it was batched cooked! (There are plenty of veg options such as salad bar, vegan corner etc) The food that stood out was the Tunisian food and sweets. The all inclusive drinks had a very large choice including alcoholic and non alcoholic to cater everyone. Entertainment were very hard working and didnt badger you if you didnt want to join. One small criticism is we hoped for more Tunisian inspired shows etc and less of cruise ship inspired acts. Overall, a wonderful holiday we did not want to end and we will definitely be back to Tunisia in the future. À bien tôt!

Stunning hotel with incredible food, facilities and service  We are staying in room 337 and Saeed (our cleaner) has been superb and fridge stocked every day! Thank you!  Big shout out to Yassine who consistently greeted us every day with a smile by the pool and kept us hydrated  The staff here are all incredible  I recommend this hotel to anyone, couples, families or friends travelling together  The perfect base for a relaxing week in 5 star hospitality

Hello what about this hotel? it is beautiful the staff is very kind always to the little care for we have a pleasant stay server at the top reception also at the top and what about the lady who looks after our room number 106 Farida always smiling and a kindness, you can come to this hotel with your eyes closed

Excellent Hotel, perfect cuisine, perfect cleanliness, women, room very well also, we are accommodated at the 106 It is Farida who takes care of us she is great of a kindness we recommend this beautiful hotel everyone is taking care of us

reviews.review_title: Very nice personnel and hotel , made us feeling so great from the first day of vacatin , very entraiment and funny peopl
reviews.review_text: I meet very good people from the staff who made us be very funny toghether and also getting best spots with them , very good recption and personnel of this hotel so good and very grateful seeing us here made good vibes and very nice memories , also good reception

reviews.review_title: AMAZING holiday. Read my true opinion
reviews.review_text: What can I say AMAZING . Just returned from a week’s holiday here and what an amazing experience we had. The hotel is clean and tidy. The rooms are basic but you don’t spend much time in them so it’s ok. The food was lovely, something for everyone. I do advise you to bring your own cups as they serve you soft drinks in tiny paper cups. The waiting staff are absolutely amazing. So attentive and kind. Giving them a small tip for their service made them treat us like VIP’s. Nothing was too much trouble for them. Treat with respect to be treated with respect. As for the animation team, FANTASTIC. They are so welcoming and super friendly. They go all out for the guests, chatting and getting you to get involved. They are amazing with children, doing kids dances every evening letting them be on the stage dancing while they stand on the dance floor doing the actions making the children the stars of the show, Joe, Eddi, Rio, Leo just to name a few, ABSOLUTELY AWESOME.  There was a man called Amid who sold trips on a pirate ship, camel treck, quads etc, who was really lovely. The pirate ship was the highlight of my holiday. Thanks Amid x Overall the holiday was FANTASTIC. I am ready looking to book again. Thank you guys for the perfect holiday xx🇹🇳

Stayed at the Riadh Palm hotel in December and again in 16th May. Had a great holiday the hotel is in a great location for sousse the staff where great couldn’t do enough for me. The rooms are big I had a city room very clean and comfortable my chamber maid was very good at her job and spoke very good English. The food was great something for everyone the pool was beautiful and you just walked right onto the beach, so all round the hotel was fantastic.

One of the worst experience I’ve ever had. Having booked a family holiday for 20 of us. I emailed the hotel as I was a travel agent and wanted to take photos and videos to upload on my social media platform. To be told that it was fine and then when I got there 1 day into my trip I had a security man who was a piece of work himself turn up at my room door to take my drone off me. He then got the police involved even though he lied and said he didn’t. The guest relations manager Abir told us it was him and he’s a horrible human. I ended up having my drone seized and Abir has since ignored all my messages as I needed police details for my insurance claim. As for the hotel, the food was average and the rooms was dirty!

A great place to relax, food is great and the animation team is out of this world.  I went solo this time and maybe next time will come with my family …………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………..

We had a great stay at this hotel twice and never disappointed I really recommend this hotel. The welcome is warm , the new entertainment team is at the top ( Ahmed , Ninja , Lary , Paola , Zizo, Chico etc... . We took a standard room and finally when we arrived at the hotel we were upgraded and we had a suite. Really go to this hotel it is great

So we had a great stay at this hotel , I highly recommend  The welcome was great. Food is average Perfect bar service  The new animation team is on top of the top thank you very much to Ahmed he is always listening, do not hesitate to contact him if you want something. Thanks for the rest of the team too (Ninja,Lary,Paola,zizo,pato….)  In relation to the room the mattresses are a bit hard and the cushions also.

احسن فندق جربتو مشاء الله كلش باهي  thanks for all the team animTiom team and i like the food  and hotel vibe and personnel too 😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍 شكرا على الاجواء حبيت الاكل و العمال بالفنق محترمين

Returned this morning from tish palms and I never complain about my holidays especially Tunisia but omg so many bad things for a supposed 4 star hotel I've been to much nicer 3 stars. The new animation teal they bought in after sacking the old ones are so bad they don't interact with guests or put on shows all they do is let the guests participate every night karaoke/female beauty pageant/men v women that's all they do. Maybe the male members of team should spend less time bedding the female guests which  I saw.  Now the reception staff the worse I've ever come across in my life the women especially yesterday telling me to go take shower at pool as I had vacated room at 12 and didn't fly till v late I was very upset to b spoken to like that at 65 absolutely no respect for women. Eventiyhe asst manager came to help resolve problem.
