The best thing bout this hotel is the food in restaurant the best choice I've ever had.will I be returning here NEVER and not will any of the other English guests I spoke to but I suppose the hotel not bothered by ENGLISH not returning

We come 17th mai it's realy good hotel , thx for  team animation ❤️‍🔥❤️‍🔥  Special the mc man 🎤 💪🤘 The weather it was lovely weather  They people in the hotel they are amazing  Thank you for everybody and see you soon inchallah ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️

We come 17th mai it's realy good hotel , thx for  team animation ❤️‍🔥❤️‍🔥  Special the mc man 🎤 💪🤘 The weather it was lovely weather  They people in the hotel they are amazing  Thank you for everybody and see you soon inchallah ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️

Great hotel, with good new animation - beach bars , lobby. Delicious beer, and cocktails 🔥 SLAH is nice in animation very funny ! Aqua gym also! Work very fast, clean and delicious! For the whole family, the big beach, Food 5/5  Beach 5/5  And more! 💖

reviews.review_title: Great hotel and some great staff
reviews.review_text: Amazing hotel, the staff were great, room was great, beach and restaurant were great. Most of the staff actually take the time to talk to you and treat you like a respected guest. I never felt alone or bored. There is lots to do. The paying bar (American bar) was great in the evening. And the food included in All-inclusive was great too lots of options.  I spent a lot of time at the beach, Yassine and oussema from the beach bar are amazing!! They are very quick, they are friendly and make you feel very welcome! They made my holiday much better! I will happily return to this hotel, even if I was travelling by myself.  Overall, very clean, spacious, professional and worth the money.

reviews.review_title: Wonderful stay at Riadh Palms in Sousse Tunisia
reviews.review_text: This was my first visit to Tunisia. This hotel was recommended to me by a friend who lives in Sousse. It was a wonderful stay! The room was large with a nice balcony! The only issue at the beginning was that the room was warm, but they said the a/c wasn't turned on until June 1st. After I got a small fan, the room was very comfortable! The biggest plus at the Riadh Palms for me was the staff there. They were so welcoming and friendly! Fadhel who worked at reception and handled currency exchange was super nice and helpful for me, especially when I couldn't get the TV remote to work. Also, Isra, who worked as a hostess at the hotel restaurant couldn't have been more kind!! During my 6 day stay there I mostly had Ali, Anwar, and Anas as my waiters at the hotel restaurant and all 3 were so kind and entertaining and attentive to any needs I had. Great job! Lastly, Ola and Odel, who both worked in the reception area were very kind, and Ola helped me set up an excursion to the city of Kairaoun. I highly recommend this hotel!

Highly recommend, very friendly staff, food is tasty, the best beach waitress Yassine excellent service, smiling all the time very helpful  !  The Best waitress in the hotel that for sure Yassine all the time looking after people sitting on the beach/ swimming pool

Riadh Palms Living it up in the ghetto   Come out the hotel front and your on the street Beach is dirty covered In glass and fag buts Sea water is dirty have to swim out to get to clean water  Confirmed by staff and holidaymakers the hotel is run by the mafia Fights break out between holidaymakers - one fight happened and they had to pay £500 to not get the authorities involved (witnessed in Zino bar which is situated in the hotel) Cocaine sold by the taxi driver out front and two men stationed around the pool that will offer you “anything you want they can get”  Offers free WiFi yet you can’t get onto it, you’ll need to buy a Tunisian SIM card £13 for 27gb First lot of animation staff were fired due to misconduct I.e. selling drugs for the “wrong” opposite cartel Offers a key safe in your room however you have to pay for the key 20dinar You have a tv but have to pay for the remote which doesn’t have English channels bar 2 news channels  Cleaners leave your balcony door unlocked and slightly open as they put kids on the roof to go into your rooms and steal your belongings - floors 1 and 2. Cleaners will also use anything you have out, I.e. make up, deodorant, and even take your tablets you have out They will also let themselves into your room at random moments tell you they have a bad back indicating they want a tip, even when the rooms been cleaned they still “pop in” for no reason whatsoever  Prepare yourself for the same playlist of music, one for the day time and one for the evening Evening entertainment isn’t amazing, my niece and nephew could choreograph a dance better than the animation team  Lots of flies, apparently they bite, either that or bedbugs but I daren’t lift the mattress cover up (what you don’t know doesn’t always hurt, unless you get bitten)  “You wont go hungry people say”, salad bar is good, breakfast it’s good so just stock up on that, hotdogs are alright, burgers are undercooked and the meat is questionable.  If you hate the smell of cigarettes avoid it. If you’re looking for a holiday stay that replicates a Temu version of Butlins - go for it. It’s as if everyone’s saved up their universal credit to come abroad. It’s “cheap” for a reason.  Male staff pester you constantly asking you for your number and social media tags, had to put ring on wedding finger to pretend to be married even though that didn’t make a difference  No doesn’t mean no here (if you know what I mean).  Avoid coming here as a solo traveller avoid coming here as a group of females - it’s not safe, I’ve had a chair against my door every evening (I told a staff member at the front desk and he said it’s because I am “beautiful”, not the best response I must admit.  Air conditioning doesn’t come on until July as it’s “not hot enough”, it’s been 30-33 degrees Celsius   Minority of staff are friendly and helpful (people in the food hall), the rest are unhelpful, speak to you disgustingly, the rest clearly hate the British (which I can see why as so many I have witnessed are rude and aggressive) & clearly don’t want to work here let alone want to help you Reception staff are as much use as a chocolate teapot and will walk away or do something so they don’t have to deal with you or your query you may have  Last point, there isn’t an “on the beach” holiday rep and the “love holidays” rep is MIA as mentioned by holiday makers who booked through love holidays   Genuine review from a genuine person from the UK - my stay was 17/05 to 24/05 & I will be claiming compensation off of on the beach for the troubles and stress this holiday has caused me.

reviews.review_title: PLEASE BRING US BACK THE OLD ANIMATION TEAM !!
reviews.review_text: I went solo to this hotel trying to have some good quality time and that was more than i expected  i spent the most beautiful day's there and that dedicated only to the staff of animation,  they were very amazing so warming and know how to make fun they really know what their job is .. spending the best time with them around the pool doing activities together and after the dinner in the animation show .. it was splendid and breathtaking.. me and my new friends around the world that i meet them there we were really enjoying every night at the animation we spent so much fun and happiness time very good quality time there ... when they get fired we really get upset  very upset .. the new team of animation they were very bad and not focusing in their job and don't have acceptance at all ..PLEASE GIVE US BACK OUR BELOVED OLD ANIMATION TEAM  I surly want to comebacks very soon to spend another quality time but not with this BAD animation team ...  Otherwise the hotel is very good the food is not that much could be better .. not tasty at all .. The room was good enough .. clean every morning thanks for the staff  The pool was nice .. the bar staff was good and nice too  and GIVE US BACK THE OLD ANIMATION TEAM PLEASE! for god sake

The whole holiday was amazing, beautiful complex,staff were so friendly, the went above and beyond what we expected, the restaurant staff were brilliant, the 2 girls on the welcome door to the restaurant were so professional, friendly,and really took to our family, the enyertsyagg were amazing, so much energy, and tome for everyone, they even came looking for us on our last day to say how sad they were to be seeing us leave for home,we would be booking again,but recently we found out that all the entertainment staff were sacked, which is a massive mistake in my eyes as they were brilliant,

The best beach waitress Yassine good service, smailing all the time very friendly talkative and he do the best job in whole hotel service that opinion from me and my whole family !!  Highly recommend if you have any questions Yassine is very helpful person

We had such a lovely holiday everything was amazing and not too much trouble for any of the staff! The animation team was brilliant welcoming fun energetic!! We had every intention of re booking until we found out that the whole animation team was fired!! Very doubtful now that we will re book! Who ever decided to fire these amazing guys sorry u made the wrong decision! Shame on u as ur hotel will suffer for ur bad choices!

name: Radisson Blu Palace Resort & Thalasso, Djerba

reviews.review_text: Stayed at this hotel  for two nights with Gate 1/Discovery Tours.  Room 4103 Nice size room with comfortable king bed.  Pillows not comfortable.  Also no A/C, which only gets turned  on in the summer; although it was 80 degrees outside.  Room was very hot.  No hairdryer in room.  Guests have to get one at the front desk.  Buffet breakfast had good choices.  Eating a fair due to the A/C issue.
Great hotel, the staff is very friendly and very helpful. Nice beach. Not too far from the airport is appreciable.

Good stay, despite the mixed weather, the restaurant is good, the pool large, and the staff is very welcoming with a special mention for Chabanne and Houcine who are not only excellent bartenders, but also very good animators, we spent great evenings in their company. A big thank you to Salem for his kindness and his work in the rooms and also to the waiter (I forgot the first name, he will recognize himself, tall and 15 years of profession, providing the service at lunch), very attentive to customers c in addition an interesting discussion.

My best moment was the welcome, this charming Faten, smiling and so warm. Luckily you have it and also the hotel is beautiful it's a fact. We stayed 6 days the bathtub was never washed the same traces from start to finish. The rest of the cold staff, the Italian restaurant, the waiters all stressed, at breakfast we hear someone screaming in the kitchens, what a pity! Luckily washed facing the sea feels good.We were there for it.

Good coonditions, nice quality food, good services at the room and also at the pool. Muhamed animator engayged as tu play games, best animator, with his qualeg Valid, Wee spent nice times to play darts, archery with music and winer's coctail.

Beautiful hotel Lovely room and excellent staff  Restaurants and bars excellent value for money. Can’t fault it Predominantly language French as not many visitors from UK so communication can be difficult but staff very helpful and really not a problem  Wonder whether some of reviews are same hotel!

reviews.review_title: You have to come to believe
reviews.review_text: Beautiful recovery, magnificent Pro, welcome, warm, room, comfortable, restaurant, exceptional, magnificent pool, relaxation area, a pleasure and staff of love, I recommend

reviews.review_title: Friendly staff, but lack of maintenance and sense of detail
reviews.review_text: Basically a nice hotel with friendly staff, spacious rooms and good space at the pool. But the stay was marked by wear, lack of maintenance, unmanaged beach, low-season atmosphere and lack of sense for the details that create a 5-star experience.  The hotel's building and common areas are architecturally beautiful and gave a nice first-hand impression. The room was spacious, quiet and was done properly clean every day, creating a relaxed base during the stay. The pool area is large and nice to stay at, and although there were no play facilities, there was plenty of room for children to swim and play. Pool staff were friendly and attentive. The same was true of the restaurant staff, who were helpful and welcoming, also toward children. The children’s club was quiet, but the staff there was really sweet and caring – and created a safe experience for my child. It worked well that you could collect payments through the room bill, and overall I experienced the hotel staff as friendly and service minded in the meeting face to face.  The hotel seemed worn out and marked by a lack of sense for the small details that distinguish a luxury hotel from an ordinary resort. The beach area was a big disappointment: The beach chairs were worn and in trouble, and the beach – although it is beautifully located and close to the hotel – was filled with dungeons and camellot. There was no beach bar at the family beach, only at the adult area, and the beach seemed generally unarranged and sad.  We booked a pirate boat trip through the hotel, which my son was looking forward to. However, the ship turned out to be the dullest one we saw in the harbor – without any decorations or details, and it did not seem clean. My son had a nice experience, but looked long after the other, much nicer ships.  Communication with the hotel prior to the stay also did not work optimally. Our messages via Booking.com were not answered, and even the day after arrival I had to point out the services I had booked from home – even though it was the hotel itself that had sent the offers.  The area around the hotel was also boring and isolated. One had to take a taxi to get into Houmt Souk, where there were restaurants and life. There were no cafes, shops or city life within walking distance, making the stay a little monotonous – especially if you travel without a car.  The whole was marked by a low season and a general feeling that the hotel had not yet gotten up in gear – and that it needed a complete renovation.

First impression, deceptive, ,reception, lobby, lounge, everything very beautiful, staff friendly, check-in instant, all ok. And then the horror starts, we lived in room 4105, apparently a mouse or other animal died in the vent, if you turn on the air conditioner for a long time, then on your return the corpse smell, okay, you can keep the air conditioner on, then ok. Beds, furniture, pillows, curtains and everything else is clean, but very, very old, everything is stuccoed, and already just throw away, impossible to use.  It concerns everything, elevator, sunbeds on the beach, towels there, umbrellas , ace just need to throw away!!! By the way no one ever cleans the beach, okay the sand was leveled, the algae garbage has not been removed, but the whole beach is complete!!!! In the faeces of camels and horses (they ride tourists on the beach) no one!!! It doesn't.  The staff just don't want anything, nobody's even trying to do anything.  Spa separate story for 80 € is the worst massage imaginable!!! And the spa itself is dirty and long in need of repair. So it's not a 5* or a 4* that's probably a 3*--' breakfast by the way also leaves a lot to be desired.  You should avoid this place!!!

5 stars unworthy! 3 will already be high.  Hotel is very outdated and very dirty. From the rooms, to the sunbeds, to the restaurant, everything is incredibly dirty. The offer in the restaurant is very limited. With All inclusive formula there is only 1 restaurant and 2 bars. All the other restaurants and bars are paying, even the ice creams by the pool. Staff very unfriendly. We will never come back here!

Magnificent hotel in all respects: rooms, common areas, catering, swimming pools, spa, beach etc... with a special mention for the staff who are at the top! The island of Djerba is a must.  ‐----------------------------

Very good hotel, quality service. Spacious room and comfortable bedding. Qualitative buffet, lots of choices. I strongly advise. Thanks to the reception, the catering and cleaning teams. Overall each personal was courteous and welcoming.

Excellent hotel, staff at the top, the spa is very good, the pools too, and the food is very good. I recommend this hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Personal, charming, they try to do their best but we feel that the hotel is old now we have to do a little work a refreshment and it will be perfect as it was, four years ago
The services are impeccable and you have warm welcome, a good plan for all stays.Big thank you🙏🥰

A nice hotel friendly staff, Has still air up, breakfast only a small selection of fruits. Apple oranges.this is aĺles Room very nice beach much too small. Hope that the new management turns things back to the old one.

Extraordinary!! Perfect hotel! great kindness of everyone!!Very clean rooms! great pool!! Delicious meals with lots of choices!!! Thalasso and heated pool at the top We will come back!! it's paradise!!On the other hand if you are all inclusive, avoid the 2 Italian and Tunisian restaurants .... menu at a discount and especially not good!

reviews.review_title: A wonderful stay for us. Thank you from the bottom of my heart
reviews.review_text: Loyal customer of Radisson Blu in Djerba for many years; finally, during my last and recent stay, the arrival of a new Director changed everything.  The hope of seeing a well-run hotel worthy of its setting and stars is finally there.  The staff who for so many years have put their kindness at the service of the guests to make them feel good and have a pleasant stay despite this permanent drop in the quality of the services provided by the hotel.  No doubt this kindness of heart and dedication of all those who work at the Radisson Blu Hotel will be put at the service of the new manager, of whom they certainly expect a lot, to help him succeed in this huge mission of restoring the hotel to the top level.  Good luck to you all. As for the thalasso, its evolution started several years ago continues, contributing to make it one of the most efficient and varied unfortunately little known. Thank you from the bottom of our hearts to all those who helped make this very special stay for me, a wonderful stay for us.

Our stay at this hotel was unfortunately a consistently disappointing experience. The hygienic conditions were unacceptable: So we were served drinks bottles that had bird droppings on them, and the tiles in the room were also damaged. The indoor pool was heavily polluted and looked very run-down overall. Also the cleanliness of the room left much to be desired, as fresh towels were often only provided after multiple requests.  The culinary offer also did not meet our expectations. The food was low quality and the choice in the all-inclusive offer very limited. We also had to pay additional fees for almost all other services, even though we had booked all-inclusive. There were only two ways to get free drinks, which were also only open at certain times.  The experience at the à la carte restaurant was particularly disappointing. We were assured a voucher for dinner after a conversation with the hotel management, but this was not accepted during our visit. Instead, we only received a limited menu, as is also offered to regular all-inclusive guests. Our demand was ignored and we felt mistreated overall.  Also at the reception we received no support in solving our problems. Finally, we had to go to the buffet restaurant with our children, where they suddenly paid conspicuous attention to our table after our situation had probably become known.  Another problem was the defective elevator, which made it very difficult to use the hotel with a stroller on the third floor.  Overall, this stay was a great disappointment. Our expectations for a relaxing holiday have been far exceeded, and we have felt greatly frustrated by the repeated shortcomings and poor service. We can not recommend this hotel.

Very nice hotel where you will spend a peaceful holiday. We particularly enjoyed the Kids Club (entire dedicated building) with facilitators who are caring for the children. Congratulations to Assia, Ayda and Essia. The service at the bar (Lahzar in the morning and Houcine in the evening) is excellent. The buffet is varied and changes daily. The rooms are nice and large. Points of improvement should be noted: wine list to review. Wine ageing and not up to standard. The Tunisian restaurant Flamingo is a disappointment. The service was slow and disorganized. Cleaning in the rooms is done quickly. No vacuum cleaners, so carpets aren't made... The spa and treatments are very nice.  Note that we were able to take 2 beautiful horseback rides with Mohsen (independent) on the beach in front of the hotel. He is trusted and his horses are well fed and treated.  The pool is huge and the staff is helpful, offering towels, deckchairs and cushions at will.  Evening entertainment (concert) is not exceptional.

Good location  Nice clean hotel room but very poorly insulated sound. Good food and quite varied, too bad there is no mustard or grated cheese for pasta  Animators are almost non-existent for people over 40 years old and daily animations exist once in two... Swimming pool very clean but the bath sheets on deposit are... Sheets just plain. In short, hotel with good value for money.

reviews.review_title: The hotel and well animation well they are polite especially Hamza very polite he talks with everyone he and very nice
reviews.review_text: The hotel and well very well pool and bine reception and well the hotel room also c bine there is nothing to say about food and good it cj age every day very well the pool and clean water it well animates them its bine the animates its good top well

Good hotel with good animators good placement very good gastronomy and quiet place very nice beach   Hamza very good animator him and all the others   Room in good condition there is no cockroach or anything like its  Very well placed with several glaciers around

reviews.review_title: The hotel teams and the animators are very well especially hamza always smiling and accessible with all the personal
reviews.review_text: Good service from the hotel  Good activate and not animator  Hotel good condition and perfect  Hamza good host  As well as their entire animation team  Cooks the waiters and the perfect service  The pitches are very well placed the welcome is well

Cold welcome as soon as we arrive, no information regarding the place to go for lunch the next day..but to pay the tax they know how to talk.. We arrive very late in the evening because delay of the flight, my friend being ill she must eat. They're bringing us two plates so far, everything goes, carrot salad cucumbers a miserable slice of je ne sais quoi, no shabby brief seasoning. The next day we look for ourselves or go to lunch because the friendliness of the people at the reception does not make you want to ask anything....  Now let's talk about the wifi...no wifi accessible in the room..the wifi is only at the reception and around the pool still you have to choose the right place...then the high speed wifi announcement is only a lie.  Now let's talk about the bedroom , the wardrobe smells musty, the bedroom smells old, an unpleasant smell.  Cleaning is not the passion of this hotel, disgusting windows not only in the room but everywhere in the commons.  On the balcony two miserable dirty chairs, a rotten table cracked a rotten mini dryer where you can put nothing on it .....  The room with both beds this remains just a pretty clean place.  The toilet and the bathroom I don't talk about it...u. dry hair that must date because crack and it can burn hands.  Cockroach meets in the toilet.....  Now let's talk about the indoor bar... unpleasant waiters no sympathy.  Pool not heated but clean finally a positive.  The buffet was at least good and varied as well as lunch there I can say nothing again.  Atmosphere had to look for her in the hotel next door....just one nice evening in the hotel with a singer.  Hotel is old.  The view from the room on a huge open waste site brief ....

Terrible Experience – Do Not Recommend  I stayed at Hotel Sol Azur Beach and Congres in Hammamet for 14 days, and unfortunately, it turned out to be the worst holiday of my life.  Despite booking an all-inclusive package, basic necessities like bottled water were not provided. You had to beg for each bottle, and the staff often reacted rudely. The hotel was dirty, and the photos online are completely misleading — the reality is far from what is advertised.  The staff was unfriendly and unhelpful, and to make matters worse, 200€ was stolen from our room. When we reported it, no one took any responsibility, and there was no support or compensation offered.  We also experienced frequent power outages in our room and the air conditioning didn’t work at all, which made it unbearable, especially in the heat.  The only positive aspect of this stay was the good food and the fresh watermelon, which we genuinely enjoyed. Unfortunately, that wasn’t enough to make up for the overall poor experience.  This stay was incredibly disappointing and stressful. What was meant to be a relaxing vacation turned into a complete nightmare. I strongly advise others to avoid this hotel — it is absolutely not worth the money.

The warm atmosphere greeted us on arrival and accompanied us throughout the stay. The staff - at the reception, restaurant, rooms, bars, pool,- lived up to our expectations. I enjoyed the cleanliness of the room, as well as the bed, for me very comfortable. Excellent value for money! The sea, very close to the hotel, was very warm for a mid May. The excursion to visit the Berber villages surprised us with the welcome, customs, kindness of Berbers, as well as the original couscous, served in plates in the shape of Fatma's hand. Unforgettable! I find the management of the hotel, very well managed by Madame Rifi.

Pleasant stay luxury hotel warm welcome personally correct very good animations room s own buffet and generous quantity good clean fresh very good quality of products holiday stays validated Thank you all lequpe

The hotel.sol azure has a nice setting clean pool is overlooking .the sea is really sublime.which makes this place unique the cuisine is too varied and very good each meal has an unforgettable taste experience the dishes are prepared with quality products and also fresh the home is very warm I highly recommend beautiful azure.

I had a fabulous weekend at this hotel. The stay was magnificent starting with the warm welcome ,the clean rooms and a superb view overlooking the pool .the kitchen was very varied all tastes are present between the traditional and new dishes .at the end I will come back as soon as possible.

Really top of the top we spent a very very pleasant weekend in all levels buffet varied animation to the top personal very welcoming and respectful especially chef de cuisine mehrez it is really smiling and listening I will return and I encourage everyone to come you do not regret it

The animation team is at the top.  Thanks to Dido and Kimo for having animated the days as well as they did and for allowing us to have a great holiday! The general atmosphere in the hotel is very pleasant. The buffet is very satisfying. We are offered a wide choice that allows everyone to find their happiness. The price of the stay is very affordable for the quality of the hotel  Thank you to the whole team!

Animation team at the top, especially Kimo and Dido. Concerned and attentive to the pleasure of the holidaymakers. Always smiling and available. Various proposed activities.  Well maintained hotel, varied buffet, spacious restaurant with possibility to enjoy the sea view

Very nice hotel...with a very satisfactory reception thanks especially to the customer manager and her team. Very good service Room with terrace and free safe. Small flat on breakfast including no dried fruit, no variety of breads and small pancakes often "burned"

Magnificent view of the Mediterranean sea. Good place to relax and enjoy the beauty of the beach, sun and sea. Overall it's a very wonderful getaway from the stress of city life. The amenities in this hotel could be improved further to make the stay more enjoyable.

Thank you all for the hospitality. The hotel is great, especially the front desk staff. Wonderful, kind and well-mannered people. Thank you, Mrs Dorsaf, Mrs Iman, Mrs Ahlam and Mrs Asmaa. You deserve all the best. Special thanks also to the person who works at the Kairouan bar, Sidi Omar Bouhajla. I don't remember his name. A clean and hardworking person
Great hotel. Many thanks and gratitude to Mrs Dorsaf❤️, Iman❤️, Ahlam❤️ and Asmaa ❤️for their dedication to their work and warm welcome. The bartender❤️ is also great and he is from Kairouan........

Great week  Very attentive staff  Very diverse meals  A special mention to our chef Zied who took care of our table so well every day With kindness and always smiling  A plus, access to thalassotherapy and activities

Awful hotel come to sign in told us we could have our rooms on same floor i was 3 floors away on the other side of hotel go into the room paint peeling of the doors cracks through the walls my key card only worked half of the time not even a sniff of the Wi-Fi in the room floor and entire room looked unclean and tatty  Ask reception where an ATM is the one outside the hotel is broke gives us no other solution later find out the hotel connecting has one in lobby available for use not after I went into town an was followed through the street and had several people try to scam me  Food is the same buffet style as usual little to non of the food is labelled it’s just a mystery every time dessert are the same not very nice at all  Staff don’t speak good English so everything is a ball ache but speak fluent if you have 20 dinar in hand. Sewage smell every time you walk to the beach  Little to non security people coming of the streets stealing drinks and other personal items  Cleaners don’t know how to knock even then will still walk in whilst having a shower Drinks are just not nice. Just the cheapest you can find For the first couple days you will be like a lost dog. Don’t even try and read the map as it’s just very outdated as well as everything else

Sol azur hotel is amazing and Dorsaf was incredibly kind and welcoming during my stay at the hotel She always had a warm smile and was ready to help with anything I needed. Her professionalism and friendliness really made a difference. Thank you, Dorsaf!

We went to the Djerba Aqua Resort, all staff were brilliant, if you had a query, problem etc they couldn't do enough to get it solved. There was a great choice of food, well cooked & the dining area was clean & all waiting staff very friendly & efficient. Some bedrooms were probably a bit dated but the hotel is doing refurbishments & ours was clean. The animation team were marvellous, we go on a few hols a year & these guys are one of the best we've seen in awhile, their energy is great. Probably one downside they could do with a few more public toilets around the complex.

We had a lovely holiday the food was amazing and the entertainment team if we said no to them they just accepted it .The beach was lovely and clean  .The only complaint we would have is that there is not many toilets around the pools and bars ,but would still love to come back

Amazing hotel and Amazing animation staff he does every time activities and many shows special mention for the young man pikachu he  have always smile and every time full energy the bar and the restaurant the reception the beach every thing is good here i will come back soon😁😁😁❤️❤️

reviews.review_title: Awesome stay and would definitely come again
reviews.review_text: Amazing stay and experience. Food was amazing. Pools were clean. We loved the indoor heated pool. The kids club was awesome for our 7 year old and she was able to colour, play with play dough and also use their swimming pool. Animation team were fantastic and we had so much fun. Would definitely come again.  Only downside was lack of internet in the rooms and the AC wasn't the best

Animations are great, the animators love children and integrate them into games. They also come to ask guests if their stay is going well. They listen to people a lot. The Aquagym course is top. We're laughing really good. In the evening the entertainment is very good too, no time to be bored. The only demolishment is that in early June the aquapark is still closed (check the opening of the park). The food is not bad but maybe a little effort can be made at this level. Basically recommend this hotel. The housekeepers are also very adorable. Top top top, we'll probably come back as a family again.
Very nice animators, great aquagym class and games too fun; Servers also very friendly and helpful; Women / Chambermaids available at our service; Cookies 🍪 🍪 very good;  The kids really had fun.

Family holidays at the top! Good food! Animator at the top especially zambala the best ❤️ beautiful beach nearby!! Lots of entertainment for children! Several nice swimming pool!! Too bad the water park was closed it opened only in early June! To make this stay again!

Superb welcome activities and great animator the team and at the top I highly recommend exceptional environment they are all listening and attentive to our every desire thank you aqua resort djerba zambala thank you for everything exceptional with tiga and all the team animation

Djerba aqua resort is at the top👍Equip animation great , good restaurant very good , very good ☀️☀️room well positioned and pool bar also very good , staff at the restaurant could be a little more responsive 🙏🙏🙏🙏zambala 😁

I had an absolutely beautiful stay. Everything was there to make this moment unforgettable: the setting, the atmosphere, the quality of the meals, the superb gardens and perfectly enhanced 🌴!  I would like to warmly thank the whole team for their kindness and professionalism 😊. Special mention to some of the staff who made our stay even more enjoyable with their smile and kindness.  A huge thank you especially to Habib Hamouda for his welcome, human warmth, availability and kindness ❤️. He was more than just a staff member: he witnessed our happiness to my partner and I. ✨💍A memory forever etched in our hearts... Thank you, Habib, for sharing this emotion with us.  Small downside though on the cleaning in the room, which would have deserved a little more attention.  And for a 4-star, it would be really nice to find a small bottle of fresh water when we arrive in the room — a simple little gesture, but one that makes all the difference... Despite these details, it did not spoil the beauty of our stay.  I highly recommend this place, and hope to return very soon! ☀️

A more than satisfying stay, modern rooms, a delicious restaurant, spacious pools and a beautiful beach! The hotel and all its teams are very attentive and do everything to make you feel comfortable! A big thank you especially to the whole animation team who were at the top! Thanks to Jamaica, Zambala, Massinga ,Maya, Fifi, Emma, Pikachu, Zico, momo, tiga, Omar,Khalido,Aziz Again thank you all for making your stay unforgettable!

reviews.review_title: Wouldn't recommend this hotel but recommend the sea
reviews.review_text: The hotel is OKAY… Came and will never come back.  CONS:  1. The plates and cups were dirty—it was disgusting. Even the tables had crumbs all over them and weren’t cleaned properly.  2. Rubbish was everywhere, even near the beach.  3. I lost a shirt, and one of the women staff members was extremely rude. She didn’t even check the lost property properly.  4. The cleaning lady came every day but didn’t actually clean. Towels weren’t changed, and bedsheets stayed the same. The room also had a weird smell.  5. The mattress was so rough, it felt like sleeping on a rock.  6. Flies were literally everywhere—on the food, on me, and on my family members.  7. Kids were taking fruit with their bare hands, and nothing seemed hygienic.  8. When I was diving in the pool, I saw tissues floating in the water—disgusting!  9. The food was either half-raw or the same boring thing every day. It also smelled weird. I got diarrhea from it.  10. There were mosquitos during the evening shows, and they were biting us.  11. The door to our room connected to another room, and we had to block it with a lamp to feel safe.  12. The walls were super thin—you could hear everything from the next room.  13. The beach view was beautiful, but the sand wasn’t clean. I even saw horse poo in the sea.  14. The camel man near the beach was pushy. He didn’t grab me aggressively, but he gently took my arm and helped me onto the camel without telling us the price. My dad kept asking, but the man ignored us and kept talking about activities.  15. There’s also a guy inside the hotel walking around with a book, trying to sell activities. He was very pushy and wouldn’t leave us alone unless we said “later.”  16. The slides and pool area were closed, which was the main reason I chose this hotel. Tip to the hotel: Next time, say clearly on your website when the slides open—and make it clear it’s not actually part of the hotel.  17. The internet was terrible. You could only get a signal in the lobby, and even that barely worked.  18. The music at the night shows was way too loud—it hurt my ears and gave me a headache.  19. There was no gym  PROS:  1. The ocean was absolutely beautiful—blue, warm, and amazing to swim in (ignoring the rubbish nearby).  2. The Bazaar near the hotel was colourful and fun to walk through (though the sellers were a bit too clingy and tried to force us to buy things).  3. The Crocodile Farm was fantastic! So many crocodiles and turtles, a great museum, cheap tickets, and I even got to hold a baby crocodile. Definitely worth visiting—it was just 7 minutes away.  4. Taxis were cheap and very convenient.  5. Most of the local people were kind.  6. It was hot and sunny when I went (in May).  7. The shrimp was tasty, and there were plenty of fresh fruits like watermelon.  Overall: I would definitely go back to Djerba because the place itself is nice—but I would never go back to this hotel. I’ll be choosing a better one next time.

The hotel aqua resort is very good we came with family the rooms are good for the restaurant there are a lot of choices in general you find something that you will like there are different pools what is a shame is that the Aqua Park was closed during our stay, a big thank you to the entertainment team for their investment and their presence

We had an amazing experience at djerba aqua resort the rooms was immaculate and the housekeepers was very friendly the bar staff was also amazing remembering what I drank every Tim we went upto the bar. For was absolutely amazing everyone fresh and the catering staff really helpful with all the cooking stations with different food cooked frash  , a special thanks to the animation team ( maya , Emma , massinga , Jamaica , momo , khalido , aziz, Omar ,Casper , malek , zambala , tiga , helmy and fifi ) thank you all again 🩷✌🏼

reviews.review_title: Very good atmosphere large hotel equipped with animation at the top
reviews.review_text: Very good hotel a beautiful atmosphere an animation team at the top a staff at the restaurant maid special mention in baya excellent a manager at your service a 24 hour reception security in the hotel all night very large hotel several swimming pools the sea has 200 m of fine sand.

I like this hotel and i wanna thank all the animation team and fifi the best girl she is so nice and friendly ❤️ and wanna thank all the staf and i like the food here i will come again in the summer i wish i can leave here the best hotel in djerb❤️❤️❤️❤️

It's the best vecation ever în the hotel Aqua resort I will come again here all the staf is good and the animation team they are amazing and they make our vecation amazing and I wanna give a big thank for all the perplex how work night and morning .

reviews.review_title: Amazing vrcation and all i will do the same experce again and again
reviews.review_text: Good familly a very big resort i like the food the beat staf i like my vecation so much i wanna thank all the pepole how make my vication amazing and all animathion tram and i wanna thank fifi so much  and all the staf amd i will came next year again ❤️

Superb hotel and animation at the top of the top, thank you a thousand times to MASSIGA who brightened our family vacation, we will come back as usual☀️☀️😜😍😍😍☀️☀️☀️☀️☀️☀️☀️☀️🎇😉😉😉😉😉😉😉😉😉😉😉😉😉😘�😘😘😘😘😘�😘��😚😚😚😚😚😚😉😁😁😁😁😁
Very good hotel with a lot  animation we got to know  omar the host he's adorable a  cream I do not regret coming here 😊 I recommend this hotel with your eyes closed 😉😊.😊😊😊😊😊😊😊😊😊😊😊😊😊😊😊😊😊😊😊😊😊😊😊😊😊

I arrived at the hotel around 11.15. and was greeted by Marwa who was so friendly and has a lovely smile. While the checked us in we were sat down and given a lovely lemon drink. The porter took our cases to the room,so no waiting. The hotel is fantastic and I can't then the staff enough. Adel my personal waiter looked after me every day having a table ready for me and a glass of wine. The animation team excellent well done Zizu,Dino and the rest of team.allthe staff were very friendly and helpful. The only downside is there is nothing outside the hotel. I will definitely be back. Well done Le sultan

We have just returned from 10 nights at this beautiful, peaceful and relaxing hotel.  The staff from the minute we arrived were friendly, helpful and genuinely seemed to want to make sure you had the best time.  The hotel, grounds and rooms were clean, tidy and very well kept.  We had a couple of issues with the room (a leaking pipe) but they were resolved very quickly.   The food was delicious and although there were some staples it was not repetitive like you would find in many places. The food was delicious, hot and very varied.   The animation team ensured that everyone who wanted to take part in activities did so but they were not overbearing. I thoroughly enjoyed the morning yoga and aqua gym and my husband and children loved the darts and table tennis tournaments. We didn't catch any of the nightly entertainment but always looked to be busy and people were enjoying themselves.    We would have no hesitation in returning to this hotel.  Thank you for a wonderful, relaxing and peaceful holiday!   The stables are an excellent addition, very reasonably priced and the horses were beautiful, and all very well cared for.

This hotel is a real gem! From the moment we checked in, we felt special. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, always smiling and ready to fulfill any request.  The location is also fantastic - close to the main attractions, yet in a quiet area, which makes for a great rest. The pool and relaxation area are perfect places to regenerate after a day of sightseeing.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a comfortable, luxurious and relaxing stay. We will definitely be back!

Very nice beachfront hotel.The site is mainly located around the pool because very small beach. Air conditioning is insufficient 24c at best and available between 10am until midnight. Nothing else to say. Clean, comfortable, welcoming.

reviews.review_title: Family stay - great for relaxing and spending quality time
reviews.review_text: It was a very Beautiful resort with scenery to die for, right on the shoreline. attentive staff, waiter service to your sun lounger all day by the beach and pool. Resort was clean, great food. Buffett had variety which was good for 2 weeks. Great karaoke as well, I even got a certificate! Enjoyed some great massages in the spa as well. Great value.

We went for rest and relaxation and that's what we got. Stunning views of the beautiful sea every morning when we opened our curtains. Staff are very polite and attentive. Bar staff try to keep you happy and keep on top of your drinks, even when your lazing by the sea!  Darts at 11:30, such great fun with Mo & Omar! Archery at 16:00 with Zezu and Omar, never played it before and really enjoyed it! I had my nails done in the spa which was a nice great, manicure and pedicure. A friend said she'd enjoyed a full body 2hr massage adhd it was the best she'd ever had! The weather was variable when we were there but the spa pool is lovely and warm so a bit of cloud on a cooler day means you can still enjoy the water. Entertainment, food, drinks, gorgeous setting, we couldn't have asked for more! One l'il tip. There are coffee making facilities but only powdered milk, which changes the taste but it still looks like you're drinking black coffee. You can get cartons of milk from the shop up the road, a short walk away.   Thank you for having us!   P.S please leave the swift nests up, I was really sad to see one had been knocked down while we were there, but the clever birds rebuilt it!

It is a very nice hotel where everything is nearby.  Tunisian food is excellent and varied.  The staff is great and attentive.  I recommend to all.  Know that the hotel managers make your stay an unforgettable and facilitating one.

reviews.review_title: Week of relaxation in a beautiful hotel
reviews.review_text: We spent a week at the Sultan and this hotel deserves a visit. We are difficult but everything has been good. Beautiful room (225) with a comfortable bed and a beautiful bathroom with walk-in shower. Flat screen TV and Wifi. Very good food with a wide choice of dishes...Breakfast at the height with fresh orange juice pressed in front of you. All the staff is smiling and very nice. Finally, a responsive and professional reception, thanks to Hela, Caroline and Tarik. We will definitely come back...

reviews.review_title: The top of the welcome and kindness
reviews.review_text: The quality of the hotel and the service.Special mention to Mr Mariani Tarak and Caroline for the excellent service. Very warm welcome from Imed, the waiter as well as the room staff. Brahim's pastries are breathtaking! The chef is also at your disposal. We will return as soon as possible with regret to leave this magnificent hotel.

From the moment we arrived we were met by the most friendly staff. Hotel is immaculately clean, rooms and beds lovely. Beach is just lovely. Wasn’t expecting much from food but the choice was fantastic always fresh, hot and tasty. One of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed at. What made this holiday extra special was the staff, all amazing but special mention to Zizu, Mohamed, Ramzi, Sofiene, Aziz and Finas. We miss you already and can’t wait to come back.

We recently stayed at Le Sultan hotel, and one of the absolute highlights of our stay was the Kids mini Club. From the moment we arrived, the staff made our daughter feel welcomed and excited. The space was bright, clean, and full of engaging activities suitable for a wide range of ages. What impressed us most was the professionalism and warmth of the caregivers, they were attentive, patient, and genuinely caring. Our daughter was thrilled every morning to return and didn’t want to leave at the end of the day!

Today is a last day of our holidays in this wonderful hotel. Thank you all staff for beautiful memories. Aqua class with Zizu, yoga with Omar. We were never short of food or drinks! All very delicious. Katamaran paddle boarding with Hassine! Clean rooms , beach area , pool & heated pool was spectacular! We felt always welcome and cared for. We loved Le Pirate meal, all fresh and well presented. We felt secure and look after by security they went above and beyond.We will highly recommend this hotel. It was our second time in Le Sultan but we will be back again!  We wish the staff all the best & hopefully health permitting see you next year!  Love from Ewa & John  Ps for those complaining about football during entertainment “get life “ it was Champions League semifinals hihihi regards from football fan!

A couple visit to celebrate my wife's birthday. An error of the booking date on my part but with exemplary professionalism the error was rectified with a big smile from the front desk manager with an upgrade. Thank you for everything you do to make my visit a real pleasure. Bravo and good continuation  I recommend the best hotel in Tunisia without doubt 😘

First of all, I would like to congratulate you on the change and improvements made since our last visit. Since our arrival and as usual the welcome was more than warm. We were received wonderfully well and on this occasion I would like to thank from the bottom of my heart all the staff working in the different sectors for their kindness, dedication and know-how. the rooms were clean and very well maintained every day. The restaurant offers a choice and a range of delicious and varied food and meals. In short, the services in the various corners of the hotel were up to what we expected. During the days, my children were not bored quite the contrary they feasted on the different entertainment activities presented by the Mini club team and especially by Mrs Mouna whom my children found warm and friendly. My wife and I also attended a show every Friday where we had the pleasure of dancing to beautiful musical masterpieces performed and sung tonight by the hotel’s outstanding and splendid voice artist. Finally, a big thank you again! I can only wish you a very good continuation on everything you do.

Everything was spotless this is the second time I go to this hotel  All the staff is at your disposal the perfect room service  the impeccable buffet  Very clean room and beach near hammamet center  I highly recommend this hotel

Third stay in the Sultan and still warm!  The rooms are very spacious and the bathrooms have been renovated.  The buffet is exceptional, many Tunisian dishes every day and very good quality and friendly staff.   The pool is very well maintained, a quality SPA with real professionals for the hammam and massages.  We'll be back again...

the atmosphere, the rooms, the cleanliness and the services and above all welcome make the Sultan one of the best hotels in HAMMAMET. It certainly takes more than some 5 star guests. Thank you to CAROLINE for her dedication and great welcome, to the waiter Mourad for his kindness, and to all the staff who dedicate themselves so that we can feel at home!

reviews.review_title: We went as a couple to the hotel the Sultan of Hammamet in May 2025. Everything was perfect for us
reviews.review_text: Very nice hotel. Well located sea front room very spacious cleanliness at the top, whether in the room or common areas. Quality catering with very varied buffet. Very nice staff. Garden and seaside. Very nice.

A great disappointment a hotel below average dirty poorly maintained carpeting in very bad condition old furniture food very medium old animation. People who have put positive reviews I think we are not talking about the same hotel

AVOID LIKE the PLAGUE! We were all bad the first week as were many other guests we had got talking too! Staff really rude and ignorant! Breakfast dinner and tea was the same every single night! Not even a chicken nugget or fish fingers for the kids! Cereal was stale every morning too! Staff stand and stare at you while eating, some standing right behind you while your eating! Made me feel really uncomfortable. Ordered panini at snack bar French lady came and ordered after me soo the worker stopped making my panini and served the French lady first! Overall food, drinks and snack bar is disgusting I was going to the shop over the road for some super noodles that’s how poor the food is! Cocktails are vile too.  ENTERTAINMENT  very poor nothing on same shows repeated every few days had football on for 3 nights in a row and stopped all the kids party dances for these nights.  ROOM cleaners were lovely and room was cleaned everyday however the passage and our room stunk of sewage! You only get 1 key card so can’t leave nothing charging while your out! Beds very uncomfortable our shower was also broke no drinks in the fridge which I was surprised at giving it’s a 4 star hotel!  Staff hang around you waiting for tips constantly!  Only positive I have is muna and the 2 young girls at kids club they went out their way to play with my daughter at the park and on an evening. They are the only staff that have manners and respect for their guests unlike the others! So big Thankyou to the 3 girls  We left the resort once and we were told put your phone away otherwise you will be robbed I’ve never felt more unsafe on a holiday in my life was counting down the days to go home Overall I would not return didn’t feel safe or welcome here. This hotel is not a 4 star more a 2/3!

reviews.review_title: Luxury break between comfort and prestige
reviews.review_text: Very pleasant stay, rest and elegance and this in all the hotel facilities, a cocan away from the everyday and escape any comfort. Hospitality, service , breakfast and five-star staff. Beautiful escape in a corner of elegance.

reviews.review_title: The best hotel in Hammamet (don't go anywhere else!)
reviews.review_text: ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ The Best Hotel in Hammamet — and Here’s Why!  We stayed for 7 days in suites 1362 and 1363. While 1362 doesn’t have the best view (though you still get a glimpse of the sea), 1363 offers a stunning panoramic view of the pool and the beach — absolutely gorgeous.  From the moment we arrived, the service was outstanding. Every single staff member greeted us with a smile and genuine helpfulness. It would be impossible to name everyone who contributed to making our stay perfect, but a few truly stood out and deserve a special mention:  Check-in: The front desk team was welcoming, cheerful, and incredibly helpful. You feel the warmth as soon as you step into the lobby.  Rooms: Spotlessly clean, and serviced perfectly every day — from morning refresh to turndown. Special shoutout to Abdallah, who went above and beyond to ensure every little detail was taken care of.  Housekeeping: Bahja was a lifesaver! She helped me get three pairs of pants hemmed — super quickly and with a smile. When I lost a precious bracelet, she turned the room upside down to help me find it — literally checking every sheet, cushion, and corner. Her kindness and dedication were remarkable.  Breakfast: Every morning started with a bright smile from Lobna, who sets the tone for a joyful day. And the omelets? Hands down the best in town, made by Olfa, with fresh ingredients and always that same warmth and perfection. Sahbi, our morning waiter, remembered our drinks and preferences from Day 1 — no reminders needed, just seamless and personalized service.  Dining – Adra Restaurant: A must-try for local Tunisian specialties. Their “Loup Malfouf” was exceptional — fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. Adel and Mr. Malaoui made every dinner a joy with their attentiveness and contagious smiles.  Spa: This hotel houses the only Clarins Spa in Tunisia — and it’s a gem. Guests have free access to the hammam and pool, and I enjoyed two deeply relaxing massages by Sirine, whose hands truly work magic.  Transfer: We opted for a private Jaguar transfer from and to the airport, traveling with my Super Dad. With onboard Wi-Fi, I managed to get some work done — freeing up more quality time once we arrived.  Throughout our stay, every single team member was kind, accommodating, and happy to help — whether it was taking photos or assisting with special requests.  We’re already planning our return!  PS: We challenged ourselves to a wild goal — walking from the hotel to the Medina every day. Final count? 128 km in 7 days. Because when you stay somewhere this energizing, even the challenges feel joyful. You can check our progress in video on my IG account @ valerieorsoni

reviews.review_title: Best service and professionalism - serious staff, excellent cuisine, beautiful rooms, tasteful architecture
reviews.review_text: For years this hotel convinces with great service super restoration. Nice rooms a great view great pools and a nice beach for swimming. The whole is crowned by a modern and creative architecture of modern and typical cultural influences.

From check in to check out we were treated by the most amazing and friendly staff.  The service was above and beyond and the food terrific!  The rooms were wonderful and the pool and beach were so nice.  I cannot recommend this beautiful place enough!

Very nice hotel.  With impeccable service.  A hotel to recommend. Very nice infrastructure.  Perfect staff.  Very easy access, I'd probably come back. Pool with extraordinary views. Efficient room service.

reviews.review_title: Excellent and pleasant stay 2025 vs it remains etched in my heart that I never forget I hope we will have time
reviews.review_text: Very nice and comfortable stay vs 2025 It remains serious in my heart really that I never forget I hope we have time to go back again It really is an extraordinary stay I always keep very beautiful memories for my children one day

"Perfection is not of this world!".Hotel La Badira is not far from making belie this quote.Very nice location in front of the sea.Very nice medium sized hotel.Very nice suites very comfortable and perfectly maintained.A la carte restaurants offering excellent cuisine.Exquisite breakfast.Spa of very high quality.Gym with coach.The staff is very attentive.I thank all members with a particular mention to:Oumaima at the reception,Kenza (Guest Relations),Olfa the queen of omelets and pancakes....,Khalil of the international restaurant,Sirine of the Tunisian restaurant,not forgetting Yassin of IT who helped me a lot. At the tour operators, I would advise to make THE distinction between La Badira 5 stars (exceptional hotel) and other 5 stars hotels (no reviews). In short a stay in the area,as far as I am concerned, is automatically synonymous with a reservation in La Badira. Thank you again!!!!!!!!! Alain

We rarely leave reviews online, but some meetings deserve an exception... ❣️For you, Haythem, and for your professional team, we do it with pleasure❣️ From the moment we arrived, your presence was felt , discreet but caring, sincere, always just. You were there without ever overdoing it, with that look that anticipates, that smile that reassures, and that attention to detail that turns a simple stay into a real experience.  You feel a real love of the job, a willingness to do well, and a natural elegance in the way of receiving.  This comment is just a small gesture, the minimum to support you, because you fully deserve it.  And for those planning to stay in La Badira: do not hesitate to meet Haythem it makes all the difference.

We had an excellent stay and experienced warm hospitality! This hotel consistently delivers great service and lasting memories. The food was wonderful, and the pool refreshing with an unbelievable view. Thank you for making our journey so special. Five stars without a doubt! This hotel is always our first choice in Tunisia.

This hotel is absolutely beautiful, the sea view from the suite is amazing, waking up and falling asleep to the sound of the waves, it is fantastic! The staff is very attentive and very friendly! The gym and coach is a real plus! I'll be back thank you.

reviews.review_title: Go to The Radisson next door instead
reviews.review_text: Embarrassment of a hotel. Incapable management, broken facilities, lacking in every way.   Even when we discussed our issues with the hotel and Expedia they didn’t care. The hotel has offered a refund then the manager walked away and left? The lack of education in the country is outstanding, but a five star hotel has a responsibility to provide adequate management so despite this being sad, it’s not the guests issue to manage.

I don’t know who could consider this a five star. I’m here now and I’m going to sleep hungry. I just had 2 ceaser salads delivered to the room ($60 or so US) that I’ve had to send back and now I’m going to bed hungry. Ordered a steak yesterday, paid the $40 and left it on the plate. Going on a five star holiday is senseless if the food is inedible.   The internet has not been working. I’ve missed 3 days of work. They brought a new router today but it’s too late.   The staff is lovely but it doesn’t matter if you go on a holiday and, despite being willing and happy to pay whatever price, you can’t get anything edible and you can’t complete obligatory tasks. I wish I could go home early. We’ve had maybe 9 dishes so far and not one has been actually good. Burgers are tying us over, but my god why would I go on a holiday to stay barely satiated to get by. I’m not a picky eater with this in mind, it’s just not good.   I’m ready to leave.

reviews.review_title: well-being in harmony with the very nice Mediterranean nature
reviews.review_text: Very refined hotel with its architecture and scents, calm and very soothing. Each time equally satisfied. Hoping to always return to this very exceptional hotel.High-quality service. An eco-friendly atmosphere that respects nature. Sample refined Tunisian cuisine.

A great stay in La Badira!  Exceptionally warm and supportive welcome in a hotel decorated with taste.  From the moment we arrived, we were taken care of with great professionalism.  The hotel is huge, which presents a real challenge on a daily basis, but the team shows great dedication to ensuring customer satisfaction.  The rooms are spotlessly clean.  We would like to thank Mrs. Nadia, the governess, and more specifically Mrs. Monira, and Mr. Khaled for their seriousness, their responsiveness and the quality of their work. A real professional!  The staff at the front desk is equally impressive. A big thank you to Mr. Maher for his professionalism, availability and service. A big thank you who warmly thanks us.   The food was excellent, varied and extremely well presented.   I'm grateful to the whole team at La Badira.  We will gladly come

reviews.review_title: Exceptional service and relaxing atmosphere at La Badira
reviews.review_text: My husband and I have stayed at La Badira a few times over the years, but something about this visit truly stood out. From the moment we arrived, we were welcomed into a calm and elegant atmosphere. The spa, as always, was top-notch  a peaceful escape with a skilled team and a soothing environment. What really caught our eye this time, though, was a charming young man by the pool and beach area. He carried himself with such ease and grace — always well-groomed, polite, and genuinely attentive. The way he introduced himself and engaged with guests was subtle yet professional, and didn’t go unnoticed. Working in hospitality ourselves, we recognise the difference between routine service and real dedication. This young man clearly cares. A sincere thank you to the whole La Badira team for maintaining such high standards.

very nice hotel with a beautiful beach and beautiful amenities. spacious room and excellent bedding excellent breakfasts with lots of choices excellent welcome and friendly staff during the stay Hotel of modest size compared to the offer in Hammamet

Spent a few days as a couple in this beautiful hotel, ideally located with an exceptional view. Calm and serenity are masters in these places. The cleanliness impeccable as well as the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. Have dinner at the Tunisian restaurant, quality meals and Tunisian musician to not spoil anything.  Only downside when you take the stairs rather than the elevator, smells of garbage cans probably come up from the basement...  For the rest, we are conquered, during our next stay in Hammamet, it is of course to the Badira that we will return 😊

reviews.review_title: A small quiet hotel with great services and outstanding service
reviews.review_text: The decor of the hotel, the services offered, the welcome, the friendliness and availability of the staff, the quality of the two restaurants and the variety of breakfast make forget the location of this establishment which is unfortunately not exceptional.

Enjoyed a fabulous Mother/adult Daughter get-away at La Badira. The amenities, service, and entire experience were amazing. Staff were extremely professional and attentive. The spa was incredible. The food delicious both at breakfast and the restaurants. Very comfortable beds too.

Excellent hotel Haven of peace, very relaxing stay with my wife we even extended by two days, I highly recommend and for the rest I let you make your own experience. The room fell sea view and swimming pool with a magical sunset the calm and clean atmosphere, service to small care and super secure hotel, special mention Ala availability of staff and managers.

Quick summary.  Not so good bits - Rooms dated. Beds were firm (I struggled to sleep). Restaurant temporarily runs out of plates mid service (little frustrating).  Good bits - Pool areas and private beach area fantastic. I found the range of food really good during lunch and evening (however breakfast was really limited for anyone with an english breakfast expectation). All the staff seemed friendly and decent. The entertainment crew were also fantastic and really do make a difference around the pool during the day 👍🏻 Option to use the sister hotel (The Occidental) pool and slide facilities (and the all inc pool bar) Few shops and Pharmacy within a five minute walk as well as a few restaurants all reasonably priced.   In all honesty I would not class it as a 4 star more a 3.5, but I think holiday companies now base the star ratings on the features available and not the quality of the facilities etc. This may just be me.   What I will say is although with everything summarised we had a great holiday and made the most of what we had and what we were offered.   We also booked two excursions from the local provider in the hotel (Alibarba), we did Camel riding and quad bikes. Both great value for money (expect to get mega dusty on the quad bikes and take sun glasses. We took age range 8 to 60 on both trips and all enjoyed them.   If you book here I hope your overall experience is as good as ours 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻   We came at the end of May and had between 26 and 32 temp throughout the 10 days, all sun no clouds (apart from one random down which was overcast with showers).  Over all great holiday 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

Beautiful hotel, pool areas always kept clean, rooms are nice, bars are good especially the swim up bar in the main pool, entertainment is good throughout the day and night, animation team are very good and friendly with all people especially kids

Came here last December for the new year . Had a fantastic time . The new year eve party was amazing . Rooms are clean and cleaned daily . Location is great near to Sousse and port El Kantoui. Most staff are very friendly and can not do enough for you . A small tip goes a long way . Although there was a few staff members in the restaurant that ere neither friendly or helpful and made you feel like you was not wanted .The hotel is great value for money . The bar staff in the lobby and beach bar was great . Reception staff were very helpful and friendly.  The rules say that you was not allowed to reserve sund beds with towels and towels would be removed . Thus was not the case and sometimes it was difficult to get a sun bed . Apart from that we had we a had a lovely time and would return

The staff here are lovely and will go out of their way to go above and beyond for you and entertainment for all ages, no bad words to say about the food at all, specifically the Tunisian night was incredible! We asked to change rooms for a better view if they had any going and they got right to it and we got a nicer room!  Thank you for a lovely stay

Very clean and safe with great facilities. Fish foot spa recommended and Ali is great! Good access to the beach and family friendly. Good location close to the airport and the main city Sousse. Lots of food and drinks available all day. Entertainment every evening.

Upon arrival, my partner realised he left his rucksack on the transfer and the reception staff were amazing and called the bus company to arrange for them to drop it off, making several calls throughout the day to sort this for us. The room is adequate. The beds are large but the mattresses a little firm as well as the pillows. The air conditioning practically useless, however we have been told by other travellers that the hotel will not switch it on until June 1st. The pool bar is a great feature although the pool itself is slightly on the small side and according to our teenage children; not deep enough. There is an idiot pool at the sister hotel next door (Occidental) which is deeper, however it is very stuffy in there. When you are sat around the pool you do get a lot of different staff walking around trying to sell you treatments and trips and you have to be firm when you do not want them as they will return and continue to ask. We have not used the gym so cannot comment, however looking at it from outside; it looks very modern and is always in use. The spa is very relaxing and the treatments are great; however you are asked several times that you leave a good tip.  Drinks are pretty standard for all inclusive. Food has been one of the best all inclusive we have experienced. There have been traditional staples daily plus a good variety of other dishes suitable for both adults and fussy children. One evening, the restaurant even provided live entertainment in the form of a saxophonist, alongside a feast of sushi and fresh fish dishes. The staff in the restaurant are incredible, they make an effort to get to know your drinks order and sit you at the same table and cannot do enough for you. The entertainment throughout the day is your usual mix of water aerobics and competitions such as darts and archery for the whole family. The evening shows have been mostly outdoors in the sister hotel and have consisted of mini disco and a show afterwards. Not all have been great, however the entertainment team are always incredible. They are engaging with everyone and bring a lot of fun and energy.

Great hotel close to town and  amazing animation team, go out there way to keep you entertained all day and night. Max and risco were great and kept kids entertained. Great value for money! Beach is clean and tidy with great views. Would recommend staying here!!

This is a great place with a good location and facilities availabilities. Extremely safe Local Tunisians and the staff members are very nice people you just need to smile and talk with them the best you can even if there’s a language barrier and they will look after you as they do in general. The reception has amazing staff and very helpful, the people outdoors are very entertaining lively people. Food is amazing with various choices and you’ll always find something you would like. The views are amazing to take pictures and look at.

I came to Tunisia, the weather was 3 days bad (cloudy, rainy) and 3 days was nice weather - sunny, 29 degrees of Celsius. The food was absolutely fantastic, a lot of variation. Animation - Max, Rico, Mino were really funny, they spent a lot of nice energy to the hotel. They offered a lot of activities - football, water polo, darts…thank you!

Marhaba Club in Sousse, Tunisia, offers a welcoming atmosphere with a blend of strengths and areas for improvement.  Pros:  Friendly and Attentive Staff: Guests consistently praise the staff for their hospitality. Receptionist Mr. Khaiss and housekeeping staff like Essia are highlighted for going above and beyond to ensure guest comfort . Tripadvisor +2 Booking.com +2 Tripadvisor +2  Entertainment and Activities: The animation team, including Max and Fufa, provides engaging activities from morning till late, ensuring guests have a lively experience . Tripadvisor +1 Tripadvisor +1  Beach Access: The hotel boasts a private beach with free sunbeds and an all-inclusive bar, offering a relaxing seaside experience . Tripadvisor  Cons:  Room Condition: While clean, some rooms are noted to be outdated, with issues like peeling paint and broken fixtures.  Food Variety: The buffet offers a variety of dishes, but some guests mention that the food can be repetitive, especially if not arriving early . Tripadvisor  Noise Levels: Evening entertainment can be loud, with music continuing until late, which might be disruptive for light sleepers . Tripadvisor  Conclusion:  Marhaba Club is ideal for travelers seeking a lively atmosphere with friendly staff and beach access. While the rooms and food could benefit from updates, the overall experience is positive, especially for those who enjoy vibrant entertainment and social activities. Booking.com +3 Tripadvisor +3 Hotels.com +3  Źródła

Fantastic place, food is brilliant and entertainment is fantastic and would recommend, rooms are brilliant and it’s very clean and comfy. Very safe place to be here.  Entertainment on a night time is brilliant and you must fetch cash with you

Stayed at Marhaba club in Sousse. The hotel is not 4 star, 3 at best. Rooms are old, tired and dated, bathroom has tiles and discoloration to edge of bath and inside. Beds are not double but 2 singles pushed together. Food is edible but limited everything is repeated daily, the egg/omelette station is below par and the juices are terrible not fresh at all artificial tasting and really disappointing. The all inclusive alcohol was like water they used the cheapest vodka/rum/gin and brandy they have in their supermarket which I saw was 17 dinar (£4.20) and you cannot feel the effects. The gin isn't gin tastes like vodka and the glasses they provide are about 250ml. People bought large cups to get it filled. Deposit of £12 for the towel per one needed to be paid. We bought towels from gift shop as was only £3.50. and kept. One of the annoying things was in the morning before 9am cleaners will come in the room even if sleeping to take the towels away (have no idea why). Not to clean room. We would come back after breakfast room not clean and towels not back until late afternoon every day. No do not disturb sign either. They didn't clean the rooms they made bed and emptied bins. There was hot chocolate stain on table for 4 days up until we left that wasn't wiped off. Mosquitos so bring repellent as air conditioning not switched on until June. The access to swimming and gym is at the Occidental hotel which is a bit of a walk away. The snacks were a few cakes at the lobby. The beach bar serves no spirit just beer and wine On the positive the people were nice and attentive, entertainment was ok. If you like table tennis bring your own balls as you would hardly find any.

Great hotel with large grounds. Never had a problem getting a sunbed by the pool and beach. Excellent choice of food. All staff so friendly and welcoming. The only negative is staying in a room that is close to the main road and hotel opposite that all  you can here is the boom boom of music at night even with closed patio doors. Kept me awake until 2.30am. Bring some earplugs and ask for a room nowhere near this and you will have a great time. Very clean everywhere and again all staff fantastic

Excellent location beach is walking distance. I would definitely come back to this hotel. The choice of food is amazing they really do cater for everyone.  The restaurant staff offer the best service ever. Skander, Tarek, Hamdi and Muhammad Ali helped is so much. The staff really are a credit to the hotel.

Best holiday ever. The hotels location is amazing beach is walking distance. The hotels entertainment is amazing. You really do not need to leave the hotel. The choice of food is fantastic they really do cater for everyone. The staff go over and beyond to help you. The restaurant staff Tarek, Skander, Hamdi and Muhammad Ali offered the best service ever. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone.

reviews.review_title: Very enjoyable place,don't believe negative grumpy travelers.
reviews.review_text: Holiday in Marhaba Club resort is a real treat. Rooms are clean,with new towels every day. Staff always happy smiling and ready to help people to enjoy their holiday to fullest, going extra mile and advice on anything. Food is what you expect on all inclusive holiday, enough variety of different kind of foods and treats including ice cream at lunch and dinner time to satisfy anyone. Animation team on our side 3 lovely guys Rico,Mino and Tores joined by some other lovely animators at times are amazing, engaging and hard working people who entertain guests by the pool every day with games, activities and pool parties. Putting up entertaining show every night. Some in hotel lobby some bigger shows outside on other side of complex. Now I would like to comment on some negative reviews I seen before I visited. I did not experience any of stuff some people write in those,to the point I have to ask why people like this even go holidays. Hotel resort is beautiful and right at beachfront,just the short walk on path leading via resort will easily lead you there. Some people don't appreciate good place and hard work hotel staff do even if they were given holiday for free. Of course with busy place like this you will have to sometimes wait few minutes to get cuttlery on your table and plates don't just vanish the second you finish eating and who cares if there is no tea bags in the room. There are some buildings around currently not in use,but they obviously work on renovations and improvements there same as painting everything to make sure place looks nice and clean, I see management walking around planing where and what needs to be done,but it doesn't just happen over night logically. The people who work here are on their feet 12 hours a day, 7 days a week, have to deal sometimes with grumpy and rude guests,as I experienced on my own eyes. And that's the kind of people who write bad reviews. I was on few different holidays in different countries but this place convinced me to come back with my family. So big thanks to all staff in the hotel,you are doing great job.

reviews.review_title: I enjoyed my stay it was  anice holiday
reviews.review_text: The Hotel is very good ist quiet it's a 4 🌟 hotel but it's looks like a 5 star🌟 hotel . The most important The front Manager is very friendly. The food is very good, the rooms are clean, the service at the restaurant are perfect. The pool is very clean the Animation teams are doing a good job the pool for the children is also very clean that hotel is 200 meter from the beach

Overall the whole stay has been awesome looked after by staff as it is our second time here and a lot of the staff remember us, quality of the room is been in point one or two things not a big deal, animation team is great they make the place hyped constantly engaging people to take part in activities and much more, great place for families enjoyable would be back anytime

Second time returning. Second time even better than the first. Great holiday, great food, staff in the restaurant always helpful and animation team were fantastic - Ricko torest mino and foufa Cleaners are great and everything is spotless

reviews.review_title: Great hotel for a sun bed holiday
