reviews.review_text: Hotel is very clean and staff are friendly and helpful. The pool area is very spacious with plenty of sun bed’s available.  The beach area is also very good and the security staff keep the beach sellers away from the area. Max and the animation team are excellent.

Amazing hotel Norah and all the staff are the best we have experienced. We were here for the month and didn’t want to come home. Clean modern and comfortable hotel. The spa was wonderful too thanks to Sabah and Rabiaa for helping the aches and pains ease with your amazing massages.  Momo and all pool staff are so helpful and friendly. Security always around polite and attentive.  The bar staff soon get to know u and are so friendly, thank u all! The food is amazing and the al a carte we had to return the best!!  Entertainment the best we’ve seen in Tunisia if not in any hotel!  Any requests are dealt with so quickly by Norah nothing is too much just ask!  Hoping to return ASAP thank u for a second wonderful holiday.

reviews.review_title: Thank you for a wonderful holiday
reviews.review_text: Excellent staff so welcoming food outstanding and I am a chef  shiatsu massage every other day for treatment few cold beers footy on big screen family friendly  some trips if you want to get out rooms cleaned daily  cool beach great  2 nd visit coming again

We travelled as a family of 8 (parents, grandparents and children). We have had the most amazing holiday.  The entertainment team are fantastic and the children love them. Shout out to Emeny and Madi ❤️ the shows have been amazing and some of the best we have seen abroad!  The hotel is lovely and clean. The pools are lovely and there’s activities going on all day and night, no pressure to join which we have liked.  Thank you all for a great holiday, we will definitely be back!

The entertainment and hotel staff were amazing. Facilities were amazing. Special thanks to Madi from the entertainment team who made us feel like family throughout our stay. Can’t wait to come back!!! Food was the best all inclusive I’ve ever had.

reviews.review_title: Very friendly staff. Amazing family stay
reviews.review_text: We arrived late on in the evening and there were meals available in the restaurant late on.  We found the grounds to be very clean and very well maintained the gardens are simply beautiful with safe areas for the cats to rise gardens and herb and spices garden. Plenty of pools and slides to keep the kids and big kids happy and best of all they have a pool bar to sit and chill during the day as it’s important to hydrate!   Staff were very  friendly and always say hello and are great with the kids! The entertainment staff well what can we say they are an awesome bunch always have time for you and very friendly especially Ameni who always made our children feel involved and welcome at every event she really does work so hard!

Great holiday for all the family. Food was fantastic with lots of choice for all, pool and water slides kept us all entertained and the staff were super friendly and couldn’t do enough to make the holiday a great time. Special thanks to Ameni who really went the extra mile always coming over to say hello and see if everything was ok, giving us an update on the days events and evening entertainment, and especially with our kids who loved her! Thanks to TUI Blue Manar for a wonderful time.

Unforgettable energy and pure joy! The animation team was the soul of the place — always smiling, full of life, and truly passionate about what they do. From morning activities to night shows, they made every moment fun and memorable. Special thanks to [insert name if you'd like] for their amazing vibe and contagious energy! Can’t wait to come back! 🌟🎉💃

I really liked my stay in this hotel, this will be definitely our future destination in Hammamet.  The food is lovely with too many choices. There are also a good variety of Activities during the day. In particular, I want really to thank Ali for his kindness and for arranging beach volley game after my request. I really appreciate it.

We had an amazing stay with the 5 of us at the hotel and felt genuinely cared for from start to finish.  A special thank you to **Noura**, who was incredibly helpful throughout our stay. Nothing was ever too much trouble for her—she always found a solution and made us feel welcome and supported.  We also deeply appreciate **Nurse Walid** for his attentive medical care. He went above and beyond, even outside of his working hours. His kindness and understanding made a big difference to us.  A heartfelt thanks to **Manager Walid**, who made sure my mother’s 70th birthday was unforgettable. Everything was perfect, and it meant the world to us.  The hotel had great animation and entertainment as well—we truly enjoyed every moment. We will definitely be coming back!

reviews.review_title: The best holiday we have ever had!
reviews.review_text: Best family holiday we have ever had. TUI blue manar exceeded our expectations and we enjoyed every moment.   From the staff being amazing and so kind. I have never been treated so good at a hotel, the restaurant staff had a table waiting for us with our favourite drinks already on it.  Wael at the beach bar was truly amazing and always went above and beyond.  Rio was just the best entertainment and really did make our holiday even better, always making us laugh and we always enjoyed seeing him.  The food was 10/10!!! So much choice, I am normally fussy and end up eating pizza and chips but I actually loved their food so much.  Cocktails are lovely too and spirits always good measurements.  Coffee shop with iced lattes and milkshakes etc!  Loved the entertainment every single night, was so good.  Needed milk for our toddler and gave us 2 cartons straight away.  Honestly couldn’t have had a better holiday, definitely recommend.  Thank you TUI Blue Manar, we will be back!!🫶🏼

Have stayed in luxury hotels across the world and this has been one of my favourite holidays. Rooms are simple but clean and comfortable but it was the staff and resort facilities that made it so great for my family. Felt so safe letting my kids be independent and move around the resort freely. A great size with all the facilities so well laid out, perfect for our boys who were 7 and 8. The kids foam party was one of the most fun things our children have ever done on holiday and so well organised and manned. Staff were always kind friendly and welcoming, Ziko from the entertainment was brilliant and the beach security Rafik, his colleagues and life guards went above and beyond to accommodate us, have fun with our kids and provide fantastic service. Food was a little repetitive but always great quality and selection, pastries were incredible and a cheese panini from the sandwich corner was always a winner at lunchtime. Dinner at the Baia restaurant was also phenomenal, couldn’t fault it. Can’t wait to return to tui blue manar!

reviews.review_title: Zied - the man of many UK accents
reviews.review_text: This is more of a thank you to Zied who was part of the waiting staff at TUI Blue Manar. He went above and beyond each night, was super friendly and welcoming. Gives such a positive vibe when coming for dinner. I hope he sees this and gets recognition he deserves.

reviews.review_title: Carpet shop tout in the hotel grounds.
reviews.review_text: Dear Mr Walid Gharbi,  Thank you very much for our enjoyable holiday in Tui Blue Manar. Ananda B has written a review, 5 star, for the family experience (family of 8, 4 double rooms). I would like to comment on one unpleasant aspect encountered in the hotel. We took the trip to Bazar Tapis La Brise that was offered by the one of the two vendors who operate in the grounds of the hotel. Points to note: 1) The vendor made out he was associated with the hotel - not true. 2) Vendor stated that hotel cars would be used for transport - not true, two UNSAFE private vehicles were used. 3) Vendor stated that visit was to a carpet factory - not true, visit was to a shop. 4) Vendor stated that factory was Government owned - not true, a private shop. 5) Vendor stated that Bedouin women would be viewed making carpets - not true. One women in the shop gave very short demonstration. 6) After our visit I found that the shop had one star reviews from French tourists stating their bad experience. Shop name Bazar Tapis La Brise in Hammamet. 7) After our visit I reported the above to the Tui representative who then discussed this with her manager. 8) On the following day I was approached and questioned by the vendor in an unfriendly, intimidating manner (something had been said to him by the hotel). Due to this I did not raise the issue further until I was safely home. A good hotel full of very pleasant and friendly staff let down by one vendor (tout) allowed to operate in the hotel grounds.  My strong advise to guests is do not engage with the tout and do not go on the carpet tour. If you want a Tunisia carpet go to a reputable shop. Mr. Walid Gharbi, thank you for our stay in your hotel and I will let you consider the tout who adds nothing but takes away a lot. Best regards Robert B

Nice clean and neat hotel. Beautiful swimming pools arranged for children (very numerous) and a swimming pool quiet area. Sufficient sun loungers. The restaurant is similar to a canteen room!!! No tablecloth or set cutlery placed on a thin paper towel at noon! In the evening an unironed and often wet fabric towel.  Food in glut tasteless not seasoned! I've never seen so much garbage thrown away by waiters, especially scavengers! The wine is undrinkable! The restaurant is unworthy of a so-called 4.5 star! The few dishes served at the little pool self have not changed in 12 days!!! You have to fall back on pizzas that are very good. On the other hand the breakfast is excellent in choice and quality!

Cannot find one fault with the stay!  The hotel and grounds are exceptionally clean and all staff are friendly and attentive. Food in the restaurants are good quality with a wide selection to choose from and the Baia Restaurant was exceptional. Lots of space inside and outside to suit your needs. Momo does a great job at keeping the Relax Pool for relaxing!  Plenty of activities provided by the entertainment team during the day and the show at night. In particular, Madi is super friendly and makes all the activities fun with his high sense of energy. The fitness team, Chiheb and Taher, will lead a great workout whilst still keeping a smile on your face.   Overall, a wonderful experience.

Very welcoming staff, superb hotel, very clean, the food is excellent the buffets are stocked with lots of choices, the staff with little care. The hotel offers a multitude of activities, several clean pools, slides... , direct access to the beach which is beautiful. the culinary restaurant and excellent. The spa offers interesting services, I spent a good time there. Very pleasant family stay everyone enjoyed.

What can I say About this hotel.... I couldn't fault a single thing.   From the moment we arrived we fell in love. Every member of staff from reception to waiters/bar staff to house keeping to life guards were the most welcoming friendly people I've ever met. Big shout out the Marwen the lifeguard, he kept the pool area so clean and tidy, went out of his way to help us and keep everyone safe.   The food was amazing, so much choice at every meal time. Snack bar and sandwich corner was great to grab some food if you're by the pool or beach.   Pools were so clean and nice, foam party was so much fun.   Beach was immaculate, soft white sand and clear blue water.    Our rooms was spotless, house keeping came and cleaned everyday and done an excellent job.   Entertainment was great, 7 year old loved it.   We left the resort twice to go to yasmine and Naubel, reception called taxi for us each time, always felt safe and loved exploring.   We were so sad to leave, but booking to come back in september. We have found our new home <3

A magnificent hotel, a staff with little care and always with a smile, during the day it is difficult to make a choice between the beach or the je ne sais quoi number of swimming pools either equipped of course with bars, sunbathing with mattresses and umbrellas. On the food side the cuisine is so mouthwatering that I will have to lose 2 kilos! Anyway, don't hesitate, rush!

Excellent stay, a professional and kind team.  The activities are extraordinary, clean and full of life hotel with a friendly and warm atmosphere.  Personally I recommend, a very pleasant stay with lots of good surprises.

On May 21st, I walked into this hotel after a taxi dropped me off at the main entrance. I respectfully approached the reception desk and asked to book a room (or two) for myself and my family, explaining that we wanted to move in immediately as our previous hotel was not comfortable.  The receptionist confirmed room availability for May 21–24 and asked me to wait. Then he disappeared. Minutes later, a security guard approached me politely and escorted me out of the hotel, saying that bookings must be made in advance online or through a travel agency.  I was shocked. The receptionist could have simply told me that instead of disappearing and having me escorted out. I was respectful, well-dressed, and gave no reason for such treatment.  Was this because I’m Arab? I can’t help but wonder.  Sadly, this experience was humiliating and far from the hospitality one would expect in Tunisia. I’m sharing this so future guests are aware and prepared in case they encounter similar behavior.

Fun animation activities  Very fun holiday Staff are very nice and welcoming  The food is excellent  I will definitely come back to this hotel and I recommend it to everyone going to Tunisia and the room very good............................

reviews.review_title: NO STARS HOTEL, NO WAY A PALACE
reviews.review_text: Myself, my daughter and 2 year granddaughter arrived at this hotel supposedly a 5 star around 11.00 a.m Got there told to put my luggage to one side, go to the plush looking reception, greeted my cold looking unhappy faces, no welcome drink, no real greeting told to complete a form what for not sure why, given wristband, told to go to another side to pay 27 dinars again what for they said service, what service, anyway i paid this and was told to wait for room but go and have lunch at 12.30 and come back to reception to try key for the room. Nearly two hours later I get room 929, disgusting disgusting disgusting. Go downstairs made complaint no more rooms to give us and check them the next day for a swap. By then I'm fuming my daughter who has anxiety was in a state that I had to try and calm down and encouraged her that we will get a decent room next day. Well this did not happen as on Day 2, Room 19 was even worse, no phone working, no plugs to charge phone, was told to charge my phone in the bathroom, dirty dirty carpet and rusty bath ware I went back to reception,  complained and again told no rooms to change to and to come back the next day, so on Day 3 was given room 351 well you would have thought changing rooms twice it should have been third time lucky, well these hotel staff members had no respect for me, my adult daughter and two year old grandchild. This room was the better of the two by far but I really would not even put my dog to sleep in it. We roughed it that night as we were leaving the hotel on the fourth day at 6.40 a.m to get picked up via shuttle service. No member of staff at all was at reception in this so called 5 star hotel. I left the key on front desk and walked out and will never ever return not even if I was getting it for free. I WANT MY MONEY BACK THAT I PAID FOR THIS NO STAR HOTEL. RECEPTION STAFF RUDE AND DISRESPECTFUL, ROOMS NOT FIT FOR ANY ANIMAL. TOTAL TOTAL SHAM OF A PALACE , WHY THEY CALL IT A PALACE NOBODY KNOWS. ANY GOOD REVIEWS ARE ALL LIES AND PICTURES WELLLLLL VERY VERY DECEIVING. I WANT EVERYBODY TO KNOW THIS HOTEL IS NOT 5 STAR AND IM RATING IT 1 STAR ONLY ONLY ONLY. I was there from 25th May - 29th May so this most definitely is a recent review sitting in the comfort of my home to let you all know.

Food was decent,reception area was beautiful,some of the staff were nice  Rooms were extremely outdated.. we had to ask to move rooms twice. The third room still wasn't great but much better than the previous 2. The carpets in all 3 rooms smelt bad.. they need to put new carpets.smelt like someone had smoked in the room. There were holes in the carpet.. and after hoovering the carpet, it was still SO dirty -there was a staff called 'Ahmed' (kitchen staff). He was extremely rude. We asked for water 3 times in which on the last time he said 'if you wait a minute I said I am coming'.but we shouldn't have to ask 3 times for water,then on another day we put fruit on a table and went to get our mains. We came back to see that the fruit had gone and someone else had laid their stuff on the table. We asked Ahmed where our fruit had gone and who someone else's stuff was on our table? He said that the other people had asked him to reserve that table for them. It's a first come first serve basis in terms of the table and we already put our fruit there (INFRONT OF AHMED) so that table was supposed to be ours and why did ahmed not tell these our people the table is already taken When I asked ahmed for his name, he said 'why?' I replied 'why not?'He then said again 'but why do you want my name?' I than again responded with 'but why not' - finally he said 'Ahmed' which i am now wondering if that even is his name. He has black spikey up hair and he always looks moody/angry. We also saw him raising his voice to another kitchen staff. I'mshocked at his service. The cleaners (most of them) are really sweet. The reception staff - at one point we phoned them from our room (finally when we was in a room where the phone actually worked) and a female staff said one minute il call you back, which she never did. When we went downstairs and asked her about this, she said 'speak to my colleague' and asked her male colleague to deal with us. I explained this to the colleague and he was very rushed in his response but totally ignored what I was saying and just said 'well get an engineer to come'. It was because the tv signal was terrible.  Now, let's get to the engineer. This same engineer came to our previous room because our phone was not working. He looked like he was doing something then he said 'il be back 5 minutes'. Of course he didn't come back. Now when the engineer came to sort the tv out, I mentioned to him, 'oh you didn't come back in the other room to fix the phone?'. He laughed and said 'no, no it wasn't me'. Well it clearly was you as I am looking at you now and it was 100% the same person. Anyway, he said 'il be back' (for a second time) - I said 'please make sure you actually come back'. Do you think he did? NO. What a joke. By this point we were so fed up, we left it. Didn't even bother telling reception as they clearly have no interest in addressing situations. I would never go back to his hotel and I would never recommend it to anyone. It's DEFINITELY not 5*. It's just about 3*.

Good hotel really amazing hotel the staff are really friendly people really very good the animation team is extraordinary good activities and nice show really thank you for all the team specialy  and the food selection lovely 😍 👌 👍 🥰 ☺️ 😙 😍

Great Hotel . lovely people . great time  Nice experice with crew animators 🇹🇳💪 Close sea and swimming pool 😎❤️ Weather was great. 😘 wish you all the best 🇹🇳 very good hotel lovely ................................................

The best animators ever, very nice and they make good entertainment. It is beautiful beach, good food and we spend the best time as a family with two small children. And habib good work in the hotel and good work dj his play every music in night club

Family of 5 we really enjoy it our holiday we was so lucky to have a beautiful days in sun and we was discover tunisia we visit some beautiful places eljem sidibousaid . Thank you for all the Staffs for helping and advice .the camel in the beach we enjoy it .jewelry in hotel he sells beautifuls necklaces )) without forget our beloved Picasso Jrs thank you for the beautiful tattoo's for the children Big love from the kids Picasso It our first time and defenitlly not last time nchalah Peace and love🇹🇳🇹🇳🇹🇳🇹🇳

reviews.review_title: Not Quite 5 Stars – Honest Review of El Mouradi Palace, Tunisia
reviews.review_text: We recently stayed at El Mouradi Palace for 10 days, and while there were a few highlights, overall, the experience did not live up to the 5-star rating advertised. I'd personally rate it closer to 3 stars, and that’s being generous.  Firstly, the hotel itself is very outdated. Built in 2005, it’s clear that the rooms are in urgent need of refurbishment. We had to change rooms three times due to poor conditions before finally settling in a fair one.  The outdoor facilities were another letdown. Both the pool and beach areas lack enough sunbeds for guests. Even if you're lucky enough to find one, many are broken or unusable. It’s frustrating to start your day with a scramble for decent seating.  Service around the pool was inconsistent. The bar is supposed to operate from 9:30am to 6pm, but on several occasions beer and slush ran out by 4pm. Instead of restocking, staff would simply stop serving and direct guests to the reception bar. Unfortunately, there you’ll often face long queues and are required to wear a shirt to be served – inconvenient when you’re coming straight from the pool.  As for dining, the buffet was underwhelming. Most dishes tasted very similar, with an overuse of the same spices and minimal variation between meals. Even pizza and fish options became repetitive, and there was a noticeable lack of grilled meats like steaks or ribs. After just three days, we were already tired of the food.  The à la carte restaurant experience was also disappointing. It's only available on select days and must be booked in advance. During our 10-day stay, we were only able to secure a reservation once. While the presentation was nice, the food tasted almost identical to the buffet offerings.  Despite these setbacks, we did encounter some excellent staff members who helped improve our stay. Special thanks to Abdul and Aziz from the buffet and Bairen at the reception – their professionalism and friendly service stood out and deserve recognition.  In summary, El Mouradi Palace has potential but currently falls short of a true 5-star experience. The value for money is reasonable, so if your expectations are adjusted accordingly, you might still enjoy your stay. That said, we won’t be returning, but don’t let that stop you from giving it a try – just come prepared to manage expectations, especially when it comes to comfort and dining.

reviews.review_title: A great disappointment, despite a promising setting
reviews.review_text: I am deeply disappointed by the policy of this hotel, which in 2025 continues to distinguish between local guests, residents abroad and foreign (non-Arab) tourists. I came with my parents for a 3 night stay, followed by a second booking with friends. Upon arrival, the welcome was icy: no drink or smile. We were simply asked to fill out a form, present our ID and wait... a long time.  Then we were charged a tourist tax three times higher than normal (9 dinars/person/night instead of 3). After reporting this, received from another hotel to support it, the checkout person eventually corrected it – a mistake that can happen, of course, but leaves a bitter taste upon arrival.  Then we were given the keys and asked to come back at 2:30 pm for the bracelets, refusing access to lunch on the pretext that the first meal included is dinner. A surprising practice, because in all the hotels I have stayed in, even when the rooms are not ready, guests receive their bracelet immediately to enjoy the buffet.  Another unpleasant surprise: although my two reservations were made in "all inclusive", I am told that it is actually a "soft" formula. No mention of that on the voucher. Several inconsistent and contradictory justifications then follow:  You must stay at least 4 nights to have the true all inclusive.  Local customers are not entitled to this formula.  Only Tunisians living abroad can benefit (which is my case).  Finally, as I share the room with my parents, it is "impossible" to offer me a formula different from theirs.  For the second booking (two separate rooms) Even in a separate room, on the same booking, different formulas cannot be applied.  As a result, I paid almost twice as much for an "all inclusive" formula as the "soft", and finally received the latter – very limited. The limitation does not stop at alcoholic drinks, it does not give access to the restaurant/beach (snacks & barbecues), nor to the pool bar, and does not allow lunch on arrival.  In other words, if you are Tunisian (or Arab in general), you will most likely have access to a limited formula, regardless of which one you have booked.  Apart from that, the hotel is vast, with beautiful scenery, and the restaurant staff is very respectful and warm – a real positive. On the other hand, room 536 does not correspond to the standards of a 5 star: outdated furniture, fridge out of service, extremely dirty carpet.  However, I would like to thank the young woman in charge of customer relations, who sincerely tried to find a solution, without success. I have cancelled my second booking and will not set foot in this or any other hotel in the El Mouradi chain, which I strongly advise against anyone in a situation similar to mine.

reviews.review_title: To escape unless you are deaf, or fans of carnivals
reviews.review_text: Very decent hotel, welcoming and friendly staff. Comfortable rooms. However: - impossible to settle at the pool, except to reserve his place before 7:15 am - Very loud sound around the pool  - in the evening 75 decibels measured in the room, closed bays, carnival style Fortunately there is the quiet beach The name “palace” is a disgrace We came to rest, impossible To flee

reviews.review_title: That hotel should be rated 3 stars not 5.
reviews.review_text: The best part of my holiday is the  spa, food was average spent most time eating at Hard Rock Cafe the staff were friendly. The room that was given to us was dirty took them 3 days  to clean it  I would never advised anyone to stop at that hotel simple because the rooms are filthy, phone line dont work so if you got any issues you can't phone, limited cushion for day bed it was terrible I wanted to check out the same day I arrived I really felt stress staying there.

A week to decompress, objective achieved. A smiling and available team. A comfortable room and a view of the pool and the sea very pleasant on awakening. A varied buffet and as soon as congratulations on the salads of raw vegetables. I recommend without hesitation

reviews.review_title: An unforgettable family stay – Thank you from the bottom of our hearts! (From May 19 to May 25, 2025)
reviews.review_text: We stayed at Mouradi Palace Sousse as a family of 6, with members of all ages – including an elderly parent with reduced mobility – and a variety of needs and expectations. The hotel exceeded them all with grace.  The setting is beautiful and calm, the cleanliness impeccable, and the food both delicious and varied. But above all, what truly stood out was the dedication, warmth, and professionalism of the entire team. We want to sincerely thank Mr. Bayrem and Mr. Lotfi at the reception, Mrs. Hada from housekeeping, the restaurant team, and also the gentleman who helped us with our luggage at the hotel entrance – always helpful, friendly, and full of care.  Thank you for turning this stay into a beautiful, heartfelt memory.  We’ll definitely be back!

reviews.review_title: Not a 5* palace - cheap paid not 1 reason
reviews.review_text: The + room 232 view roof🤷🏼‍♀️ quiet- Italian-tv nikel all the impeccable channels - hair dryer - food there is enough to eat - breakfast impeccable ORANGE JUICE PRESSED in front of you- wholemeal bread butter jams cereal eggs donuts pancakes salty fruit- evenings and lunch what to eat we like or not there is of all tastes- even had shrimp grilles of the real French cheeses "sushi" bar drinks waters coca Fanta wine beer- clean beach- 8 tennis courts- 1 mini golf course 1 pétanque course- paid sea activities banana parachute etc- Ali baba store exiting on the right you will find all gifts and drink on 3 floors-postcards- 1 letterbox- Animations not tested but yen a - thalassotherapy massage of the back and feet 1 kiff- indoor pool- an outdoor pool and pool for children - currency exchange: scam  euro 3.31 against the airport 3.35- taxi rank outside the hotel is 20 dinars to go far enough- that's the price- helpful Hedy server always had my table booked and sometimes better 😱-  Les - amiable zero I left this morning nobody at the reception the guy was lying elsewhere- no smile of some waiters butler and responsible- memebnot "hello" take your towels your mattress and your deckchair- and the direction not worth saying "we'll fix it" it already makes several comments that say it- nor at the beach and we're only May- make conventions at the same time as tourism IDEA STUPID 1 file of 5 meters I ate fruit that day- no kettle or anything- 1 fridge everything rots- safe never knew how to use it and yet I travel - carpeted corridors in 1 state..broken phone in the elevator- works on the 1st floor so at 8:30 I thought my door was broken down- children's games OMG abandoned broken - WiFi rots only in the room but did not go to the balcony it no longer capture and at the reception, not at the pool- Conclusion did not believe what is written Crossroads travel sunshine not even a briefing nada wallou it is not 1 palace 5*

Very friendly staff, good animation team. Great team happy to help and participate with anything. Good entertainment in the evenings for kids and adults different shows every night starting off with kids shows first then adults after 9:30 till late evening

Very good hotel amazing hotel the staff are really kind and are there to help always l really recommend the animation team is extraordinary we will come back againe the food very good really nice thanks for all the team very good hotel ,,,,,,,

Customer relations she went out her way to help. A lot of people where complaining about the rooms my fridge did not work ,dirty beech towel, the photos on the web site are not what rooms are this is a 3 star at most no kettle in rooms only good thing where the staff who where helpful

Pool is nice and big, doesn’t get too busy. Rooms are standard clean and nice. Food is good and the same every night. Staff is very friendly around the pool and the evening entertainment is good. You can head into Sousse in a taxi for not too much.

Good staff, food was good all very friendly,   Room was a little out of date reasonable size and good sea front view, pool was good size with a lot of sun lounges. Wether was great also had a private beach which was great clear water and even activities.

Lovely holiday in tunisia it our first time here we really enjoy ut we visit turkey egypt before but we find tunisia amazing also definitly we will come back .we enjoy our stay the staff very hepful they really make oyr holiday great . Thank you for all the staff and animation team without forget the Master tattoo Picasso Ahmed he really very talent doing great tattoo for both of us big love from Sheffield Picasoo see you soon

reviews.review_title: This hotel is in a perfect!
reviews.review_text: What a beautifully appointed property. A feast for the eyes! Staff is friendly and eager to please.  This hotel is also situated in a perfect location.  The roof top restaurant offers beautiful views, great service and delicious food!  The Hammam was a disappointment.

Hotel to recommend! Nothing wrong. Our best 5* hotel, all our stay. Clean suite, impeccable rooftop, excellent kitchen. Do not hesitate, you will not regret it. If we were to return to Tunis, our choice would be this hotel and not another!

The hotel is a little hard to find  as it's nestled amidst the alleys of the Medina. Getting there by car is a little hard. But once you're there it's like a tiny oasis. The attention to detail is incredible. Your eye is diverted to every nook and cranny.  The service is superb. After a shopping spree the staff managed to conjure up extra cartons to pack and also opened their boutiqueat 1am to take out scotch tape.  Would go back there again tomorrow.  Definitely worth going.

reviews.review_title: THE place in to be in Tunis medina
reviews.review_text: Dar Jeld is well known all over Tunisia and you can tell they set the standard for incredible decor and service. Everything at this location is beautiful. The rooms are spacious, the place itself is a fixture in the medina with its ornate yellow doors and blue windows. The staff are super helpful. The food is outstanding. And the view from the roof is gorgeous. You can get to/way via taxi which is hard for most in the medina. One off the nicest places we have stayed anywhere.

Very nice guest house to visit and stay. The staff is friendly and the atmosphere is perfect. Comfortable bed, beautiful decoration and a le suhour was hearty and varied (we stayed during the month of Ramadan). A beautiful roof top with a breathtaking view of the entire medina. I highly recommend the guest house and we will definitely come back to stay and especially do a SPA.

This is a wonderful hotel right in the medina of Tunis.  The staff was very helpful with anything we needed.  It has a great location, just a few turns away from shops, restaurants, and the old mosques.  The rooms are very big and comfortable.  The restaurant on the rooftop is delicious and the views are great, you can see all of Tunis from up there.  Also, the spa was great. We got a hammam there and it was an amazing experience, its easily worth your time.

Beautiful hotel in the Medina in Tunis.  Great food, wonderful hospitality and loads of positive atmosphere in the old medina. Tunisian people we met are kind and friendly. Spent a week here visiting Carthage, Sidi Bou Said, Bardo Museum, La Marsa and got bus to Hammamet. Hotel has a great spa too.

Always a real pleasure to return to this magical place of luxury and voluptuousness. Coconut in the heart of the medina, this hotel is as beautiful as it is comfortable and exotic. Large roof top for eating or drinking. The staff is very attentive. Anyway, it feels good. Only downside on the quality of the breakfast that would deserve better to stay in tune with the rest.

The hotel is on the edge of the Medina, a perfect location for us—just a short walk to grab a taxi. The property is stunning, beautifully decorated, and full of cozy spots to relax.  They market the suites under Dar El Jeld and the single rooms under Dar Doora. The suites, even the classic ones, are spacious and luxurious. We only realized the Dar Doora connection when making arrangement for a day room before our midnight flight.  The rooftop restaurant serves an international menu during the day, which was a nice change during Ramadan. Breakfast was delicious.  The spa was a plus —free hammam access for guests, a relaxing massage (though not deep tissue), great facial and manicure.  Dar El Jeld is an easy choice for luxury; Dar Doora is a solid lower-cost option.

In the center of the old town, very careful old mansion with high level of services. The staff helpful, the cleanliness impeccable. Transfer to and from the airport. Very good value ratio. I strongly recommend it.

An excellent choise, this Hotel is located in the Madina itself. If you are visiting please book a Taxi from the hotel for Euro 20 it will save you a lot of trouble since regular taxis are not authorised to drive up to the hotel door step and they will drop you off a couple of hundred meters away.  There are plenty of shops, restaurants and things to see all around this Hotel. The staff are pleasant and efficient. The rooms and bath are large and the bath floor is heated. The rooms are large and comfortable and they generously flood you with fruits and chocolates daily which made me feel at home and wanted.  Their spa was good but the hammam portion needs better handling and I was not happy since I was left to fend for myself and constantly had to call someone for assistance.  Food at their restaurant is delicious and the views from the rooftop are a splendid sight. They also a Tunisian restaurant with the same name next door and it is well rated and need a booking.  You cannot go wrong with this hotel !

Hotel advertises that rooms have air conditioning. They do NOT. We had to request fans and were told they don't have any. I had to press the issue and they finally agreed to bring a fan.  Can't leave windows open due to constant street noise and sewer gas smell. Room service food and restaurant meals were embarrassingly bad. Not a luxury place. Not up to international standards.

Beautiful hotel in the heart of the Medina and close to the souk. The charm of the old and modern comfort make it an exceptional place. The staff, very professional is very attentive.  Tunisian cuisine is of very good quality. The superb roof top overlooks the city and gives access to the pool. We spent unforgettable moments there. We recommend this property.

reviews.review_title: Wonderful stay at Dar El Djeb
reviews.review_text: This hotel is amazing! Very nice establishment, beautiful decor, ideal location in the heart of the medina. The suites are very comfortable and pleasant. The rooftop offers magnificent views of the city. But above all, the staff is at the top! Very professional and pleasant, always smiling and very efficient! Thank you to them for the welcome and service. In short, this stay was wonderful!

Splendid hotel, renovated with taste and luxury while respecting the site. Staff with little care. Despite the constraints of our group of 12 people.  Superbly placed in the Medina.  It would be a shame to miss this marvel.

Very nice welcome. Cleanliness of the premises impeccable. A pleasant smell of orange blossom and jasmine floats continuously in the air. The staff listens to their customers. Please take advantage of the wellness area, the staff is also very welcoming and very professional. Remember to book your treatment as soon as you arrive at the hotel. The real positive is its location, it is located in the heart of the medina.

The perfect boutique hotel. The spa is fabulous and far from overpriced. In fact, it is a steal. The negative reviews are absurd and unrealistic.   I did the hammam and 60 min massage for about $58 USD. The aestheticians were fabulous and I walked out feeling renewed. I only wish they had more availability. Book your appointments when you book your room, since it is fully booked. The spa has yummy treats. My only suggestion is that book early, since they run low on amazing local treats.  The hotel rooms are suites. We had a bedroom, living room, and 1.5 bathrooms for about $178 USD. The places is immaculate and beautifully decorated. Chocolates and fruit are given at turn down. I wish they switched it upon arrival.   The restaurants are divine. We ate on the roof which is casual and less than the restaurant where we ate last year. Try both, since it is a very different vibe.  Take the hotel transfer service. I usually don't, but taxis aren't allowed in the Medina and we found ourselves dragging our luggage. The premium for the transfer is worth it especially if arriving at night.  I highly recommend this property. My goal is to find more properties like this globally that deliver exceptional quality at a fair price.

Went to the Spa on Sunday for a manicure, massage and facial treatment. The cosmeticians are faaar from being professional as its visible on the photo with deplorable nailpolish. The quality used for the products is embarrassing. Not even a base coat has been applied. Eventhough not in the hamman itself it was hot like hell. I mentioned several times to turn on the Ac and that heat harms me cause of my medical condition with multiple sclerosis but nothing and it was just me and my sister there at that time, so no risk someone else could "freeze". Viewing the price and honestly even for the tenth of the price an impudence rarely seen

Exceptional hotel, from start to finish no false rating. From the reception at the Spa the best hotel I have made in Tunisia...  The decorations and furnishings of the suites made with taste and without false notes. Rooftop restaurant to do on the other hand the restaurant Dar el Jeld has no interest, I reserve another comment not to distort this one.

Dar El Jeld Hotel and Spa has a beautiful architeture and is situated in one of the best parts of the Medina. It positions itself as a luxury Hotel and SPA. This might be true for the Hotel part. However this is far from being reality when it comes to the SPA. If one pays this prices for a SPA (675 Dinars for two people `100 euro each) in Tunisia one might think that you will be welcomed with at least a glass of water while you are in the waiting room which was not the case. You would also expect to be in the hands of highly professional beauty staff using good to high quality products, which unfortunately is not the case (manicure / nail polish was very poor). The girls are lovely but lack experience. All in all being at the spa was nice but value for money was far from being good. If you sell luxury clients need to get that!

Hotel is good animation team excellent food okay lots of activities for all, no air con in room until June, overall drinks and staff are lovely, pool great  security on gates felt very safe, bed comfy think you very much Marco Polo perfectt very good

reviews.review_title: I recommend Marco Polo Restort such an amazing experience,
reviews.review_text: Food is amazing!! The music is such a good mixture of cultures. Big pool!! snack bar is amazing. The rooms are very spacious. The entertainment team is amazing and so so sweet. The discos are amazing at night. Very clean Resort. People are very lively. There is a bar that stays open till later for those who want a snack at night. You will never be bored as there is plenty of activity that the entertainment team provide. Good vibes here in Março Polo. 10/10 experience

Amazing, 10/10 experience for anyone who is thinking of coming, entertainment team is so so amazing and so kind. Made my week in Tunisia so special!! The room, big pool, and food is just as amazing. Security is so good and keeps us all safe all day.

reviews.review_title: Could be a lot better, much better.
reviews.review_text: Not enough bar staff serving customers, no waiters serving drinks outside at night, tables in restaurant are cleared quickly but not reset for next person. No bar at beach. At check in I was told to come back in 1 hour for my room, 80 minutes later I return to reception and get told to wait another 2 hours, poor ! It’s a nice hotel but poorly run.

I stayed at the hotel for 7 days with my boyfriend and we were delighted with the hotel, the food, the service, the team of animators, everything is really at an enviable level! The staff is very friendly, everyone is smiling and in a good mood.

Great, entertainment team is the best u can get. People are so sweet and welcomming, weather is good its sunny and hot, pool is good beach is great so i advise you to come here as soon as possible you will love it. Willy is the best guy in entertainment team!!!

I had a pleaseant journey at Marco Polo hôtel I really enjoyed my time even though I came for work but the entraînement time did thé job Thé food was good But I really liked m'y room especially that the guest service upgrade me to a suite  ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️

The welcome at the Marco Polo hotel was very warm from the staff who were always smiling and pleasant, both in the restaurant, as well as in the bar and maintenant. Hats off to the animation that is always attentive to customers with a smile and is very cervical. Tasty.

Marco polo was probably the best holiday i have ever been on. The animation team was so kind and easy to talk to. Pikatchou and Magi were so nice and funny. The team always got us doing archery and dancing at night which was amazing!! Overall an amazing trip!

The hotel is very good: very large swimming pool very clean, the food is good and varied.the rooms are spacious. Great animation team. The staff is very friendly and attentive and always with big smiles.  Very good stay....

The hotel is well located, the rooms are spacious and clean. Some renovations would be necessary, toilet doors in the hall and outside broken, bathtub, water flows poorly.   The highlight of my stay is the WK 3 and 4 May 2025, far too crowded because of a seminar and on Sunday 4 May no way to eat properly 3/4 hour just to arrive at the buffet and to finish eating cold.  Otherwise the staff is very nice and the FRAM animators are great, they offer different activities during the day and in the evening.   I really enjoyed this holiday

Don’t go !  Stayed in many hotels this is one of the worst one  Apart swimming pool which is nice there is nothing.  Food very poor variety, not enough plates and glasses  Very poor dinner too  Cockroach on corridors soo be careful  Rooms , bathroom are very old.  Beach is full of seaweed, you can’t even go to the water.  So if you want a nice stay look for another hotel

The hotel was amazing. We have 7 days all inclusive. Here are my thoughts   - Food was beyond my expectations and always available at any time of the day or night.  - The hotel has one of the biggest pools and really nice to swim in it. As per google, it is 1800 m2.  - the atmosphere and people who work there are really nice people and very helpful. Of course if you speak French or Arabic would help a bit more.   - The animation team is absolutely the best. Every day there are so many activities and in the evening the entertainment and dancing. Loved the whole experience, and they are very helpful. Shouout to Manel and Maggie they are exceptional. Their dedication and sense of humour and dancing style made whole stay different.

reviews.review_title: Great Stay at Marco Polo Hotel
reviews.review_text: We had a lovely time at Marco Polo Hotel. The restaurant served fresh, tasty food and was very clean. The swimming pool was decent and perfect for relaxing.  The staff were all very friendly and helpful. A big shoutout to the animation team, who made our stay extra fun – especially Manal, who was so kind and welcoming.  Our room was clean, tidy, and well-organized. Overall, a great experience – we’d definitely come back!

Beautiful trip with Italian groupo, great service, helpful and welcoming staff. Very happy location , large swimming pool , also beautiful indoor and the spa. Near a very popular restaurant and the marina of hammamet

We just spent a week in this magnificent hotel direct access to the beach and barely 10 minutes from the shops and the medina. Very well received by pleasant staff and very smiling.  Jaafer and walid always taking care to serve us at the pool bar. The whole team shuddered in terms of animation at the top. Perfect room very clean (, cleaned every day with beautiful floral arrangements). I highly recommend this hotel. You're on top don't change anything

I thoroughly enjoyed my time at the Marco Polo.   The staff were fantastic throughout, always on hand to help and always extremely professional and delightful.   The facilities are superb. The food was excellent and the drinks selection was one of the better of the hotels I've experienced.   I would highly recommend booking this hotel .

Just on the last day of our 9 night stay here at the Marco Polo will be very sad to leave in the morning. Has been a fabulous break away from the UK in this family friendly hotel and even though our group was all adults we can't fault the hotel at all. Rooms are spacious and comfortable, facilities are spot on with a great pool with a swim up bar. A stones throw from the beach as well. All the staff have been so friendly and helpful from the waiting staff in the dining room, bar staff who keep you refreshed with a great selection of drinks on the all inclusive. Special mention to Oumymq who is part of the animation team who is an absolute diamond. She's been so helpful and friendly and it went a long way to making the stay so enjoyable. Kudos to the rest of the animation team as well, it's a tough job but the activities help break up the day.  Would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of coming to Tunisia and for an all inclusive break it can't be knocked.

Had a very good stay here, food very good and good change of food every day especially at night, the Brik (traditional Tunisian food) is such a highlight and I now want it every day 🤣🤦🏼‍♀️ Staff are very friendly, Sami and Hamdi are lovely and go above and beyond! All the staff do, but you obviously make bonds with certain ones quickly!  The animation guys are ace, didn't get all their names but Oumyma, mygi, and soleil were really friendly, helpful and fun! Pool is SOOO good, sun all day pretty much whenever your lounger is, beach a stones throw away.  Easy to get to from the airport. Only downside was the air con was broken apparently in the whole hotel for our stay, made it very warm at night in the room, but luckily could keep door open and the net curtain over. Didn't really change the heat, and definitely needs fixing asap!  Cleaners are all very lovely and rooms are clean.  The odd bit of maintenance needs doing in rooms/around the hotel with lighting, but over all a wonderful stay 💛💛

No hot water. The buffet was borderline, no variety. Pasta is already prepared in advance and heated on site. Filled with salami and cheese. Cold pool.  The only plus, we were provided with a suite for a couple with a small baby.

The hotel as a whole was quite ok friendly staff and clean. The animation was also ok. The stand is further back (5 min walk) and there is no internet.  But the food, well, mostly cold and tasted like nothing else often. Breakfast is good. 7 days ok but not again when I come back.

Excellent hotel with an excellent location, best beach area, excellent rooms with a fantastic cleanliness, excellent pools, indoor and outdoor, the bars are very good, an excellent staff, especially the animators are of excellence.

Everything is perfect the restaurant great choice of food excellent its staff at the top.  Mermaid bar very well all friendly.  Equipped with animation thank you all do not change!!!! You make us dance as usual. Thank you 😊  Receptionists all listening and smiling.

I had an absolutely wonderful experience at Djerba Plaza Thalasso & Spa! The hotel is impeccable, with a relaxing atmosphere, spacious and very clean rooms. The staff was extremely friendly and attentive to every need, always with a smile. The pool and spa area are perfect for unwinding, and the private beach is clean and well-maintained. The food was varied and delicious, with options to suit all tastes. I would definitely return and highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a peaceful and high-quality vacation in Djerba. Thanks a lot for everything and for your effort.😘🤗🥰

Beautiful sandy beach. Turquoise water. Pretty nice staff.  The only downside is the food Large swimming pool. Very spacious room with plenty of storage space. Evening entertainment followed by a discotheque atmosphere

My stay at the Plaza Hotel in Djerba was simply exceptional, and much of this magic I owe to Djo! Upon arrival, his warm welcome and professionalism immediately set the tone. Always smiling, attentive and full of energy, he knew how to make our trip unique.  Djo knows the region perfectly and has made us discover the true riches of Djerba, with personalized advice, authentic local activities, and always in a friendly atmosphere. He has a rare gift for bonding and making everyone feel special.  If you are staying at the Plaza Hotel, don’t miss the opportunity to meet Djo: he is the beating heart of the establishment, and he transforms every moment into a precious memory. Thank you Djo for your energy, generosity and passion — you made this trip unforgettable!

Quiet and friendly hotel. Swimming pool, meals, room very good 👍🏼 animation very good from morning until evening. Hotel close to the sea with activities close to the city center.  Various and correct catering. The all-inclusive option to take to be quiet all your stay!

Great hotel, pool access and fast beach , the staff is friendly and helpful,  The facilitators are great , kind , and do their best to facilitate and organize activities adapted to everyone.  The food is relatively good and the rooms are spacious.

✨ A perfect stay! ✨ Everything was spotless, from start to finish. The rooms are clean and comfortable, the services at the top, and the setting is beautiful. Special mention for the animation team: always smiling, dynamic and full of energy! Thanks to them, every day was a real pleasure. Thank you for these beautiful memories, I will return without hesitation

Nothing to say 🫶🏻  Clean room, warm and professional welcome. The staff in one word: a jewel ❤️  Many thanks to all the animation, security and staff of the restaurant and bar. THANK YOU also to the girls of the spa and its director. We had a great time with you. Unforgettable meetings with the hotel staff and guests. Thank you for your welcome.  Go ahead! Do not hesitate to choose the hotel Plaza 😊

We stayed at this hotel this week   Just perfect.   Ideal staff   Superb animation   Ideal catering   Very nice room   I look for negative things but there are none 👌  We'll be back   Beautiful beach   Awesome beach bar

Beautiful hotel, large quiet pool, varied animation...lots of excursion proposed, team of entertainers at the top especially Erwan very friendly sociable and always smiling. The buffet is good and varied. Spacious and clean room .Djerba beautiful island

We had an absolutely fantastic stay at Djerba Plaza Thalasso & Spa. From the moment we arrived, we were seduced by the enchanting setting of the hotel, nestled in the heart of a beautiful palm garden, with direct access to a dream beach.  The staff is simply exceptional: welcoming, professional and always ready to help with a smile. Many thanks to the whole team for their kindness throughout our stay.  The room was spacious, clean, well decorated, with very comfortable bedding. We particularly enjoyed the calm of the place, perfect to recharge.  The buffets are varied, well presented and delicious. There is something for everyone, and Tunisian specialties are a real treat. Breakfast is also very complete, with a wide choice of fresh products.  The pool is huge and very nice, and the thalassotherapy center is a real plus to relax and enjoy the stay to the fullest. The private beach is superb, with its fine sand and turquoise waters.  It was our first time at Djerba Plaza, and certainly not the last. We leave with memories full of head and only one desire: come back very quickly! And thank you again to Erwan for his warm welcome and always smile.

Very welcome from the staff, an animation team at the top and always with a smile. Area of improvement: a wider and more varied cocktail menu selection  The whole stay was pleasant and I recommend it to all to live a good week of vacation.

reviews.review_title: Pleasant stay that needs to be renewed
reviews.review_text: Bel hôtel. Cleanliness impeccable and very friendly staff. The room is spacious, impeccable cleanliness  The new animation team is very dynamic and takes care of the customers very well. The food is very varied , hearty and the cooks listen to customers

Great hotel!!!with staff listening to the customer ...............and animators at the top ............ ....pity that all guests do not play the game lack of proposed at the beach On the whole no reproach to make... Thank you, erwane.

This is the perfect place ❤️ with great animations and perfect clean room. Food was great and everyone is possible find something for themselves even my 10 years son find something for himself. Perfect beach and great place. Thank you for this holiday!

reviews.review_title: We came to this hotel by recommendation of our daughter
reviews.review_text: We are delighted to welcome catering staff very attentive to customers ...   Speed of maintenance intervention ...... Super entertainment team and very varied restaurant  Everyone with a smile 🤩 .

Personal very well.  Hotel very good food excellent.   Excursions very well we will return with pleasure.      Lively and very nice evening  Very present and well polite facilitators  we had a great holiday and thank you very much to Marco

Excellent animations........,.. Reception very attentive ...,,,..., Various and good food ........ The very helpful and professional housekeeper ..,. Nice evening atmosphere  The animator Erwan pro in aquagym and his animations are very popular  Marco is very friendly and approaches guests brilliantly

reviews.review_title: Always happy to. I will definitely visit the hotel again. I myself can only pass it on positively.
reviews.review_text: Super great staff especially The animator Rio. All very friendly super clean and worth a recommendation.  All the staff and reception just top. Everyone is in a good mood and tries to animate all guests positively without stress.

The animators are really at the top, thank you to each of them for having animated my solo trip! The rooms are very clean and spacious. The food is good, it looks very similar every day but is nice! The pool is very well maintained. I recommend this hotel!

Excellent stay. Nice, comfortable, clean and secure. Very high quality catering. Entertainment, pool and private beach perfect. All the staff at the top. Good job. Very good value for money. To do again without any hesitation.

Just returned from a week away at this hotel, we had a brilliant time! Food is great, a bit repetitive but we wasn’t fussed as we was happy with the selection provided. Entertainment is brilliant!  A big thank you to the following for making our holiday even more enjoyable: Hassan the lovely waiter at the pool bar Joe in the entertainment team Naseeb at the main hotel bar. They all go above and beyond to make sure you have the best holiday & constantly have your drinks replaced.  Overall I would definitely go back to this hotel - highly recommend.  The beach is lovely white sand but when the sea is choppy it’s quite dirty as me and my partner found out when getting on the jet ski’s and we’re filthy!

Beautiful stay, Too short all the staff without exception is in small care. They do everything to make us spend an unforgettable holiday. We quickly forge a friendship with them. They are available at any time.  The rooms are clean, comfortable. The hotel is warm. Hearty and varied cuisine. There is something for everyone I also recommend exceptional thalassotherapy. The services are offered according to your health and your needs the staff is at your disposal. Animations at the top dynamic and formidable team. Long live the next holiday

Great team atmosphere assured evenings at the top my children loved.  Animation at the top service to perfection nothing wrong we had a wonderful stay I will come back.  Go ahead with your eyes closed. Many thanks to Sophie willy djo marco rio leo❤️❤️❤️

reviews.review_title: Very good holiday will come again Lovely holiday great staff very helpful good fun rio good guy very😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍
reviews.review_text: Lovely holiday great staff very helpful good fun rio good guy very helpful great entertainment food is delicious great swimingpool and great entertainment for all the beach is lovely and just across the road from the hotel also  has a bar with great tasting beer 😀 👍

A very pleasant stay an animation team at the top a very warm welcome from all the staff of the quality services of the kings a very beautiful hotel is very beautiful spaces.  Is the restaurant at the top of good meal from breakfast to dinner

Excellent hotel, everything is perfect. Welcome, entertainment at the top, impeccable service, splendid and clean rooms and excellent catering. Hotel worth its stars. A big crush for animators who give their all with great activities! Wink to Willy!!

Once again a very good stay of the animators at the top listening and always in a good mood  With Rady mido and a marco always in care Spacious rooms and varied catering  A nice thalasso and wonderful massage with kind staff

We had the best time here. Staff looked after us to a high standard. The animation team Joe, Marco, Rio,mido,Leo,Alex,Sophie were amazing and extremely entertaining! Great food,pool area, and beach.We will definitely return to this hotel.

Very nice hotel. Spacious rooms. Restaurant on top. A great team of animators who puts atmosphere at the pool and makes us spend beautiful evenings. Little crush on Sophie and Willy. The waiters at the restaurant and bar very smiling and caring. Great week.

Very welcome, lovely staff with little care. Good animation team.  Room on top. Diversified meal.  I highly recommend it. All staff attentive, very helpful. Speak French.  Pool on top.  Quality Hamman, with top massagers.

Great hotel with great animators/animations. Our room was niquel and clean. The atmosphere of the hotel with the entertainment every night was great. We loved our stay and we made very nice meetings. We will definitely return!! (Small + for very friendly staff)

Great host hotel at the top!!!! Super nice use them from massager to animator, always smiling and engaging with tourists. I would gladly come back to enjoy all the advantages that the hotel and the surroundings give!!

Very good hotel, good value for money.  Meals are good , entertainment team on top , theme night every night.  The hotel is very clean and always smells good. Suitable PMR with elevator everywhere, to go to the pool , or to the beach from the first floor terrace!  I recommend!

Nice atmosphere animation at the top The bar very nice...the beach ...unfortunate not possible....super welcome....very spacious room very advantageous space...restaurant unfortunate little varies.....very animated pool especially late morning...dynamic youth with animation and really close to customers

Really it is a very good experience ❤️ spacious rooms.. Quiet... Sweet... ♥️❤️ Excellent atmosphere all day with the animation team especially.. Several activities and played... Thanks for the whole team ♥️♥️ ♥️

I spent an exceptional week at Medina Solaria. The hotel is very nice, with comfortable and well maintained rooms. The restaurant is a real highlight: the dishes are varied, tasty and well presented, with excellent service in room (thanks to the chefs especially Lotfi and his team). The staff is always smiling, attentive and very professional, whether in the restaurant, bar or in the common areas. Animations are dynamic, well organized and create a great atmosphere throughout the day. Special mention to Mama missa, Mohamed-Khalil and Sophie for their involvement and professionalism!  An unforgettable stay, I recommend without hesitation!

The animation team was exceptional, and the hotel remarkable.  The atmosphere was pleasant, and the all-inclusive formula satisfactory. The room was clean and had a nice sea view.The stay was very quiet and relaxing.

Very good stay in Menara spent with family.  Many activities during the day and for the world thank you to djappa , azizet especially nermines and the rest of the team.  Let s not forget the maids so the Restaurant especially houssem and karim , the buffets are varied and quality.  The excursions offered by the reception for the hotel are diverse and interesting.  To summarize a stay at the top on all levels. I highly recommend the Menara hotel

Very average hotel frequented mostly by Maghrebs, very far from the city center it always makes take a taxi 12 dinars 4 to 5 € the driveway, not interesting food recycled several times, too much noise at the time of eating, no queue to serve, the staff I feel he watches instead of being at our service, no water it is paid knowing that tap water is salty. I strongly advise against running.

Everything was fine. Food was available 3x a day + cake in between, pool OK. Animation with Mario and Amine perfect, the beach a little 5 minutes away crystal clear water. My girlfriend and I had a great week.  Anytime again 👍🏻✌🏻 💗💗💗💗

Great stay in Tunisia! The hotel is great, the staff is really adorable and always there to help answer our questions and requests. Special mention for the animation team with whom we had great times by the pool and in the evening! Frankly, I loved this stay I hope to come back!

The employees are great! Always listening and smiling. The animators are great! Embedded in the card game to set the mood, also at parties, they make us sport on request oriental dance classes, stretching, table tennis and dart! The bartenders take care! The cook for our outings prepared sandwiches on request when it didn’t seem usual but he does it with good heart. The cuisine is local so spicy, but there is white pasta, thankfully! In addition the place is very clean and very secure. The housekeepers we were in the little care in our rooms every day while we did not tidy up too much ... There is an indoor heated pool and there is the outdoor pool protected from the wind thanks to the cypress and architecture. There might be some things to complain about, but considering the price and the kindness and attention we get, it’s worth 5. Just the soundproofing in the room requires balls.

Menara Hammamet , a good plan for family and for vacation ,I was surprised by the good level of the hotel restaurant overlooking the pool and by the level of food and other services of the hotel.the staff really attentive. Thanks for nermine and the animation team

The animation team is very friendly and make you feel welcome and included they have fun activities to involve you with and they all have amazing nice personalities especially nermine and mario he made the holiday more enjoyable and he shared a passion for football with me

The hotel staff are really welcoming and respectful.. the rooms without clean and fragrant.. only thing the buffet lacks a lot of choices but the meals so delicious the friendly waiters .. the animation overall great.. they are so aware how to handle between all nationalities the Algerian the French the English etc... Thanks for the nice nermine and the beautiful Mario also the DJ djappa and of course amine the cool .. sincerely quiet and clean hotel . family I recommend it

Nice hotel  I would like to thanks Mr Mohamed and haven't for bring welcoming  during all our stay A large choice in buffet and such a  dilecious  food Good animation  team  and I enjoyed night time games miss and minster we had really fun with nwafel and other team Thank u menara

All staff were fabulous- very warm and welcoming. Special thanks to mario from the animation team! Lovely food with plenty of vegetarian options. Clean rooms. Only downside was being charged twice by reception staff for tourist tax- not resolved and not helpful.

Hello, I have been a loyal customer of the Menara for almost three years, where I come regularly, about once a month, whether as a family or alone to rest. What makes me come back each time is the staff: whether it be the restaurant team, the bar, the entertainment or the housekeepers, all are very kind and respect the privacy of the customers.  It is true that the hotel still has a few areas for improvement, such as the elevator which sometimes has breakdowns, or a few minor malfunctions here and there. But I have complete confidence in Mrs Narjess, who places great importance on the well-being of customers and is doing everything necessary to make sure that everything goes in the right direction.  Mohamed, the manager, is always available and very attentive, which makes every stay more pleasant. I also had the pleasure of meeting Mr. AmanAllah, a new charismatic and motivated director, who seems determined to make Menara an institution of excellence.  What I also value very much is the quality of the customers. When I come with my children, I feel safe, which is essential for me, especially in Tunisia.  I would also like to highlight the warm atmosphere that emerges throughout the hotel, where every detail contributes to creating a soothing and friendly environment. A special crush for my little Nermine as well as for the entire animation team, always invested, caring and able to adapt to everyone’s desires. Thanks to them, we feel really good here!  Thanks to Djappa, who has been faithful to himself for the past three years, and to Rami and Hassen, who facilitate each stay. Jdidi is a great Mr! I would have sincerely liked to thank many other people, but space does not allow me.  I look forward to repeating the experience and discovering even more little touches that make all the difference.

Kind staff Top and varied restaurant Excellent animation and magnificent atmosphere.nermine and mario  The pool very nice and location very well and quiet Unfortunately the room ran out of towels , toilet paper , and the Tunisian channels .I don't like much.. damage

Friendly hotel Family hotel animator mario . nermine listening delicious meal comfortable room decent housekeeper and listening to our request reception thank you for all your efforts I will return with my family inchallah good continuation

Beautiful, excellent, family-friendly family-friendly hotel repaired for everyone who loves to relax and relax ✌️The staff and animation are polite, courteous and always smiling for a very nice experience. Thank you very much for mentioning animation Nermin very close to the beach less than 500 meters and also Yasmin bathroom area 5 minutes 👍👍👍👍👍

From the moment we arrived, we received a smiling and personalized welcome, with attention to detail that makes all the difference. The elegantly decorated rooms offer a magnificent view of the pool and are of absolute tranquility. The hotel restaurant deserves a special mention: dishes  delicious.  The hotel is a haven of peace! A big thank you for this perfectly orchestrated stay. We recommend with your eyes closed and hope to return soon

The welcome was warm and the staff incredibly professional and attentive. The rooms are spacious, impeccable cleanliness, and equipped with everything necessary for optimal comfort. The bedding is like a palace – you sleep beautifully! Breakfast was varied, with fresh and quality products.

An excellent stay in a friendly hotel. Regarding the food it is excellent and good. The setting is nice and beautiful Welcoming and professional staff. The room is clean. What attracted me, what caught my attention is the property of the whole establishment. I recommend this Hotel Congratulations to the entire Menara team Directorates and staff I'll be back...

reviews.review_title: VERY BAD EXPERIENCE ( DO NOT RECOMMEND )
reviews.review_text: The service offered by the host is terrible with dras en moin cushions in mon, the food is execrable. Generally the service is poor and the lady of the host falsified the feedback rating of the hotel on their websites without my agreement.

Amazing stay at this hotel, we came for 7 days, and met so many lovely people from the hotel, the entertainment team were fantastic as we're the management, unfortunately my nan had a fall during our stay, immediately the staff were so attentive, making sure she was okay, while she was in hospital, they kept checking up on her, and offered to send food etc to the hotel for her, once she was back they took special care and attention to make sure her needs were met, the entertainment staff were especially helpful, and kept checking in to make sure everything was okay, honestly couldn't recommend this place more!

reviews.review_title: Nice hotel, but it's tired  and in need of some TLC,  outside and especially  in the Hammam
reviews.review_text: We booked this venue through Thomas Cook as we preferred to be very close to the beach and their online details showed a picture of  what appeared to be a nice venue overlooking lovely beach/sea views. But as it happened the beach was a long walk from the hotel and the  nice "on-the-beach-venue " wasn't there. However, when I queried it with the lady behind reception, she seemed to think that the "pop-up" beach venue was only there in the summer...Such a great shame !  The Hotel: It's a nice looking venue and first  impressions on entry was a definite "wow".. the little fountain area in the lobby is impressive and there was plenty of seating all around.  We received a friendly  welcome, and after the formalities we were given our room cards for our room on the second floor close to the lift as requested.  Bedroom and bathroom: The room was a little on the small side, but impeccably clean.  We needed to speak with reception about something, and luckily there was a phone on the bedside table... but dear readers, when, after pressing various buttons, the phone was just silent! So we moved the bedside  table to see if it was actually plugged in... and all we saw was a bundle of wires sticking out of the wall and NONE into the phone. 😂🤣... no wonder it wasn't working! So we went downstairs to mention it and the next thing we knew when we returned to our room, was that reception had sent up the maintenance guy who was only holding another phone in his hand, also without a lead ...which of course was of no use whatsoever... we showed him the wires hanging from the wall and I'm sure he must have understood as he seemed a little embarrassed by the whole silly situation!  Think Faulty Towers!  It was like a comedy sketch.... and we'd only just arrived!   What would be next 😅 The bed was comfortable and came with lumpy pillows - which actually surprisingly  enough were also comfy to sleep on.  Bathroom: Immaculately clean! No nasty fingermarks on the mirror, and we had the usual bathroom  condiments with lovely smelling shower gel and shampoo. There was a walk-in shower as opposed to a shower over a bath, which was great. It had good pressure and the water was always lovely and hot.. it was a  pure joy to stand under especially seeing that it was cold.. (still low season) but I didn't expect it to be that cool!  The lovely lady who made the bed and cleaned our room each day was a darling!  She said her name was Hazel (not sure if I heard  her right but it sounded like it..) not particularly Arabic but nevertheless we were able to communicate with each other. And extra special hugs with many "Shukrans" when she decorated our bed with flower petals... such a kind gesture and so so appreciated.   Restaurant: Plenty room all round with a help-yourself-style buffet for  breakfast, lunch and dinner. All the staff behind the buffet  and waiters were incredibly helpful and courteous. One tall helpful  lovely waiter in a white shirt, whose  name I have completely forgotten I'm ashamed to say, decorated our table with gorgeous hibiscus flowers and bougainvillea  flower petals. Again many  appreciated Shukrans all round.  Wines: (🙀) We ordered a bottle of red wine with dinner the first night which we didn't expect to be super good,  but I have to admit that is was really nice and a lovely surprise - so much so that we ordered another bottle of the same  quality the following night  (the only choices were red, white or rose)   On another night the waiter came back with a clear glass bottle the contents of which looked  more like rose rather than deep red, and when we tried it it tasted like vinegar, it was truly awful. Not even remotely palatable, so it got sent back and subsequently replaced with a bottle exactly the same, which was also immediately sent back after tasting.    We then asked if they had a bottle of what we had before we were told that this was all they had.. The ONLY red wine was the old vinegar tasting stuff..  So, the next available option was to go for a bottle of rose, which when it arrived had a darkish peachy  colour and tasted quite nice also.  So far so good, or so we thought.  The  following night we asked for the same rose, but his  time  the colour was very pale, and in our opinion it very much tasted like it had been watered down..  Anyway.. this pale coloured  non tasting liquid was, needless to say, also returned to where it came from.. and what they did with it behind the bar is anyone's guess...However,  it was subsequently  replaced with another bottle of the same label which luckily tasted  completely different and more like the wine of the previous night - it also had a much better colour.    So! Sadly to say... not  great on the wine front.. seemed like they just wanted to get rid of some old wine that had been lying  around to their all inclusive  European clients.. Impressed??   Hammam: In need of intense refurbishment, the toilet was broken in that it didn't flush, the inside of the steam room had black mould on the walls and ceilings with paint flaking off.  The sauna with broken slats of wood on the floor. I have to say that the mould  worried me.. hoping that I wouldn't become ill  Nala was lovely, she is clearly good at her job and we both enjoyed our pamper time - just such a shame the place was so run down.  Day trips: Instead of going on a so-called organised activity trip (as hawked on an irritatingly daily basis  by a person who has  great difficulty in understanding what "No thank you" means )  you can have your own driver who will take you wherever you want, which is what we did His name is; Chaaben khedira Gerant  he's on FB and is a pleasant helpful guy and speaks good English   Negative  bits: Outside by the pool/conference room area towards the entrance to the indoor pool and hammam, there are so many places that need to be deep cleaned, maintained, painted and refurbished, some of the sun beds need to be renewed as they were broken, and all of them can do with a good scrub. Basically attention to detail is needed   Changing currency: Beware!! We were advised on the bus that if anyone needed to change money  to do so at a bank. However, on the day we arrived we were given a lift  into to town by a member of the hotel staff,  as we needed to find a bank to get some cash to buy some supplies (he actually very kindly paid for our little bit of shopping)  and said that they could help with us with Dinars at reception.. Cut a long story short, we did exchange some Euros to Dinars  with the lady at reception but when it came to changing our remaining  Dinars back to Euros on the day of our departure, it seemed all of a sudden not to be at all possible  for some reason only known to her.  It would have been a simple exchange, nothing difficult about it but the lady at reception  whose name begins with H was adamant and totally refused to help. Instead she assured us that our Dinars could be changed at the airport on presentation of a passport. When I mentioned about needing an official receipt - she said that this wasn't the case, but that showing a passport would suffice. WRONG!!
