reviews.review_text: It is no longer the luxury of 5 stars unfortunately, that I experienced, the bedroom phone broke down and the request to provide us toothbrushes without suite .. Furthermore, the restaurant remains suitable and the staff is welcoming.

Marhaba Salem is one of the best …..  I love the animation team they are really lovely and friendly specially bob and Leo …. And the bar staff are very good 😊  And the rooms are clean always xxx And the food is really good .. And I’m sure I will come back soon ❤️

What to say about Marhaba Salem if not a hotel where you feel good. Oh it is not absolute luxury it is not the most beautiful beach but what the human side of this hotel brings you serenity and well-being. The meals are very good and for all tastes this is the first time I put such a positive review in a Tunisian hotel. Congratulations to the hotel management

Very friendly staff very available  Malika is really adorable rooms very well dates and maintained  The varied meals and very good  And finally Laysa very available and professional and attentive  Beach pool environment and very clean hotel  We celebrated our sister’s birthday, we were treated to a nice delicious cake, with song and candles

I come here first time and I really like this place ❤️😘 I feel like I'm at my home and the people is so nice and friendly and helpful and the weather is nice for this time and thankful for the team animation there make so nice show and thanks for midooooo he help man just ask him for everything u need here

reviews.review_title: Please bring back normal drinks service on the beach
reviews.review_text: This was my 11th holiday at the Marhaba Royal Salem in Sousse and it was yet another almost faultless brilliant holiday. However, I asked for/requested a room with a walk in shower as I've recently had a hip replacement and I still find getting into and out of a bath a little difficult. Sadly this  request was not noted, but it was quickly resolved. I was also slightly disappointed with room service..... whilst the room was always spotlessly clean, it lacked the little extra's I had on my last visit in February, the swan towels and the complimentary fruit basket, but whilst I  understand these were extra's and not part of the normal service , they were missed.  The food as always is amazing, I've read that some find it boring and bland!!!  Most definitely NOT the case. They have themed evenings, Tunisian,  Spanish Italian etc. They are amazing in that they always manage to cater for all tastes and all ages, with chips, pasta chicken nuggets and all the usual children's favourites :)  What REALLY makes this hotel standout from the others is the staff. Whatever role they have, be it waiter, cleaner, room maids, chef the guys who spend hours making sure the gardens are clean and looking their best, or the beach staff that bring you your sun lounger, they all do an amazing job, but special mentions MUST go to the animation team who work tirelessly to make sure we all have a great time. They all work really hard and it would be difficult to mention just one person, as they all deserve a special mention, but I must mention Mustapha whose job it is to make sure that everything happens on time and in the right place. He has to make sure that every member of the team knows what they have to do and where they need to be at any time of the day. So when you are watching a show or playing darts and thinking this is good...... it's good because every aspect has been planned and co-ordinated by Mustapha. His organisational and man management skills are incredible...... and it shows, well done Mustapha.   So do I have anything I don't like? Well just one........... they have sadly stopped serving alcohol on the beach. It was so nice to be able to get a nice ice cold beer when the weather is 30c plus. For reasons I'm not 100% sure of, now nothing is available, no wine with your meal.... nothing. You can still take a hike to the nearest "other" nearest bar and get it yourself, but the waiters are not allowed to do this for you ???  WHY?? Very strange Would I change anything........YES, please resume normal service for drinks on the beach please. Will I come back, 100% YES I have 5 more holidays already booked

We stayed at the Marhaba Salem hotel outside Sousse for two weeks, three of us.  Hard to find fault, the food is excellent and each meal time has a huge and varied variety of hot and cold food. Staff are excellent, always in attendance and very pleasant and friendly.  Lots of activities, recreational and more serious fitness classes. Facilities are shared between three hotels which works very well, including a nightclub on the grounds.  There is a comprehensive animation team who take care of engaging with all guests both during the day and during and after the evening entertainment.

Loved this hotel, food was amazing and all of the staff were great. The animation team worked tirelessly and were friendly and great fun. Special mention to Sam , Ziko , Momo and Foden and bar staff Mouhend and Hamza. Would definitely recommend this hotel and hope to visit again

Rooms out dated and  needrefurbishment . We had requested a quiet room but did not get one. They tried to move us  to their cheaper hotel with horrible rooms. On the whole the food is ok but meat needs to be cooked thoroughly. Staff very good and very helpful. Animation team excellent specially Simon

First time in Tunisia at The hotels nice the stall are all excellent and helpful, All the members are very good animation team is amazing, , Sam,Mido, Fidom, Zico, especially simon he is friendly.....we definitely come back here next year.

We are just into our second week here and our first time in tunisia has been great.  My little boy has a milk allergy and after a conversation with the restaurant manager they have made sure cartons of soya milk has been available and also made him dairy free puddings and food freshly every dinner time.  The staff have been excellent very friendly and go above for you all. The staff at the bar by the slides are always coming round asking you if you want drinks.  The team at the lobby bar in the evening are brilliant and never leave your glass empty.  The room was very large and comfortable with 4 beds and samina our cleaner was very thorough and always very clean.  Food was very good and very good variety.  May at guest relations was very helpful and always available if anything was needed and if anything needed sorting out  Will definitely be back

reviews.review_title: Above average for the price. Recommended
reviews.review_text: I discovered this hotel for myself. Booked it the third time. Top price and performance. Staff always friendly and accommodating. Mrs. M. May's guest care is particularly striking. If you have any questions or problems, she always has a suitable solution. The management and all the staff are very friendly and a great team. Excellent is also the food and service to us guests. Everything clean and well maintained. We were completely satisfied. Thank you for the great holiday

Absolutely lovely hotel,  cannot fault the cleanliness or the food. The animation team are fabulous,  very friendly and engaging, especially the guys in the main hotel in the evening and the dj. All the staff are very helpful and polite, the lifeguard Ahmed was great finding us sunbeds each day.  Would love to come back,  overall a great holiday.

The hotel is fabulous the rooms are clean and tidy  Food was amazing Staff are wonderful with particular mention to Simon from the animation team alongside Hamza in the pool bar, Foden, Shadow, Bibo and Zico!!!  They made our holiday wonderful

The place is great, highly recommended. The rooms are large, clean and modern. Wi-Fi is free throughout the hotel, even on the beach. Animation is entertaining. The food is very good, the service is also good. The staff is very friendly. Water is always in big bottles. I really liked it, I would book it again. The beach is fine sand, you can walk very far.  There is only one negative point, there was a lot of seaweed or seagrass on the beach and in the front of the water, which was not cleaned up.

Lovely hotel, made my daughter’s 10th birthday very special!! Staff can not help enough!! Big shout out to Mido and the animation gang! We’ve had the best week!! Looking to book again!! Loved it!!! I hope come back soon au I can it’s good time here ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️

reviews.review_title: Great restaurant and kids club nothing more, lazy and rude staff in the management and highly wouldn’t recommend.
reviews.review_text: Management were rude,  arrogant refuse to acknowledge whenever I needed help, the grounds are very unstable and unsafe and this is NOT a disability friendly hotel. The restaurant staff are lovely but that the Tunisian people and my children loved the kids club, they would love to play with the entertainment, I will not let this knock my experience with Tunisia as iv been here 7 time but I would definitely not return here or advice people to come here (this hotel) .  I was pestered into removing my last post.

We return to this hotel for 6 years for the quality of its always very qualified staff with a very warm welcome led by its director very present a very special thank you to Hamida  Congratulations to all the cleaning team always impeccable cleanliness of the rooms and the hotel very well also all the part catering meals and service kalhed Braim and all the team  The bar thanks Karim Mohamed and Mokhtar with a plus for Salem at the beach the same kindness  Summarize this hotel to the luck of having a quality staff

Absolutely awsome hotels ! This was our 2 visit this year !  Great staff , from cleaners thru to managers  Animation team are really good our 8 y grandaughter had the best time ever with mido, Bobby n Leo ! Food really good always a good selection! We are going back in oct ( can’t wait )  Ps big shout out to hsouna on porter duties always ready for a smile and a hug ! Our granddaughter is demanding to go back lol ! See yall soon x

It's not first time I'm here I come often,, marhaba royal Salem is my favourite hotel . Everything is perfect  barr , reception, food , room  , animation team is the best special simon is my favourite he is so nice and helpful and make our holiday the best. We like simon

reviews.review_title: Nice hotel, very pleasant, couldn’t fault and everyone is very friendly, first time here and would definitely come again
reviews.review_text: First time staying here and the rooms are great and very clean, Great experience, lovely hotel, great staff and entertainment!! Loads to do and staff are so welcoming and friendly!! Goes from foam parties to karaoke etc it’s great, couldn’t recommend it more.

Probably the most disappointing experience at a four seasons in any country. Considering the price tag I would expect a seamless visit but it was far from that.  The food at the cafe was bland, we ordered the poke bowl which had no flavour or seasoning. The spa was a complete waste. The facial was below average and to top it off there was no hot water in any of the cubicles. Walking through the corridors it seemed as if there was no attention to detail. It was more of a Holiday Inn rather than a luxury chain. Needless to say we checked out after two nights.

reviews.review_title: Only one season at Fourseasons Tunis
reviews.review_text: The weather was the best part... sunny but with a cool breeze. i am not sure what their room service would be like but their service at an international conference representing the country was close to abysmal. they wouldnt serve coffee until the specified coffee break, and even then they would not be on time. they ran out of food for lunch and it wasnt for just 10 mins.... and their food was just mediocre and with ZERO imagination... its Tunisia, and its an internatinal conference represent the country please... sliders sliders sliders and then some more.  the second day when we came back our booths had not been cleaned, the bins were not empty, i had left a glass of water on the table ( with a lipstick mark) and it was still there..... by the afternoon one of the conference host stopped by and my neighbour complained.... and then another silliness- someone is sweeping while there are guest milling around!!!! On the second day i finally gave up and went off to the restaurant to get a coffee.... empty restaurant and they took upwards of 15 mins to make me two black coffees!!!!  Four seasons!!!!

reviews.review_title: Not worth its price and dangerous
reviews.review_text: In view of the price  - no welcome cocktail at the reception -no one to accompany us to the room -children of -3 years must pay a place as much as the adult and we are asked to take a second room to put young children!!! (A danger to them inconceivable!  -and the worst is the shower head holder that falls on me and misses my eye! For answer -> we're sorry sir? ...no move anything!  Review the reception and the customer service urgently especially when the price of the night exceeds 500€!  Competition in Tunisia needs much better next year we will go elsewhere.  Big disappointment. A waste of time and money! I really do not advise this channel which really is not worth its price!   Otherwise the bedding is comfortable, the hotel is nice and well placed and the pool and restaurants give a beautiful view!  Unfortunately all this is worth nothing to face the inconvenience of this stay...

Restaurant that on weekends and more than one nightclub, because restaurant Italia where you come to eat quietly It's a shame because the restaurant is good and the staff and very professional So avoid the weekend unless you like loud music that doesn't laugh Italian

Great hotel at the top in terms of service with amazing views!! this is the 4th time I go there and it is always an unforgettable experience! Many thanks to Aziz Nagara for his availability, responsiveness and professionalism,  I forgot my iphone fast charger I contacted him via wattsap, he could put it aside for me and I picked it up from reception the next day thank you Aziz!

A Four Seasons in all features of the network: beautiful, fragrant, luxurious, attentive and kind staff, impeccable rooms, delicious breakfast coffee, restaurant with few but all great options.  In freight to the sea with a view of taking folego and beautiful pool.. the property and immense  Nearby airport and away around 30 minutes from the city's tourist attractions.

My stay at the Four Seasons Hotel in Tunis was a perfect blend of luxury, comfort, and cultural immersion. Whether you’re visiting for business or leisure, this hotel offers an experience that is both memorable and indulgent. It’s a place where every detail is meticulously crafted to ensure an unforgettable stay. I cannot recommend it highly enough and look forward to returning in the future.

Hotel, rooms, service: very good. On the other hand, meals at the bar very average (spaghetti carbonara peppers at will, could not eat them, minestrone without taste, ...) Breakfast in restaurant: in savory few choices and not to the level. On the other hand very good if room service. The hotel is too far from the city, we are really isolated.

reviews.review_title: Very nice staff, but I didn't like the hotel
reviews.review_text: I feel bad writing such a bad review, because as stated in the title, all the staff are really lovely. But I simply wouldn't stay here again for so many reasons:  1. The hotel really has no charm: it looks nice enough when you enter, but it quickly starts to feel like a massive labyrinth, and the rooms (at least my one - 2124) are dreadfully stale.   2. It's massive and the layout is stupidly confusing, it actually takes forever to get to your room (plus when it's rainy the courtyard areas get slippery too, making it even more annoying)  3. The location is really not great. There is nowhere to have a nice walk around the hotel, it's isolated away from anything else, so you need to get a driver and head elsewhere to see anything interesting.  4. I found the food really disappointing.   5. There seem to be way more charming / boutique type options in far more atmospheric places, for example in Sidi Bou Said. That's definitely would I'd go for on my next visit to Tunis!

reviews.review_title: One of the most beautiful meals we have experienced but non smokers beware!
reviews.review_text: We stay at Four Seasons Hotels all over the world when we travel - we just adore them! On this occasion we were staying in a nearby apartment so satisfied ourselves with a couple of visits as non residents during our stay in Tunis.  We booked in for the Christmas Eve set course dinner in Creek, which was truly one of the most exceptional and beautifully presented meals we have experienced, huge compliments to the chef and the delightful staff.  However, we were horrified and shocked to see (or smell) that smoking is allowed inside the hotel in the lounge and bar area that is situated directly adjacent (no wall in between) to the restaurant and that we had to walk through this area to access the restaurant and to go to the toilet during our meal.  We could also smell the smoke at our table.  We could not believe that a hotel group of this standard could allow smoking in a public area that cannot be avoided!    Also the lady at the next table was smoking what looked like a vape - billows of smoke everywhere!  Apparantly Iqos are allowed to be smoked everywhere inside so we had no protection.  We could not believe that we were in a Four Seasons hotel as we have never experienced this!  I believe smoking is popular amongst Tunisians, but a hotel of this standard, catering to international guests, should not allow smoking indoors.  If it has to it should be in a completely enclosed area as in some airports.   Other hotels we stayed at during our Tunisian holiday in Hammamet and Sousse were totally non smoking indoors and one we stayed at even had a non smoking area in their outdoor restaurant. I would dread to be sitting outside at the Four Seasons Tunis, in the compact area around the pool and be subjected to smoke, it would totally ruin our experience - we do have to breathe they don't have to smoke!    Clearly non smokers are second class guests at the Four Seasons Tunis so non smokers be aware!

We stayed at this hotel with my sister and my girlfriend, to attend the wedding of a friend who was celebrating it there. It is beautiful in every way, absolutely nothing to say, but I want to say, it is a bit normal considering the price and prestige of the Seasons oven. the staff at the top, the phenomenal breakfast, the pool and the breathtaking spa. the party room where the wedding was celebrated was breathtaking.  I'll probably come back to it.......

reviews.review_title: beutiful hotel right on the beach
reviews.review_text: The hotel is beautiful with spacious rooms, friendly staff, but the hotel didnt have the excellence of four seasons elsewhere, staff even those who could understand english did not fully comply with our requests, maybe didnt fully comprehend, also the service at breakfast was not to the standard which we expected from four seasons. Also the restaurants they had 2, italian and sea food. would have expected more choice of food, over all we enjoyed, had a pleasant stay and enjoyed the beautiful enviroment of the hotel.

Worst service ever. I had to ask for the menu twice, and then they didn't check what we wanted to drink for a whole 25 minutes. So again, I had to get up and look for someone to serve us. Then our friend joined us, and again, I had to ask for the menu. Also, they never came back to us. I spent my time there walking in the corridor looking for waiters. Honestly, your service is shocking and embarrassing. I'll never be back here.

One of the best hotel we've ever stayed at. The hotel itself is beautiful- we felt like we were staying in a royal palace. Service is top-notch. Staff is so helpful and friendly.  We  traveled with a 10 month-old baby. A crib, blankets, diapers, bottle warmer & sterilizer were provided in the room. Highly recommended.

This has truly marked its territory as my all time favourite Four Seasons Hotel. The ambience, architecture, breath taking views and above the staff have been extraordinary. There are particular staff that I would like to mention who made this experience memorable, from the birthday touches to the concern for when u was ill. Nadia Chaker, Maryem Lassoued (Reservation), Waafa (The therapist), Rania (The spa), Mario (Restaurant manager), and Asma (Azur Breakfast Manager). They made our stay truly remarkable.

After a fortnight tour of Tunisia we can say in summary that Four Season Tunis is the best hotel in Tunisia. Not only a great well-kept facility with beautiful rooms, but also fantastic food (both quality and choice) and a super professional and pleasant team such as Ahmed Karam (looking for the best room/suite for you) or Amr Magdy (the loving and perfect restaurant manager) as well as the everywhere dedicated Ayoub Ayadi who is admirably qualified for his young years. Transfer from the airport or Tunis City can be arranged and Myriam from Guest Experience will take care of everything else. We will definitely come back!

reviews.review_title: The place to stay in Tunis
reviews.review_text: I had an exceptional stay at the Four Seasons in Tunis. My room was clean, spacious, and had a lovely partial sea view. Room service was flawless, and the breakfast spread was perfect, with every option you could imagine. The restaurant service was outstanding, with a special mention to Mariam, who warmly greeted me each morning. Highly recommend this hotel for a memorable experience in Tunis!

reviews.review_title: Unbeatable stay in front of the Mediterranean.
reviews.review_text: The hotel service is very attentive, they took care of every detail of our romantic package with great affection and precision. The hotel facilities are wonderful... the halls, the pool, the restaurants, all fantastic. Very varied breakfast, with more focus on baking and viennoiseries. The hotel is close to Tunis-Carthage airport, the capital Tunis, and the sights of Sidi Bou Said and Carthage, making it the perfect place to relax and explore this region of Tunisia. I'd definitely come back.

My best Hotel overall.  Four Seasons Hotel Ambience and Facilities  The ambience of the Four Seasons Hotel is great. It feels like being in a large castle from the Andalusian time.  Facilities  - The facilities are great. - The food is great. - The room is great. - The view from the room is great over the swimming pool. - The swimming pool is larger than the 25 meters pool that I swim at weekly. - The sauna, the steam bath, the massage itself, and the gym are great. Great equipment.  Overall Experience  Overall it was an excellent experience. I don't feel that I left the comfort of my home when I visit there. Actually, even some better facilities.

The Four Seasons Hotel Tunis is a truly luxurious experience. The hotel's décor is stunning, a beautiful blend of modern and traditional elements. Both the main restaurant and the à la carte options offer exceptional dining experiences with delicious food and impeccable service. While the price is undeniably high, the quality of the service and the overall experience justify the cost for a special occasion or a truly indulgent getaway.

We spent 4 days in this hotel room 259 magnificent views.  Despite some small problems on arrival our stay went very well.  A big thank you to the manager of this establishment who made the necessary so that we could make the most of our holidays and leave with a smile.  Thanks are also due to all the staff. They are really all very welcoming, smiling and concerned about your well-being and especially Tarek and Karim from the reception as well as Aziz.  The animation team is also at the top!  The food is very good, the a la carte fisherman restaurant is excellent!  In this hotel customer satisfaction comes first and it is very rare.  I totally recommend.

Superb establishment and a 20/20 level of rooms (standards at 50m2). Hotel Completely renovated!  Divine food (especially pastry, local dishes and fresh fish)..  Fabulous central pool and a second with sea water, very professional staff and attentive.  The best hotel in Jerba and hands down!

Beautiful stay spent in Eolia Djerba! Spacious and tastefully decorated rooms, impeccable bedding and impeccable cleanliness! As for the buffets, from breakfast to dinner everything was delicious , special mention for the pastry that can not do without. Impeccable service, smiling and with little care. We had a great holiday ❤️I highly recommend!

Attention last minute cancellation! 48 hours before departure the hotel announces that it will not be able to welcome us without any proof! This mishap has brought us a lot of stress, to see what Iberostar can do... control although the hotel is accessible before you leave!

reviews.review_title: Very disappointed: stay cancelled one week before departure due to work
reviews.review_text: We had booked this hotel several months in advance for a mid-May stay, attracted by the setting, reputation and services advertised. A week before departure, we were informed that our reservation was cancelled due to work in the hotel. We were relocated to another establishment that had nothing to do with the standing of the Iberostar Selection Eolia Djerba, which did not correspond to our expectations or our travel habits.  It is impossible for us to postpone our holidays at the last minute, nor to find an equivalent stay. We therefore preferred to cancel everything, deeply disappointed.  This is the first time that this situation has happened to us. The work is not decided a week in advance: the hotel or its partners should have warned us much earlier, out of respect for their customers.  This lack of anticipation and consideration means that we will never book this hotel again, despite its beautiful appearance on paper

Everything was awesome: amenities, food, service, and beach were all top-notch. Special mention to the rooms: incredibly spacious, modern, and freshly renovated. A perfect place to relax and unwind. I highly recommend staying at this great hotel!

Superb establishment  I arrived on the opening day, we were well catered for. This establishment is a palace in the true sense of the word due to its infrastructure (modern swimming pools, huge rooms, luxury refinement but also authenticity. The beach is superb and the animators are very friendly. Their activities brightened our stay. But the great plus of this establishment is the food, cocktails and especially the professional who is incredible. This is my third stay and I plan to come back in August!

Although there was a wait to enjoy our stay, we are very happy to be in this Hotel. We thank Rym at the reception for his investment in getting us out of our waiting accommodation (The Royal Garden Palace) to enjoy our stay at Iberostar Eolia. She is a person who is very invested in her work and deserves our full appreciation.   On the other hand, when we arrived on May 21, we were welcomed with a kindness. Here all the staff is smiling, says hello, is available when necessary. In short we will return with great pleasure.

Booked on the Iberostar website two and a half months ago for a stay from May 17 to 24 at the Eolia Hotel. 4 days before our arrival we receive an email stating that the hotel is under renovation and that they will not welcome us. We are transferred to the Iberostar Mehari, a 4-star hotel with different services but for the same price. No commercial gestures, no upgrades.   This is definitely the last time we book an Iberostar hotel.

Too bad the hotel is cancelled 1 month in advance... for unfinished business.  So I do not understand the opinions that date from a similar period.  We were disappointed because Iberostars fan, this misadventure stays in our way.  Finding a hotel in a panic spoiled the fun.

A hotel that deserves its 5 stars!!! Home,room,cleanliness catering nothing wrong. All the staff and the animation team of an exemplary kindness. Very satisfied with my stay I return in June. Can't wait to be there again!!!

We had an incredible week .I thank the maintenance workers for their seriousness and kindness towards their customers .The team of animators was funny and warm ,always new activities to offer us .The dishes offered were various days and appetizing .Again thank you!!!

reviews.review_title: A mixed experience: a decent hotel, but disappointing reception service
reviews.review_text: I stayed at the Iberostar Eolia Hotel in October with my 10-year-old godson. I'm finally taking the time to share my experience. Used to 5-star hotels, I consider this one to be more of a 4-star. Some of the attention that makes a difference is missing, such as the daily replenishment of the minibar – here you have to go to the reception every night to request it, which I have never seen elsewhere. The bathroom is small and poorly equipped: no bathrobes and toiletries. These are small details, but they count in a hotel in this category.  Disappointing reception and unacceptable management  As soon as we arrived, an administrative problem ruined the beginning of the stay. I was asked to pay two adult tourist taxes, when my godson is only 10 years old. At reception, I was initially told that they would check, but no solution was found. I contacted my agency, which confirmed that I had to pay only one tax. The next day, at the information meeting, I raised the issue with the tourist manager, who assured me that I only had one tax to pay. He accompanied me to the reception to clarify the situation, but the discussion quickly turned unpleasant.  The unkind receptionist insisted that their system showed two adult taxes. However, I booked from the start with the correct information (surname, first name and age of my godson). Despite this, she implied that I had changed the booking. Faced with their inflexibility, I offered to wait for them to solve their problem and then pay the exact amount. But I was almost made to look like someone refusing to pay, even though it was a mistake on their part.  After tense discussions and several hours at the reception, I was finally forced to pay both taxes, otherwise I would have to vacate the room. I asked to see a manager, but no one came. Deputized, I ended up paying... cash, because the credit card was not accepted, which added further stress as I had to change money.  A few hours after my payment, I received a message from the guide telling me that the hotel was refunding me the extra tax. This whole absurd situation, which wasted my time and energy, could have been avoided with a minimum of professionalism. Worse still, no word of apology from them. I had the impression that as a single woman with a child, we were not considered a priority clientele. Since when I talked with other couples, some had fruit and champagne in their room, just after talking 5 minutes with the manager. Some also had the presentation of the complex by the manager, which we did not have.   Positive points and necessary improvements  Outside the reception, the staff was very nice: the waiters of the restaurant were very kind. The meals were good, though repetitive, with little variety over the days.  On the last day I ate grilled fish and got sick... but it can happen.  Regarding the bar, several alcohols were missing from the menu, such as Amaretto, and the bottles were not renewed there were not all week. From what I have heard, the hotel is planning many improvements to get closer to a real 5 star, especially with new infrastructure.  Conclusion  Overall, the hotel is ok: clean, well located, with a beautiful beach. However, for someone used to high-end service, there is reason to be disappointed. The à la carte restaurant is passable, without more. Fortunately, my godson enjoyed the kids club which was the main thing for me.  I probably won't come back to this hotel, as the service at the front desk significantly tarnished my experience. A good hotel not only judges its facilities, but also the quality of its welcome and service. And on this point, the Iberostar Eolia still has a lot to learn. I’ve been in several other Iberostar far better just than those of Morocco and Spain. And my neighbor will be in Mexico

The hotel is worth going to!  Nice rooms! The food was fine, and the most delicious Crepe Suzette (flambéed with zest of lime) I ate here! Most receptionists were very helpful and friendly! Actually, they should all be! Most people in the ministry were okay, but really not everyone, unfortunately! Someone who jumped out for me in a positive way and ran his legs under his body was the waiter at the pool and the beach, Abdellsalam! Many compliments to him, because he worked extremely hard and tried to please everyone! Also the gentleman, I do not know his name unfortunately, from the teahouse was a sweet and pleasant man! If I ever want to go back to Djerba, I would choose this hotel again!

Beautiful stay, very nice hotel. Thank you Lamia Tarek always listening and Me Feriel head of reservation and thank you to Mr the director always present .. We look forward to reopening!! Congratulations also to the staff always pleasant...

We had a lovely stay at this hotel. We stayed for four days. The food, rooms, grounds, servi e and beach were amazing. My kids loved it and it helped that the weather was lovely too for November. I know it was out of season, however my only negative was the entertainment wasn't the best and the kids would get bored in the evening.

I spent a stay in November in this beautiful hotel. I am a travel enthusiast and former travel agent I can tell you that I have had the chance to visit many hotels and this one is excellent. The lobby of this hotel already gives you a positive first taste of your stay. All facilities are modern and very well maintained. The beach is the most beautiful of the whole island with palm trees, and especially a large beach area since the hotel is a direct access to the beach but has respected the distance between the construction and the sea. The food is amazing from morning to night. It is excellent, there is quantity, but also quality. The orange juice pressed in the morning is extremely appreciable, this is not the case in many hotels.  Congratulations for the diversity of dishes congratulations for the service of the people who serve us at the buffet and the waiters in the room. the service and great outdoor terrace of the restaurant and just beautiful. The a la carte restaurant with sea views is a jewel. The large lively and beautiful pool the adult pool only is just as beautiful and the indoor pool is really a nice asset, really appreciable. Animators its present, but not invasive. A good team. All the hotel's waiters, waou bravo what quality service to the bars but also around the pools, at the beach. The beach towel service to change without restriction is really great and the gentlemen who give the towels are very nice. The quality of the rooms is very good for my part I had a room with sea view just beautiful is the room service with the housekeepers and high  Mini bar and snack daily in the room. Bathrobe and slippers very appreciable  The thalasso center is a gem the care is of very good quality I am used to making thalassos and I really was not disappointed. I recommend you for barca and amel massages, two professional masseuses and they are kind and very kind. At the reception of the thalasso you will meet Sara who is a really great woman, patience and very kind. All the infrastructures of the thalasso are beautiful and well maintained The board game bar very good idea c is great. International brand drinks c is rare in Tunisia and in the med basin in general. The hotel, in its totality and beautiful clean and well maintained. All the sanitary facilities in the common areas are extremely cleaned after each passage I feel. I congratulate all the staff without exception of the hotel who bends in 4 to make our stay go well, they always have a nice attention a smile and a moment of sharing. Madam Director you have great teams which allows your hotel to be amazing.  I assure you, I haven't often seen hotels so well maintained in the Mediterranean basin. Make sure you keep them, they're valuable. Thank you all 🙏 Morgan

reviews.review_title: IBEROSTAR SELECTION EOLIA DJERBA TUNISIA, Excellent stay.
reviews.review_text: IBEROSTAR SELECTION EOLIA DJERBA TUNISIA, stay in November 2024.  Free parking. Nice hotel complex.  Beautiful hall, lots of charm, well arranged. Beautiful and large outdoor pool well appointed, direct access to the beach secured. Nice indoor pool. Very spacious nice rooms, seating area, terrace. In our two bedrooms the safe was not fixed. Nice restaurant room. as well as the outdoor terrace. Beautiful installation of the buffet, see luxurious. Excellent lighting throughout the buffet. Nice presentation, cleanliness, choice, quality. Reception staff can friendly, see highin. Just like catering. You wave and no one answers you. Very pleasant stay.

A new stay in this newly renovated 5*. My stay is unforgettable, the welcome, the availability of the staff everything is done to spend a dream stay.  Cleanliness of the premises and rooms is impeccable.  At the restaurant level the food is varied, fresh and excellent. At the bar there is something for everyone!  One thing's for sure I'll be back next year. Do not hesitate you will be delighted by your stay!

We booked a four night stay in this hotel, for part of our honeymoon. We weren’t disappointed, it was truly magical. Everything, from the room, to the food, to the lobby was absolutely perfect.  The staff were all great and we loved the little personal touches the cleaners left in our room and how the waiter remembered us and our drink preferences. We can’t wait to come back and explore more of Djerba, with the Eolia as a perfect base. Thank you!

reviews.review_title: A Great Time Was Had Again
reviews.review_text: As always had a great time at the Hotel. All the staff were great, nice friendly and helpful. The lady who cleaned my room Sassia did a great job, room lovely and clean every day.  There was a great choice of food and drink, and the restuarant staff were great as always, espicially James.  I would like to thank the guys who served you round the pool, they were always very busy but got on with it with a smile even in the very hot temperatures. A special thanks to Maher who really looked after me and also a thank you to Wissam. Ben in the main bar also done a great job. Unfortunately i can not remember everyones name, sorry.  The animation team done a great job, very busy every day, unfortunately i can only remember one name and that was leo.  I cant wait to go back and have a great time again.  So i would like to thank all the staff again from the Management to all the other employees who all did a great job.

I had an incredible time at Marhaba Palace, and the entertainment team played a huge role in making my stay so enjoyable. From the moment I arrived, I could tell that the team was dedicated to ensuring everyone had a great time. They offered a fantastic variety of activities throughout the day, from fun poolside games to engaging sports sessions, catering to both adults and children alike.  The evening entertainment was something truly special. Every night, there was a new show or performance, keeping things fresh and exciting. The entertainers were full of energy and enthusiasm, and their performances—whether they were dancing, singing, or even comedy sketches—were always top-notch. It was clear they put a lot of effort into their work, and it made the whole experience feel incredibly vibrant.  What I appreciated the most was the friendly and inclusive atmosphere the team created. They always made an effort to get guests involved, whether you were just lounging by the pool or actively participating in games. It was the perfect balance of fun and relaxation, and I always looked forward to what the next activity would be.  If you're staying at Marhaba Palace, I highly recommend participating in whatever the entertainment team has to offer—you won’t be disappointed!

Amazing hotel with fantastic staff who can not do enough for you. This has been my 3rd visit now and honestly can say I have never found fault but certainly this time around it feels the service has gone up a notch. There are staff and managers everywhere!! Always checking if everything is OK. If you need or have a problem it's sorted within minutes which is very rare in this day and age. The rooms are spacious and definitely recommend a sea view room. No hidden extra costs either as safe, bathrobes, slippers, beach towels, sunbeds on the beach are all free!! Rooms are cleaned daily to a high standard. Great choice of food and drinks also. Daily activities and entertainment is very good and definitely worth a watch!! All the staff work extremely hard and make the whole holiday enjoyable. Spoke to many single female travellers which just shows how safe they feel. Highly recommend this great hotel. Many thanks xx

Great hotel, animation team perfect food ok bar staff are really good, my chambermaid was absolutely great. Also one of the animation team members, Mimi, was absolutely great she went above and beyond to make my stay enjoyable she is the best!!!

reviews.review_title: Some interesting features, disappointing food and drinks, friendly staff, not four start
reviews.review_text: We booked an eleven night all-inclusive holiday here, through Tui, from 31st March to 11th April.  This is described as a four star hotel, oh dear slight exaggeration, two stars at a push and that's generous.  We have stayed in other hotel chains the brand their superior hotels as a Palace, this Hotel's use of the word palace did not have to same connotation.  Our fifth floor double bedroom, with it's high arched ceiling, was equipped with a wall mounted television, along with tea and coffee making facilities.  There was a small fridge in the room, this was classified as a mini bar, there was nothing in it, no drinks were supplied. A large bottle of water was left in the room on a daily basis.  There was air-conditioning which multitasked as a heater, the air-conditioning was not working, so the only air circulation was when the balcony door was open during the night.  The view from our balcony, overlooked the roof of the indoor swimming, out to sea and over to Port El Kantaoui   Bathrobes and slippers were provided, the robes like the bath towels were a but thin and threadbare.  The bed was was comfortable, however, the bed linen was stained at times.  We did have issues with the quality and supply of food available in the Main Restaurant and the A la Carte, both reviewed separately.  The main bar, Bar Salon, reviewed separately, was open daily from 09.00am till midnight. Local drinks were served, thankfully the local beer Celtia was okay.  There was also a pool and swim up bar, reviewed separately, which was open daily  from 10.00am till 17.00, weather permitting, we did have some rainy days.  The Lobby was a vast area with a huge chandelier hanging from the ceiling, a fountain and sections created using carved panels.  There were also numerous interesting paintings hanging on the walls around the hotel.  Appreciate that it was very early in the season and the hotel and not all the bars, restaurants and other facilities had opened up yet. Unfortunately, those that were open could not cope with the volume of guests that were there.  There were two outdoor pools, one saltwater and the other fresh water and chlorinated. There was also a kiddies pool as well as an indoor pool.  However, we did prefer to use the beach, the hotel did have an section of beach which was for the sole use of hotel guests. There were sunbeds and static umbrellas along the beach and a lifeguard would bring a mattress down to your bed. At times it did get rather windy on the beach, on those occasions we found ourselves a spot around the pool.  Beach towels were provided from the kiosk near the pool, however, they were prone to running out.  The Port of El Kantaoui was accessible from the Hotel, a short walk along the road or a 700 metre walk down the beach

Incredible hotel food 5 star rooms 5 star grounds 5 star Beach excellent all staff really friendly unfare to mention any by name as they are all excellent and a credit to hotel .It was our first time here but will be definitely be back ,little tip tea and coffee making facilities in bedroom but no milk no problem go to inside bar and you will be given some  A la carte is fantastic you have to book with restaurant manager in main food hall some of the Tunisian dishes are superb be daring and give them a go only downside for us was bed too hard and pillows too high but that is personal  preference not a bad  comment for hotel TUI rep fantastic has some great tips on going out and getting  a bargain at the port all in all a wonderful time in Tunisia spent with the wonderful  Tunisian people so friendly polite  and helpful

This hotel is Amazing !! If i could give 10 out of 10 certainly would. Staff are brilliant. Room was spotless. Food was good, so much choice.  Pool area/beach spotless. We were made to feel welcone from the minute we arrived by all members if staff we made contact with. Already looking for next year .

Wow! What a place, literally my idea of heaven! I have to say I have never felt so relaxed and happy 😊 This hotel is truly one of the best I’ve stayed in if not the best 💯 From as soon as you arrive you are welcomed and taken care of. I travelled as a family party of 6 and each one of us could not fault the experience at all. The food was delicious every night, plenty of choice and always piping hot ! The waiters especially Marwain & James made our times in the restaurant so much fun 🤩  The waiters work tirelessly and were an absolute asset to the hotel. I’ve never been anywhere with such friendly attentive service and this is what made my holiday such a delight. Service always with a smile and so very professional.  The cleaners in our rooms were also so friendly and As for all toilets dotted about the hotel they were always well kept and immaculate with wonderful touches like rose petals on the sink and pleasant smelling oils..  Lastly I would like to give praise to Youssef “The fish man” what a wonderful guy! Not only did he do an amazing job of my feet he really knew what he was talking about. My feet were in very bad condition and he has given them life again! Youssef was so informative, gentle. And just a lovely guy! I will definitely be coming back for another fish spa treatment.  Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel to anybody! It really does have such a lovely atmosphere. We also enjoyed the entertainment by the animation team daily & nightly! These guys work exceptionally hard. Always something for everyone! The Arabian night & light show were our favourites!  Thank you to everyone at Marhaba Palace for making our family holiday special! We will DEFINITELY be back, with even more of the family !!!! Think I’ve found my forever happy place 😍🏝️🎉

We have just come back from a weeks holiday at this hotel . Absolutely stunning hotel , spacious , clean and welcoming .Gated security at the front . The room we had was on the 4th floor . Beautiful large room overlooking the front of the hotel . Tea and coffee facilities but no milk , and bottled water was changed daily . Cleaned daily with fresh towels . The chambermaids were all friendly and always wore a smile . The food was amazing and delicious.  We loved EVERYTHING  we ate . Plenty of choice , fresh fruit , fish , meat , pasta , salads . There was something for everyone . It was nice to try Tunisian food and something a bit different from the norm . The waiters in the restaurant were amazing . They were so polite , attentive and pleasant. We really felt spoilt and cared for .  On the last night we tried the A la Carte dining which we found a little disappointing.  We were expecting Tunisian food , but instead it was mainly English food and some of it was quite cold .  The entertainment was good . We enjoyed what the hotel had to offer .Especially enjoyed The Golden Girls drag act . Shout out to the animation team who work tirelessly all day and night to ensure the holidaymakers have a good time . Shout out to Sophie , who was such fun and remembered our names throughout our stay . Drinks are local brands and are in keeping with the usual all inclusive package . The service from the bars was exceptional.  The waiters couldn't do enough for you and every single one of them was polite , professional and welcoming . A special mention to Badii and Salah who went above and beyond to give amazing service . The beach bar , just a short stroll past the pool was a lovely little spot where we enjoyed lunches and drinks . Salah the manager there was such a wonderful host , along with Naheed and the other young waiters . They were so much fun and we enjoyed our time there very much . The pools were cold but there was plenty of sunbeds , chairs tables around the pool area . Whilst we were there we enjoyed an excursion on the pirate ship . Special mention to Hichem who was such a lovely man . He was so informative , professional and friendly . He didn't pressure us into buying an excursion but gave us lots of information of what to expect on the ship . The pirate ship was all that he had described and was well worth the money . Amenities around the hotel were only a short distance away . The Port was a ten minute walk away as was the Hannibal Park fountain , which we had the pleasure of seeing in all its glory . Hannibal theme park is next to the fountain . Sousse Mall is only a short taxi ride away . Only downside to venturing outside was the locals trying to get you to buy there wares,   which can be a bit off putting .  We can't recommend this hotel enough . First class service from everyone . A million THANK you's to everyone for making our holiday so special x

Brilliant hotel. Staff are amazing. Plenty to do on the resort. Fantastic animation crew and entertainment. Would definitely recommend anyone old or young. Everything within walking distance and if you want to venture out of the complex, there is plenty of excursions to do.

We were 5 friends and were pleasantly surprised by this hotel, the rooms, the service, the food, the shows, etc...my maid Somaya always added a little personal note to the decoration, our evening waiter, Hamdi was very professional and attentive to our every request, a special mention also to Aziz for the day service, always smiling and eager. We also met with Terratours representative Mrs Dora who was very helpful and kind, and our guide Yzed was very knowledgeable and attentive to our needs and questions. We greatly enjoyed our stay. I strongly advise him.

The hotel is spotless everywhere, the food is amazing lots of choice ,the beds are massive we always upgrade to a superior room with sea view , all the staff are amazing they can't do enough for you so you can enjoy a relaxing holiday ,see you all next year again ,thanks for another amazing holiday.

Hotel top! Great atmosphere!  Spa top! Very good massages! Attentive staff!  Nice place! Proximity to everything!  Welcome to the top!  Fish spa: mention for Yousef! Unmissable!! I recommend for who wants to get beautiful feet, even if it is thought that this is not necessary!;

Bel hôtel, I recommend the foot treatment by Fisher spa! A very pleasant experience and especially a human contact with Youssef! As much as the feet are delighted, but the exchanges are even richer! After a wonderful massage, the foot treatment was magical!

The best holiday at the hotel Marhaba palace.  I recommend soon thanks to the animation team. I really like the atmosphere is especially sports activities like ( aquagym , yoga, zumba .. ) very varied evenings ..  See you soon

Lovely hotel and staff .. thoroughly recommend it.. genuine value for money .. especially Yusef from the Fish Spa by the pool who worked hard to promote his business in a very friendly and funny manner. Lovely guy - good value and great treatment.

We have recently stayed at the Marhaba Palace Hotel. Well we are leaving today, pity.  The rooms are great and cleaned daily only fault is for tea and coffee facilities, they leave an assortment of tea bags, 2 sachets of coffee and sugar. No milk, strange. Bottles of water are left daily.  The hotel it's self, might have been a 5 star in the beginning now it is low 4 high 3. Needs some work to bring to a higher class.   The food is great, there is something to eat for everyone. Just remember it isn't English food. You want English food, stay in the UK or go to Spain. There are plenty of choices. The restaurant staff are fantastic and friendly. Can the cats be kept out of the main restaurant. Not everyone likes cats rubbing their bodies against you while dining.  Bars. The drink is plenty full, local spirits and beers. A small cocktail list though pre-mixed. Staff again are very friendly and attentive.  Pool, plenty of sun beds, why do people go down at 06:00 put towels down then not go back for hours. The pool bar could do with an update, currently half is in use. Weather they increase it in the summer, not sure.   Animation team. Good entertainment,they don't go bugging you while eating or sun bathing. Yes they come past and ask, say no. They leave you alone. No pressuring to join in, no nagging to buy bingo cards. They do their best to keep you entertained. The usual water aerobics and games.   Over all a very enjoyable holiday.

staff so friendly and welcoming, food amazing food selection, room service in every day all cleaned ,  went to the foot fish spa with yosef.  amazing session made my feet feel so energised and smooth. yusef was so friendly and a good laugh was very informative and respectful explained every part in detail step by step. would definitely recommend.

Very nice hotel, the food is very good. The animation is not bad despite being out of summer period. I tried the fish spa, a very pleasant experience at an affordable price. Youssef is adorable and takes good care of his guests. My parents loved it too.

Lovely pool areas, plenty of sun bed & parasols. Rooms are dated, we had to try 3 rooms as issues with all of them, black out blinds don't close, shower tray leaked, safe & television didn't work. Air conditioning was working either, we ended up leaving the patio doors open. you can hear people  in the their rooms too, especially when they are moving chairs for some reason. Daily  room cleaners don't do great job, forgot to leave towels & water, empty bins, basic stuff which you would expect to be done. Staff are amazing especially in the restaurant, you get to sit at the same table most of the time, just to note that you have to choose if you want 1st sitting for dinner @ 6.30 pm or wait until 7.45 pm for 2nd sitting.  Food does get a bit repetitive & cold. If like salad & pasta you will be fine, French fries & bread plentiful. There is a guy who does fresh orange juice @ breakfast but be prepared to queue. Themed nights, not all food labelled so you don't know what you are eating until you try it & there is a lot of waste then, plenty of sweet treats & fresh fruit. Staff also in the bar areas are polite, friendly they get to know your drinks order. Good beach location & again plenty of beds, restaurant/bar there also so easy for drinks & late breakfast & lunch if you didn't want to go to main restaurant.  All communal areas are exceptional clean, including the toilets( be aware that you can't flush toilet paper down any of the toilets, put in the bins provided)  You can walk into the harbour area less than 10 minutes but be prepared to be pestered by the bar staff,  sales teams trying to sell you trips, to be honest wasn't worth the walk, the area very run down & full of rubbish!  Animation team work hard around the pool area all day getting you involved with games etc. Live music in the bar area, pianist was amazing & saxophonist  wasn't bad either, but again gets really busy in there, they had to take the tables & chairs from outside to accommodate people & this is not main season.  Wouldn't class this as a 5* maybe 3.5 at best, wouldn't recommend & wouldn't go back.

reviews.review_title: Hotel amazing and spa is unbelievable
reviews.review_text: Went to the spa and it was the most amazing experience ever, lovely people and feel so fresh afterwards, highly recommended, Olympe spa at the hotel! We got the 2 day treatment but wish we got 4 now! Hotel is beautiful well maintained and staff fantastic

reviews.review_title: Easy communication with the hotel staff. The hotel is located close to two cities, Monastir and Sousse. Well-maintained
reviews.review_text: ☀️☀️☀️The best barman’s in the world!!! make the best drinks, are always smiling, and incredibly positive — they boost your mood with their amazing energy!!!⚡️⚡️⚡️!!! ☀️☀️☀️ The lobby has a wonderful atmosphere. I can relax and feel good there with the best drinks☀️☀️☀️

Staying here atm and it's a absolutely amazing hotel from the rooms to the animation team they all worked really hard nonstop and get everyone involved it's honestly my favourite holiday so far the bar staff and the restaurant workers are amazing also there is something for everybody would 100% recommend this place entertainment team is amazing

reviews.review_title: Bad experience and shocking customer service
reviews.review_text: Shocking place they bug you to buy things and use your kids to make you buy them!!!! All Scammers and get snotty when. You tell them no and the spa is a joke and rude!!!!   Wouldn’t recommend Don’t book anything with Ali baba camels is a waste of money   Always try to sell stuff when you just want to chill

reviews.review_title: Honest Review from a Family of Five
reviews.review_text: We’ve just returned from 10 days at One Resort Aqua Park & Spa and wanted to leave an honest, thoughtful review—especially for other families weighing it up. It’s a resort with a lot of heart, and while it’s not perfect for us, we had a really good stay overall.  What we loved:  The setting is stunning—whitewashed bungalows tucked among palm trees, lush greenery, and a truly beautiful beach with turquoise water and soft, pebbly sand.  The staff were incredibly friendly, especially with our baby—there’s a real love for children here. Expect cuddles, kisses, and lots of warm attention from waiters and animation staff alike. It might be surprising at first if you haven’t been to North Africa before, but we found it genuinely sweet and helpful.  The buffet food was great for an all-inclusive. It can be busy and a bit chaotic at peak times, but head to the quieter areas at the back of the restaurant—mornings had fresh donuts and lovely quieter corners.  The fish à la carte restaurant was a great experience—fresh and well done. The Tunisian à la carte, however, wasn’t nearly as good (oddly, the Tunisian food in the buffet was better).  The spa was wonderful—we did the 2-day package with hammam, massages, seaweed wrap, and hydrotherapy. A great treat, though do haggle or check prices, as we found we paid more than others for the same services.  The resort is spotless. I was often up early with the baby and saw dozens of staff scrubbing floors and cleaning everything thoroughly. It’s clear they take pride in keeping it immaculate.  The beach is the most peaceful part of the resort. With the animation team being quite lively in the pool and stage areas (lots of dancing, music, and energy), we often escaped to the beach for quiet and calm.  The lazy river and pools are fun and spread out—great for families with kids who enjoy activity.  Tipping makes a big difference: We always tip on all-inclusive holidays, especially when we see how hard the staff are working. It really showed here—staff went out of their way for us: beautiful towel and flower displays in the room, bringing drinks to the table, helping us get the best tables at mealtimes. We didn’t spend much overall, but tips felt meaningful and appreciated.  Things to know / could be improved:  There’s no hotel info in the rooms or via app—events like the Tunisian parade night (Mondays 6.30pm) by the beach aren’t mentioned anywhere. A printed schedule would be really helpful.  Cocktails are poor quality (which we’ve found common in this region), but Tunisian wine is surprisingly lovely, and the coffee from the urns is excellent.  The ice cream bar only opens 12–5 and the portions are tiny—a bit of a let-down for kids. We’d have loved it open from mid-morning.  Plastic spoons at dessert are not ideal—especially for toddlers. We stopped taking them because our baby nearly choked. A switch to proper cutlery would make a big difference.  Room upgrades matter. The standard family room was too small for our family of five, so we upgraded to a superior family bungalow for an extra £225—and it made the stay far more comfortable. Also, avoid rooms in the 100s if you have a pram—they’re upstairs. Room 49 was perfect for us.  There are some resort quirks—like towel card confusion (we returned ours but were still nearly charged), TV remote with no batteries, weak air con in some rooms, not enough sockets etc. Small things that mean it’s not quite a 4-star experience—but a very solid 3-star-plus.  Day trips & local tips:  We visited Sousse and Monastir by taxi (worth noting hotel taxis are very overpriced—we paid 140 TND for a return to Sousse that should have cost about 40).  If you only have time for one, Monastir is easier to get around, with a great square for kids and lovely beaches. Sousse has the cultural edge with its medina—Café Kasbah is full of charm.  Tunisia’s currency is controlled, so exchange rates are the same at the hotel as anywhere else. Dinar is helpful, but Euros or Pounds are widely accepted too.  Weather note for May–June: We didn’t realise until we arrived, but being beside the Salt Lakes means this area is a mosquito hotspot during breeding season. We were bitten quite a bit, so for families with young children, we’d recommend coming outside of May–June if you're choosing this area again.  Final thoughts: We paid around £1,850 for 10 nights all-inclusive, plus the upgrade and tips. We wouldn’t return, only because we prefer quieter, smaller resorts—but we still had a genuinely enjoyable time. For those looking for a lively, family-friendly place with beautiful surroundings, it’s excellent value for money.  And if you want to see photos, videos etc, I’ve shared everything over on my page: @freedomfamilytravel  Happy to answer any questions if you're planning to visit!

Just returned from a great 10 days stay away took my granddaughter. An she loved it so  many things to do the entertainment team are absolutely brilliant  the shows they put on at this hotel are great one of the best hotels in tunisa for food I've ever stayed in  an I've stayed in a few by far the best  this is a 24hrs resort so food drinks  all day an all night  my room was clean and fridge was stocked with water an cola an waters you get a  bottle from any of the bars here  all staff are so friendly  for the pool bar to the lobby bar beach  bar  u guys do an amazing job . An the chef in the restaurant was wonderful  could not do enough for us I've have a food allergy an he would cook me gluten free pasta  but to be honest  I found lots of food I could eat so much choice  I can not wait to return  I fully recommend this hotel  I honestly can not understand some of the reviews on here  try for yourself an go with an open mind  . One thing I must say give respect too get respect  .. I had a great time and was looked after very very well by everyone that worked there  . Let's not forget the reception team so helpful and approachable  the lady that's books the  A la carte restaurant is wonderful lady an couldn't do enough for you  Thank  you for a wonderful. Stay one resort aqua park and spa  .

Great hotel! Clean thanks to the housekeepers who are very present and kind! large and nice room it just misses a few takes! Several swimming pools a little cool but nice because you always find room! The meals are varied and good. The activities are great thanks to the animators of the mini club Mouna, Touta, Estefania and Maelys who make the holidays of the little ones magical and set the mood with their mini disco. At the spa you can do beauty treatments with Loubna she is great and also braid with Zeineb who is adorable and very gifted thanks again for my 2 daughters <3

Coralia team is a dynamic team that does several activities such as water polo, pétanque, archery and lunchtime play. The host Slouma is super nice. 😁  For the room, I think it's a shame the bed is hard.  As well as the pool hours that end at 6:00, it would be nice to extend it to 7:00.

Very beautiful hotel we had a great stay at the top it was great 👍  Very clean hotel the rooms are very good buffet very good 🥰 The animations are at the top a big thank you to the manager of the club Coralia ☺️ yassine and the animator of pétanque 👍😊

Super top hotel for children the family great atmosphere day and evening I recommend for families thank you also to the manager Yacine for his kindness and professionalism we had a great stay I tell you all soon

My partner and I had a wonderful stay in Tunisia. The hotel was on top. We loved everything!  From the welcome of the 1st day by the very nice and always smiling staff to the little touches in our room. The site is clean and the infrastructure tops. I recommend for families...We will come back next year with our children. The most of the hotel are the animators .Bisou des Belges

Best part of our stay was the waterpark, the room was fine for our stay. The only thing I would change is more safe places for baby’s to play, outside entertainment is on a high stage and one night was near the pools . No outside parks or inside play areas for small baby’s or children.

I’ll start with the positive- the animation team are lovely! Pool service is great and the lifeguards are on top of what’s happening. That’s where the positives end.  We stayed in rooms 110 and 111. Neither room had a proper working safe- this was a disaster trying to get sorted. The water didn’t drain from the shower in 111 either. Then we move onto the big problem!! We all got bitten while there- we thought it was mosquitos as there is definitely a problem with them around the Resort. Came home to discover that it’s actually bed bugs!! Fantastic!!   On checking out no room was available for us to keep on so we had to use the shower room to get changed.. I’ve seen better on “worlds worst jails” they are stinking of urine, the water is freezing and they have cctv cameras in them!   The food is questionable.. breakfast being the only decent meal. Then when you go to leave the hotel the taxi drivers try to rip you off! I’ve been to Tunisia many times and if this would have been my first time I would never return.   The hotel needs to up its game regarding food and pest control. Never ever again!!

reviews.review_title: One resort, one family, one love ❤️
reviews.review_text: Visited this hotel for the 4th time and literally welcomed back with open arms. I even got upgraded to a swim-up room, because of my loyalty. The staff is really the best I've seen, from the gardener to the director.  The enjoyment team is the best in the world ♥️ Except for one, you are all in my heart 😘

This hotel is for families, I wouldn't go as a couple. We were a family of 10, 6 adults and 4 children under 6. The rooms are nice, my daughter had an infestation of cockroaches but the hotel were on top of it. Our air conditioning and tv  weren't  working but within a hour they were both fixed, staff were very good, read reviews about not attentive unless tipped, didn't find this was the case, they couldn't do enough to help.  Entertainment team were very good.  Foam party in the pool was amazing.  Food was OK, could be better.  Everywhere was clean all the time.  Would we go back, YES, my grandchildren were crying on the way back to the airport as they didn't want to leave, they had a fantastic holiday.  Only down side is the mosquitos, take plenty of repellent and spray for your room. They were a bit of a problem, we all got bitten.

reviews.review_title: Enjoy your stay at ONE Resort
reviews.review_text: Good atmosphere, with lots of activities for all ages, very good value for money with decent rooms, the housekeeper makes small decorations with sheets and towels, good sanitation. The highlight is the animation. Do not hesitate to ask for ice cubes in the glasses 😂😂

Everything perfect thank you very much the animators are very nice and very welcoming the housekeepers are very nice also and very nice the medium rooms .. The highlights are the animators who do a lot of activities and atmosphere

Place is great, enjoyment team are one of the best we have ever coma across. Sam is really great with the teenage kids. He gets them all involved. All staff are wonderful & do everything to make your stay easy. Will come again!!!!❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️

Everything was great here.Everyone was very friendly .There could be more seats in the outdoor area.Otherwise it is great here.It is here very paid attention to cleanliness.Food is also great here.The staff are very nice here.

One of the most fun hotels i’ve ever been to!  The animation team are the absolute best and are a credit to this hotel, they work such long hours, but make you feel so welcome and are always happy to see you. They put 100% effort into everything from 9am to 11pm with a smile on their faces  Big love to the whole team ❤️  The hotel overall is really clean and rooms are cleaned daily with towels washed and beds made.   The food is nice. I’m vegetarian so struggled a bit as not everything is labelled that clearly, but there is plenty to eat and they have themed nights throughout the week.  The beach bar is open for food and drinks 24 hours a day.   Tips really go a long way! Tip your waiter and they will save you a table and have your drinks ready, tip your maid and you get freshly picked flowers on your bed etc  Overall, the staff are lovely, so welcoming and there is always something to do/see.   100% recommend this hotel if you want to visit Tunisia 🇹🇳

reviews.review_title: My experience at the hotel was truly amazing
reviews.review_text: ---  I had a wonderful stay at the hotel during my recent vacation. Everything was perfect—from the warm welcome at the reception to the beautiful and clean rooms. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, always ready to assist with a smile. The hotel’s location was ideal, close to many attractions and with a stunning view. I also enjoyed the delicious food at the restaurant and the relaxing atmosphere by the pool. It was truly an unforgettable experience, and I would love to come back again!

The best hotel I ever been. Amazing staff.rooms good. If you going with kids it's perfect place to go as they have loads activities for kids and taking care of them.every day something else to do for them. Big thank you for Gigi and Pipa for amazing job with kids.Kids gonna miss you.Perfect location. Very good cleaning service. Very good food.

Thanks to the hotel El Ksar Sousse for the cleanliness, the warm welcome, the friendliness of the staff, the varied entertainment, the evenings, and the care given to the children.I love it this weekend,I am satisfied for this experience ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️

reviews.review_title: Nice hotel & staff but beware of scammers in the town
reviews.review_text: The hotel was in a nice position on the beach. Close to shops, banks & cafés. The hotel itself was a little dated but spotlessly clean. Room was basic, the air con was useless. No plugs beside the bed. Only 2 plugs by the dressing table. Shower kept going hot then cold. Tip: take some extra hangers. Bed nice & comfy.  Beach bar wasn't serving any snacks or food until high season apparently. Only served wine, beer & soft drinks.  Pool area kept tidy. Sammi the pool attendant/lifeguard was an absolute star. Waiters are always on hand to get you drinks from the bar, especially Eshem & Falid. They went above & beyond.  Food in the restaurant was a bit samey but ok. Plenty to choose from though.  Snacks were served in the a la carte restaurant but looked like all leftovers from breakfast, lunch & dinner (bit disappointed)  The entertainment team was always around trying to get you involved in various activities.  All the Staff we encountered was very friendly throughout the hotel.  Tip: if you get a taxi into Sousse Medina, make sure you turn your wristband inside out before you get there. There are scammers that  say they work in the hotel & it's their day off, and they offer to take you round various government backed authentic shops. It's a rip off. Please do not be fooled.

Rooms are great, cleaning done every day  Animators are great except girls , great atmosphere great music at the pool , waiters at the bar are nice  Cleanliness is great, super good food  Thank you chico you are the best

the awesome hotel  the super good food the waiters in the downstairs restaurant are great the animators boy oh tooop average girls no smiles  activities are great especially when they play with us  very good atmosphere with music at the pool

Hotel very good , clean , maid of the 3rd floor very nice and helpful , in cooking especially pepper pizza , waiters of the restaurant at the top , nice .   The animators great nice team , the boys animators are the best , thank you Chico , Rio , sizo , zegi, biso , Diego.  Thank you hugs the team ❤️❤️

The people around the hotel were so helpful and simpathic. There were so much program like dancing, aqua gymnastic, waterpolo, archery, and even if you are shy they kindly tell you to come with them. We had such a great time i truly recommend this hotel so much activity.
I had a pleasant stay with everyone good service from everyone maque water at the table food was Good evenings pleasant and warm thank you for the animators and receptionists welcome Thank you.

We had a great time staying there with family. For my part I had a room 4 people a decent double bed and 2 sofa beds with a mattress a little too firm but the housekeeper made it a little softer with a blanket. The room was spacious with great views of the sea and pool. The hotel in general is ok but some renovations would do him good. The restaurant was ok but the dishes a little repetitive with a limited choice on the other hand during the Tunisian evening the dishes were succulent. The undeniable strength of this hotel and undoubtedly the entertainment team that made our holiday just exceptional, my children loved the kid's club a big thank you to Pika and Gigi. The activities and shows were very funny and quality. I've been to all the shows and so have my children. A big thank you to all the animation team 👍

Good facilities. Very good animation team. Good environment. The food is repeated but varied. Beach and pool very close and very quiet. Good atmosphere among guests and very friendly service staff. Good cohabitation between the guests themselves. If

Beautiful hotel with friends as a couple or even as a family with lots of activities for children (kids club), swimming pool and impeccable services!! Direct access to private beach and entertainment at the top. Staff always listening and smiling 😃 Near Medina souk and El kantaoui port.

I just got back from this hotel, I am very satisfied, the service is at the highest level, the food is great, the rooms are clean, the sea is within reach, the pools, the animation is very nice, the bartenders are very nice, thanks to Hichem and Nuri, they made us feel like at home, I recommend it, I will definitely go back there

Another lovely stay in this hotel. I'm nver thisapointment. Animation team was going over and beyond to make all days amazing.Special thank  you for Hichem from bar who make ours stay unforgettable. Compare to other hotels in Tunisia this can offer what You can't find else vere: amazing food, lovely beach and swimming pool, nice clean rooms and the most imported very polite and helpful smile faces staff. Than You again. We will come back soon

I like the hotel everything was good the staff the rooms the food the animation team was so nice to me and they was there for help and support. i really enjoyed everythink and i invite everyone to try this experience because they really make me feel welcomed and happy a big thank to them

reviews.review_title: The hotel is very good, the food is very good, the people are very good, the activation is very good and the work is very good.
reviews.review_text: The hotel is very good and well fed and the people here are very good and the activation team is very good and they do very well. I like the hotel very much. I might be back next year and it was a very good vacation and thank you. Diego and riou and bika and all the team will be back next year and we will find you at this hotel next year.

Friendly,rooms fine,animators fine,they knew us from last year and that was a warm reception of some,food was a little less,disadvantage ladder pool not yet made,activities plenty present,can laugh a lot and enjoy that's what counts

Good rest, fun animators, friendly maids. Good cleaning in the rooms,the restaurant has a large selection of dishes,delicious sweets and pastries.I would like more sea of food. Beach with sandy,you can swim in the sea .Clean pool. Animators from morning to late night at work.Sports games in the afternoon,disco,karaoke in the evening. It is possible to book out for shopping and other excursions and entertainment.  Sun, sea and friendly people what better way to relax.

We stayed only a few days in your hotel. We were very well received up to our room which is clean with a very nice sea view. Thank you!!!  We would also like to thank all the facilitators who are invested in their work. And especially mimi who it's a lot of fun with mia our daughter, and raina. But also Rio and chico with whom we had a good time.

Amazing Holiday. We booked this hotel after staying down the road in November. We would choose this hotel over and over again. The staff were amazing, super friendly. We had the best service from all waiters especially those at the beach bar (waiters and the security). Lots of friends and memories were made. Animation team super friendly and would take time to sit and chat during breaks.   Rooms were comfy and always clean. Our lovely cleaner would leave cool towel swans which was nice to come into after a long day.   i would recommend this hotel to anyone. We will be returning this year :)

Stayed as a couple a week ago. Hotel doesn’t look as flashy from the outside compared to others, when you pull up but the warmth of the staff and amenities make up for that. We stayed in the main royal building and had a distant seaview which was lovely and the room was spotless. Maids always cleaning everywhere in the hotel! The only issue is there’s only one plug socket in the room and the air con doesn’t come on til june (a Gov rule), which was hard as it was 38 degrees when there, so sleeping was hard. Quite noisy if neighbours are stomping about upstairs as no soundproofing. A nice walk in shower and quick lifts.
