Staff were lovely and we felt if you tip them (just a small amount to us)  you’ll get better service, so worth doing. We did a walkabout video on YouTube (badcrumblexxx) which may help you. We felt the hotel was lower budget when there but having looked at hotels since, it’s actually not. The food was really lovely for all meals with a good selection. I wish I’d used the gym (best I’ve seen in a hotel) as I put on lots of weight! Animation team worked very hard. We stayed by the small pool as it was quiet. The slide pool is salt water which wasn’t so good. Only thing is perhaps not so good for disabled people, no lift to lower pool or dining room. It’s a large complex so quite a bit of walking one end to the other. The spin class music was deafening which was annoying but only happens every so often and lots of smokers in the public areas which wasn’t so nice if you don’t smoke.  We had a fab stay and would def stay again but only when the air con was on! Special thanks to Said, Lotfi, Aziz and Alexander. All of who looked after us beautifully.

the best of marhaba royal salem .... the bar staff are so frindly and aymen  and they do great job ... and the animation team is really amazing 🥰 especially bob and leo ... and the room is really clean ... and the food is good xx i hope i will come back soon ❤️

I want to say this is not my first time here i come last time with my freand i relly like this hitel so much and thus time i come with my freand angin and i reely luke this stuff so much and big thanks for team animation there make cery good show every night to make u happy alwys i will be back soon agin

reviews.review_title: Fab holiday good and bad points.
reviews.review_text: This hotel as goods and bad points firstly we will go for the good the hotel is lovely all public areas are cleaned constantly and room was cleaned everyday fresh towels everyday the hotel is huge the kids pool was amazing and most importantly the staff are friendly nothing is too much trouble and fablous with the kids once you find your bearings around the hotel and it's sister hotel it's easy to get sround it's like it's only little village with all its little walk ways the down side for us and it  let down the most was the food it did have some positive like fresh made pasta that kids lived off and fresh pizza. The breakfast lacked options simple things like mushrooms and hash brown there wasn't lot of fresh fruit options and lunch and tea there wasn't lot of choice either lots of liver the theme nights had the best options also the beach bar there was lots of flies and really hard to find a seat. Also tye kids club could of been advertised more they didn't really come around asking if the kids wanted to go and what's was happening each day the animation team was lovely but felt it was more towards the adults games instead of both adults and kids. We would maybe go back again if the good options improved.

Very nice experience! The staff is so kind and helpful. Rooms are comfortable, clean, food is amazing. The best experience is Animation team! Mido is the best animator and trainer! Also, Marco, Patricia, Zaca… They’re making such a good atmosphere, feeling like I have been here many times before! Thank you guys, we’ll come back for sure!

Ian just back with my husband from this wonderful hotel complex both John and I are disabled and our mobility is not good when we arrive Riem booked me in and told me all about the hotel also arranged for mobility scooter for John from local English agent (advise to book before holiday as very busy) we got one delivered next day my only complaint is the ramps are very steep and no rails down them but the staff are wonderful Mohammed that looks after the foyers came and pushed or lifted scooter up front ramp anytime the waiters at the bar like Arbi and Jousef couldn't do enough for you either so friendly cheerful and always there to help at the quiet pool out the back alexandro and saif were amazing they helped me in and out pool moved our chairs just fantastic guys now the food if anyone says anything about the restaurant I don't understand why no one could go hungry there it's clean well laid out the waiters and management always there to help and explain different thing to you nothings too much trouble to them I can't thank them enough there is so much I can say even Adair the night time security guard was fantastic with us all in all I can't wait to come back it felt like an oasis in for John and I and we can't thank everyone we came into contact enough I'm sorry I can't remember everyone names but thank you from the bottom of our hearts please try this place

The animation show was absolutely fantastic and incredibly enjoyable. From start to finish, it was clear that a lot of effort and creativity had gone into making it such a fun experience. The team behind the show did an amazing job throughout the entire day, keeping the energy high and making sure everyone was entertained. Their enthusiasm and dedication were evident in every activity they organized, and it really made a big difference in how enjoyable the day was.  Each part of the show was thoughtfully planned and executed, appealing to both children and adults alike. The characters were engaging, the storylines were captivating, and the performances were lively and full of excitement. Whether it was games, music, dancing, or interactive skits, there was never a dull moment.

Entertainment is brilliant, beds are really comfortable and staff are fast and reliable. Food was lovely and overall an amazing accommodation. All the entertainment was on-time and happening all the time. Something for children and for adults.

My first time in Tunisia,  but definitely will not be my last. From check in to check out everything was perfect. Every staff member we came across was polite,  friendly,  welcoming and helpful,  nothing was ever too much trouble. The rooms were large and clean.  There were plenty of sunbeds always available, just ask the lifeguards and they will get one for you,  thank you to Ahmed.  The bar and restaurant staff were brilliant,  special thank you to Hamsa and Mohammed.  It is obvious who the leaders of the animation team were, but the other guys were the friendliest,  Momo, Foden, Sam, Chadou,  Bibo, Ziko and Patricia.  The food was plentiful and tasty, always such a selection and very fresh. Spoke to the guys at the fitness suite,  but declined to take part in a spin class, but Younes was very polite, knowledgeable and helpful. I am definitely hoping to come back,  thank you all again.  🙏

Bel hôtel  The spacious and very clean rooms The perfect facilitators  Meals not enough choice but very good. Too bad there are no aperitifs and ballroom dances between 9pm and  21h30 before the show👍👍👍👍👍👍Other great stay

Animation is brilliant and chaima is amazing and lovely we will definitely be back next year we loved it so much. Can’t do enough for you and the food is amazing so much choice, people who work there are amazing work so hard and are lovely !! Entertainment is brilliant and made you feel at home and lovely ❤️ 5 star need to come back don’t want to go home

reviews.review_title: An exceptional stay, faithful to Marhaba quality
reviews.review_text: As in every stay in the hotels of the Marhaba chain, I was never disappointed. What makes this property particularly interesting is its structure: several resorts, each with its own pool and bar. In total, there are three outdoor swimming pools, an indoor pool, three or four bars, as well as two restaurants, one of which is by the sea.  The room was spotless, very clean, with stunning sea views, everything is functional and quality. The drinks included in the all inclusive formula are excellent, and the food is tasty. The staff is friendly and always smiling. A special mention to Hamza of the bar service, which does a remarkable job at the pool – thanks to him!  I will definitely return to this hotel which really impressed me.

It has a good locationwl with a good stuff. The bar stuff and the qnimation team work so hard. Some parts of the hotel needs renovation, but the food and the drinks are awesome. Programmes are good and fit for every ages.  We had good days here. Highly recommend.

Everything is great I would definitely recommend this hotel to my knowledge Clean rooms Atmosphere at the top Everything is really good animators Super nice waiters Good food Super karaoke  Reception welcome  The animations are numerous

I want to say is not My first time i come here 5 time and i like the team Animation there work so hard to keep u happpy and smile always and big Thanks for midooo He always have nice smile in his face and He good man He help me for everything we need to now and Thanks for the bár stuff too

Had an amazing holiday the hotel was brilliant and the food was great!  The animation team were absolutely fantastic can’t fault them! Will defo be back!  The staff and bar are amazing always happy and quick to serve and the cocktail selection is great!

reviews.review_title: My stay at Marhaba royal Salem
reviews.review_text: Had an amazing time at this hotel! The staff can’t do more for you which is brilliant! The food is delicious and the entertainment team are second to none! Will 100% return! There is a large selection of drinks in the all inclusive with some delicious cocktails

We stayed here for twelve nights we had booked a room with a sea view on a top floor which we sort of got was on the 4 floor but there wasn’t much of a sea view but you could see it the room was good and it had a bath with a shower in it. There is plenty of wardrobe space  and a nice tv but only news channels in English but that’s ok you do not get a information book in your room so you have to ask where things are in the hotel We found the food plentiful and tasty and the waiter’s are very good and friendly and the local drinks are nice the entertainment doesn’t start till about 9 pm in the evening there’s two places that have evening entertainment  We used to walk into Sousse and we got the train a couple of times once to El Jem and once to monastir which Dacia lot of money if you do get a taxi don’t get from the guys by the hotel get them on the street and ask the price  I think the hotel is good value for money and would go there again it just needs more information and to start the entertainment earlier

We came here for a short stay. So what I can say it was one of the best short stays in Tunisia .Bedrooms are very tidy .Staff are very friendly and helpful and if you need any advice what to visit in this little town they always there for you... One more thing food here... amazing .Love it ..EVERYTHING.

The hotel is very nice and clean, staff are so friendly. We had such a good holiday a special thanks to the staff and animation team especially Mido, Bibo and Marco for making our holiday the best ever! The food is amazing different variety and selection every night.

Excellent entertainment  Excellent pool  Excellent beach  Excellent staff Slay  Staff was very helpful and funny  Very hygienic and clean  Food very sanitary and good  Amazing service  Beautiful views  Rooms cleaned professionally everyday  Slay

What can I say absolutely loved it the place is amazing for us personally something for everyone from staff at reception to entertainment team can't do enough I'm definetly coming back. The food I enjoyed something for everyone I will be back with wife and children next time 10 days is perfect

reviews.review_title: A PLACE WHERE QUALITY IS MUCH HIGHER THAN COST
reviews.review_text: Firstly, the downsides. This is a wonderful hotel surrounded by palm trees, with a great location, manicured lawns, magnificent flowers, a big swimming pool and a monumental lobby, but the rooms need serious renovation. We arrived in a large group and settled into five rooms, but each one had some kind of problem. Our bed was huge, with a very good mattress, but the rest of the furniture is apparently still the same that miraculously survived the destruction of Carthage by the Romans. We paid a tiny price for our holiday, but during the high season, expectations in a four-star hotel are usually higher. The saddest thing is the state of the plumbing, and if it is not noticed in the nearest future, all the leaks in the bathroom and toilet will destroy this excellent hotel and there will be nothing to restore. I highly recommend the owner of the hotel to take care of this issue.  Well, now about the pleasant things. The food in the restaurant is very diverse, with national flavor, there are a lot of dishes from different types of fish, there is always lamb, beef, chicken in the assortment, king prawns are fried on the grill, and I have never eaten tastier strawberries in my life. The bar serves a variety of cocktails, and the quality of the local wines was a pleasant surprise. The service staff does not always speak English, but they understand gestures and facial expressions very well, so there were no problems with communication. There is a shower, toilet and a small bar on the hotel beach, but if I am not mistaken, you have to pay for drinks there. The sea is great, we swam every day, but there is one unpleasant moment. There is an endless chain of vendors with various crap walking along the beach like ants and very-very-very-very insistently offering their goods. They became so annoying that at first I wished to drown one of them in the sea so that fear would make the others avoid our hotel along a large perimeter, but perhaps reducing competition would have led to the opposite result, so I had to abandon this idea.  Finally,  it is necessary to mention the animation team. Here is a very simple piece of advice. If you are not a public person, do not like excessive  attention and do not want to become the star of the hotel, just stay away from these smiling gangsters. Especially beware of two named Mic and Simo. For example, no one warned us about their  insidious plans and we followed them to the show as audience but the next day I woke up famous, got a stage name and spent the rest of my vacation walking around the  hotel with a bag over my head to be unrecognized.  I hope you read to the end. A huge thank you to all the hotel staff for a wonderful holiday. Wish you the best ever season. We got fabulous four-star service for the price of a bed and breakfast.  Miss Mouradi

reviews.review_title: Sea view.. lack of hygiene, customer service, welcome
reviews.review_text: The El Mouradi El Menzah hotel is located in an exceptional location (facing the sea, in Yasmine Hammamet) but clearly suffers from a lack of maintenance and quality management. If you are looking for a quiet, clean and well organized stay, this is probably not the right choice. If you are flexible, the sea view and the beach are your priorities, and you accept very limited comfort, then this may be possible... on a low budget. Personally, I would not recommend it unless you get a very cheap offer and your expectations are really minimal. The "sea view" experience should not compensate for problems of hygiene, food or comfort. Good luck 💖💖

I don’t even know where to begin, on arrival was placed in a different hotel due to it being closed. Hotel room is mediocre at best. DONT get all inclusive there’s barely anything offered to drink and it’s all bottles poured into tiny drinking cups. All drinks are luke warm it’s terrible.  No wifi unless sat in the lobby of the opposite hotel.  Only one pool is allowed to be used- the slides seen in pictures are barricaded off and not allowed to be used. The hotel in the picture is not used for anything but sleeping they send you to another hotel to do everything else.  Hardly any communication if your English- if your french it’s a little better but hardly. Nothing to do all day sat by the pool.  Let’s get into the food/breakfast/dinner experience-  It’s like a swarm of wasps attacking something- I’ve never seen anything like it everyone is fighting for food pushing snatching food not even using the tongs provided- non of the food is labeled you have to guess what they are.  The food is not catered for British or European people- not that we was bothered but some meals we missed completely.  Along with the lack there of communication- finding where to go to get food or the toilets is a game of survival of the fittest. In the dining hall there are limited number of seats and they prioritise people with different wristbands and will tell you NO if you try to sit down but then if you try to leave with your food to eat elsewhere they will follow you shouting.  If you ask questions or ask for something IE cutlery or cups they simply look at you in disgust and walk away.  We booked to stay for one week and have never been so unhappy with the service and the hotels hospitality.  If you ask me the hotel is in need of proper management and hospitality training.   Waste of my money and time

Just arrived back home and couldn't wait to get home. Arrived late in Saturday night was allocated a room, no key, had to keep going to the desk and wait for someone to let us in. Room was very dirty. Was told a key would be available to us after breakfast... we had to wipe everything down before unpacking... went down on Sunday for breakfast... forget anything English. The food wasn't catered at all for British people.. couldn't even had a croissant as no butter, jams, cheeses or hams. Couldn't get drunk as the spirits in the all inclusive were watered down. The furniture in the room was battered and rotten. The balcony paint was flaking. Our safe wasn't working do was told a replacement was being sorted.. this didnt materialise. The beds are like sleeping on the floor and the pillows are like sandbags, I woke up aching every morning. The 2 good things about this hotel are the pool and the hospitality staff. The bathroom flooded everytime we had a shower as the shower curtain was letting the water through. Be aware when walking about as you will get hassled all the time to go in the shops. Cigarette but outside the lift for 3 days.. Avoid avoid avoid.

I had the opportunity to stay at Hotel El Mouradi.  The reception of the hotel is not very warm.  No drinks in the fridge in the room.  However, we were very well received by the animator Ahmed who accompanied us very well. Thanks to him

reviews.review_title: Great experience 3rd time on hammamet and frankly the animations the buffet the location super nothing to say.
reviews.review_text: Rooms a little old but frankly the pools service the animators Chacha especially for children frankly nothing to say. Highly recommend. Don't be fooled by negative reviews. The amazing super varied buffet...

reviews.review_title: Don't be fooled by 4 star! Dated and dirty!
reviews.review_text: This was classed as a 4 star resort. Definitely not!. Although  there are facilities.  The rooms are an absolute disgrace! Our first room upon entering. We noticed how dated the furniture was and how threadbare and dirty the carpets were. The balcony banister was rotting and unsafe to lean on. The bathroom bath had rust stains and the coating on the base of the bath had rotted away! Tiling must have been done by a chimpanzee! We complained and was given keys to check another room. This had a carpet that had a large section out and stuck back down. The carpet was absolutely filthy! Human hair balls matted into carpet! The third room we were offerd was habitable although the hairdryer was broken and there was only one plug socket to charge items! The hotel is massive with lots of pools and spa center. But needs A LOT OF MONEY spent to bring it up to 4 star! The maintenance staff need sacking as signs of shoddy workmanship everywhere! There seems to be lots of managers loafing around but no one correcting the faults within the hotel! Location is excellent, right next to beach. Could be an amazing hotel if money and proper management were spent on it!

reviews.review_title: Save yourself!! Although the budget is interesting
reviews.review_text: Totally to be avoided! Very old , filthy meal , very dirty and unmaintained pool at this time! No varied food the same every day without taste! The common areas are very dirty as well as the dilapidated rooms  The worst holiday in 10 years

The hotel lacks much maintenance: -The rooms are bad (defective shower, window does not close, no internet, no TV...) -The hallway is dark and lacks ventilation (bad smells) -Service is average especially in the restaurant. -The food is average sometimes good. In summary not to recommend

This hotel is truly amazing when is comes to caring about their guests. They offered an extra room free of charge for us saying it would be less crammed for the week. Then for new years arranged a beautiful dinner with spectacular entertainment. It was truly a wonderful night. The staff here are very sweet and welcoming making the stay even more enjoyable.

The Receptionists are friendly but politely rude. The food is in abundance but lacks quality. All meals are served with Dry rocky bread and omelets are full of egg shells impossible to eat. The inclusive deal covers the cheap low quality drinks while those who want quality have to use the exclusive side bar where you can pay for quality. The Hotel cash point charges interest rate to use on top of a commission of 10 Dinar on each withdrawal. One can only withdraw 300 Tunisian local currency at each time. The agents authorized by the hotel to organize excursions charge ripoff fees. If you are stupid enough to ignore my comments and still book a trip to Tunisia please arrange your preferred tours from home before you travel. Also carry enough money to eat from out, unless off you love oranges. Those reading after booking good luck.

This has to be one of the worst hotels I’ve ever experienced. Staff are rude, the entire hotel is run down and needs a complete renovation. Says it’s a 4* hotel but in reality more like 1*.   Rooms are awful, beds rock hard and pillows are lumpy and full of stains.   The all inclusive food on offer is quite simply vile. No options for children. We have eaten out everyday which defeats the purpose of booking an all inclusive. The dining hall is rotten. We was violently sick 3 days out of 5.   We couldn’t wait to leave and fly home. I would never visit Tunisia again. Love Holidays should take this hotel off their option list.

reviews.review_title: Abysmal hotel. Ruined the holiday. Never returning.
reviews.review_text: I hope you are seated with a cup of your favourite beverage to hand...  First time writing a review for a hotel stay. El Mouradi El Menzah  No safe in room so had to carry all valuables with us all times  Hair on floors and bathroom sink Broken shower handle so the head did not stay in place  Key stopped turning on second day No telephone in room to call reception so every problem required a trip downstairs and back  Telephones are for show and connect to nothing!  Shower gel not replaced so had to keep asking daily  Poor wifi in lobby and none in rooms Second floor call button in lift stopped working on second day  Very old and dated decor which needs serious renovation. The next door hotel looked much better.  Food was bland or unusual tasting. Few options for children. Not much variety and there was always a long queue for anything you wanted. They need more food stations and service staff.  Second day a very large group of youngsters from a football academy came for their stay. Oh boy! Dinner was like pigs rushing for the trough. The restaurant didn't use both sides of buffet to speed things up. Plates ran out and one man almost fought the restaurant manager on duty over it. Tables were short and guests were nicking chairs from other tables, at one point some guests were eating standing up! Guests had to clear their own tables because the servers were so overwhelmed. There was no consideration of the extra 100+ generally-always-teenage boys that would be coming to dinner. One of them got so cross with a granny trying to cut in that it looked like he might shove her to the back of the line! Chaos is not the word but I do not what is.   Same plate shortage happened on day. Abismal

reviews.review_title: What a filthy and western unfriendly hotel absolute disgrace
reviews.review_text: Awful place, the hotel is tun down, food is dreadful, a very nousy place to stay, there is no considerarion for western visitors so if you are dont be suprised id you have to eat out,   The entite place is filthy dirty, ants bugs, never ever will i visit this place or indeed tunisa the vast majority of the country is filthy and litter ridden

Hotel that must have had its glory days.  But it's time to review everything. Everything is in decrepitude, rooms , catering, swimming pools , slides.... Everything is in ruins, dangerous limit.... Tunisia welcomed us in better conditions a few years ago. Very disappointed and sad for a country that deserves much better....

Charming staff and care, ready to satisfy us at the home level, ultra kind and hardworking catering staff so knowledgeable at the hotel s central bar ready to satisfy you   On the other hand pitiful hotel, dilapidated, state of dirty rooms on the 3rd floor, unkind maid and cleaning quickly done badly. Glass bay that does not close completely, leaking bathtub shower and hot water pressure egg Archaic air conditioning a kind of air blower that makes an incredible and inefficient noise  No Wifi in the rooms in 2024 c is incomprehensible, no French channels on TV!!!!  In terms of catering no fake sugar saccharin for people who have to monitor sugar it is a problem nor any substitute for cow's milk, no vegetal milk! No jarred yogurt in the morning or fresh fruit in the morning and rarely at meal!!! Microwave its broken turntable does not work and new tea machine that offered succulent broken tea after 2 days!!!  Animation non-existent except the morning muscle building gym very birn and very professional but terrible aquagym with unbearable techno music  And the whole day of mystical techno or arabic has bottomed sui fzit lal at the head of everyone but to the unlikely taste of the young ka sono who does not care royally about the opinions and requests of customers   And finally clientele mostly pru educated, not polite, who insults the staff, respects nothing and bathes in burkini despite the ban   Brief hotel very mediocre, poorly soundproofed, very noisy, no wifi or French channels  A LOT OF THINGS TO IMPROVE IF THEY WANT NOT TO CLOSE

Lame hotel the 4 stars are gone apart from the friendly staff the rest zero the buffet lame old room the customers no respect to fight for a plate to avoid if you want to go to Hammamet spend your way take another hotel

This hotel is just ok. We paid around £1000 for flights and hotel (all inclusive). Bottom line - very underwhelming compared to my previous experiences at similar price points (albeit the comparison is to mexico and turkey)  Things I liked:  Inexpensive overall Nice staff  Enjoyed the food  Lovely beach  Nice pools  Clean   Things I didn't like:  We arrived at night after the restaurant had closed. They gave us a plate of cold food (salad, cured meats, a boiled egg). Underwhelming and not what we are used to at other all inclusives.  No entertainment  Lack of atmosphere at the hotel  Lights would be switched off at around 11pm despite people being sat in the lobby.  Running out of drinks  Not having beach towels (even early in the day e.g. midday)  Menus / brochures only being in French  AC not being on half the year regardless of temperature  Being charged extra for the gym (seriously?? I've never seen this before at a 5* all inclusive)

We arrive around 10pm, very friendly guy on reception checked us in and lead us to the restaurant, that was closed. We were provided with a plate of food and drinks. Nice touch. Porter took our cases to our room. We had booked a beach bungalow. It’s basically a lovely room, with a terrace and direct access onto the beach. Away from the main part of the hotel. So tranquil, beautiful views of the sea. Robes and slippers provided, tea and coffee facilities, small fridge with fresh water everyday. The beach is beautiful, great bar, look out for Kareem the bar man. So lovely and helpful. The beach is so relaxing. The restaurant is amazing, something for everyone! Oysters! Wow. Our waiter, Lefty, looked after us like Kings and Queens.  I only have 1 fault with the place, no Prosecco! What’s that about lol. Pushed me out of my comfort zone, gin and mojitos are my new faves😍 Tunisia is a beautiful country with beautiful people.  This hotel is amazing and we will be sad to leave ❤️   of the hotel. Huge, comfy bed and bath!

reviews.review_title: A First Class, 5-Star Experience for our Wedding Anniversary
reviews.review_text: This is one of the best hotels we have stayed at. After an almost 4 hour flight delay, we arrived to be greeted by the hotel staff and quickly escorted to the lunch area, which closed in 30 minutes of our arrival - very thoughtful as  they anticipated our fatigue and hunger after an almost 11 hour travel time from home to the hotel. The food throughout our stay was '5-star': sushi, oysters, vegetarians, meat-eaters or fish-lovers - all our catered for, as was our sweet-tooth - their desserts and patisserie area could respectfully rival any in France. Equally, the A La Carte Italian seafood restaurant experience was one of the many food highlights of our trip. Our room was spacious and peaceful, with air-con and a lovely balcony with an ocean view, that also overlooked the 3- pools, including an infinity pool. Our room was cleaned daily and the hotel was spotless and had a lovely, relaxing atmosphere. The restaurant staff were also kind and thoughtful. The indoor pool and Thalassa was used by us. The entertainment was low-key and 'chilled' (singers, musicians and dancers); however, the bonus of having access to the sister hotel, next door, meant that we could see 'shows' and access a disco and a range of day entertainment for adults and children for free. Absolute excellent value for money. Thank you Zainab, Chokra  and the whole team.

reviews.review_title: The Hotel worth a long staying
reviews.review_text: This hotel has been our greatest experience ever. I and my family enjoyed the hotel hospitality, great staffs, spacious CLEAN rooms, reasonable rates, beautiful pools & beaches. The food was excellent. We LOVED this hotel and we will always book there whenever we travel it to Tunisia.

Here now at this fabulous hotel. Cannot rate this hotel as its one of if not the best hotel we've stayed in. Bar staff restaurant staff cleaning staff pool staff reception staff absolutely brilliant can't do enough for you. Been here two days and as I type booking for later on in the year. Thank you so much for making our holiday plus the food is second above none absolutely fabulous best food me and my husband have ever had and he was a chef lol thank you once again 🫶

I stayed at this hotel on 11/05/2025. The place is beautiful and the welcome very warm. I am fully satisfied with this hotel, which is clean and conveniently located. We opted for a standard room, which was spacious, well maintained, with a king size bed and partial sea views, but one small note: the air conditioning was not turned on, although it was a little hot (26-28°C) for a month of May. The staff is extremely welcoming and helpful, especially the chefs, who are very responsive. The buffet offers a nice variety, although the pastry section could be improved. The pools are superb, as are the sea views, and the burkini is allowed for veiled women, which is a plus. I recommend this hotel without any hesitation. I share with you some pictures

What a great experience we had at the Royal Azur Thalassa hotel! You cannot fault it - 5 stars are well earned. The interior design, paintings and furnishings are top quality. They also have Azur gallery with spectacular pieces of art.   Reception staff and guest relationship manager are very professional, knowledgeable and helpful. They are always there to help.  Waiters are doing exceptionally good job in all 3 restaurants on site. Variety of food in the main restaurant is simply amazing - there was something to suit all tastes, no matter where in the world you came from - pizza, pasta, grilled fish, beef goulash, salad, etc and lots of fresh bakery, also plenty of fruit and desserts.   There are also several pools, spa center, indoors and outdoors chill lounges. Very conveniently in the hotel area (10 metres away from hotel entrance) there is Le Grandes Bazaar - local shop where you can buy souvenirs, clothing, carpets, cosmetic and other stuff surprisingly at a very decent price.   Simply the best hotel in Hammamet.   Thank you!

We are disappointed with the overall amenities of the hotel.  The food is bland, little varied. The waiters at the table are adorable. We quickly became ill and yet we avoided ice cubes. Leave with smecta and probiotics.  The pool staff, whether lifeguards or bartenders, do not necessarily bother to greet us and are unpleasant.  The staff at the front desk is very kind as well as the maids.  We are satisfied with our room except the soundproofing, we heard the noises from outside and the lobby until 1:30 in the morning this night.  We had sent an email to find out if there was a gym, a positive response from the hotel but on site we were surprised to discover that you had to pay 50dinars a day to access it.  The pictures of the hot tub attractive on the ad but it is only accessible by taking an additional option that is not indicated on the site.

My stay at this hotel was absolutely unacceptable from start to finish. Despite paying for an upgraded room with a balcony, I was given the wrong room because they had overbooked — no apology, no refund, just shrugged off.  To make matters worse in the early hours of the morning, a staff member entered my locked room without knocking while I was completely naked. I felt terrified, violated, and utterly unsafe. The staff member ran off without saying a word, and I never received an apology.  To make matters worse, I’ve had to go back and forth with both the hotel and the booking provider, only to be gaslit and told it never happened despite them having CCTV footage and email evidence.  No accountability, no empathy, no proper apology. This was a serious breach of safety and privacy and I wouldn’t recommend this hotel to anyone. Completely traumatising and disgracefully handled.

reviews.review_title: Great location, hotel lacks personality outside
reviews.review_text: Excellent food and service in the dinning room, our room was immaculate but had only a small wardrobe and no drawer space .. The pool areas were Scruffy,sunbeds and tables dirty and wet, the pool bar staff were rude and lazy, it took 40 minutes and still no drink arrived, sadly this is because of the tipping culture they expect.. the life guards were hard to find and towels were kept in the hedge!  The beach bar and staff was friendly and clean.. such a shame, a refurbished hotel that had everything you would expect from an all inclusive hotel inside but outside was a disappointment where no management checked up on the staff or came to speak to the customers...

We had a lovely sister’s holiday at Royal Azur. Loved every second of it! All hotel staff were very hospitable and welcoming. Bedrooms are spacious and spotless with cleaners coming in daily to refresh beds and clean bathroom.  Buffet food was good. A wide variety to choose from, even if you’re a picky eater, there is definitely something you will find. Lovely outdoor pools which are well maintained and clean. The entire outdoor area is beautiful and relaxing. Beach is just a little walk down or you can use the lift. Light entertainment during the nights, nothing too much. If you want to book excursions, you can book through the main office. Big thank you to ZAINAB and HANA at the reception. They were so lovely all throughout our stay. Always checking in on us and making sure we have a good time. Definitely recommend this hotel, will be back soon!

Stunning Hotel! Had such a nice time Hotel staff were lovely, especially Zaynab and Hana. They made us feel very welcomed and helped us throughout our time here. Would definitely recommend to anyone thinking of booking. Rooms were very clean and spacious.

I had a very pleasant stay, the buffet is excellent (tasteful, not too much salt, not too much sugar) with lots of choices. Chefs and those who program the menus do absolutely everything to please us with the buffet.  The hotel is very clean. Special mention to Anissa who was my maid who did a superb job every day. This woman is fantastic, very warm, adorable. She's really a beautiful person. Thank you Anissa!  I would also like to thank Aykel at the Hotel Reception for his professionalism and great sympathy throughout my stay.

Nice hotel Very friendly staff , lovely pools , beach does  what it says on the tin Food is both a good standard and varied  Always find it a shame when people fill plates and then not  eat anything leading to huge waste . Waiters are all very efficient   I honestly think some people must have only stayed at the Ritz Carlton New York from the way they behave   Thank you Royal Azure  A fine week was had x

Plus points ….great hotel, spotless, pleasant attentive staff .Rooms cleaned to perfection. Plenty of sunbeds available at all times of day in the spacious grounds Main restaurant food is  varied, delicious and plentiful. Hayla on the waiting staff deserves a special thank you for her attentiveness and alertness when things need doing. Lovely pool areas. No animation team or music so very peaceful. Relaxing entertainment at night -saxophonist was great. Downside … too much use of plastic bottles and straws. Can the straws be replaced with card ones? Can plastic  bottles of water in the rooms be replaced with refillable glass ones? Can the shampoo, shower gel plastic bottles be replaced with all in one solid bars?. The only snacks available outside of mealtimes were small wrapped sandwiches from an outside bar. This is ok for me but at other “all inclusive resorts” snack options have been more widely available

reviews.review_title: we obviously know that we should not expect miracles: 3.5 stars max
reviews.review_text: Plus:  Pools and the beach The terrace of the room The kindness and efficiency of the waiters in the “canteen”, indoor bar and pool bar as well as lifeguards Cleanliness of the spaces around the canteen and swimming pools Massages: Stones has 4 hands, Shiatsu, massage under affusion  Less: - Reception: cold and totally detached: do not ask for help or information - Wifi not working or intermittently  -The "Canteen":  1-the same starters without any seasoning for 10 days. Very few typical dishes. No flavor. 2- Some rare labels indicate the name of the dish but no description and no mention of allergen   3-One serving spoon for 4 or 5 dishes (never seen anything like it) 4-Breakfast eggs broken from the ledge of the worktop and the same bowl used indefinitely whatever the preparation requested by the guests... it is sure that the hygiene inspectors would make it a discomfort 5-European desserts: pass your way from these pastries with various and varied mousses that come straight out of the freezer (as proof: ice cream still present). For fruit it will be apple, orange, sometimes some melon and some dates  6-Italian restaurant: cold pasta, restrictions has a starter and a dish while the menu offers two courses. The servers are unprofessional and unseemly.  Thalasso (independent of the hotel): the first prize of a chaotic medieval organization. The unanswered question: How do they do it when it’s high season  1-No digitized schedule. The cloakroom rewrites everything by hand on a carbon notebook!!! There is no indication that caregivers know who to care for. Ten people will march in front of you saying “it’s not me, it’s my colleague”. You hear the same refrain all day long. 2-No signage in the building. No one understands how this organization works. You ask your way and you get very little answer. 3-The people at the reception are hateful. Same for the locker room 4-First day: there is no towel. Next days: towels and bathrobes are damp: are they well cleaned between each client?? 5-big doubt about changing and/or cleaning massage tables between each client. The pinnacle being the hammam/scrub room: what about the glove change between each client? What is certain is that the plastic support is not changed. The speaker is brutal and unpleasant 6- in doubt I did not venture to go to the hot tubs and other jacuzzis  Please note that the hotel will not inform you about the start of treatments. Late arrivals could not access the building in Thalasso. They discovered that the treatments had been scheduled the morning after their arrival. BIO AZUR did not want to change the schedules: lost care. Similarly if you request a change of schedule during your stay they will be refused

We have just returned from this absolute gem of a hotel, on arrival we were met by their porter who took our cases away and waited for us to check in, check in was very smooth and quick and we were escorted to our room, the room - superior room with sea view, faultless (apart from be warned, no air can until June 1st) the view was impeccable, very comfortable extra large bed, lovely bathroom and seperate toilet and very clean and tidy. What seperates this hotel to others is the view, the best in Hammamet I was informed by our waiter around the pool Skander. what a lovely young man, nothing was any trouble and he was insulted if I went to the bar as he wanted to serve us poolside. The drinks are all served in glasses which is a nice touch, rather than plastic cups which other all inclusive hotels have normally presented us with. The pool area - impeccable, so well designed, you do not feel on top of anyone and lots of shaded areas if required. Lots of beds, very comfortable beds but in the morning these can be very wet as they are hosed down every morning, these do dry out quite quick though. Now the food - fantastic buffet restaurant with lots of choice, all fresh and something for everyone, we always straight to the grill section with fresh fish, meat etc. The pizzas were also very good. All in all amazing people, lovely hotel and an amazing holiday,  Thank you to all the staff at Royal Azur!!

An excellent surprise because we had read several very negative reviews. A beautiful and spacious room with a very nice sea and pool view. A warm welcome throughout the hotel and a quality and varied restaurant. A special mention for the Dia server who took care of us with competence and kindness. Many thanks to all the staff. The spa is also beautiful

Lovely hotel. We were upgraded to a suite which was really nice and spacious.  Poolarea very nice. No problem getting a sunbed. The pool bar was very hit and miss. Some of the staff obviously had their favourites. We weren't asked if we wanted a drink once. Had to go to the bar each time. Staff in the buffet restaurant were very helpful and polite, unfortunately the food was very average and not very warm . Definitely a disappointment. Luckily it didn't spoil our holiday. We got a good deal through Tui so we were happy overall.

reviews.review_title: Would be more of a 4 star!
reviews.review_text: The lobby is impressive! Our room (a premium sea view) is great and the views of the pools and the sea is beautiful! The dressing room, with the bench, is interesting. The spacious bathroom. It is however poorly arranged, the towel hooks of the sinks force to skin the back of the hands!  The 2 TVs work simultaneously... The terrace in front of the rooms sends back the heat and the air conditioning is not functional until May! An oven! The restaurant is nothing exceptional except the morning Tunisian honey cakes: excellent! As for the waiters, both restaurants and bars, it would be nice to reform them to the reception of all customers. The beach is nice and the sea a translucent blue-green. For me, a 5-star rating, even by local standards, should anticipate the needs of customers.

Unforgettable memories.  Classy hotel.  Warm welcome, varied animations.  Various meals of all nationalities.  Unlimited buffet.  Cleanliness impeccable. Hostesses, waiter and animators very smiling 😃.  Outdoor and indoor swimming pool with jaccuzi at your disposal.

The room was fully equped a cosy. Restaurant was great and a food was amazing. The pool is nice also the indoor one. The spa was amazing. Beach bar and the beach too. Animation was great with Magi and all of the staff are very friendly. I am very pleased with evrithing

Location of the hotel is great, near the center and all of the shops. Hotel is beautiful, food is amazing. Rooms are big and clean, and the service is so kind and nice. Beach is beautiful. There is a lot to see and experience. I am very pleased and I had great time.

reviews.review_title: Great experience at the Sousse palace
reviews.review_text: Great experience and have to spend good times with all the sousse palace team. Beautiful place for this beach walk well clean.  Spa service at the top thank you Maya. Animation at the top thank you Magui. Very nice catering service the servers are very professional.  Thank you again very much for Fedi. A big thank you to customer relations manager Alia

Quiet and relaxing hotel near the medina and the very nice personal town center and if you lack anything the lady public relationship and there to help we had a very nice stay. Beautiful walk along the beach to advise

The stay was superb. The rooms were tidy and cleaned every day. The staff was very polite and friendly, there was a relaxed atmosphere. The animation team did their best and made it fun every day. The food was delicious and varied every day. During dinner you noticed that the waiters tried very hard to make you as comfortable as possible. The location is also great, you get off the hotel and are on the beach. Overall, a great holiday!

reviews.review_title: It was really fun had a great time here! I came here for 10 Days and it wasn’t long enough.
reviews.review_text: It was very Nice, clean rooms. Beautiful hotel and Nice pool with sunbeds. Also really friendly people they Will help you with everything. There also are fun activities like dancing en music in the evening. The food was really Nice there is a lot of choice en differences in the food. En there are bars where you can sit al day with great people.

Absolutely beautiful, the people cannot help you enough. The service is top notch! Also very attentive to detail. Making sure everyone of your needs are met! Five star service for sure! Rooms are comfy, food is also brilliant. GREAT VIBE!!

We spent a pleasant week at the Sousse Palace. A big crush on our waiter Ghaith🤩💕💕 for her kindness and professionalism, great work👍, as well as Maia (Spa/Hammmam) and Alia (Customer Manager) always very smiling, professional and present and Thank you also to Khadija😍💕💕 our maid who does her job super well and magically.💕💕Very hard to leave after having all her amazing relationships.  Medji tjs smiling the same and let's not forget the bartenders 😉then other people....... Thanks to the masseuses also they do their awesome work we would stay there for hours🤩😘bravo. Respect to all this wonderful team.  The hotel is very well located close to everything🤩 beautiful private beach. Tunisia knows how to welcome 💖 and are very touched by bcp of things.😘😘😘

reviews.review_title: Very nice and relaxing hotel we will come back
reviews.review_text: First experience at Sousse Palace excellent service responsive and attentive staff very well located between Sea and city.⭐👍😘 Room very good and clean good The restaurant 🍉🍌🍍🥭🥕🍑🥯🥐🍞🌰🥪🌮🥙🍨🍰🥧🍦🎂🍪🍩🧁🎂🍛🍲🥗

reviews.review_title: Nice to come to this hotel
reviews.review_text: The staff is very professional and always attentive.hotel and rooms very clean, for us it is perfect  Thanks to the whole team. The restaurant team is attentive and very helpful 🥰😍🍞🥑🥝🍋🍈🥩🍕🥫🍟🥪🍝🥘🍣🍟🍕

Very nice hotel luxurious and comfortable room  The food is very varied and delicious  The perfect setting and location in the heart of the city center and next to the medina  The staff is great  Maya the head of the spa is a love of no one up to the treatments  Mejid the host very kind helpful gives good mood  I have nothing to say about this hotel  All the staff is great It feels like kings  A standing ovation to all ❤️

Good place nice view we can say good food good mood and I like to people there  Happy to go there.👍🌹🌹🌹🌹🌹🌺🌺🌺🌺🌺🌺🌺🌺🌺 Good location near sousse medina. Thanks a lot chef for your delicious food at the Must restaurant 🌹🌹🌹🌹🌷🌷🌷🌷💐

Top expérience at  sousse palace WE get an Amazing congrès everything so perfect. Thanks a lot for thé staff and for the waiters. Réception top. Good accommodation room very clean thank you Khadija. Everything very clean. Nice and comfort hôtel.

reviews.review_title: Come and you won't be disappointed!
reviews.review_text: I have visited Tunisia seven times and I have the Sousse Palace the best hotel - by far. From the excellent variety of food, the private beach just footsteps away, the different types of massage (fabulous) the exceptional staff who go over and above their role (especially Alea and Maya) from the top managers to the gardeners - I cannot praise the Sousse Palace enough. Come and you won't be disappointed.

reviews.review_title: Training well spent at souse palace
reviews.review_text: Warm welcome thank you to all the training team really well equipped and well organized room with break coffe vary.  Ideal location classic and very chic modern hotel decoration with top lighting. Catering service with exceptional quality waiter to the top delicious food.  Room well cleaned.  Thanks to all the team Sousse Palace

Top experience with great animation.  Staff really high quality helpful listening.  Various food especially Tunisian 🎂🍰🎂🧁🥧🍪🍩🍨 Service deserves 5* luxury from the spa restaurant room.  Hotel to recommend 🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰

An amazing stay really the staff so friendly even there is some détails to improvement but they do their best to every things be in good way.  Thank you so much Alia for your professionnel and for react immidiate.  Good location near sousse palace.  Food délicieux 😋 😋 😋 😋 😋 😋  Nice hôtel 5 stars.

Wonderful relaxing hotel. In the Center on soussse. Great location. Food is great. The one thing I will say, is that beds are not the comfiest but other than that, great. They are very helpful staff. And go to above and beyond to make sure you are having a good time. Spa is also very good.
Service top and expetionell restaurant 🍻🍻🍺🍺 top . Warm welcome thank you to all the team. Various foods 🌹🍪🥮🍕🥥🥞🌭🍔🥩🍟🍈🍌🍎🌶️❤️🥕🍊 Animation top🥰😍🥳 Beautiful swimming pool ❤️🥰😍🥳 Ideal location,❤️🥰🥀🍻🍺🌹🌹

An exceptional stay! with my little family  We had an unforgettable time at the hotel! Everything was perfect: the warm welcome, the impeccable cleanliness of the rooms, the comfort of the bedding and the quality of the services offered.  Special mention for the staff, always smiling, available and caring. Breakfast was hearty and delicious, with fresh and varied products a buffet always varied  The location of the hotel is great,  Thank you to the whole team for this great stay, we will return without hesitation and highly recommend this property to all those looking for a quality experience!

reviews.review_title: A real favorite, well above a 3 star
reviews.review_text: This is the second time we’ve come back to this hotel, and it certainly won’t be the last! Everything is absolutely perfect: the hotel is clean, whether in the rooms, public areas or around the pool. The beach is a stone's throw away, which is very appreciable.  The staff is always smiling, professional and attentive, whether it be the waiters, bartenders or cleaning team – a big bravo to all for your kindness and efficiency. Special mention to the animation team: dynamic, caring, always in a good mood and very professional. They really know how to create a friendly atmosphere without ever being invasive.  Frankly, this hotel deserves more than 3 stars. We had a great time there once again, and we are already looking forward to returning! Amber and Delphine

Good evening to all Stayed from 13 to 22/5/25 room 165 Nostalgic return to Paris after 10 magnificent days From the evening of my arrival to my departure in the morning a staff at the top always attentive nothing wrong Whether from reception to hotel staff, gardener, housekeepers, waiter at restaurant tjrs a kind word from them. Don't change anything. Always smiling 😃 😃 A real happiness Thank you again for your welcome in my room, flowers, fruits, bathrobe and small attention ♡♡ Hotel so clean and neat Nickel catering Beautiful beach, very clean pool also. Personally I do not do any activated with the entertainment team, but I have to say that these are people are just very brave and full of life so that they can give the best to the holidaymakers. Thanks also to Simba for coming to lunch and dinner with me on several occasions. I must also say that the chief animators is in my opinion very clever and false!!!! 3rd stay in 2 years and I would definitely return. Bravo to all And also a thank you to Ali for his kindness to the small business of the hotel  The Princess of the Mr. Reception sincerely thanks her Thank you again. SYLVIE

Arrival around midnight we ask you the tourist tax, we assign you a crappy room in front of a garbage dump, a blocked shower, a window that does not lock, barking dogs and motor coaches on for arrivals and departures all night, if you want a suitable room it is 30 dinars more per day here is the answer, you are pissed while the goal is holidays relaxation, we too work hard to be able to afford a holiday!! The masseuse who sleeps on you and who dares to ask you if you liked it, it’s making fun of people’s heads, the exorbitant prices for everything, we are considered cash cows, we can do nothing, knowing that the average salary is 350 euros per month there, the restaurant a lot of smoke, smell of snuff and many people have been sick, vomiting temperature diarrhea flatulence, the animators only a few are very invested if not the others it’s the hunt for the young beautiful and easy where very old but rich to leave the country, alcohol sex disco chew money, there are many problems in this hotel, nothing serious early on.  We came home sick, exhausted and disappointed

The animators are very good, good atmosphere in the hotel, there is a lot of entertainment accessible to everyone during the day.  The restaurant is varied and very good!! it was a good little stay!!  There is a beautiful beach, beautiful activities, including quad biking that I recommend!!

The animators at the toppp!! The bar restaurant on top!  We had a great weekend!!  Very smiling and friendly people from the hotel  I highly recommend  The bar is great  Lots of super well supervised animation from the animators that puts us at ease!!  Signing Diego!!!!  Thank you again to all the staff for this wonderful time!

Charming hotel with a clean private beach At the animation level, a beautiful smiling team  Three swimming pools, one covered  On the beach a camel for the pleasure of children  Variety buffet yen has for all tastes  ++ for the pastry chef  Room: correct bedding however air conditioning not activated only from 15 June it is hotddd At the bar several cocktails not too sweet With regard to the hotel's proposals The little souvenir shop: to flee  Activities to flee , henna to flee massage to flee  They confuse the euro with the dinars  Tip: leaving the hotel on the left 10 minutes walk a market with souvenirs affordable prices even that can be negotiated The massage and the henne go to MoMo hotel dar El bar either by the road on the left exiting or by the beach on the right  20 euros per massage of 1 hour and much more proposal (5 days 155 euros hammam scrub....) 20 dinars per henna  The least: the very loud music during the evening entertainment in the bar and in the theater which does not prevent to appreciate the variety of them TO RECOMMEND +++

3 star hotel   Ideally placed with a beautiful beach where camels and private deckchairs are located  A short walk is possible outside on the beach or outside or there is a small supermarket 15min walk away.   The hotel has 3 swimming pools, 1 of which is covered.  All-day activities are planned by facilitators who are not insistent. Quality evenings with superb shows  Music a little loud indoors.   The buffet is varied and of very good quality from morning to night.  The all inclusive is respected.  The room is clean and enough for a stay. However if your stay falls or the air conditioning is not activated in the room good courage, because even if there is strong heat June is June!   If you are looking for small activities watch out for the scammer  I would not recommend the shop inside the hotel at all.  But if you are looking for a place to be pampered at resonable prices compare to the hotel, walk 10min on the beach and you will find a hotel with a spa “at momo” you will not be disappointed.   I recommend and will be back.

Beautiful animation team! A nice hotel and nice buffet to discover local dishes! Very professional waiter who reserved our table every night.  For activities and excursions contact Walid, he will be at your service and for the camel ride go see Ibrahim;)

Great hotel and the animators were amazing they set a great atmosphere and offer several shows, there is something for everyone. You can also go directly through the hotel to do all kinds of activities on Djerba.

Great place with a team with little care, always smiling and concerned about our well-being...the team of animators is dynamic and caring...special dedication to Nafti aka Diego.. the staff who take care of the rooms are creative, adorable and professional. We highly recommend this property. All-you-can-eat buffet that allows you to discover new flavors every day... A stay at the top!!!! Thank you all Julien and Melanie

A hell of a team I recommend with my eyes closed.... I'll be back soon  Everything was on top  A great atmosphere, everyone is super top and it makes a difference. Thank you to all the facilitators   The hotel is clean and the buffet super good. Too bad we can't have breakfast outside

Great stay at this hotel  Everything is perfect restaurant animation ....very nice beach  Only flat no terrace for meals  A big crush for the animators ... Tchaomini nour Tito Simba blacky....and many more  See you soon....can't wait to see you again.

Very good hotel good installation team animation at the top level they regaled us all week really amazing a tight-knit team that transmits its happiness and joie de vivre  There's something for everyone and every desire  Thank you titou simba simon diego spider tchomeni dj moh nour youyou ayoub and of course maxim for water sports  Amo

Thank you to the whole team for this great stay you are all at the top. The hotel is super cool, clean with a good buffet. Great atmosphere top of the top. Thanks again to the team we don't forget you ahah ❤️(Nour, Diego, shaminy, Zizou, Titou, spider, simba, dj mo, simo, kayta🙏🏼🙏🏼

reviews.review_title: Very pleasant trip in the perfect desert
reviews.review_text: The best animator is chameseddine perfect hotel animation team at the top the pool at the top beach perfectly cleaned every morning service perfect restaurant room cleaning every day ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️���😘😘😘😘❤️😘🙏🙏🙏🙏🙏

The hotel staff and animators are very welcoming and kind The rooms are very clean Restaurant with lots of choices, very varied!! The pool and beach are very nice Beautiful sea view  Thanks to the whole team

Everything super, excelent animation team, hotel servis great, clean beach and nice sea, clean and nice swimming pool, excellent food, thank you for unfogrettable experiences, our second time in this hotel and everything great again,  thanks

I am returning tonight from 10 days in Djerba to the Hotel Al Jazzira. Week of dreams and disconnections. Unforgettable atmosphere thanks to a team of young animators full of energy. Smiling, attentive, they invite you to participate or let you rest.👍 The shows (dance and music) are worthy of professionals.  The beach a few meters away allows you to enjoy the turquoise waters or the pool and its entertainment, move or relax (2nd swimming pool quiet). Each hotel staff is present to bring you all the well-being of a successful week’s holiday. Whether it is the reception, the rooms, the restaurant, the bar, all welcome you with a smile. Looking forward to returning

The hotel is great and the buffet was also very very good there is a very varied choice, the rooms are very spacious and the beds are very comfortable, the entertainment and the animators are great too, there is access to the beach which is very convenient

Need napkins and small spoons on tables in dining rooms as I had to ask every time Need more hooks for hanging in rooms Beds are comfortable Best shower ever Rooms are clean Spa was well appointed Beach was fabulous  Staff was friendly Great place to visit

The staff was really helpful I wanted to name supervisor Azza, Farida, and Waleed the room is clean and neat. The room service are friendly the reception is welcoming. The food is healthy and delicious. With gorgeous view. I highly recommend visiting this hotel especially in summer

Amazing service by Amal and Akram. Great food and wine. Fortunately went on a peaceful Monday Night. Very convenient to have it right in front of the Movenpick hotel. good ambient and music. Had the entree sampler which was great to try different things.

Excellent service, clean room, really enjoyed the stay and had nice and friendly staff helping me all the way through. Especially Jannet was lovely to us:). Would recommend to anyone who values a clean and nice hotel experience. It all feels very luxurious

The Movenpick Gammarth is a bit of a grand old dame - an excellent location on the edge of La Marsa overlooking the bay, but a few years past its prime. After a renovation it could be spectacular, but for now it’s the best choice in the area, of the bigger hotels. The staff are doing a great job; Madame Azza and Monsieur Houcine in particular - very friendly and doing everything they can to bring the restaurant to life. Enjoy!

reviews.review_title: I was sent by a person to the spa to treat my back pain in view of all the services that are available to relax it
reviews.review_text: The staff is welcoming, the place is beautiful, the sea view is pleasant, you feel in another world in this calm that reigns, the SPA and a haven of peace, the massages are excellent, a very good service makes you want to return.

reviews.review_title: Authentic Tunisian food in the heart of Tunis
reviews.review_text: Very attentive service and great ambience. The service staff asked all the questions I had and the food tasted out of this world. The restaurant overall is very nicely decorated. Of course, the famous Tunisian olive oil is not missing from any of the tables as well, which added a delicious fresh touch to all the dishes I tried, including tajine trío and the osben couscous

reviews.review_title: Tidy and cleanliness is every big impact to us as a guest to relax during our holiday here
reviews.review_text: ROOM HERE IN SUPERIOR IS CLEAN . EVERYTHING  I NEED  THERE IS... (SUPERVISOR AZZA   IS VERY NICE  CALM  Person VERY GOOD FOR US  !POSITIVE VIBES)  JUST ONLY 1 COMMENT FOR   THE OUTSIDE CARPET OF MY ROOM TO THE TOP LOTS OF  White CRUMBS  I SEE..I THINK NEED RO HOOBER RHAT Everyday AS IT  ALL FOR THE GUEST   PART OF RELAXATION TO SEE EVERYHWE IS TIDY AND CLEAN.. . THANK YOU SO MUCH AND MASHALLAH

Very excellent hotel with impeccable workers especially azza and the chef rank fedi. Extraordinary hotel with a beautiful view , breakfast is very varied, rooms are clean , impeccable view  I will return without hesitation

The wonderful and highly recommended hotel, in Azza restaurant and fedí made us the very pleasant stay.Adel persona en concergie..made us the stay great,and it was my birthday and the hotel had a very NICE detail.HOTEL HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.. ALL GREAT.

Stay in the hotel for work. The reception the service the rooms the spa ... everything is there. Finally got to try the hotel’s traditional restaurant!!! An unforgettable moment with a sea bream worthy of a starred restaurant and exceptional service. Thank you Achoun and Akram for the welcome and good humor.

Very nice and quiet located directly on the Mediterranean Sea and from the airport fast to, architecturally very nicely designed, breakfast terrace with sea views, rooms are well equipped Excellent service. Thanks Amal😉

reviews.review_title: Hotel very nice and clean in terms of hygiene
reviews.review_text: Cleanliness is impeccable, the rooms were clean. The housekeeper Azza and the maid Janete took very good care of us and very friendly. The welcome was also perfect , all welcomed us well and warmly.

reviews.review_title: Very clean and staff is smiling and motivated
reviews.review_text: I had an exceptional stay at the Mövenpick Hotel du Lac Tunis. The staff were incredibly professional and welcoming. making me feel at home from the moment I arrived. The rooms were spacious, clean, and beautifully designed, offering great comfort

reviews.review_title: Kalisti Spa, best palce to chill out
reviews.review_text: I had opportunity t enjoy the Kalisti Spa, the indoor pool, fitness gym and massage. Fatima at reception does excellent job, explaining all the procedures. Massage with Amal was also very good. After sport she was able to get my body back to shape.I fully recommend.

Room was seafront with excellent view. Restaurant has a nice sitting outdoor area. Calm hotel in the evening perfect for relaxation after a busy day. Beautiful city. Seham "receptionist" was very helpful during check in and check out process. The staff was friendly and welcoming.

reviews.review_title: a good setting and excellent service
reviews.review_text: The Horizon is a pure wonder! The sea view is sublime and makes the setting unforgettable. The welcome of Mrs Azza, sublimated our experience. His smile and professionalism are exceptional. She made our dinner even more special. A restaurant to discover, enhanced by a perfect welcome and excellent service!

Clean restaurant located at the entrance of the beautiful MovenPick Hotel. Very good restaurant to eat typical Tunisian dishes. Thanks to Achour, Amal and Akrem for their delicate welcome and superb service.  Looking forward to seeing you again!

Many thanks to Fedi An excellent meal, enhanced by attentive, warm and fluid service. Real attention to detail, a constant smile and great efficiency that marked our experience. Thank you for this moment..

Very good stay, never disappointed with the chain accor. Friendly and welcoming staff. It was for business but it makes you want to experience it again for a holiday. Very quiet area. Service at the top, smiling welcome ............................

reviews.review_title: Exceptional Stay at Marriott Sousse Pearl!
reviews.review_text: I had the pleasure of staying at the Marriott Sousse Pearl Resort & Spa for two days, and it was a truly wonderful experience. From the moment I arrived, the team made me feel welcomed and well taken care of.  A special thanks to Handi, the manager, for his professionalism and attentiveness. Majid at the front desk was incredibly helpful and courteous, making the check-in process smooth and pleasant. I also want to highlight Wafa from the Guest Relations team—she was always smiling and radiated warmth throughout my stay.  The hotel itself is beautiful and well-maintained, with great facilities and a relaxing atmosphere. I highly recommend it to anyone visiting Sousse. I’m definitely looking forward to returning!

Rooms are beautiful. Staff amazingly friendly. Food is good. Look after you with everything. Entertainment is a great night with great entertainment team. Fare’s is a great laugh and a credit to the hotel. And the manager too he’s super good person

Hi just returned from a two week stay at this hotel this is our 6 visit from arriving to leaving it was fantastic first Haroun on reception was of great help as were the others .its a very friendly hotel the general manager made him self known to all the guests the security staff were always up for a laugh. Entertainment was good especially the dra queens (changing Ladies) would like to thank mozad and all the staff that made our stay a happy one

Love this hotel I visit sousse often staying at different hotels but the marriott is special,the authentic tusian food I just love they do lots of other options if that's no your thing,staff omg I don't know were to start fatiha who I think went the extra mile with my room spotless and sooo freindly, salha (sorry if I slepted that wrong)he never left me without a coffee or fresh juice in my hand they make my stay so special, the reption staff,the waiting staff ,there is honestly too many people to thank,I go for few days to take break from caring for my dad and all the staff make me feel sooo looked after, the new manager is lovely too.the hotel is beautiful very calming pool area is my favourite spot it's lovely. Can't wait to be back. Ps they have lovely pool for kids

The hotel is of an unimaginable mediocrity. The rooms have no comfort, even the bathroom has no ventilation: it is a small room without air extractor or even a window. The room overlooks an unpleasant side of the city. But the biggest surprise was the food: it was of the worst possible quality, you can easily find better in a 3-star hotel. Frankly, this property deserves no more than the 3-star rating.

We (five friends) have just returned from the Sousse Pearl where we had an absolutely wonderful 7 days of pure indulgence ☀️🍷🍻☕🏖️.  From arrival to departure we were treated like royalty from every single member of staff.  Our adjoining room on the 6th floor was terrific with sea views and good sized balconies.  We spent every day at the large pool area where Taemar organised our sunning spot every morning and the bar staff looked after us all day 🍻🍷☕💯.  The Restaurant Staff were just amazing and the food was good and plentiful.  Our last night was pretty special as our table had been decorated with silk runner and rose 🌹 petals.  A special mention goes to Fathi for going above and beyond and Ammar for his smiley 😊 face at breakfast.  All in all one of the best holidays we have been on.  Thank you to the Manager and his team of friendly, helpful staff 🩷  Maggie Johnston

Coming to the end of our 10 day stay at this hotel , the hotel rooms are excellent and the staff go above and beyond to make sure you have a wonderful holiday from the cleaners right up to the general managers everybody here at this hotel is at your beck and call to make sure you have a fantastic time
Very nice experience, everything was well-appointed and the crew was so helpful and memorable and thank you the famous 7th floor balcony was so helpful and beautiful.💐💐💐💐💐💐💐💐💐💐💐💐💐💐💐💐💐💐💐💐💐💐💐💐💐💐💐💐💐💐💐

The rooms are clean, the personal are friendly. The food is good, if You like the spaicy food. ♥️🤗 The hotel is nearly beach. 🌴🌅🏖️. I sugest to go in many trip because are not many activities into to în the hotel. The spa is perfect and the pool is clean and not deep, about 1.45m. In general, was a good vacantion and I feel comfotble. Good jobs!♥️🥰

This hotel is one of the best I’ve stayed in, it is perfect for amenities and its location right on the beach. Food is excellent, and the restaurant staff and chefs are second to none. The bars are always attended so you can always get your drinks, they even go and bring them to you. Now the entertainment, there are 3 of them, Massimo who is in charge then Momoo, and not forgetting the lovely Rania all three of them start really early and finish late and in that time they offer a full programme they include everyone, you can do as much as you like or as little, but you will always see them around smiling. The pool areas are immaculate and staffed by at least 2 lifeguards so little ones can feel safe, pools are 1.5 metres, there is a heated indoor pool sauna steam room and a intensive package should you require massages of all types. The hotel is very secure with 24hour security always present and you can always feel safe. I would have no hesitation whatsoever in recommending this hotel to anyone as you will not be disappointed. I cannot wait to return early in June of this year to see all my friends we made whilst in the hotel. 5* in all departments  Our room was 402

reviews.review_title: Nice getaway in a nice place
reviews.review_text: My stay in the Sousse Pearl Marriott was really very enjoyable but as with all nice holidays the time went too fast.  I can't find much complaints about the hotel. The rooms are clean and spacious and comfortable. Had the best sleep in ages while I was here. The staff were all friendly from reception, to the restaurant and the lifeguard Fawes.   The spa with shout outs to Meriem and monia. The animation team of Moomoo and Rania all were wonderful and looked after me and everyone. Send them my regards should you meet them.  The animation team provided entertainment during the day and interesting events in the evening from karaoke and live music.   The food was varied and nice and there's something for everyone mostly. You'll be able to find something you'd like.  All in all I would definitely come back as there wasn't enough time and this was a nice place to come back to.

I don’t usually write reviews but, This hotel has got to the best hotel I’ve stayed in, in sousse. I have been Sousse several times but this is my favourite. The Rooms are nice and clean, the food was very tasty, drinks nice. All the staff was nice and very professional. Manager Maher was very nice and front desk supervisor Mohammed. I would definitely recommend this hotel and I will be visiting again.

reviews.review_title: Good experience at the Marriott Hotel
reviews.review_text: The Marriott Hotel is a great hotel , not far from the center of Sousse. The hotel is clean , welcoming and all the staff is nice and kind. The rooms are comfortable, the meals are delicious. The animations are great, the fun is there! 🤩

This hotel has beautiful rooms, good and primitive staff, good food, a nice restaurant, big,clean and beautiful pools, a nice view to the sea, the beach has very good sand. I also met the best animation. You can t get bored with this animators. Very nice!

Super service from Hauskeeping named Fatiha.  We are extremely pleased with the work of our housekeeper Fatiha. It is very reliable, thorough and organized. All agreed tasks are always completed on time and with great care. We particularly appreciate her discretion and friendly manner – she is always polite, respectful and pleasant to deal with.

Super staff Doria the breakfast chef is incredible as well as the head chef and all the team from pool gards , reception to housekeeper , very thoughtful and kind  Restaurant chef always catering our special needs . Thank you to the whole team for making our stay beyond special

Best hotel in Sousse, the entire staff really make this place special. Feels like a home away from home, from the beautiful aesthetic to the incredible local, fresh & tasty buffet this place is an absolute Gem !   Thank you to the incredible staff and special mention to our Chef for the Mlokhia 😉

It was a wonderful experience in Marriott Sousse, the facilities were great and amazing, staff so friendly. I would like to extend my deepest thanks to Ms. Zuhaira housekeeping supervisor, she provides outstanding service with a warm and welcoming attitude. She’s professional, efficient, and always ready to assist the guests with a smile. Her communication skills and ability to handle inquiries with patience make the hotel experience much smoother. Thanks Zuhaira and keep it up.

reviews.review_title: An unforgettable welcome at Marriott Sousse, thanks to the Executive Chef
reviews.review_text: ⸻  ! Upon arrival, I was touched by the warm welcome and attention to detail. Special mention to Executive Chef Karim Bannour , whose kindness, availability and passion are felt in the dishes as well as in the atmosphere of the hotel.

reviews.review_title: It was a successful experience. Thank you all
reviews.review_text: All thanks and appreciation to the manager and all the hotel workers, the animation, especially the restaurant and the chef for the special reception to meet our desires. I hope to return here and I recommend trying this hotel to visitors.👌

Great and clean hotel with wonderful foods , accommodation like the spa and the animation,   the stuff is so professional specially the receptionist  Mm  Fathia and mr mohamed and the director I highly recommended. I will certainly come back in my next vacation.

As for hotel the very welcoming and pleasant staff the only flat just arrived we jump on you to book the activities. ( A little stuffy) The animations on top every day different themes for the restaurant's welcome meals quite different every day. For the snack you'll have to think about the kids ( pizza not great )  We should review the safety of elevators too dangerous for children the doors close on um and do not open 😪  This is a great place to stay.

The waiters were very welcoming especially tahair and hasty the best waiters the housekeeping was not really at the rendezvous but a very warm welcome! Lots of good food activity but I advise you to take the all-inclusive formula on the site because otherwise it is 40€ per day that is really too expensive!

An unforgettable stay in a great hotel! We had a great time in this hotel, everything was perfect from start to finish. The property is beautiful, clean and very well maintained.  A huge bravo to the animation team: Djo, Mickael, Rio... You were great, always smiling, dynamic and attentive, you contributed greatly to make our stay even more enjoyable!  Many thanks also to Salah and his whole team for their warm welcome and professionalism. We felt like home from the moment we arrived.  We recommend this hotel 100%! We will be back with great pleasure 😊  Manon, Marion, Amélie

We came for about ten days with friends. One thing is certain, we feel like home except that we have a team that is really taking care of it. I found the establishment to be really intimate with small spaces in different parts of the establishment.  The big big +++++ is the quality of service. We made 3 hotels advertised as equivalent, the golden tulip is above the level of staff sympathy. Special mention to Taher who took care of us so well!  We really spent 10 days relaxing pile what we needed. Thank you!!

Very friendly hotel especially when you have children there is a kind of crèche where the nannies are great and the activities offered by the hotel are top. The animators also and there is a boom every night for the children. The meals are ok and the staff friendly. The rooms are simple but friendly.

Entertainment brilliant with Michael Jackson, very friendly, taher the barman made us feel so welcome. All staff brilliant. Starving as meals not catered really for british.
