Enjoyed pirate ship and camel ride and aladine does a lovely henna.  Room service perfect, all we needed for our break. reception always helpful.  Cleopatra shop outside hotel gates less pushy than shops inside hotel.

Stay at the top, welcome and especially a waiter from the hotel called taher who is adorable, a true love. Thanks to him for having was there for our stay and guiding us in not my things. He took care of us and very polite. We'll never forget you. Otherwise excursions to the top, and nice hotel.

We stayed a week and we are already sad to be back!  Indeed, there are small negative things about the rooms , we stayed a week with a blocked shower with two young children and the bedding is very hard! But in fact we don’t care because the little things to improve are caught up by the kindness of all the hotel staff, special mention for the waiters and animators who are of an incredible kindness, and the little care of the children! I find that value for money , there is nothing to blame! The buffet is fine. We may come back;-)  JANIN THIVOS family Justine/ Yoann , Tom and Leo

The only good thing about the holiday was the staff taher was very attentive went out of his way to help always checking if needed anything always working unlike the outside staff facilities are terrible mouldy bathroom ant infested room food cold

Impeccable hotel, very clean, very warm welcome. We had a wonderful stay, we are delighted.  The staff, Ashraf, Mohammed Ali, Taher, Atef, as well as all the staff.Very nice meetings. Swimming pool and great atmosphere we will come back!! See you soon.

Very good stay I recommend the waiters Taher Very efficient and mohamed Ali at the adorable restaurant.  Atef also very nice encounters.  Hotel very clean very large pool, efficiency of all staff. Good job. We are sad to leave today, we will be back soon.

Fethia (receptionist) was very welcoming and nice. The Bartender Souhail was a really good host and made our holiday!!! Overall, the service in the hotel is amazing the staff really do go above and beyond. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Stay mixed level cleanliness to see curtains room full of tasks, cleaning done to the va quickly when it is done we were hit at 6.30pm to make the room abused. Bed even a 5 year old does it best just the sheets put back on the bed not even bordered between the two beds. Stains on the carpet that brings to the room for evidence nice coffee stayed 2 days on the floor. Sock that must wait desperately to find the way back to the garbage on the ledge of our balcony (stayed the 10 days we were present). Let’s not talk about the car alarms that ring every night as well as the hoods of the kitchens that start at 6:30 am just like the diskettes of the works. No one from the smiling reception when you arrive but then after you don't have to ask. Fortunately the waiters gave us a smile and why we were on holiday tt particularly Osama of extreme kindness. Clean and quiet pool , decent food. Bad experience for this hotel.

Apart from the uncomfortable beds, the President is a welcoming place due to the friendly waiters and always with a smile and entertainers who knew how to involve you and entertain you. Karlos, Michael, Djo and Jabrane are top.  Carefree stay and to repeat

We are disappointed by room located near a technical room equipped with a noisy engine. Otherwise the room is clean and the breakfast is hearty and varied. We also visited other hotels in Cape Town that offer better value for money.

All the staff at the top especially Taher helpful friendly. The only downside the dilapidated bungalows, dirty curtains, no hair dryer, medium cleaning.Also no decent food. Clean swimming pool good animation. Housekeeper not very friendly.

Well placed hotel , beach nearby, friendly waiters , pity lack of hygiene in the room , dirty curtains , stain on the ground when we arrived unwashed throughout our stay , and the presenter of the excursions really haughty , lets you know that she is not happy if you do not take with her the excursions, besides a few meters away the rates are divided by 4 compared to what she offers .

reviews.review_title: Nice quad bike ride and visit Tunisia and its souk
reviews.review_text: Friendly staff, cooking not varied enough according to the nationalities of the holidaymakers. Cleanliness is not very dirty carpeting in the hallways of the rooms with extra cat droppings as a gift.  4 days were enough for us!!. Too bad the views of the photos on the site.

Customer service at Golden Tulip President Hammamet and customer care was sadly lacking  unfortunately. Everyone remembers how you treat them and the women staff at the reception, for example Wiem was so so un helpful for simple enquiry, there was almost a fear to actually go to the receptionist for help or support because of thier disinterest in actually helping. They continue conversation with local language speakers and avoided eye contacted each time you approached them. For simple requests, we booked a family room with a sea view.but was put in a bungalow far away from the hotel, with stairs with a baby/ a push chair, each time It rained It was sliperey, so imagine having to carry that up and down the stairs. This room also had no WiFi access, Eventually after asking again and again and again, we got moved, to a different room, although this was not the sea view room we paid for. The experience at this hotel was just unfortunate as we've previously had a great experience with other staff at a different hotel in Tunisia. Some of the staff in the kitchen were helpful. The food was okay, however, management/leadership at the hotel would benefit from ups killing their staff on customers care and better service.

reviews.review_title: Lovely hotel shame about the surrounding areas
reviews.review_text: Hotels is lovely as are its staff especially the night time bar staff in the indoor bar (I did have their names on a piece of paper at my request however this has now been through the wash 😟) our room was beautiful and specious with a lovely view, we were all inclusive so min bar topped up daily in the room. We would have struggled if we were half board like a lot of the guests as there isn’t anything near the hotel. On check in our room wasn’t ready but the guy handling our check in was polite and friendly and we were able to access all of the facilities whilst we waited. Pool and garden areas were clean and well maintained, the pool bar opened whilst we were there which made getting drinks in the day time easier as prior to this we had to get dressed and walk to the inside bar (a minor inconvenience) The beach for the hotel is lovely however the beach bar was not open during our stay) the food was fresh and lovely and the staff were happy to make things fresh. The spa is definitely worth a visit and not expensive if you book a package as these work out much cheeper. We had a hammam, soap scrub the lady which did this was fantastic she sang and chatted to us throughout and was so lovely, we then had massages it cost less the £80 for the 2 of us.This is out of the control of the hotel but the surrounding area is scruffy,  the beaches were disgusting, full of litter and on our walk to the new town we passed a dead turtle which had clearly been there a while 😖 our visit to the old town wasn’t much better and I would only recommend this if you liked to be hassled and dragged around by people constantly. We visit lots of Arabic countries and have been to Tunisia historically but we felt unsafe and uneasy leaving our hotel so wouldn’t recommend. The hotel is perfect for a relaxing, don’t leave the hotel all inclusive week

We were here for the second time and it was like the first time again very nice and relaxing! The service was great again! The whole staff is very friendly and accommodating! We found the loud seminars that took place there a bit disturbing! Unfortunately, there are more and more hotel guests and this is not only noticeable here who go to dinner wearing sweatpants! Otherwise everything is fine!

Overall, this was a good experience which improved each day. The staff are accommodating. The rooms are very spacious and the grounds are well maintained. A public beach is at the rear of the hotel and is an added bonus for all. There are also several pools ( indoor and outdoor). There is a shop on site to cater for all your needs and for anyone wanting a spot of pampering there is a beauty salon as well as Turkish baths. I used the gym several times and did classes with the fitness instructor at the hotel. Special thanks to Daly, who was very professional and gave me some excellent advice on exercises to do at home.  Oceana is a decent hotel to relax,  unwind and escape to. Thank you to all the staff who made my stay an enjoyable one!

Great stay! a staff with little care, a superb SPA center a huge thank you to Hemène and Sonia for their kindness and professionalism, a very good and varied buffet, everything was perfect and the sun was on the rendezvous I tell you soon. Peggy

I am very satisfied with my stay. The staff is very attentive, smiling, available and very welcoming. The atmosphere of the hotel is warm. Many thanks to the whole team for their professionalism and kindness.

reviews.review_title: Booking this hotel again when we get home!!
reviews.review_text: We had not visited Tunisia before and were not sure what to expect.  We loved our stay more on each of the 10 days we have been here.  So much so that this is the 1st holiday we have ever been on that we plan to rebook again (for a similar time next year) as soon as we get home!!   The hotel, our room (pool and sea view) and the grounds were all beautiful and very clean.   All the staff are super friendly and efficient. A very high standard of customer service from everyone who works here. The room was exactly like the pictures, on the booking site...very clean and spacious and the bed & pillows were very comfortable. The hotel location is great! Right on a beautiful beach, in a peaceful location.  Jasmine Hammemet is walkable, or a short and cheap taxi away.  Old town Hammemey was not walkable but the taxi fare is still only around £3 to £4 each way.  There were lots of people we met that were returning.  One couple were back for a 33rd visit!  I almost didn't want to leave a review in case it ruins our next experience because of becoming too popular!! Overall a holiday that exceeded our expectations and I can see us visiting many more times in the future. Thank you to everyone at the hotel for a wonderful holiday x

reviews.review_title: Second time as good as the first.
reviews.review_text: Second time at Oceana, we loved it as much as the first. The hotel is always clean, the rooms are spacious and comfortable and the grounds are immaculate. We prefer to visit out of season for the quiet but obviously don't get to experience everything on offer as it's pre-season.  Only minor issue we had was a large conference event shortly after arrival. This is quite off-putting for guests as the conference attendees take over the restaurant and consume everything. Another guest has addressed this, so I'm not going to go over old ground.   There is also a guy in the hotel, I won't name him as he is there legitimately, but he hangs about the toilets, trying to organise  trips into Hammamet, amongst other things. Strikes me a snake oil salesman, but if I want something, I'll ask. I don't want to feel like I need to find alternative toilets to avoid him.  Every single member of the Oceana team go above and beyond, and they will always find a way to assist, even if you don't understand each other. They will find a way. Special nod to Bashir in the restaurant, the morning chef (sorry, I didn't get your name), Ramy at poolside, and Fatima in housekeeping. So many more who's names I didn't catch.  Can't wait to go back again.

reviews.review_title: Great break in a beautiful hotel.
reviews.review_text: We took the opportunity of a pre- high season package for a restful,half-board break, in relaxed surroundings - exactly what we needed and got. Stunning hotel, spacious junior suite and balcony, great view, excellent reception and restaurant staff, lovely grounds.

Lovely hotel well worth visiting.  Grounds amazing and very well maintained.  Staff all lovely and friendly and go above and beyond  Food variety good. April is pre season and pretty quiet but enjoyed that even though we went during Easter school holiday. Beach bar etc not open due to low occupancy but bar staff amazing  Indoor pool heated and lovely beach area with numerous sunbeds & umbrellas with attentive staff.  Would like to say that:- Touis (bar waiter) amazing so thoughtful and makes an amazing Pina Colada and was so friendly to my twins.  Daly (personal trainer) was great with the kids and went above and beyond to adjust his schedule to fulfil our needs.  Rami (poolboy) kept the pool in immaculate condition and was there with your towels and sunbed cushions as soon as you appeared near the pool.  Thank you for a great stay and holiday.

A lovely hotel!.  We had a junior suite with a stunning view.  Amazingly comfortable beds  All the staff bar none were attentive and super friendly. Food excellent and varied.  Indoor pool heated.   Immaculate grounds. Super soft sandy beach.  Good, not overpowering evening entertainment.  The gym instructor, Daly was exceptional. Super qualified. He made sure there were sessions to suit all from meditation to pilates as well as gym and pool . April is very much pre season, so not too many guests..I love that!

The hotel itself is lovely, and the staff are truly outstanding — they go above and beyond. One evening, my daughter, who’s quite a picky eater, didn’t like anything at the buffet. The chef noticed, and without hesitation, went to the kitchen and made her some pasta just for her. That kind of service really stood out.  There are a few downsides. The hotel is showing some signs of wear, particularly in the carpets, bathrooms, and some of the seating in the restaurant, which could use updating. We stayed in a spacious suite with a sea view, and the beds were incredibly comfortable. However, the air-conditioning wasn’t on, which made it hard to sleep. I requested a fan, but it never arrived — disappointing, especially from a 5-star hotel at the price we paid.  One thing to note: the hotel hosts a lot of conferences, and this really should be mentioned during booking. Tourists were definitely in the minority during our stay. The conference groups completely took over the restaurant. Some were quite rude and acted with a sense of entitlement, showing little regard for paying guests — something that should be better managed by the hotel.  The food was okay, but perhaps not to our taste. We weren’t expecting sausage and peppers or boiled potatoes for breakfast, for example. Not a complaint, just an observation. There were no snacks available between meals, aside from a plate of crisps at the bar, which felt lacking for an all-inclusive package — especially considering the price.  We also visited the marina one evening, but unfortunately, it wasn’t a great experience. It felt run-down, with many shops closed and the area quite dirty — though perhaps it’s better in the summer months. Also, be prepared to be firm with the local street sellers.  All in all, a mixed experience: excellent staff and spacious rooms, but let down by a few avoidable issues that could really elevate the stay if addressed.

Food was good, staff were excellent, resort was really nice and the a la carte restaurant food was first class. There were four classes a day at the gym from pilates to boxercise. The personal trainer tailored his classes for all levels of ability and was very professional and knowledgeable. Would highly recommend.

Been back a week now, I have to say this was the most relaxing break I've had. The hotel occupancy was low, never more than 30 guests, which worried me at first as I thought I might get bored, but I soon got used to the tranquility and quiet. Staff were fantastic, especially Sameh on reception, who upgraded me to a sea view room at check in. There are no animation/entertainment team at the hotel, which was a first for me, had a couple of treatments at the spa which were inexpensive, good choice of food everyday and chilled evening entertainment.  Glad I paid that little bit extra for the all inclusive as I was drinking Jonnie Walker red label whisky every night, also included was Gordon's gin and other premium spirits. Had a relaxing week and would highly reccomend Oceana, I will be returning.

I have mixed feelings about this hotel. I was blown away when I walked in to the reception with its high ceilings, beautiful decor and view to the pool and sea.  Reception staff were welcoming, attentive and polite.  I was shown to my junior suite, which was spacious and clean.  But there were some details in the room that needed attention such as the shower, where the water cascaded through the shower door onto the bathroom floor and the shower head where the small outlets needed a good clean so that they all worked and directed downward.  I had a massage during my stay which was great and good value for money, although not the massage I asked for, but I think that was a language barrier.   Restaurant food and its staff were amazing. They remember your name, where you like to sit, what you like to drink. Food was varied, fresh and well presented.  Cons: There were children staying at the hotel, but when I had booked this, it was advertised as an adult only hotel. Finally,  as a solo female traveller, i occasionally felt uncomfortable with the level of attention from some of the male staff.

We stayed at the hotel off session in March 25, this is stated as a 5* and the amenities didn't let us down with great service from the reception and Salah who really made sure everything was done properly. we stayed in a junior suite which had a walk in wardrobe, free mini fridge and safe (as we went all inclusive). Drinks and food where at a very good quality, mainly Fish, Lamb & Chicken dishes, the red wine was severed by the glass , 1/2 or full bottle great deserts.  a walk to the Marina down from the private beach is do-able (20mins). would recommend this hotel especially if you just want to chill with the option the take the Taxi to the market in Hammamet ( 15 - 20 Dina). we also had the Spa treatment at the hotel which was excellent, Sonia I think was her name who sang and was very good with the start of our treatment. we also had a free Al-a-cart meal included in our stay which was really nice with a higher spec of meal & wine. CONS - exchanged money has restrictions so don't take any out of the country, defo eat before you get to the airport as the only place open was a baguette and burger place which was £12 for a burger and chips... a sandwich shop and shop selling bags before you go past passport control is the only place you can spend Dina.

Best hotel we have ever stayed at! Great rooms, great terrace, impressive bar, super friendly staff! Good food! And even if you take the all-in formula, you don't get a strap around your arm like you do in all other hotels. Are 5 stars more than worth it! Second time here and we'll be back!

The best hotel I've ever been to! Unprecedented friendliness, all inclusive, beautiful... I felt like a prince I the Maghreb! Good food, delicious drinks... Big big congratulations to the whole team! We were here the second time and will definitely be back.

We had one of the best stays at the oceana hotel, the food is too good and the pool is heated, we booked the spa and steam room , it is a more beautiful experience.  A big thank you in all the hotel staff, reception, restaurant and steam room. Goodbye, and we'll be back soon.

reviews.review_title: One of the best stays in Hammamet
reviews.review_text: We spent 4 days there. And it was just perfect for relaxation. The staff were so welcoming and very kind. They helped me plan my mother's birthday. The room was top notch clean and very very spacious. I will be definitely coming back. Food buffet was diverse and dinner service was good with servers and chefs making sure our needs were met.

First impressions, the reception and bar area are stunning! I arrived at night, but this didn’t impact upon the hospitality. I received a welcome drink and - without requesting - a plate of cold cuts, cheeses and salads were sent to my room. I didn’t go to bed hungry! On waking I pulled the curtains and was greeted by both beautiful gardens, pool and sea view.  The hotel suited me as it had an intimate feel - although large. Staff are friendly and helpful anticipating your needs and remembering your orders each day. Staying here took the work out of my holiday.  I came to rest, and rest I did!

reviews.review_title: A pleasant Tunisian hotel in a pleasant location
reviews.review_text: Following the recent opening of a direct flight from Moscow to Tunisia, we decided to revisit that country. Of the available hotels, Regency was interested in Monastir. Among the great advantages is its central position with the possibility to walk quietly through the port (Marina) even in the late evening.   Also in line of sight and the main attractions i.e. Ribat and the Bugriba Mausoleum. Very high quality and good food for breakfasts, lunches and dinners with strawberries and shrimp. A pleasant and colorful building of the hotel itself.  Animation by physical activity is qualitative and varied. True, there's no gym but it's not noticeable. Rooms are clean, quiet and well cleaned. There is a children's club and a small playground, but the girl in charge of them doesn't like to show up there and a search for her is necessary for its use.  It's a nice impression overall.

reviews.review_title: Great stay! Special mention to the ani Fram team
reviews.review_text: The buffet was varied: during our 8 days on site, no meal was alike, which was very appreciated! The room was superb, comfortable and well maintained, and the staff always smiling and attentive.  Special mention to Wadja, Firass, Djo and Gigi, who marked our stay with their kindness, kindness and the quality of the activities they offer on a daily basis. Many thanks to them for their energy and presence!  Not to mention Rayan who was very attentive and attentive throughout our stay!   Thank you all and recommend this hotel, which I would probably do again soon!

One of the best stays I had! The Regency Monastir hotel really surprised me with the quality of its service, its warm atmosphere and especially its exceptional entertainment team. A big bravo to the Fram team, especially Wadja, Firas, Djoe and Chef Rayan, who made each moment unique. Their energy, kindness and professionalism made all the difference. Thank you for these unforgettable memories, I will return without hesitation!

Photographer saber he is really professional and kind .I recommend he has a creative eye with a pretty carded sunset and, beach ,hibiscus ,pottery ,Tunisia in all this splendor.thanks to him he is a magician . And the rates pretty good

Aging hotel poorly maintained and dirty Staff are doing their utmost but there are not enough The piece of sand that serves as a beach is a real garbage can, garbage everywhere We are extremely disappointed with this stay, the hotel does not conform to the description.  The director does what he can...... Thanks to Rayan for his very professional welcome Only positive the restaurant

Simple and quiet hotel very well located next to the marina and 5 minutes from the medina. Lots of varied walks to do around the hotel.  Very nice staff whether at reception, bar, restaurant and entertainment team. Director often present and discreet. Clean rooms Thanks to Rayan for his kindness and professionalism.  We will definitely come back

Great stay at Regency, nice hotel, varied food it was good with choice. The clean room with sea view at the top (the bathroom would need a little refreshment but otherwise correct) towel replaced daily with room made. Special mention to the photographer SABER really pro with superb photos 🤩 really do not hesitate. The beach not very clean pity. We also enjoyed the massage spa really well 👍  Team of top animators 👍 Willy, Barbie and Jawad the best. I recommend. Nelly et Eric

The food was plain and the beach super dirty. The pool bar didn’t work. The rooms were dirty, the towels were not changed, even when i asked for it. 10 euro for a beach towel in a 4-stars hotel is a joke. For the price i paid i expected much more. The standard of the hotel is definitely not 4 stars.

Disappointing experience to put it mildly. The facilities were outdated, cleanliness was an ongoing issue, and many of the advertised amenities were either unavailable or not functioning properly. The hotel felt neglected and poorly maintained. For the price paid, I expected a much higher standard. I would not recommend this place to others and won’t be returning.

The hotel very good and we anjoy a lot in our vacation and we are sad to come back home it was the best trip i want thingink the theme of animation they are very good we anjoy a lot and i want thank willy because he is the best 😍 animateur framissima the bar good the food okay and we will come back very soon

Visit from May 2 to 9, Super friendly animation team, games and entertainment are at the rendezvous despite a quiet week at the level of the holidaymakers.  The waiters at the restaurant are super friendly also, the food is very good and varied. The rooms are quite old but clean, the bedding is perhaps to be reviewed. The location of the hotel is ideal because 5 minutes from the city center, I recommend Fram outings with the animators, it is very interesting. The pool bar is not open with regret. At the interior bar, space not reserved for hotel guests and I regret that the service is less neat for guests in all exclusive. Sometimes we walk past you four times without looking at you and we serve you cocktails that have nothing to do with what you asked for, it's a little sloppy. In terms of security I find it is borderline, the outdoor gates access beach are smashed, so everyone goes back access to the pool and the hotel. The more non-hotel guests at the bar, it's open bar, the more smoking in a part of the bar. Otherwise, I recommend treatments and massages at the spa, they are all very gifted and kind.

team at the top!! Thanks to Willy for his dynamism and good humor on a daily basis, thanks to the whole team for their work, their availability and their good humor. The buffet well stocked and the hotel is very well placed, close to the center, in short we had a very good stay I recommend

reviews.review_title: An unforgettable stay with my lover a regency
reviews.review_text: Hotel Regency is an excellent place for a romantic holiday with a welcoming staff and excellent in their work , the animator Mado is a beautiful source of joy his ability to create the right atmosphere and has integrated the clientele

Hotel Regency offers exceptional experiences to guests with various activities and welcoming staff and a pleasant atmosphere with the animator Mado he is excellent in his very welcoming field , his enthusiasm is infectious

Animation was sooo good, Willy is the best dancer and animator haha! Was realy good and fun! Everything in the hotel was good, food etc. but it is the animations and games that I remember best. Willy and the others do a very good job! I recommend

reviews.review_title: A fantastic trip with a great atmosphere!
reviews.review_text: I’m very happy with the trip – the hotel had a perfect location in the city center, the food and drinks were excellent, the rooms were large, spacious, and had comfortable beds. Everyone was friendly and smiling, both the hotel staff and the other guests. Special recognition goes to the animation team – they were upbeat, cheerful, and full of energy. A big bonus was Willy’s amazing dance skills, which made it impossible not to jump onto the dance floor with joy.

I highly recommend the hotel, delicious food,  delicious food, clean rooms, very nice service, beautiful weather and very nice animators! Great fun thanks to the animators The evening was super fun, the best vacation of my life I will definitely go back there with pleasure

I was already 3. Mal im Hotel Regency. I love the hotel. The location is perfect. The staff are very friendly. I had a fantastic time. The animator team is great. Especially Mado and Jo. They always spread a good mood. Her laughter is infectious. Boredom doesn't come up. I'll be back in the fall.

it was my first time visiting and it was so beautiful. they welcomed us so good and everyone working at the hotel was so nice they always made sure are satisfied with everything. the animation team was amazing they always made sure we have fun. especially mado he's funny and he's good with communication and  we spend a good time with him and the team .

I was in this hotel at May 2025. I fly there with my friends and we spend good time there. There was a lot of activity. My favourite animator is Willy. He is the best animator and the best dancer in the world. He help people and he take care of people.

Holiday with my mom ❤️ They were exceptional  The entertainment team is on top  Talk with us, the evenings super close to the holidaymakers we laughed  Super aquagym animations, darts....  Thank you to Mizo, kouki, sat...❤️

The hotel is good we came with family ... my 16 year old daughter was approached by an animator ... apparently they bring the girls up to their rooms no control for this serious subject they do not protect themselves from your children!  To flee this hotel no control and security

Overall the experience here was great! Some issues but were promptly rectified by staff when made aware!  The entertainment could be slightly better however the kids enjoyed it!  The food was absolutely amazing and a big thank you to the restaurant staff for looking after us so well! Everyone is super friendly and polite!

Top hotel and spa is beautiful ✨ The whole team is super friendly and welcoming. The animators are great too, especially Kouki, Mane, Myzo and Sam!  Very nice and good dancers! Thank you for all the wonderful memories.

Very good club value for money, the food is very good and varies, the staff is friendly, animation team overall at the top except Mr Mane too proud to say BJ even when he crosses you and looks at you.... Otherwise, bungalow very functional but a bit old  I will definitely come back soon after the work..

The staff is very nice and always smiling.   The animation team is at the top. They are very welcoming and attentive to travelers. (special mention for kouki, miso, mane and sat)   The food is delicious.   There’s always something to worry about, you never get bored

Super friendly family hotel, animation team with Sam, Kookie, Mizo and Mane on top. The buffet very variable and tasty. The choice of swimming pools with / without entertainment and the.beach. Super friendly and kind staff. A family hotel to try

Very nice stay between mothers and daughters 🥰 The hotel staff is charming and always smiling. The animation team at the top 🥳🤩🥳 Special mention for Kouki, Sam, Mane and Mizo 😍 Thank you for those memorable memories❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️

This hotel is cleaned constantly,  the place is huge. Lots of sports , nice walk through the grounds to the beach. Kids pool 2 main out side pools 1 of them more peaceful near to beach. 1 Indoor pool lovely and warm Bar staff are nice some a little grumpy.  Restraunt staff the waiters are lovely. Chefs are  nice  Best and above all and what makes the hotel worth a look are the animation team! Not just for kids.  They are lovely, friendly and so funny. Always making sure your ok. Sam, kouki, mosi, mane, sousi, nina can't remember everyone's name . Made our holiday worth it .

What to say to summarize this experience... To begin with, the rooms: everything you would expect from a hotel like this, clean and comfortable service, bonus point for the women of households who took care of the well-being of our soft toys.  Regarding the restaurant, very good surprise. A fairly recurrent base pleasing to as many people as possible, and different specialties every day to discover new flavors. The pool: the choice is there! 5 swimming pools with different atmospheres to have different fun each day!  Special mention to Sam, Kouki and Nina for their warm welcome, exceptional! I recommend, see you soon.

Second time in Tunisia, but first time in this hotel, what is sure is that I will come back. From the moment we arrived the staff showed exemplary professionalism to welcome us in the best possible conditions. The rooms are clean and very spacious. Daily they are refurbished with great care. The food service is quality, the dishes change every day while keeping a base to please everyone. The biggest plus of this establishment: animation. Teams smiling and always in a good mood. The activities are varied, the shows worked, a big bravo! In particular, I wanted to thank Kouki, Nina and Sam for making our holiday memorable. See you soon

My daughter spent an amazing week in this hotel as part of the ‘share your dance’ project. Everything was perfect pools and many activities. Dance classes were held on the beach which is a few steps away.perfect for an inclusive week.

reviews.review_title: Excellent staff and exceptional animation team
reviews.review_text: Animation was fantastic, we enjoyed all of the group entertainment and also the shows. The hotel staff were excellent, couldn’t do enoughThe waiting staff exceptional. Will definitely be back especially to see Sousou and Sam kouki bob😍😍

The animation team were absolutely amazing especially sousou,bob,kouki,sam and mizu they were exeptional every day and the shows every night were spectacular each day with a different theme that were all amazing  along with a array of different activities for us to do every day

Dirty bed with insect smell of moisture and room not secure when we press the window it opens in addition the housekeepers come once out of 10 and the staff not at all pleasant on the other hand there is a good atmosphere and the food is not bad

A big thank you to all the hotel staff who have become accustomed to welcoming us for the 4th consecutive year as part of the event "share your dance" at a time when you can take full advantage of the outdoor infrastructure to take a dip in one of the pools, a small game of tennis, padel or volleyball, a game of pétanque and many other activities... The rooms are spacious and functional, the food varied and tasty and the service is impeccable carried by available, efficient and particularly caring staff. A service to the TOP at all levels! Always a pleasure to come back!

Once again, a huge thank you to Mr. Anouar, the hotel manager, and all his team for their incredible welcome.  We stayed with six international delegations in the organisation of the "Share Your Dance" event, it was by all accounts an extraordinary moment.  Thank you Anouar.

reviews.review_title: An unforgettable stay in the framework of sharing your dance!
reviews.review_text: A superb stay spent in the framework of sharing your dance! The hotel is majestic, many outdoor areas, swimming pool, play areas, sports, activities of all kinds, there is something for everyone! And the icing on the cake, the hotel overlooks a white sandy beach in turquoise water!  The staff is lovely and welcoming. The restaurant is very rich. The rooms are functional and spacious. The spa is beautiful. And if you look at the sky, you can admire the wild goose flights at nightfall! We highly recommend this resort.

Always as much pleasure to come back... the service is very good, the rooms and the animation team very friendly, the beautiful setting, atypical architecture, has excellent restoration....highly recommended..........

Super stay, the services are tops (room, buffet, pool and beach) Special mention to the animation team who do everything possible to make the stay exceptional!  We hope to be able to come back and spend another week in the next few years

Perfect stay, animation team on top, thank you for the availability and your smiles! I recommend 100%. Well maintained room, hotel staff at the top.  Idyllic place, beautiful beach, some nice towns 15 min taxi ride, very good stay!

We had an absolutely fantastic stay at this hotel! The atmosphere was incredible thanks to the animation team "with the manager Mr JAMES" always smiling and full of energy. They have created a friendly and entertaining atmosphere for all ages. Many thanks to them for their professionalism and good communicative humor!  The room staff was also exceptional. Our room was always spotless, and the service was discreet and efficient. It's so nice to come back to a clean and tidy room after a busy day.  Finally, we would like to emphasize the quality of the room service. The staff was attentive, warm and always ready to respond to our requests. The meals were delicious and varied.  We highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an unforgettable stay. A big bravo to the whole team for their professionalism and kindness!”

Very nice hotel, clean , animation team and animation at the top. The staff is very helpful and smiling ,the servers listening. I recommend to spend a nice holiday. Beautiful indoor and outdoor pool. Pleasant thalasso area with massages at the top and very affordable.

Animation team at the top, smiling, hyper dynamic. The people on duty at the bars, in the room are always smiling. Meals always diversified and super good. I recommend 😉👍 this group trip was really great.

Nice hotel with private beach, we had a spacious room with terrace not overlooked, the buffet is varied and of good quality. The staff is is is nice and the animation team is at the top, James shared his good advice. Thanks for everything.

We had a great stay at this hotel.  The animation team was very attentive to us so that we could enjoy activities (quad, camel ..) and discover the surroundings with confidence. Thanks to the whole team!

Beautiful! I leave stars full of eyes by this superb week punctuated by the animation team that delighted us all week. The hotel is great , the wonderful staff is caring for its guests. The rooms are spacious , the park is sublime and the beach absolutely superb .  Thank you again , memorable stay 🤩🤩

Superb entertainment team always available and smiling , meals always varied and specialties of fish, chicken and excellent brigs!!! excellent overall the exteriors very well decorated lets to do the best activity the lazing....😊 I highly recommend it.
We stayed 1 week in total in this hotel.  The staff is friendly and smiling, the animation team invested.  The facilities are nice and having direct access to the hotel beach is a real plus

Very nice hotel, the decoration is amazing. The room is top and the bed very comfortable.  The animation team is top and very present for clients. We had a great time with the evening show. We recommend this hotel with great pleasure.

I went to this hotel for a week with my brother in May this year! That was great. Great hotel! Animation team at the top  Catering and pool complex perfect! I highly recommend for a good holiday in Tunisia!!!!

Great team animation, every night there are shows. In addition, they are there all day to treat us with activities!!  The buffet is varied, for every taste, all the team is smiling and helpful. Thank you all, I recommend!!

Very nice experience in this hotel the entertainment team is great very nice and dynamic offers lots of activities. The meals are varied and delicious special mentions for pastries that are succulent. I would recommend and return as a family to this hotel which has an idyllic setting with its decors and pools that make you travel.

Superb hotel, very good atmosphere and the staff and entertainment team are at the top.  The rooms are good, the food and food offered are good, the excursions offered are superb.  The organized shows are excellent

I have a very pleasant stay in this beautiful hotel. The rooms are large and comfortable. The hotel is very well decorated, very clean and very well maintained. The buffet is fantastic, there is something for everyone!  The animation team is very friendly, professional and we have very good times.

reviews.review_title: A beautiful hotel for a good holiday
reviews.review_text: A very nice hotel with a beautiful sandy beach and a beautiful setting. The pool is large and clean, lined with palm trees with lots of deckchairs. Meals are varied and good. The staff is very friendly and very helpful. A very nice and dynamic animation team.

The buffet is delicious, a wide choice, everything is good. The rooms are spacious and Africa-themed. The animations are varied and the animation team very nice, talented and pleasant!  Activities are offered outside the hotel. The beach is beautiful and clean.

The hotel is super very nice. It is very clean and the rooms are spacious and clean. The bedding is good too. The restaurant is just great, it's very good and varied. You'll find his way.  The animation team is at the top listening to the customers.  I highly recommend this place 😍😍.

Very good hotel, aquagym at the top!! Thalasso, very good quality food!!  Clean but a little old rooms Very nice staff and the animation team is really nice!!   Hotel close to the beach and very clean pool!   Thank you for your holiday!

reviews.review_title: Great hotel right in the centre of Tunis
reviews.review_text: A great hotel in the centre of the city. Quiet yet right near everything. Fabulous buffet breakfast and friendly helpful staff. Many cafes and restaurants right outside and near to the Medina. A very clean and comfortable hotel in a fantastic location.

Great location, in the medina, surrounded by shops, just a few min walk to the souk. Friendly staff, always ready to help. Room was always very clean. A variety of food for breakfast was awesome. I would recommend this hotel anyone traveling for bussiness.

My sister and I stayed at the Carlton Hotel in Tunis the night of April 12/13. Last night of a tour of Tunisia perfectly organized by a local tour operator. We were received at the reception by Mr. Lofti.  I'm not lying about staying at the reception for an hour. Mr. Lofti could not find the reservation. Once found, he couldn't find the payment. Once found, we asked for a basket for breakfast the next day that we had paid for but that, following the anticipation of the departure of the plane, we could not take.  Nothing. Don't move, don't pay attention. Nothing. Then we asked for an additional room. Mr. Lofti, angry and again, not available at all, replies that no room was available. On the site, however, there were still some. Let's move on to the bedroom... Mr. Lofti increasingly rude and pissed off (I didn't understand why...) gave us a nice surprise. A room that wasn't one. It was probably the staff room. The air conditioning did not work, the room and the bathroom were outdated.  Mr. Lofti was unpleasant, showed a cruel lack of professionalism. I wish future customers not to run into this person. A hotel that wants to be of a certain standard, should be careful about the choices of its staff.

The transfer programmed by the hotel will not be done, because the airport is too big to find the driver, no big deal I will take a taxi that will rip me off from 80 DT The room was indeed renovated with warm and pleasant colors, but it is not with paint that you remove dust the hair and dirt in general. No welcome products just liquid soap.  The TV will run for a while then I will call a technician who will repair, then it will go back down again I will wait for another technician, and I will warn the reception that this is all not working I am leaving. The smoke detector lamp remains lit red while you sleep, the technician informs me that this is normal.  Anyway fortunately I only booked 3 nights, and the rest of the week I will go elsewhere.  Personally, I don't go back to it, it's up to you.

reviews.review_title: Good location in an emblematic building
reviews.review_text: Hotel very well located, close to the Medina, the cathedral and one of the safe and busy avenues. The Art Deco style building is very well renovated, the service is friendly, you can make change (although sometimes they didn't have enough to make the change), with a good breakfast. I recommend

Introduction: this was the last overnight stay in Tunisia. Room booked and paid for by the tour operator who organized the trip for me and my sister, always relying on good hotels.  Lofti, the receptionist, claimed that the payment had not been made: he made us wait an hour before giving us confirmation. We asked for an additional room and also for this reason he made us wait, according to him to confront the commercial office! We took the opportunity to grab a sandwich at a bar just outside the hotel. When we returned, the additional room had been sold moments earlier and we were told that the hotel was fully booked (which is not true as there were 5 rooms available online).  The reservation included breakfast at a cost of 10 euros per person, which is no small thing in Tunisia. Since our flight had been brought forward, we could not use it: since the refund seemed not to be possible, we asked for a doggy bag, and we were denied that too. Later, however, the usher knocked on our room saying that he could take care of it, obviously for a fee.... When we saw the room, we were shocked: it is the worst in the structure, as confirmed by people who work in the hotel (n.242): window that opens onto a closed atrium, therefore completely useless, non-working air conditioning with a rather high temperature inside, an iron column near the bed that holds structural beams, definitely dangerous especially at night in the dark, very old bathroom (I do not go into details) whose only opening is only for the inspection of the pipes, noisy ventilation that operates itself even when the light is off and there is no way to interrupt it. In short, a disaster on all fronts! We have not understood the reason for such a relentlessness towards us; perhaps because we are Italian women? The technical director of the tour operator we relied on also intervened but even he could not achieve anything. We tried to speak to a hotel manager but this was not possible either. To sum up, the receptionist proved absolutely incorrect. The next morning his colleague tried to defend him saying that he is new in the trade: assuming that this is true, it is not justified a similar behavior; in any case, the management all this where is???

Rooms were very clean I was fully satisfied Breakfast was also everything there  I also had my rest there all and whole was all well  I had no problems reception were very helpful a person who could also speak German

reviews.review_title: I would return very willingly.Excellent location to visit the city and very helpful staff.
reviews.review_text: Small room but new and clean with all amenities. Great breakfast with a nice assortment of savory and sweet .Personale very kind and helpful .Un special thanks to Imed at reception who helped us in all ways with a smile.

We only stayed here one night in order to catch an early morning flight the next day. The hotel was completely adequate: interesting modern decor but aging interior, extensive breakfast bar with Tunisia and European offerings, and great location for late-night food. Unfortunately, the evening staff agreed to arrange a transfer to the airport for us, but failed to do so. Frustrating.

Excellent accommodation both for the very convenient location and for the features of the recently renovated structure. Room not large but well equipped and with all comforts comfortable bed and with a good quality kit modern bathroom, corresponding to European standards, new and well-functioning accessories, enjoyable shower, excellent cleaning service Breakfast space well laid out and welcoming excellent quality food and well cooked and assorted Professional hotel staff even if minimally detached. absolutely advisable.

This is a clean, modern looking hotel which is very conveniently located. It’s surrounded by cafes, restaurants and shops plus it’s only a five minute walk from the Medina. The breakfast is excellent - lots of choice and well presented. My room was a dedent size and well cleaned every day. The taxi run to the airport early on a Friday morning was quick and relatively inexpensive. I do think it’s a pity that the restaurant isn’t open in the evening. All the staff were friendly and professional.

I only stayed one night and would certainly return. Decor was modern, rooms clean and staff friendly. I booked room with (very small) balcony which looked over main street at the front of the hotel. I left before breakfast so cannot comment but they drop a star because the wake up call never arrived. Drive to airport was 10 minutes on a traffic free Friday morning and was done by very friendly night porter. Location perfect in town centre with lots of bars and restaurants close by.

reviews.review_title: Disgusting and not suitable for longer stays
reviews.review_text: The room and equipment is a joke. Bed frame is wobbly and squeaks as soon as you turn.  Bathroom is outdated. No storage space for toilet bags or personal hygiene items. Roasted parts make a disgusting impression. Faucet as well as shower faucet worn and calcified. TV has hardly any German/English channels and no connection with Netflix or other apps possible. In the standard rooms there is no kettle - only the newly renovated rooms have one according to the reception. Apparently, there is an additional distinction between what the 3-star category includes for standard rooms and what applies to the “better” renovated rooms. Bad policies and message to guests.  Door lock is so unstable and broken that you are worried about your own safety and the safety of your belongings. Standard room rather disappointing and sad. There are better accommodations in this price range. Would not recommend it for longer stays. There was a bunch of mosquitoes in the room that were bothering at night. Staff is not interested in helping you and does not respond to the criticism, only after renewed demand we would be moved to other rooms but insects/mosquitoes remained a problem! The staff should have solved the insect problem and prepared the rooms better before the guests arrived. We barely slept. In addition, it is very loud, you can hear every door that is closed and every movement on the corridor. Bring earplugs! Door lock is so of unstable and broken, one has concerns about one's own safety and property. Standard room rather disappointing and sad. There's better for the money. Would not recommend it for longer stays!  The only plus is the location, really central and city center within walking distance.

Hotel Carlton is located in Avenue Habib Bourguiba in the heart of Tunis, capital of Tunisia. It’s surrounded by many restaurants, cafes, shops and highlights. A one minute walk to the clock tower of statue of Habib Bourguiba. Also another minute to be near The Grand Theatre and Victory Square and Ibn Khaldoun statue.  Well, for the hotel, big room, with flat TV. 2 bottles of water, no boiler to make your own, bathroom with cold/hot water, no slippers, safety box not working. Comfortable room and sleep. The breakfast is amazing, it’s enough to rate this hotel as excellent. Big variation of cheese, salads, eggs, olives and many others. A wonderful outer seating facing the clock tower.  Friendly staff. Highly recommended.

I spent one night at the Carlton Pension with my family, we took two rooms side by side. Spacious rooms and very well maintained and clean. For this I would like to thank the hotel since we were upgraded. We had a wonderful day in the capital.  Pension staff present and kind. Breakfast 10/10. I highly recommend this Inn and promise I will be back. Only one small problem was the air conditioning which was umpeu weak. Thanks to the whole team.

Pension in the city center ideal for short stays, small but clean and comfortable rooms and a very hearty and rich breakfast.  For the service the staff was helpful and attentive, Regarding the location the Pension is located in the center of Avenue bourguiba.  Nb/Only downside of this neighborhood that it is a tourist trap all Awards are excessive we are all the time ripped off by taxis, restaurants..etc. For this part a real disappointment not too bad but .......

A small clean 3-star Inn with a ideal location to visit the city center not far from the airport no parking Renovated room, relatively spacious, but the equipment is obsolete since I made the costs around 10:30 pm following the fall of the curtain rod directly on the cot fortunately my little girl was in my arms, when I called the reception for the claim, the person in charge of the reception first tried to tie the rod with tape afterwards when I insisted on changing rooms, he asked me an extra 100 Dt (30€) payable on the spot (without making an apology or commercial jeste due to the inconvenience caused) Air conditioning does not work (more noise than cool) by 30 degrees The only positive is the varied perfect breakfast and everything was good 10/10 nothing to say If I have a Trip Tip we have to see the team again especially the air conditioning It's a Pension for one or two nights, with the family it's a bit difficult

Excellent central location with respect to the city  Exquisite breakfast with a wide choice of bread and fruit. Fresh strawberry and lemon juice. Courtesy of the staff. Comfortable room. Great value for money. Too bad the shuttle service really cost twice the Point of Sale price.

I stayed here for 3 nights in Tunis after travelling around the country.  Location is perfect.  Bang in the middle of all the action with eateries and shopping on your doorstep.  The Médina de Tunis is literally a 10 minute walk.  Small boutique type hotel.  Room was big and spacious.  Very clean.  Housekeeping done well.  Staff were pleasant, helpful and friendly.  Good security.  Buffet breakfast for a 3-star hotel was very good with a nice selection.  My difference between a 4 and 5 star rating is WIFI was painfully slow.  I think complimentary water should be provided everyday, not just the first day.  Would recommend otherwise.

Very good hotel, facilities, staff, services, location. A very good address on the main avenue of Tunis. Close to the airport (15 mins by hotel shuttle). Fabulous breakfast. Very quiet and comfortable bedding.

super clean speak english some breakfast awsome clean sheets awful traffic you should go it is awesome nice nice nice nice people so so so so so so  so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so so fun         i  love it here so so so ssssssssooooooooooooooooo fun.

Very nice staff but not professional at all. Lack of working rules. Disgusting food and tourist tax too high for the hotel!  Dismal decoration and end-of-the-world atmosphere inside the hotel. Poor insulation of rooms

Hotel to escape absolutely. Unpleasant staff, room maintenance is not well done. You can hear everything that goes on in the hotel (people talking in the hallway, cars honking for nothing, neighbours of rooms making noise...). The housekeeper who insists and goes into the room if we don't come quickly. Lack of privacy. Breakfast is not fresh it is often leftovers of the old and there is no choice. Evening dining is awful, no choice and no taste.  I would not recommend this hotel at all.

NOTHING RECOMMENDABLE!! Rooms NOT too clean. VERY bad mattress, sinks and bursts your back. Every day problems due to lack of towels. Breakfast in the very austere dining room. In my review you have one or two stars left at least. Old-fashioned facilities. Bar on the terrace of the hotel for all audiences. Lots of traffic and noise; very expensive prices. We left there beeping, leaving paid days and everything!!!

Hotel downgraded room condition  There is disco noise Inn of young not families nesisite renewal of establishments  Breakfast well  Pension placement very good  There are insects in the curtains  The view is panoramic over the zoo

reviews.review_title: C a hotel that offers a very poor value for money
reviews.review_text: It is a hotel of another era that is based on the sale of alcohol in its 02 bar, the hotel is a secondary activity, that is why the staff is unpleasant, the rooms are poorly maintained with moisture and water leaks, the food is borderline, the restaurant is dirty. If you are a heavy alcoholic smoker, this hotel will be a paradise for you. Do not forget to request the tourist tax receipt.

Pleasant hotel, the staff is friendly and welcoming. The geographical location is perfect, close to the city center, the view of the park is calming.  Housekeeping is perfectly done every day.  The breakfast buffet is very varied.
Pleasant welcome. Room with a faulty plug. Used and very dry towels. My husband and I contracted scabies after we changed the sheets which I think were not clean.

reviews.review_title: A good hotel to visit Tunis
reviews.review_text: A very well located hotel a few minutes from the city center and the airport... from the upper floor rooms a nice view of the Belvédère park... there is a nice bar on the 9th floor of the 'rooftop type hotel... small downside the night bar the B52 is a little noisy...but otherwise I recommend...good value for money

I stayed with my family for just one night. It is a basic hotel. The rooms are dated. Hotel is clean. Breakfast is basic. Nothing really special. If you need an overnight, is ok. For long stays is not recommended. Also it is opposite the zoo, so if you want to visit the zoo, it is the best place to stay.

I never expect that I'll fell at home.. Nice rooms, adorable views, very good breakfast, and kind smiley stuff. I found things to do at the hotel, and I didn't feel the club although my room at the same side of it.

reviews.review_title: Good Hotel with all amenities,  but the noise from the B52 club doesn't let you sleep
reviews.review_text: This is a good hotel with nice clean rooms, a good bathroom, a pretty view, a good breakfast, pleasant staff, etc.  However, the daily noise from the B52 club, which seems to occupy the first floor of the hotel is unbearable - preventing you from sleeping until 1:30 am or thereabouts.

reviews.review_title: Opening the club was the worst idea ever!!
reviews.review_text: I was a frequent customer of the hotel and always had a good experience. However, ever since they opened that God forsaken club IN THE HOTEL; a floor below the rooms it has gone down hill. People cannot sleep. I made the mistake of walking in to reserve a room instead of going booking or TripAdvisor believing they would appreciate customer loyalty and take care of me like they usually do. This was not the case. I will not be returning...

Horrible room on a noisy street. No heating so very cold. Shower broken so had to hold it while showering. Restaurant diner Ok although Friday was a buffet so by the time I ate it was cold. Saturday with a menu was good. Breakfast on saturday was good but very limited on Sunday. Staff didn't seem to care about anything. Only soap in the bathroom.

reviews.review_title: It must have been very nice when it was new.
reviews.review_text: I spent 7 days at this hotel.  My room on the 7th floor was clean and nice.  The maid service cleaned everything each day and seemed attentive to details.  I had a balcony overlooking the park (spectacular view).  Although the noise the ostriches make at dawn are a bit disconcerting at first.  The down side is that the hotel is not being maintained well:  lights out in the bathroom, the buttons for the elevator were so worn it could take five minutes to get them to light up, etc.    All of this were minor inconveniences.  However, the hotel advertises Wifi which worked well the first day I was there.  The second day it went down and there was no wifi available by the  time I left.  The front desk's attitude was "what do you want me to do about it?"  I complained several times but got shrugs in response.    Bottom line:  It is an inexpensive, clean hotel but don't expect any support from the front desk.

The hotel is nice . But there is work to do. Maid service should be done better. And the staff is not welcoming. Attention is drawn to the trash. The sea was dirty. But impressions are good . Thank you

I wouldn't complain about the dead light bulbs, and the sanitary items (used tooth brush, shaver, etc.) left by previous guest (I guess) all over in the bathroom. After all, the hotel offers a very attractive rate in a nice location in the amazing city. But three things I found very unprofessional.  1. Wake-up calls never came. 2. The reception insisted to keep my passport for "administrative work." Half a day later, I found my passport at the reception unattended within the reach of anyone who walked by. I found a staff and asked him if I could have my passport back. All he said was "Feel free." 3. In the morning of checkout, the lady at the reception refused to take a credit card. My booking accepted CC payment, so I said so. She now said something was wrong with the CC reader and told me to wait for an hour. The hotel knew I was checking out in the morning, but there was no prior warning about the machine trouble. I asked her for alternative options, but she only kept saying "You have to wait for an hour." Not until I raised my voice and explained to her (for third or fourth time) that I had a plane to catch when another staff at the reception went into the backroom, looking very annoyed, to fetch the non-electric CC reader to process my payment.  An average 15 year old would have been more thoughtful and helpful.  Totally and incredibly irresponsible, unwilling and incapable staff at the reception.

I'll try to write objectively, so that the built up frustration doesn't bias things:  -Front desk staff is lukewarm at best in terms of greeting guests and helping them.  I showed up and had to get the gentleman's attention to help check me in.  He asked for my name and passport, took my passport, gave me a key, and told me to go to the room.  Not flat-out rude, but certainly not welcoming.  The doorman had been sitting inside, so he carried my bag from the front door to the elevator (20 ft), then to my room.  He set it down and stood looking at me, waiting by the window.  I assumed he wanted his tip, so I told him I only had large bills and would give it to him later.  He offered to get change, then came back with the bill only split in two...and stood at the door expecting me to give him a tip more than double what I would give a waiter for a full dinner here...no further assistance or greeting from him over the following week's stay. -The hotel is generally very dark. Rooms have *enough* light, but the hallways and lobby are very dark at night. Stairwells literally have no lights. Not sure if this is for eco friendliness or something else, but it's odd. -If you have any issue with indoor smoke, the lobby area and restaurant can be difficult. My colleague also mentioned that cigarette smoke was leaking into her room from a lower floor. -The room key cards randomly stop working. Currently listening to a neighbor repeatedly try his key card (going on 20 minutes) and banging on the door (or trying to break the doorknob?) in frustration (at midnight). This was easily fixed at the front desk for me, but apparently things are different at night. -The front desk credit card machine was down when my colleague tried to check out. -The mini fridge is in the wardrobe. It works fine just the same, but takes up half of the space. -Breakfast may be the most positive experience: plenty of options, and pretty good food. It's a little greasy, and the staff clearly don't enjoy being there, but it's better than average. -We asked at the front desk about dinner and were told that the buffet costs 40 Dinars (after waiting 10 minutes for them to figure this out). We didn't eat dinner here. A large bottle of water from the lobby bar costs 2 Dinar, versus .5-.6 at the shop on the corner. The man who runs this shop is very nice, and it's a good place to stop for snacks. -The walls are paper thin, so you can hear anything that goes on next door, in the hall, or outside. Flushing my toilet means 5 minutes of screaming pipes. A mysterious droning whistle sound comes from outside on the street every half hour or so. -The wireless internet is decent, but the signal was sometimes unreliable even though no room is more than 15-20 feet from a router in the hallway. -Beds are nice, and almost make up for the intermittent noises from elsewhere.  If you won't be around it much, this hotel is serviceable. The staff don't really care that you're here, and they don't do much to improve your stay inside or outside the hotel. You're basically paying for 1) a bed and 2) food in the morning. The experience between Ambassadeur and Hotel Belvedere (around the corner) is night and day, for basically the same price.

The price of the room is too high compared to the services offered. The people at desk were not polite and didnt speak good english. My room was flooded in the last day because there was a damage on the upper floor so i had to go to another hotel. While they packed my luggage during the flood, they made a damage at my stuff and noone could take any responsibility on the damage!

Service at desk was poor and arrogant. At arrival I had no indication of where I was, received no map even when asked for it, breakfast times weren't indicated, where to get taxi, facilities of the hotel. Nothing.  There was ongoing construction next door to my room, on my floor actually in a half empty hotel. I wonder if they couldn't have allocated me to somewhere more comfortable. I left the hotel earlier than desired (2 less days).

We had an amazing time at La Mirage. I’d read some reviews and was a bit worried but we couldn’t have been treated better. Thanks to Wassem in the restaurant, Hamed in the bar, Rabby at the pool bar and Hana from the kids club, even though we didn’t have children with us she came and chatted. There was a huge choice of food with cooking stations as well as help yourself. We had a fantastic 2 hour spa experience. Everywhere was spotless with cleaning going on all the time. Yes, the entertainment was more geared towards the French but we just did our own thing. The staff love to be tipped but we never felt pressured to tip. The beach was a disappointment with plastic bottles and rubbish and I would advise not leaving young girls on their own as the locals would turn up and just stare. But as far as the hotel and complex were concerned, we couldn’t have asked for a more relaxing holiday, thank you.

Facilities aren’t the best , gym needs a major update with more machines and sauna should be included with the price I payed. Massive shoutout to Ahmed, he made my stay very fun and always in a good mood. Make sure you wear trainers in the gym !!!!!  Ahmed is the enforcer! The entertainment team were fantastic! Ooooowaa Ooooowaaa   Yassine, Victor and Hannah were also very welcoming.

reviews.review_title: A great time at Iberostar selection the mirage
reviews.review_text: Top hotel, great food and the staff will do anything for you  especially Ahmed and Victor  and the entertainment team who provided the entertainment. The only downside was the gym which was inadequate and the equipment very old, apart from that we really enjoyed our stay

I don't normally write reviews but for the great experience I had it was deservedly needed. I want to have a special shout out to Ahmed. He was one of the entrainment team who made my holiday stand out from the previous ones. Ahmed was uplifting and always a great character to speak to. Ahmed would be at the gym carrying my exhausted body to the end. He would be pool side next to me and my family creating conversation.

A real week of decompression and a warm welcome. Special mention for Zied who accompanies the tennis section ... super teacher, volunteer and really helps to progress in all simplicity and technicality. Everyone can enjoy their stay according to their desires

reviews.review_title: Beautiful hotel and beautiful entertainment team
reviews.review_text: A very good stay in a beautiful hotel with an animation team at the top. Thanks to Momo, Papis, Victor and the rest of the staff for the welcome. We have and luck that the hotel was sparsely filled to enjoy the quiet and exchange with other guests.

I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The staff were friendly and attentive. Food choice and quality was good. Breakfast can get a bit repetitive. Food isn't really catered for English tourists but it didn't bother me personally. Design and decor of the hotel was really nice. I had a bungalow apartment, which was really spacious and nice. Can do with a bit of updating. If u like entertainment, u will like it. Some of it can be catered for again non English tourists. There's security as u come into the hotel as well as the hotel beach area.   Advice i will highly recommend bringing mosquito plug in, spray etc. We all got bitten plenty of time. Always have change with you as people love being tipped. Once you go past the hotel beach area you will be very disappointed. As i saw so much rubbish and dead coral, seaweed everywhere. I was very saddened to see this, the beach is being neglected.

This hotel consists mainly of the bungalows spread over a vast and very well maintained green area. Too bad the rooms lack amenities ( storage, courtesy tray, hooks from the bathroom etc., worthy of a 5*. The real weakness is the restaurant, very monotonous cuisine and without flavor, only breakfast saves the day a little. However, the service is impeccable. Kindness and efficiency from staff. Being part of Club Eldorador, we were able to benefit from the various activities, organized by very pleasant and very available animators.

Beautiful stay, very nice hotel. Thank you the reception team always listening and smiling. Congratulations also to the always pleasant staff All facilities are modern and very well maintained, Bangalows with very charming, well arranged. Beautiful and large outdoor pool well appointed, direct access to the beach secured. Beautiful well maintained garden, very clean hotel. At the restaurant the food is varied, fresh but sometimes dishes are cold. In my opinion the negative point to the all included formula are extras (orange juice, mookhitoo...) paid unlike other hotels in the iberostar chain

The staff made our holiday, Absolutely fantastic! Billy, Jo, Mimi, star, zied and momo especially. Rooms were clean, food was excellent, staff were amazing and couldn't do enough for you. I would definitely recommend this hotel although there's not much to do outside of it but that didn't bother us. There's excursions if you would like.

reviews.review_title: one of the most beautiful but especially cozy iberostar hotels
reviews.review_text: One of the most beautiful but especially cozy iberostar hotels.  Although it recently joined the Iberostar group in October 2024, it is clear that the adaptation to the group's quality standards has been made quickly. A welcoming and very cozy hotel, I recommend it to those who want to spend moments of peace in an extremely pleasant environment. The rooms are really large and special with a different kind of touch compared to the industry standard.

reviews.review_title: Family of four in a suite room
reviews.review_text: Pro Very beautiful suite, with perfectly divided space and enough room to move around Very responsive on email Delivered on a certain overshooting when promising about childcare. I'd still recommend to try and organise babysitting independently before arriving though   Neg The mini club lady has very little interest in the children, maybe because she's left to take care of them all by herself, but really she should try harder. Also, the mini club should be open longer! Not everyone has their thinking hat on: I was woken up in the middle of the night by a guy doing maintenance with a compressor on the room in front of my window, and he didn't understand why I was annoyed! They could try harder on the food: in the restaurant you'll still find the old fashioned baine marie containers to get the food from, rather than the live kitchen stations most hotels have upgraded to

We spent two great days at the Iberostar Selection The Mirage Hammamet. The welcome is warm, the rooms clean and comfortable, the food delicious and varied but not for a 5* hotel.  Special mention to the always smiling staff, a big thank you to Mr. Noureddine, the butler.  Small downside on Wi-Fi sometimes capricious, but overall, a very good value for money. I recommend!

We spent a marvellous 6 days at the hotel. The staff are very welcoming and the food was varied and delicious. The villas are very convenient for larger families. Mostly well equipped though could do with having a kettle and access to an iron. The pool areas cater for all ages and abilities. They have entertainment on for most of the day by the pool side. We don’t usually use the mini club facilities but after hearing how welcoming the staff were, we sent the kids there for a couple of hours on two days- they all loved it, particularly thanks to Hanna. We would also like to thank Khaled the porter, Sassi the waiter, Adel and Mohammad in reception who all regularly went out of their way to be of assistance.   Top tip if you’re a family of 5 with kids- it may work out cheaper and more convenient, to get the hotel to organise a day trip to Tunis/ Carthage/ Sidi Bou Said than to go with a group tour.

reviews.review_title: “How we got ripped off in the fake Iberostar – Hammamet Horrortrip”
reviews.review_text: The hotel was advertised on your platform as well as on other booking sites as a 5-star Iberostar hotel high quality services. On the spot, however, it turned out that:   The hotel was supposedly taken over by Iberostar, but honestly: you don't notice. It does not seem modernized or professionally managed.  The first impression was already negative, and unfortunately it did not get any better. From the shower came an unpleasant smell that spread throughout the room. The air conditioning was noisy, indicated 30 degrees, but it was still freezing cold in the room – we had to sleep with thick jackets  At the entrance is only “Mirage Hotel”, there is no Iberostar branding.The services and condition of the hotel correspond to a maximum of 4 stars: unpleasant smell in the room and cold, loud and faulty climate hot system, weak Wi-Fi in the room, and no reception in the restaurant or at the stand no service on the beach nu old lying chairs no longer, (all closed ). Because of these massive shortcomings, we have the last two nieces   leave the hotel earlier at your own expense and book a new real 5 star hotel.  In our view, these circumstances are a clear deception – both in terms of hotel classification and services provided. This hotel does not deserve the name Iberostar – at most mid-range. I definitely cannot recommend it.

I rarely leave positive reviews when it comes to hotels, but Mirage Resort truly deserves one.  The food is fresh, well-thought-out, and genuinely interesting — a pleasure to eat every day. The interiors are modern, and the entire layout of the resort, including the pools, is very well-designed. There are pools for every age group: a shallow one for young children (40 cm), a mid-depth option (80 cm), and a deep pool reaching up to 2 meters.  We were given a room that feels more like a private bungalow, which was a wonderful surprise. The room was spotlessly clean, just like the rest of the resort — everything is extremely well-maintained and tidy. The dining area is also very clean, and I was impressed to find no flies at all, dead or alive.  The layout of the entire place is perfect, making it a pleasure to move from one spot to another. The staff are kind, professional, and genuinely welcoming. I haven’t encountered a single hint of unprofessionalism — honestly, I don’t even get this kind of warm welcome in my own family home! It’s truly heartwarming.  I've been here for nearly a week now, and usually by this point in other hotels, I’d have spotted at least a few flaws. Not this time — everything has been excellent.

So my self and my now wife have just returned from this hotel. We were on our honeymoon and wish we had gone some place else. If you are British stay clear as they do not cater for the British , vegetarians or anyone with allergies. My wife is a vegetarian and was told that she was eating vegetarian fritters only to realise after taking a bite it was actually chicken even though the label said vegetable fritters. She was very sick. I have a severe fish allergy,  meat was being cooked on the same griddle so I struggled to eat the food. We both didn't trust anything.  We were supposed to be having a la carte meal, only to be told they were fully booked. We spent a fortune eating out. The beach bar and both beach restaurants were shut so we were very disappointed. The beach was littered in rubbish and you get constantly hassled by locals trying to sell you something. All entertainment etc is in french. Some of the staff are lovely, very overworked but still smile. They made our holiday but it was just not the romantic honeymoon we thought we'd get.

We been here for family holiday the hotel was great from A TO Z  The member of staff are so so friendly the treat you like family from manager mr kalid and coach AHMED  and the entertainer management Dali and kids club HANA all the team I LOVE TO BRING ALL THE NAME  I really happy to advise everyone to this hotel ..

The animation team makes it all make sense eventho it was very very cold. But enjoyed every moment. They were very nice very cheerful and very nice people. If I would go again I would just go for the animation team very very nice ambiance and made the trip a 100/10. Thank Yassine, Ahmed & Billy you all are the best. Keep it going!!

Zied is an excellent coach, attentive, pedagogical, pleasant and very gifted. He made me progress on sticking points in record time. Run to learn by his side!! He is very nice, friendly and above all extremely professional.

The staff were the best! Always friendly, positive, and could also speak English, which made it a seamless, excellent stay. Shower was fantastic, breakfast selection large and delicious, and room a good size. TV was good - admittedly limited English language channels but at least some! WiFi good.  Location a decent walk to centre/Medina, hopefully a wider range of restaurants establish nearer to the hotel over time.  Recommend!

Equipped with every comfort, the manager and staff is efficient and courteous.  I'm glad I found a pearl like the Belvedere.  I also stayed in other hotels in Tunis but only at Belvedere I found a size and service that lived up to expectations.

The hotel is beautiful and conveniently located near Tunis's largest park and   The zoo is not far from the old town(the cove) excellent amenities, clean dining, and there are plenty of cafes and restaurants in the area and airport transfers are available as the airport taxi fee before 9pm is only three euros
