I spend 2 nighs hère was beautiful for me thé pool is Big and alors if people had to makr alors Friends everything is okay and i m glad to meet New people in animation team they was great for me all of them fif a good job i will Côme again next Time i liké it

A disaster, this is not even an Inn to talk about the number of stars supposedly awarded (4 stars). He doesn't even deserve a star. Very dirty. Carpet very dirty, real estate very old and very poorly maintained, cockroaches in the bathroom, disrespectful staff. Breakfast, lunch and dinner service catastrophic. Outdoor swimming pool and dirty deckchairs.  A nightmare this establishment.  To banish, do not even think of staying in this nightmare.

Hello,  We just arrived at the Amir Palace Hotel in Monastir for a family stay and were extremely disappointed by our experience. The hotel is very dirty and poorly maintained. There are stains everywhere, whether on the curtains or the carpet, which seems to have never been cleaned. The lack of maintenance is obvious.  In addition, there are no electrical outlets in the rooms, except the one that powers the fridge and TV, making it impossible to charge our phones. The bed was broken and despite our call at 2pm to change it, no one came until 6pm. The key to the room was working very hard and now it does not turn at all, leaving the door stuck.  We're not the only ones complaining. At the reception, every newcomer seemed to have a problem: air conditioning not working, elevators broken down, etc.

Ok the Hotel staff were brilliant.     But the Guests were rude and without toleration towards non Muslin customers.     We arrived at this hotel only to discover it was a "non alcohol" Hotel. Which in the adverts for the hotel it stated it has 3 bars with a picture of a champagne glass beside it. My wife was constantly verbally abused by the guests due to not covering up. As for the dining buffet the guests were greedy and wasteful. They would totally fill their tables with food then leave about 65% of it, leaving the place in a mess. The poor waiting staff could not cope with the clearing up.     The hotel was poorly maintained virtually every light  wasn't working and only 1 out of 5 elevators worked. As for stating the hotel is in Monistir, It was in Skanes a total dump of a town about 20mins from monistir.       We were relocated to this hotel by love Holidays due our previous hotel not being available at the last minute, We wish now we had cancelled!!       We moved hotels paying with our own money after hiding in our room for 3 days due to the tension caused by the guests. Love Holidays were no help.      Avoid....

Madam, sir,  We stayed at the Amir Palace Hotel in Monastir from 21 to 23 June 2024 and would like to express our deep disappointment at the quality of the services offered, which in no way correspond to those of a 4-star hotel.  Problems encountered during our stay include:  1. **Cleanliness of the room**: The room was dusty and missing sheets, which is totally unacceptable for an establishment of your standing. 2. **Equipment**: Several electrical outlets in the room were non-functional, which significantly hindered our comfort. 3. **Meal quality**: The cutlery was often dirty and the quality of meals was very poor, far from expectations for a hotel in this category.  These inconveniences have greatly impacted our experience and leave us very dissatisfied.  To flee

Good points: Beautiful architect Very large hotel, on a beach Easy access Comfortable bed Negative points: No internet in rooms Weak internet in reception hall Very dirty carpet (severe) Degraded furniture (bedroom) Restaurant, limited menu 02 elevators out of 5 broken down Room doors without card, with very old keys (breakable)  In conclusion : Hotel requires emergency rehabilitation Can become an excellent hotel after major work and major improvements Personally, impossible to return to this hotel Experience forgotten

The staff in this hotel go above and beyond to make sure all the guests are well looked after. Amazing holiday, probably the best we’ve been on. Can’t recommend enough!! Animation team are AMZING!!!! Lovely beach, great swimming pool. Food is very good, ate at the hotel every evening. Definitely 10/10

The hotel is an overall 10/10  It was a great experience and the staff were amazing  The food was great with vast selection of different foods for all  And the animation team were amazing very engaging and entertaining coming up with new things every night which were very enjoyable

reviews.review_title: AVOID AT ALL COSTS – Misleading, Dirty, and Disrespectful
reviews.review_text: I stayed at Abou Sofiane Hotel & Aquapark with my partner from October 12th, 2024, and it was easily one of the worst hotel experiences we’ve ever had — especially heartbreaking since we booked this specific hotel to accommodate my partner’s chronic back condition (Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome), and it advertised wellness facilities that were completely non-existent.  1. FALSE ADVERTISING  The hotel’s website claims to have a spa, sauna, massage services, gym, games room, and various sports facilities. None of these were available. When we asked staff, they told us to go across the road to another hotel (Hotel Riviera) and ask them to let us use their facilities — which we weren’t allowed to do. The Friguia Zoo, listed as being 1km away, was actually 47.5km away — farther than the airport.  2. FILTHY ROOMS 	•	We were given burnt towels one day. 	•	The bathroom was mouldy, and the shower was poorly designed, leaving us to manually drain it ourselves or stand in a pool of water. 	•	One of our walls had a hole where a light switch should’ve been. 	•	We were placed in a joint room separated by a door from total strangers. We could hear everything next door — including showers and conversations — and one night the woman next door banged repeatedly on the door and then verbally abused us in a foreign language for simply watching a movie. 	•	The hotel reeks of cigarette smoke even though it’s advertised as a non-smoking property. Staff and concierge were smoking indoors.  3. UNHELPFUL AND UNETHICAL STAFF 	•	No iron available, and the hotel only offered to iron our clothes via laundry service with a 24-hour delay. 	•	We were withheld the TV remote unless we paid a city tax in cash the night we arrived, even though this cash-only requirement wasn’t listed prior to check-in. 	•	We were not even given a receipt when we paid. 	•	There was no cash machine on-site, forcing us to literally beg security from another hotel to let us inside just to withdraw money.  4. FOOD MADE US SICK 	•	There was only one restaurant open (Le Doyen) despite them listing two. The food was repetitive, bland, and left us with stomach aches and bowel issues.  5. ZERO CARE FOR GUESTS WITH DISABILITIES  We selected this hotel specifically because it claimed to offer massage, spa, and sauna services — essential for my partner’s chronic pain condition. Not one of those was available. This is not just disappointing; it’s misleading and unethical.  In summary: this hotel is a complete scam. The facilities listed on every website are outdated or outright false, the rooms are unhygienic, and the staff are disinterested at best, shady at worst. If you value your money, your health, or your peace of mind, book literally anywhere else.

I have been on my holiday I can say the food was amazing no faults the rooms were spotless and clean the staff were amazing and very friendly and the animation team was very good entertainment for kids in daytime and night time then adult music afterwards would highly recommend this hotel

After reading alot of negative reviews was dubious. What can I say from walking in the doors the service has been amazing. All of the staff have been fantastic so friendly and helpful. The restaurant service and food have been amazing . Cannot fault anything. Would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely be back

Hotel needs updating, rooms basic,food could do with being a lot hotter.nothing to do at night so called entertainment non existent.do not trust the staff to organise taxis,we got ripped off.the only redeeming about this hotel is the pool ,and area,and the beach is a short walk away.

This has to be the worst hotel I have ever been too! Advertised as 4 star but doubt it’s even a 2!  It’s dirty, worn out and dated  The inside of hotel is yellow and feels like your in some nicotine stained building  Some of the staff are lovely but if u have any issues don’t even bother with the guest relations manager as he is a nasty intimadating man , accused of breaking a tv in room and demanding I pay 350 Dinah for it although I didn’t break them accused me of being drunk and pulling it off the wall . Locked out of hotel room until under duress I had to pay  Asked to speak to manager every day and was always being told come back tomorrow . Manager was never in. ? Food absolutely disgusting and covered in flys  Once you found food that was edible you then had to find some plates or dishes that were not dirty to eat from  And if you want a drink , you can always use the plastic cups that have fag burns in the bottom of them  There is no food for children to enjoy and if they are hungry and u decide to go to the shop in reception you can always enjoy out of date crisps as a quick snack !  You can always relax by the pool Or in lobby where u constantly have some chubby little waiter constantly saying you look after me I’ll look after you lady , outside hotel the taxi drivers pee up the walls so it constantly stinks if urine ! Nothing is lite up at night making it a death trap For children as there is a path that leads right to pool from bar so if a child was to run off they would land in pool and no one would ever no  Pool Shuts every day at 6  This hotel is just awful I’m so disapointed that I worked hard to pay for a holiday that was awful  When booking this holiday the pictures looked stunning but don’t get hopes up as I think the pictures may be a few years old  I need a holiday to get over this holiday   Tbh you have to be drunk to stay in this awful depressing place

Just returned from 9 nights and absolutely loved it had the best holiday room comphy and clean food was good did get repetitive but being a frequent traveller that always goes all inclusive it always does if your there more than a week there is a alacarte resuraunt u can use once and a snack bar which was good we used that most lunch times  pools were nice and clean  slides were great loverly beach being a smallish hotel everything was not much walking which was perfect as my mum can't walk far got a sunlounger no problem animation team were good there was a few nights there was no entertainment which was disappointing but we just went out all staff was very friendly an went out there way for us no kettle in room but we always take our own always taxis outside to take you too surrounding places very cheap no spa facilities but you can use the hotel next door which we did has a loverly in door pool would I come again most definitely for the price we paid I cant complain ya holiday what you make it an we met some amazing people why we was there an had a great time didn't want come home

reviews.review_title: Bad experience and the greatest regret
reviews.review_text: Pension is the worst I've seen, the room is not clean is degolace, the room is not as booked (view). The room so old equips not like the pictures, and there is no personal air conditioning the air conditioning was on until 10pm, the heat pq in the room, the water is occupied before midnight, once the electricity was interrupted, long customer service and not well. I mean, I don't recommend it because you're gonna regret it.

Flights - TUI delayed us by 3 hours without any explanation to why, so we arrived much later than expected (and hungry).  Hotel room - wrong room given (paid for superior sea view), we were facing the carpark on our first night. The room had lots of ants (in the bed as well), the toilet was cracked and stained and the floors and walls felt/looked dirty.  We had to wait until 12 to change our room the next day, so we tried the breakfast whilst waiting. The corridors were very dark and dirty, not touched with a hoover in months.   Once our room was swapped, the sea view was very restricted (covered by trees and buildings). The room was cleaner though and the cleaning lady was very pleasant - deserving of tips for working so hard.   Food - very disappointing for an all inclusive holiday. The only edible thing in the morning was the pastries, the rest was unlabelled and greasy with guests often trying it before scooping it out (with the same spoon, appalling hygiene).  The lunch and dinners were extremely lackluster for British holiday goers, the trays were lukewarm with meat attached to huge lumps of fat and grease. Being 6 weeks pregnant, I physically couldn't eat any of the food, especially as there were no labels (maybe 1 to every 4 dishes) to explain what the dish was. The coffee machine was vile and the fresh juice was always warm.   The drinks served were usually flat, coke was often decanted from taps into a bottle before being poured into glasses, making them all flat on arrival. Better to buy your own drinks and keep them in the room fridge.  If it wasn't for the local shops selling Yoghurt drinks/sorbets I would've starved this entire trip. Thankfully there are restraunts around port el kantoui so if you're willing to spend extra eating out every night, you're better off.   Beware of the taxi drivers outside the hotel, they massivley overcharged us (white tourists!). A taxi TO Hard Rock cafe cost us 15 dinar, whereas a taxi back cost 2 dinar (how?!).   The hotel lobby is the ONLY place you'll get your free wifi, the rooms have none at all. Take an E sim.   The beach was the only thing I was happy with during the stay, it was clean and the water was lovely to swim in. The bar staff were very helpful as well and would often bring fresh drinks as you stood up.   Beware of the sales guys on the beach, we were nearly conned out of 70 dinar for some pictures and fruit (that we didn't ask for, it was forced into our hands). If I didn't have my partner I would've been wiped of spends very quickly as I'm too socially anxious to haggle, they can see this.   We were meant to stay a full week here but I panicked from the lack of food and bad air con to come home by day 5 - costing another £255 (£100 in phone payments, £120 for flights, £35 for taxi)  The staff were generally very polite and helpful, but it did take them 3 times for them to take our booking seriously. They had taken photos of my phone booking on the first night and I had emailed it to them (reservation number and details), and subsequently knocked on our door to come to reception for us to do this all over again another 2 times.   The bar staff are very much tip encouraged for good service, not understanding the currency we gave a staff member a tip one night to be met with a disgruntled look. Made me regret tipping in the first place.   I would not come back to this hotel, mainly because its been miss sold as a 4 star when it rightly should be a 1 or 2 star at best. Definitley wouldn't go all inclusive again as the food and drinks were highly dissapointing.   The staff do their best in a bad situation, so when service has a smile it is appreciated. Communication is often 'come back tomorrow for help'.   The streets outside the hotel smelt of pure rodents/faeces/urine, which is was sick from on our first day there.   Tunisia is a beautiful place, just unfortunately this hotel is NOT what the websites (loveholidays, im looking at you) advertise.   Pay a LOT more in another hotel if you're looking for a better experience - and THOUGHOURLY read the reviews, the 1* were accurate for what we experienced here.

Has a lovely time weather was hot staff and animation team were brilliant big shout out to tito and the other beach was really lovely food was amazing thanks for everything 😊 ❤️ ☺️ 😄 😋 😀 😊 ❤️ ☺️ 😄 😋 😀 😊 ❤️ ☺️ 😄 😋 😀 😊 ❤️ ☺️ 😄 😋 😀 😊 ❤️ ☺️ 😄 😋 😀 😊 ❤️ ☺️ 😄 😋

REALLY Enjoyed the holiday. The hotel and the room were GREAT. Food was excellent. Animation team were fantastic. Bar drinks and beach great. Pool very clean. All staff friendly and helpful. Reception was always there and answered ant questions we had.

The room was good, the housekeeping ladies were lovely, the waiters at the pool bar were great mostly, and all of the staff were mostly friendly. The food was very hit or miss and I experienced an upset stomach for 7 of the 9 days we were there, but unable to pinpoint the cause, although the water from the coffee machine tasted of mould at our final breakfast. We were not able to have a kettle in our room, the receptionist seemed to think it was a funny request, but it may have saved my bad experience. Our sea view room had a very limited sea view and was very close to the very loud entertainment area, but thankfully the music stopped at 11pm. We had to wait 4 hours for our room on arrival, and although we were told we could get an early breakfast on our last morning, because we had an early flight, this was not the case, if fact they lost the keys to the restaurant and so it opened late, giving us 15 minutes before our transfer arrived. The indoor pool that is advertised was empty so could not be used, the outdoor pool are clean and well maintained though. There is no information given about facilities or activities, which would have been helpful. The first holiday I have ever had that I wasn’t sorry to leave!

Thank you for this wonderful holiday, and I want to thank especially the animator Simo for his interest in us during the activities ❤️❤️

Hotel very nice, clean, food ok. Animators very nice and friendly.I recommend it to everyone for a trip alone or with family.Beautiful views, large hotel, lots of attractions to choose from. Everything's all right. Very Good people. Sure to be back here

Very good 5 star hotel. The room was nice and clean, the staff was friendly and helpful, the breakfast has a wide selection of food and drinks. great performance of the animators who provided great entertainment. We were very pleased. Sure to come come back here.

Excellent hotel, food and the whole of the staff at the hotel were professional, approachable, friendly and always keen to help. Entertainment team particularly were friendly and always tired to get you involved, well done. Would visit again next year

reviews.review_title: A beautiful discovery @ Hammemet South with qq small improvements to make
reviews.review_text: I knew this place for a long time, but it was my first time as a resident... And it was a nice surprise overall! The infrastructures are neat, surrounded by green spaces that make the setting soothing and pleasant. The room, spacious and functional, met our expectations.  The hotel seems ideal for summer: outdoor pools, children’s playground, private beach and bungalows. Breakfast was varied and quality, served by a smiling and attentive staff – a real plus. The SPA centre is also worth a visit for a relaxing break.    2x points a little disappointing for such a beautiful establishment, however:   - Reception & departure at reception cold & very expeditious,  - The method of information on checkout times (a paper slipped under the door!!!!) Very surprising & really useless!! Especially in low season!   Overall, the experience remains positive. This property is a good option @ South Hammamet.

Hello everyone, I do not understand the negative reviews about this hotel! We stayed here from 8 to 15 May and we were afraid given some comments! What a nice surprise upon arrival the hotel is beautiful the rooms are perfect and cleaned every day. The bedding is excellent! The restaurant remains a buffet like all buffets some dishes often come back mostly at the starters but all the dishes were very good and varied every day. The staff is so nice and helpful whether at reception, bar or restaurant. The animation team is also very nice! The hotel is very clean wooded and lots of greenery. I also recommend Samir in the hotel that offers excursions (the catamaran is top! ). Massage services are excellent and very inexpensive for a one hour service. In short a perfect holiday and I can already announce that next year we will return to this hotel with our eyes closed.  Thank you for everything and see you soon!

reviews.review_title: Exceptional Service at Le Royal Resort – Thanks to the Animation Team: Didi,Mario,Simo,Rico & Chico
reviews.review_text: Exceptional Service at Le Royal Resort – Thanks to Animation team!  During my stay at Le Royal Resort, I had the pleasure of being assisted by the animation team, whose outstanding service truly made my experience unforgettable. From the moment I arrived, they all demonstrated professionalism, warmth, and a genuine passion for ensuring guests feel welcome.  No request was too small or too big and they went above and beyond to accommodate every need with a smile and an incredible attention to detail.  Didi/Mario/Simo made every interaction a delight.  It’s rare to find someone so dedicated to making guests feel valued, and the exceptional hospitality is a testament to Le Royal Resort’s commitment to excellence. If you ever visit, be sure to look out for the animation team—someone who truly embodies top-tier service!  Thank you, Didi/Mario and Simo for making my stay remarkable. I can’t wait to return!  Haseeb..

We had one of the best holiday ever. The resort is such a beautiful and peaceful place to stay. The animation team is very friendly and makes your stay very enjoyable with their lovely activities and amazing company. Food is delicious. Restaurant staff is such a lovely and look after us all the way. Everyone is extremely professional and makes you feel like at home.

It’s a great hostel ,  animator they are all good ,the Restaurant is very good and there is a bariery of good . The indor and outdoor pool is good , clean , the weather is sunny and good to enjoy , it is a really fun trip in Tunisia , also the swą is good for swimming.

I like everything about this hotel. Animations are great, food is very nice. Room is clean and comfortable. The reception is good. The activities are interesting and you can’t be bored for all day. You can play darts, ping pong, gymnastics, archery

reviews.review_title: thanks everyone for a lovely holiday
reviews.review_text: Animation are great, Simo is great.  Pool is lovely, food is good with lots of different things on offer. Weather is great. Staff are polite and friendly  Rooms are always clean, gardens are beautiful  Reception staff are very helpful  Good entertainment in the night.

I had a really amazing few days here. I will definitely recommend this hotel - The grounds are beautiful and spotless and the animation team are incredible - They are what make it special. The rooms were cleaned daily and there were nice views from the balcony.

My family and I had a wonderful vacation thanks to the Royal Hotel. The reception is very nice, the rooms are clean and beautiful, the food is delicious and tasty I would like to thank Royal Hotel for this experience. I would especially like to thank those who made it a beautiful and happy holiday Animation Team They are with us all the time and are very good at activities. They are the ones who made our holidays good and happy. Thank you very much.❤️❤️

reviews.review_title: Disappointing Stay – Poor Service and Security Concerns
reviews.review_text: I stayed at Royal Hammamet for a training event. I accidentally left a jewelry box in my room and reported it immediately, but the hotel claimed they found nothing. No proper follow-up was done.  The food was average at best, the room basic with nothing special. For a so-called 5-star hotel, the experience was underwhelming and unprofessional. I do not recommend this hotel.

Great hosts! Animated evening nice I recommend! Buffet food at the top, renewed often enough! The room is good. All the staff is always ready to help you. The excursions offered are at a good price. Total change of scenery.

reviews.review_title: AGAIN  : On my way this year 2025 [8 May 2025] InshALLA , from Poland
reviews.review_text: Reception is classy standard : Mr. Mohamed/Mr.Karim /Mr. Ben Rejeb Mr. Gamal . Bar & food  : quick care by Mgr. Samir , Mehdi . High selection of tasty food & wine : Mr.Khalil /Mr. Hussein . Room v.clean with amenities   Thanks Mr. Dia F.                 Mr. Maher Mokadem [rgds to Iskandar] / Mr Adnan   *I knew these names as they are very friendly also my work is Marketing Consultant Middle East and mentioning the names is very important rule  in expressing the Realities  of any point of view or  situations .   Thanks for reading

The personal essentially in the restaurant is perfect and friendly. The service is wonderful and the room is spacy. The swimming pool is big and clean.  There are so many food that you can’t choose what you want. The buffet of desserts is so big and delicious.

We arrived at Hammamet Garden Hotel at 3 o’clock in the morning. As soon as we stepped into the hotel, the staff warmly greeted us and asked if we were hungry. We said yes, and to our surprise, they brought us some delicious food. It was the first time we experienced such hospitality – where a hotel served their guests a meal after check-in!  When we entered our room, our first impression wasn’t great. We thought the room looked old and outdated, but we were tired and went to sleep. The next morning, I spoke to the reception and mentioned that the room felt too old. That’s when I realized it wasn’t old – it was vintage! The entire hotel is designed in a classic, vintage style that gives it so much character.  As we explored the hotel more, we were impressed by everything it offered. The food was simply wonderful and absolutely delicious. The staff were amazing – their hospitality was beyond what we could have imagined.  The spa experience was also fantastic. There’s a gentleman there with three lovely ladies – Wahida, Khadija, and Samar– who give the most amazing massages. Their care and professionalism made the spa visit truly special.  The animation was great and every night they laughed us. All guys in the animation were all good specially Maro, Sam and Dali.   can’t call this just a 5-star hotel – I’d say it’s a 7-star or even 9-star experience! I’ve traveled to many countries for holidays, but from now on, my number one destination is Tunis, and specifically, Hammamet Garden Hotel.  This hotel is exceptional, and I can’t wait to return again and again. Thank you for such an unforgettable stay!

Very clean, good service, diverse selection of food both for breakfast and dinner, great entertainment in the evening, all very friendly, dedicated animation team, the facility was just brought up to speed at the time of my trip, only the way to the beach is not optimal.

We had a fabulous and exuberant time at Hammamat Garden. Staff were so friendly, polite, joyful, excellent. A fantastic memorable atmosphere with high level of customer service and satisfaction. They utmost looked after each guest. The best hotel and spa services that you can receive. Dedicated staff. Food was on point. Salim was the hostess, so friendly and attentive Dali was a excellent entertainer very comfortable to be around. Waiters were so friendly and efficient. 10 out of 10. Sonia was one of the best reception staff, she was so chilled, relaxed and calm.

A beautiful place, staff are very warm and  friendly, made us feel at home. Entertainment  especially the dancing lessons, and was shown magic by Omanr. Daali was very charming and made us feel very welcome . Great selection of food and drinks.

Great staff... very friendly and entertaining... Staff look after you ..had great fun at night with Dali and with rest of staff... laughing all night with Oman who showed us some magic and dancing lessons with Dalia.. service is great... nothing is too much bother

It's been super fun and all the staff are so nice, helpful and friendly. They have a wide range of food to try and activities to do. The place is also lovely. Nice rooms and view. The drinks are good. Entertainment is really good and we love chatting with the staff.

Great quiet place. Spacious rooms with view on a swimming pool and bar. Fantastic service.  Lots of great food. 2 lovely swimming pools. Tennis, volleyball, football court. Great evening entertainment.  Spa, massages, hairdresser. They have everything!!  We will be back.

Nice hotel with good size of swimming pools (2 to choose from) kids mini club, football pitch and volleyball. Visited in may so it wasnt too busy. all staff very polite . Clean rooms. Entertainment team doing amazing job. Food very nice and a lot of variety. Would definitely book again.

Accustomed to stays in Tunisia, the hotel perfectly met my expectations.  It has all the infrastructure and services possible. Preparations for the summer season make you want to come back!  Few customers when we came, we felt privileged, everyone is so careful.   Thank you to all the staff of the Hammamet Garden hotel for their kindness, availability and smile. Special mentions to the little masseuse, to little Mohamed from the bar, and to Sonia from the reception. But they are all great (spa, kitchen, service, cleaning and maintenance, entertainment...). Thank you, it's people like them who want to come back. The art of hospitality.

only ever stay in this hotel when ive been stayed in tunisia. the staff are lovely, nice variety of food and beverages. rooms are cleaned everyday. shops across the street. staff interact with you and are friendly. the animation team are amazing, new team but with lots of potential, funny and happy to assist. even though the hotel is quiet this time, they still entertain us of a night time. DJ rocks the tunes🤟🏼🤟🏼 wouldnt want to stay anywhere else. 100% worth a visit. ❤️

Came for two weeks in May and loved it. Lovely choice of food everyday, clean rooms and great service. The staff are amazing, they cannot do enough for you. The animation staff are fantastic, Dali made our stay very enjoyable, always having a laugh and making jokes with us, super friendly and always happy to help! We will definitely be returning and hope to see Dali again next year!

Really a big thank you for the whole team hamamet garden for the warm welcome.and on tt a mme Sonia khdher at the reception with a beautiful smile.and professionalism  Thank you to all the chefs a delicious beef with a variety animation team also thank you to the director who is tjrs on site to check that all its running well.I had a great time with my family tt the team that does not make the difference I hope that this year also I spend.the mm moments. In 2025

With the family we spent a short stay at this hotel, it was a pleasant experience! We came to a fairly quiet period. The hotel is well equipped with a large outdoor swimming pool with deckchairs as well as an indoor pool for the more chilly, a gym and a spa. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful enough. Special mention for the animator often wearing a cap , of a real kindness , he will put you at ease. It was a short but pleasant stay.

it was a lovely it was fun for the kids the workers are lovely and sweet they treated us with kindness it was an amazing experience  the pool was amazing and fun especially for the kids even as i as an adult it was fun  the spa was amazing i would love experience it again if i could and the food was amazing

We did not fall on the right week, the hotel hosting handball internationals. We found ourselves relegated to second place, with athletes taking priority. No room in the restaurant, sportsmen passing us in front of the buffets, no drinks offer at mealtime. Few choices at buffet level, almost non-existent desserts. Very noisy hotel due to all these young sportsmen gathered, who are the kings of oil and we may have complained about the noise (especially at night), we quickly realized that at the hotel it was the last of their problem. No or little animation due to the presence of handball players.  Beach not according to what was advertised. Disappointed with our week, not restful. Beautiful outdoor pool. Friendly staff

I tell you about my experience with my family, a very quiet hotel, I found by chance the shooting championship it gives me pleasure to participate and share with them their experience, a very clean hotel with a quality of food, we took room 206, seen pool with a lavazza machine  A very good atmosphere.thanks for the team

A paradise on earth, very decent hotel, A big bravo for the general management For the organization, always present, a real leader who gives the fruits of success, I spent three days , a very varied buffet with themes, big thank you for animation and the real show, thank you Sat , very clean hotel.  I'll be back in August.  Thanks.

Unfortunately, a vacation that did not go as hoped -( Nights disturbed by groups of young handball players... a huge lack of organization on the part of the hotel and a manager who allows himself to neglect his guests! A story that ended with the police when we've been suffering for 3 days already. That's a shame!  Family-friendly hotel, indoor and outdoor swimming pool, water slides (off) , buffet top (except for 200 young people present) , and staff who do their best.  I thank them again-)

Run away! This is by no means a 4 star! The hotel is dirty and not maintained. No hot water every day, you had to go down to the reception to claim. Many power cuts. The only good thing is the restaurant staff very friendly and varied meals and not in abundance as I have seen in other hotels. I would not return to this hotel and would not recommend it.

The hotel is lovely it is dated but nothing major just paint needs touching up.  The staff were absolutely lovely, everyone very friendly and helpful 😀   The hotel is right in between old town and new so about a 45 minute walk or less than 10 minutes   The bar is only open 10 til 10 for all inclusive you can buy alcoholic drinks but only til 11 and then the one and only bar is closed I found this weird but it actually saved me from getting drunk and ruining my holiday haha and everyone was in bed for 11.   Food wasn't the best but it was edible would probably suit fussy eaters as very plain or fishy

Great service and fantastic hotel. Amazing facilities. Great food and room comfortable. Staff is extremely helpful and excellent especially Aymen,Ahmed and Siwar at the front desk who helped me to arrange my travel when I was missing my taxi.

An excellent stay, the welcome was magnificent and warm by the salim receptionist who gave us a very nice room that offers a splendid and soothing view of the lake. The ptt already ‘was a real delight and varied  This hotel is perfectly located on the banks of the lake, in a quiet location, just minutes from the airport

reviews.review_title: The DPJ is worth a visit!
reviews.review_text: Just passing for the morning.   Breakfast offers a wide range of fresh and delicious Western and Tunisian dishes.  Fruit juices are offered in small individual bottles, which is a very good idea.  Nadia and the host staff are very friendly and professional. Congratulations for the service! The staff at the bar are friendly. Serve sparkling water with fresh mint leaves and lemon in a nice carafe and not in a bottle is a very good idea. The setting of the hotel is beautiful and clean.

thanks to Yusra at breakfast who got us some bananas which are hard to get it seems! I was staying in Movenpick and fruit and veg is mostly local and seasonal. But the staff are very helpful to try to make our stay pleasant. Also want to recognize the pastry chef back there!

"I would like to express my gratitude for this wonderful experience. The welcome was perfect, especially thanks to Mariem from the reception who was adorable and very helpful. I would also like to thank the entire front desk team for their professionalism, availability and attention to every detail. Their warm welcome really helped to make my stay pleasant and unforgettable❤️❝

Nice hotel..well located.. about 15 min drive from SOUK. Large lobby, beautiful decoration of good taste. The rooms are comfortable, bed and bathroom. Fast elevators, polite funconaries. cafe the manha wide and dinner in the hotel that offered a vast buffet

We had a great time.       Eftar The setting was wonderful and the      staff was in the care   particular, we would like to thank the whole team for this attention. We highly recommend this hotel..................🥰🥰

Very nice hotel the staff very friendly, and kind.... a special thank you to the ex-chef for El fater and more than superb also for the cuisine is very refined the excellent buffet presentation.... A very big thank you....

reviews.review_title: Top 👍 thank you Amira and at the reception.
reviews.review_text: Superb Hotel by the lake. Very clean room The pool to relax after work is beautiful. The steam and musical shower is great.There are some to please everyone at breakfast. A wonderful choice. The housekeeper who took care of my room was adorable 😍 special credit to Amira who surprised me with flowers after a crazy day fixing machines for Telecoms. A big thank you to the Mr from the reception who made sure I could have a quiet room.  * Thank you for everything * Gwen Hayden room 261

I am moved by the welcome and smile of all the staff, a very qualified and very competent team of which we are proud. I knew at first Mrs. Zeineb who helped me to make my first exhibition, I owe her a lot of respect , an exceptional woman, after I admit that I have befriended others, likewise, I would not change my mind for the sympathy of everything, example, the adorable Eya with her beautiful angelic smile , well I hope that will not change, all my encouragement for all the staff and just good contuniation.

I enjoyed my stay at the movenpick hotel. Spacious rooms with extra views. Guest service: Eya and Houssem Belhaj were very helpful and helpful. They helped me have a pleasant stay with recommendations to walk around and try quality restaurants with extra local dishes. Eya made sure everything was perfectly planned with her artistic touch and helpfulness  Breakfast was tasty

Hotel that regresses from year to year. Mixes seminar meals with regular customers which fair that one could not have lunch properly with an excissve expectation Prefer the Four Season if you want superior standing and tranquility

Booked hotel for training course with 24 attendees. Training room is not cleaned thoroughly, dirty carpets (not vacuumed regularly). Conference room very hot inside with all attendees sweating constantly, due there being no air conditioning in the entire hotel through the winter months. The hotel rooms have same issue regarding the air conditioning. I tried to leave window open, but was tormented by mosquitoes all night, covered in bites. Not a comfortable experience in any aspect, especially considering the high rating of the hotel. DO NOT COME HERE DURING WINTER MONTHS!!!

reviews.review_title: Not worthy of standing and price
reviews.review_text: No wifi in the room  No TV that works  No air conditioning with a room temperature of 26 degrees  Do not respond to complaints  Extra-billing (and not for the first time. They bill consumptions of the minibar systematically that is why we must check the invoice)

That’a Wonderful hotel in front of the sea. The staff at the reception desk, at the conciergerie, at the restaurants were very kind with us and we enjoyed their advices.  Great experience. Rooms were very clean and the views is extraordinary

It’s the highest-quality place to stay in the LAC—the precious part of the city. It’s a quiet and serene place for business tourism, and it’s all about soaking up the stress of the day at Lake Tunisia.

reviews.review_title: Spacious room and quality spa but no alcohol, poor wifi in the room, à la carte restaurant to improve.
reviews.review_text: This hotel is located in the Lake District , without alcohol, neither in the hotel nor in the vicinity. I think the hotel should communicate on this point. We mustn't find out when we get there. I would not have chosen this hotel for 4 days with this information. On the other hand the spa is very good, the reception too. The buffet restaurant is quite complete. The restaurant on the plate is nice but do not take the Burrata (tasteless and dry outside. The wifi is not good quality in the room to watch netflix. (regular stop). No coffee machine in the rooms for a 5 star...so overall good but there is room for improvement.

reviews.review_title: Thanks to the reception and restaurant staff
reviews.review_text: Very welcome by Fathi dorman ahmed reception clerk Osama and Master Tarek thank you for the service top personal helpful active I give 5 stars clean hotel we get there nchallah good continuation chef's flat restaurant thank you to raslene

reviews.review_title: Giving you the sign of excellence and quality
reviews.review_text: The experience was very beautiful and very excellent I wish you would be back with my family in the next few days and enjoy your clean hospitality in my room 263 was very nice and special I would like to thank everyone who served me from 21 to 26 September 2024.

Very good Pension, impeccable service, smiling staff. Beautiful spacious comfortable rooms. A varied and hearty breakfast. The buffet for meals is ideal for tasting Tunisian specialities. There is also a good à la carte restaurant. A very nice terrace overlooking the lake.

Where do I start… we booked the hotel for a cheeky trip away for my wife’s birthday. It was cheap and I prepared myself given all the poor reviews I’d read.   We arrived and nothing but the best experience from every single member of staff. From start to finish.   Felt hot so the staff got the fan from the security guard to keep our children that little cooler.   Fussy in the restaurant the chefs made a special pizza to my request.   NOW the entertainment team - WOW! We have travelled to many inclusive 5star hotels and never had the dedication that this team provide day in day out even missing a day off to come and wish my wife happy birthday.   If your looking for decor then it’s not for you if your looking for a hotel that needs some support and want some real fun to let your hair down with games, care and real genuine attention then give this place a shot and ignore the bad reviews.   This place can only get better as long as the Animacion team remain!!!’

reviews.review_title: Overall this holiday was very good especially the animation team
reviews.review_text: My holiday here was really good the pool was really nice but the food wasn’t the best because there wasn’t much options to pick from but the animation was the best part about being on his holiday and hotel and there’s lots of places to visit from the hotel and it’s got a nice view and nice beach and a lot of activities to do

The hotel was nice, basic and a lot of things advertised was closed due to only starting the season BUT the animation team made it an amazing holiday. Haha and his team were amazing and made it a holiday to remember. Would deffo recommend if the same team are here.

I was on vacation with my 11 year old son. The vacation was wonderful! The staff is very friendly, always helpful. The animation team is wonderful, extremely cheerful guys. They entertained all the guests, even the youngest ones! I really enjoyed my vacation.

Unforgettable journeys! Animators on top! Great atmosphere. The best holiday in a hotel! Thank you to all the animation team. The hotel staff is super nice , the rooms are spotless and we eat well 👍 ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️

reviews.review_title: Great Entertainment, Delicious Food & Inviting Pools – A Perfect Holiday Spot
reviews.review_text: I had a wonderful stay at Houda Golf Beach in Tunisia. The rooms were cleaned daily and kept very tidy, which made the stay even more comfortable. The food was excellent and varied – there was always something new to try. Twice a week, they served themed dinners: one evening with regional Tunisian cuisine and another with delicious Italian dishes.  The animation team was fantastic – they made sure no one got bored and organized fun activities for guests of all ages. Overall, the hotel has a warm, family-friendly atmosphere that made us feel welcome and relaxed. I would definitely recommend this place for a great holiday experience.

Hotel dated especially the rooms but it's ok for what we paid.  All staff amazing.  Very friendly can't do enough for you especially the animation team.  Best guys!!! Entertainment all day and night it's great!!   Food...  lunch and dinner is OK.  Breakfast terrible.  Hardly any choice. Pool area very clean and tidy and you got a padded bed which is even better.  A few bits they could improve on.  We have lost a few nights sleep with fire doors banging all night as the latches are broken.  Some slides for the kids which they loved!   Hotel has nothing outside so don't expect to go out a wander.  All in all we would stay here again it's good value for what you pay.

The entertainment was great the children entertained all day and evening   Very welcoming. Good food and friendly people. Would definitely recommend and come back again. Maid service was exceptional and cleanliness very good. Local bus outside the gate. Will be back again next year

The animators sound perfect and very good for your children the food changes is not always the same the rooms are correct neshiter especially asked to change rooms if it is not suitable for you and the bar and very helpful cocktel galore friends in real nehsiter not

An excellent stay at this all inclusive hotel. We spent 4 and a half days in early May, and we had a great time. Everything was clean, the staff cared for us. The quality of the meals is to be noted as the kindness of everyone. The animation team is just great! Congratulations to yaya and nader! The bartender is great too! As for the outings, do not hesitate to ask Habib and lotfi, they will accompany you.

Excellent memory of our stay both the quality of the restaurant and the animation. A very good organization, the hotel offers many activities that could be suitable for any age. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wishes to have a comfortable stay without difficulty

The stay with friends at Houda Hotel went well. The room is clean. Maintenance every day. The staff is very attentive. Great animation team. The superb pool!  We did not like the beach! Near Monastir and Sousse to walk!

I recommend.  From the staff to the care of its travelers.  Top animation team that does a lot to make the hotel live.  Thank you to them all as kind as each other.  The pool is great.  Except flat, the range ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️

Very good stay overall! The hotel is clean, comfortable and well located. Special mention to the animation team Yaya, Zizou, Nader, really at the top: dynamic, smiling and always present to set the mood – a real plus for the stay! Small flat on the reception side, where the welcome could have been warmer and more professional. But overall, a nice experience that I recommend. 👍

Excellent hotel, large pool, varied food. Animators 10/10. Bar with unlimited cocktails for every taste. Aquapark on the hotel grounds. Live music, evening shows on the terrace. Beach 50 meters from the hotel, weather not for swimming, sea is cold.

During my time at the hotel, I really liked the animators. They perfectly organized and planned their classes.Gymnastics,fitness all kinds of games,dancing.In the evenings they organize discotheques,games of different plan,children,youth,and adults.Everything is conducted with good music,fun,incendiary!Well done guys. Thank them very much. It was good with them. I wish them success, prosperity and all good things.

very good  hosts very clean food not good  😂animator team excellent carnt fault them good for kids  shows good activity good  location not to good carnt go out anywhere  rooms clean dailey  barman very frendly loverly warm weather very quiet in may

Great stay with my wife varied food personal restaurant very helpful team animation that gives a plus for the hotel thank you to them I recommend the hotel quiet clean a large pool A swimming pool with slide and a heated pool lots of activities to do  One thing I didn't like about the beach of the hotel sanitation that clears on the beach

Nice hotel with a large pool near the beach. The animation is top and dynamic. Little nod for the yaya animator who knew how to animate well during our 4 days. Not to mention the bartenders always smiling. Recommend without hesitation.

Great hotel, great animators. I recommend. Great food and very friendly service. Great bar, very large selection of drinks. Every day great fun by the pool, zumba, aqua gym, french bolls and darts. In addition, large pools with slides. Great music.

Beautiful hotel with a large swimming pool, by the sea. Very nice welcome on arrival. The animators are very present and very professional to make your stay pleasant. The waiters too are very attentive as all the staff at this hotel.  I recommend you.

Well as you can see by the title 3 visits in one year,the hotel must do some things right. Not a perfect score though but let's leave the negative stuff to the end. So No 1 for me is the complete Value For Money you get from this 24 Hour All Inclusive. The Friendliness of the staff whether it is bar waiters,food waiters,animation team,cleaners,gardeners and reception. Special mention to Ben " my brother's,kept me supplied with various drinks during the day,water, Mint tea,B52 and Vodka Sprite. The rooms are a bit dated but very clean and maid very good. Entertainment team led by my friend Rio are a new team but very good.Only slight criticism is in the last year nothing at all new.Same shows but good  nonetheless. So now we come to the main negative the Food. Firstly I will say that you will never starve at this hotel but sometimes the choice and quality of food let's them down. Breakfast was ok with Omelette and fried eggs and some pastries.Toaster is a waste of time. Lunch at Wok with Sammi with Pizza,Noodles,fish was pretty good.But in the beach restaurant pretty poor quality and a lot of things cold. During the day from Noon to 6pm beside the Pool there is a pink burger van,and to be fair their burgers and panini's were pretty good. Now for most people after day on the beach theirmain meal of the day is dinner.But this has been the main bone of contention formost people.Choice and quality are the 2 main words that come to mind.As I explained to a manager it is not more British style food I wanted but more good Tunisian food like Brik.Yes they went and made me one and it was on menu most nights after that.Ihot treated very well last few nights and they even asked me night before what I wanted next day.Iy will be interesting if they continue to improve in this aspect. But 10 out of 10 for listening and improving last few days of my hols. So to sum up if you want Value for Money,friendly staff,great entertainment and plenty food and drink come here. If you are a huge " Foodie" not the place for you. I will be back in November keep the food improvement coming along😎❤️

The entertainment team is very good. Reception is very friendly, and the restaurant is very nice, with lots of good quality food. The room is spacious, the pool is very big and clean. And the beach is also very nice, I will definitely come back.

Entertainment was great Food was brilliant The pool was nice  So was the indoor pool  It was good to meet new people My room was good standard  Activities were very fun Great if you are going on holiday to Tunisia  The beach restaurant was brilliant  Camel rides on the beach

Good week spent in this hotel!! Animation team on top. Good Broadway and Tunisian shows  Swimming pool and beach perfect  Good food, Tunisian couscous and very good Asian meals. Very nice housekeeper  Server too and reception listening

Great hotel, you feel in good hands as if you are coming into the family. Animation,Yoga is great,Steparobic,especially since badchata and minidisco every evening very nice I've been coming here for years Massage is good. Beach is fantastic

Very good hotel I have already been here 2 times and would love to come again the entertainment team is great and lovely lots of activities to do and amazing food and delicious I LOVE IT HERE they have 2 very big pool one indoor and heated and one outside they is a very good massage and spar at this hotel and it’s honestly incredible

very good could it i very good the entertainment is fabulous i love it darts in a motioning berry good spar amazing food is so good very delicious there is two pools one inside and one out side very nice i would recommend also they have wafted polo in an afternoon

Very friendly staff with great sense of humour. Variety of entertainment and activities at the hotel. Tunisian show is worth a watch, great dancing with fire. Entertainment team are really friendly and put on a great show. Room is lovely, air con is brilliant.

Fantastic hotel and great entertainment. Lots of different activities both during the day and at night.  Shows at night are great - bingo and a Tunisian show with fire eating last night were particularly good.   I hope to come back again 😀😀😎☀️

Very nice hotel! Perfect service  Imed made us take a wonderful horse ride! I recommend it 100% 🔆 Our guide (Ghassen Marsit) was also wonderful, he allowed us to discover Tunisia over several days 🐪🏝️🏜️  SpongeBob (Zan 🫏), waiters and bartenders (especially Sofien 🫶🏻) are on top of the game, they spoiled us during our week and we will also come back thanks to them in this great hotel that allowed us to meet with family and live a great holiday!  Thanks to you!  And surely see you next year 🔆🥰

Super friendly staff  Clean hotel and perfect food Whether with family or friends or simply alone, I recommend this hotel completely  Hyper well maintained complex  Zan's quite a character who wants to be known

I stayed at Les Orangers Beach Hotel in Hammamet, Tunisia from May 19 to 24 with my grandmother, and unfortunately, the experience did not live up to our expectations at all.  First of all, the food was extremely repetitive. After two days, it felt like we were eating exactly the same thing, without any strain. In addition, I noticed very unequal treatment by the restaurant staff: if you are not English, German or “typically French”, you are almost completely ignored. No smile, no look, a real feeling of marginalization.  I was also very shocked to see that bottles of wine were automatically placed on all tables, as if it were a norm that everyone should drink alcohol, without taking into account customers who do not consume alcohol for religious reasons.  The reception on arrival went well, but at the time of departure, it was a different story: the receptionist slept on a sofa (it was 2am for a departure at 2:40am for the airport) impossible to return the card or make the formalities of departure. This is a huge lack of professionalism.  Regarding the room: this is one of the worst points of the stay. First, it is never stated that the central air conditioning does not work until June 1. The result: unbearable heat throughout the building. I had to insist on being given a room with individual air conditioning. Second, there is no soundproofing. The walls are so thin that you can hear everything that happens in the neighbors. We were awakened several times in the middle of the night by din, screaming, music, and one night in particular was totally unacceptable we were awakened by very explicit intimate noises... inadmissible in a hotel supposed to be family-friendly. Indeed, the hotel calls itself family-run, but nothing is put in place to guarantee a minimum of privacy and tranquility.  The pool is also very small. As soon as there are a few people, it becomes difficult to swim comfortably.  As for Wi-Fi, it’s simply a lie. There is only at the reception. No connection in the rooms, not to the restaurant, not to the pool, not to the beach. For a hotel that calls itself 4 stars, this is unacceptable.  Fortunately, there were some positives: the beach is really nice and the security guards are very professional and welcoming. The cleaning in the rooms is perfectly done, the maids are very serious and do an excellent job. The balconies are also nice to enjoy a little outside.  But in all honesty, this is not enough to compensate for all the shortcomings. This hotel is definitely not worth its 4 stars. To me, it's worth two, not more. I would not recommend this property, especially if you are traveling with family or seniors.

Very nice staff and delicious food. There are many activities on site such as tennis, volleyball and darts. There is even a free massage. The shows in the evening are also really mega funny, the entertainment team makes a good mood. Unfortunately, however, there is wlan only in the lobby.

The entertainment team was very nice the hotel facility very nice I liked the activities and the shows were very cool. The food was good, the rooms were clean. Located 10 minutes by taxi from Los Medina and the taxis are right in front of the hotel. I would definitely come back.

Excellent stay, very welcoming , adorable animators and care for you , very good animations every day morning lunch and evening . Room clean every day maid's passage, catering with several gastronomic choices and very very good.

We had the most amazing time, the hotel is lovely, Zan and Sasuki made us and our children feel like family.  Staff are very very helpful and accommodating, would definitely come again. Great activities my daughter loved the horse riding.  Thankyou to all at Les Orangers beach hotel. Tunisia is a beautiful country.

Stayed in one of the bungalows and cannot fault the service we received from the moment we arrived to leaving. Whilst we ate in the restaurants at the beginning, we ended up having all melas on the veranda overlooking the beach.  For breakfast we were given a list to choose from, but for other meals just ask and they will try to help. We chose  a BBQ one night which was very nice.  Mini bar fridge was full on arrival with branded drinks, came around often to see if we wanted anything more. Asked for some water, got 12 bottles, asked for a g and t, got a litre bottle of gin. Bottle of Schweppes tonic, a plate of sliced lemons and a bucket if ice.  Wi-Fi also good in the room, even streamed a movie on the iPad, no buffering. Overall a very relaxing holiday and great to reset.

The animations are superb and the animators very well and the shows grandiose. Massage the spa the servers very nice. Great reception. Nickel catering. The rooms are very good. Recommended to all. I'll get back to it.

I have been coming to this hotel with my late husband for many years. So I decided to go on my own, the first time I have holidayed solo! I am so glad I did!  I loved it. Everything was perfect, I was never worried or lonely. The staff and holiday makers were so nice and friendly. I made many friends, of different nationalities, even if my French, German is limited?  Food and drinks were spot on, the room was very clean, with all I needed, it had a brilliant shower, ( I am going to email the hotel and ask for the same room next year)  I cannot recommend the hotel highly enough. It maybe not to everyone’s taste, but for me, it was just what I wanted and absolutely perfect!

Hello, my name is Maria. I came to the hotel. His name is Al-Muradi. It's very good. It was a surprise for us, but it's very good. The pool, the reception, the room, and the food is all good. It's really good and I thank the team Entertainment And I thank the special person named bebo. He is a fast man. I like him well. He made me and my friend happy. Thank you We will come again soon

The animation team (Lucka and the others) is great! The food could be better, especially for those of us who don't eat meat. :) The rooms are nothing special, but since we spent the least amount of time in them, we managed just fine. We might come back.

I don't get why people expect 5 star in Tunisia as you would get in Europe, hotel is amazing the staff can't do enough for you, room was huge cleaner was in everyday, reception staff ask anything they would help, bar staff work there arses off people complaining about paper cups your drinking outside if you ask for a glass you will get one, pool area is amazing beach is amazing the best part of my holiday where the animation team i travel alot and these guys are by far the best❤️, its Tunisia the food isn't great but thats Tunisia it's like that everywhere there but i cant fault this hotel and a big shout out to momo and saif from animation i will definitely come back regardless of all the karens moaning ♥️♥️and the lady by reception she sots opposite it and will help you with anything you need ♥️

reviews.review_title: Great hotel, animation team are brilliant and hard working
reviews.review_text: After reading the reviews after I booked I was so worried, but after spending a week here it really isn’t that bad, the only downfalls are- the transfer is 3 hours.  The food is repetitive , no sandwiches for lunch just breakfast dinner & dinner. No ice lollies either.  Not really anything around so if you just want the beach and a pool this is perfect.  The animation team here made my holiday, along with the bar staff and waiter they really do deserve a pay rise they have such long days and are so hard working! Always smiling and enthusiastic! My 6 month old had the best time due to the animation team.  The hotel is clean and constantly being cleaned. Everyone is friendly. I probs wouldn’t come back due to food and not anything really to do near by but we made the most of it!  Also the staff here are on around £5 a day in English money Wich is so sad because they are so hard working!

reviews.review_title: Waste of money this hotel is not even 1* don't go on pictures no CCTV in hotel no security in hotel
reviews.review_text: No management no service no internet in room no kettle for tea coffee in room no water bottle in room for water bottles u have to go in lobby to get water n for wifi food no variety n same type of food every second day very minimal staff phones not working in room

reviews.review_title: Good hotel, crap food Beirut outside
reviews.review_text: Great hotel, met some great people but food and drink are very inadequate most of the food was inedible to our party it was either cold, full of bones or just plain disgusting apart from the cakes they were fantastic and choice was terrible and brits aren't catered for as for outside Beirut is prettier than mahdia as soon as I stepped out of a taxi near the medina I was accosted by yet another scamming beg thinking I was his meal ticket then what we were told was a lovely walk up around the cemetery and fort was a disgrace flea ridden cats everywhere accompanied by rubbish dumped everywhere and to to our disgust I thought Muslims respected they're dead only to discover the cemetery was the local fly tipping site never ever again

Terrible hotel I would say 2stars, food cold , plane, no taste. Drinks serving in plastic cups disgusting have a coffee or tea in paper cup. Everything is old has horrible smell in room and towels yellow , was white long time ago. Very poor hotel. Be avoid!!!

reviews.review_title: Take it at face value and you’ll have a great time!
reviews.review_text: Upon arrival at the hotel our transfer was around 2- 2.5 hours from the airport, we had a direct transfer without any stops. As we arrived late, there were no facilities open apart from duty free in the airport at night to buy snacks / drinks so make sure you have some if you need it prior to leaving your departure airport or the airplane onboard snacks.   At arrival they did however save us some food and plated up a salad, some chicken, rice and potatoes which was a nice touch and gave us a large bottle of water. This was around 11pm.  Tunisia is a closed currency so if you need some and haven’t organised this at the airport, there is a cash point approximately 10 mins walk from the hotel.   At the hotel our check in process was easy and we were given a selection of rooms to chose from. We chose the sea view which was basic, but definitely fine for our needs.   Please note, this hotel probably was a 5* back in the day, but realistically it’s more like 3*.   We had 2 single beds, separate toilet and bathroom with a balcony. The tv had Channels but were mainly in French. WiFi throughout the hotel is pretty good though so you can use your phone to stream to the tvs etc if you want to. The room was carpeted throughout and many have criticised this - we personally didn’t see this as an issue as it was cleaned daily and the maids were in the room daily to clean/ change towels etc.  The food is relatively basic and repetitive. We came at the start of season so it’s probably unfair to give a full true reflection but we managed to find something to eat everyday without failure,  although found breakfast the most limited. There is however cereal, omelettes, eggs and crepes which we tended to eat repetitively. Lunches varied generally with the options being fish or beef with rice or potatoes and similarly with the evening meal with sometimes offering turkey or chicken. At breakfast you can pay 4 dinar for fresh orange - worth it! Please note every day there is Pizza freshly made so at the very least you’ll definitely find something to eat.   The bar soft drinks are Fanta/ coke / lemonade, then there is strawberry juice, lemon and orange (these are like dilute but extremely strong). There is also a machine which you can find with breakfast offering pineapple juice, apple, orange, tropical juice etc. again we found we had to dilute with a little water. At the bar you can ask for water and they give you a big bottle of 1.5l which is handy so don’t buy this from the shop on site!   As for alcoholic drinks there are local spirits, beer, wine and cocktails. The cocktails vary depending on who makes them but I would say the pina colada was probably the closest to what it should taste like.   Please note it is quite pushy for sales of quads/ camels or The spa treatments, equally if you go out into the town of Mahdia make sure you hide your wristband! They use the local “oh I’m a chef at your hotel” technique to lure you into their shops to buy souvenirs. It is extremely difficult to avoid so be aware of this in advance!   The overall hotel facilities are great. Yes in need of decoration and a slight upgrade in terms of modernisation but if you take it at face value and you’re not a Karen you’ll have a fantastic time here. It is a lovely hotel with a fantastic team of people running it - customer service is excellent from all staff.  Finally The entertainment team / animation team. These people work tirelessly day in day out for extremely little money! They are fantastic at what they do and we’ve had a great holiday as a result. They get you involved in the dances, make you feel like a person and not just a number at the hotel and I can honestly say they’re great given their limited resources.   Overall I’d say this holiday for get away all inclusive has been fantastic for us and we definitely would return. Given it was start of season, its hard to give a true reflection of everything but I would say from what we have experienced as long as you don’t have too many high expectations you’ll have a great holiday here.  If you go looking for issues you’ll definitely find them, but if you’re looking for the sun, a nice environment and people who are genuinely interested in making your holiday then I would definitely recommend this hotel.

I arrive on December 20, good welcome , spacious room, attentive staff , varied meals , very nice decoration throughout the hotel , for Christmas very good meal friendly atmosphere , very nice show of the animation team .I look forward to New Year's Eve

reviews.review_title: Where not to stay in Tunisia
reviews.review_text: Avoid, avoid, avoid at all costs. This hotel is advertised as a 5 star, I would give 2 stars if it is lucky! Also stated it is 30 minutes from the airport, well it is at least 4 hours. Have stayed around the world in several 4/5 star all inclusive hotels and some are not so good as others, accepted. But this place… We are on holidays, we work hard all the year round and enjoy good wine and food. Drinks are served in plastic glasses, they are warm and not nice. So if you get the last glass of wine in the bottle around 22:00, they say “it’s gone “ and won’t open any more!! We did pay for all inclusive, but it is just not delivered. In the bathroom, there are holders for toothbrush cups etc, but no cups!! Food is average, well below average. The a la carte restaurant (there is only one, but advertised at three) is open three nights a week and the lovely restaurant manager Mr Mourani or something made sure we were booked in every time. Also this hotel is advertised as “ in the heart of the new tourist area”. Well, outside and for the walkable distance, is just wasteland and roaming dogs and a few restaurants. Please note, if you like to walk and stop at a bar for a beer, they do not serve any alcohol whatsoever outside the hotel. Our air conditioning stopped working first day and we reported it at reception and he told us “all stops in October “. Blatant lie as our room cleaner fixed it. Also it was remarked by a group of young Tunisian men in one of the cafes, that I was not wearing a hijab.  Top tip, bribe the bar staff, give them £10 at the start of your holiday and you will get real glasses and slightly better drinks.  Even better tip, DONT GO!!!

This Hotel is at best a 3 star. Run down rooms , damp beds fit for the dump, old broken furniture and peeling damp paint. Corridors with leaking roofs and mats to soak up wet. Wild dogs on the beach and staff that are not interested as season winds down. All inclusive do not bother as the Hotel will not provide it Evan though you pay for it. The hygiene of this Hotel is poor with guests getting sick, food standards and selection was the worst we have ever experienced in all our travels uneditable possibly the only all inclusive we have lost weight. The sunbed mattress were sticky and done the dinner mats in the restaurant unclean and The Entertainment more enthusiasm in a primary school play. The Hotel is 1hour and 40 minutes from airport in a bus that nearly cost us our lives with a dangerous driver on his phone all the time. I can not stress enough do not use this Hotel and believe me this is brief total waste of money.😡

reviews.review_title: Downgraded and senior management not receptive to guest improvement suggestions
reviews.review_text: In other hotels just don't swerve into this one! The reception on arrival totally overwhelmed, not even a page helps you bring the suitcases to the room. In the main restaurant there is no eye-catching, totally chaotic the table clearing/uncovering, food was not written to - ALLERGERS have the total look. The manager does not take care of the hotel areas at all, neither does they control them. After contact, the guest gets the impression that the guest is annoying!  The manager is also not receptive to small suggestions for improvement. Wi-Fi only in lobby area. The dishes are broken off - you can get injured here- is nevertheless offered to the guest every day again.  Even with a hotel that has become old, you can maintain the standard with daily checks, which has not been the case here for years.  It was only during an announced visit from the management level that the guests were able to experience the hustle and bustle of the day before. Since everything was then acutely cleaned on high polish, trimmed, swept, cleaned, covered, fixed - I would suggest to the hotel management times incognito check in there 2 days, then you can see it directly that the pretended quality is just sham! My rating: Don't go to this hotel, because you can spend your saved holiday money better elsewhere where quality is right!

We stayed here for 10 nights October 2024, the hotel is absolutely beautiful! Rooms are big with loads of storage and a beautiful balcony view!! The hotel has 2 pools & a kids pool, a spa, 2 bars and loads of activities included with the all inclusive. Such as football, volleyball, beach volleyball, darts, ping pong, pool, archery. People work on the beach directly outside for jet skis, boat trips and the hotel can organise excursions, we did quad biking and camel riding. The hotel is about 15 minute drive from Madhia city which is an absolutely gorgeous place. We also ate out 3/4 times and all nearby restaurants are amazing. The food in and out of the hotel was all beautiful, there’s loads of option and is served beautifully. The drinks menu in the hotel is slightly limited however they have most alcoholic drinks/ soft drinks. I definitely recommend asking the hotels photographer (they have 2) to take pictures and print them, we did and ours are beautiful. There isn’t an ATM at the hotel but one about 15 mins walk, however you can change currency in the hotel. There’s also 2 shops which have literally everything you could need on holiday! We had a shuttle transfer and it took about 31/2 hours so I do recommend getting a private transfer to save time. Other than the long transfer i cant say anything bad about this hotel, it’s absolutely beautiful with lovely people, good food and in a good location in Madhia. Will definitely be back next year!!

Firstly let me say the transfer was at least 4 hours from the airport that we flew into. Arrived at 5am in the morning after a quick check in we were taken to our room. When we got to the room we were pleasantly surprised we had a suite which was unexpected but a nice surprise. Room was lovely sea view couldn't have asked for more. The hotel was spotless the staff were friendly and helpful. The food well as a fussy eater myself I still managed to eat something everytime .The waiters were great cleaned tables very quickly fresh water on table at every meal. Would I go again yes but fly into a closer airport.

Really comfy beds, great staff, clean rooms and lovely pool.  Food is ok could do with more selection for English- beach is stunning and definitely worth getting up for the sunrise as its stunning! Would happily stay again - staff and locals are lovely

All staff from SPA were very friendly and kept hight standard of customer service. A dealer lady (Sameh) did a fantastic job by recomending which massage will suit to my preferences.  Personally I highly recommend a Jalila for massage. She is top one.

reviews.review_title: Great bust, not even worth 2 stars
reviews.review_text: The room was old, spoiled, with stained carpeting where you were afraid to walk barefoot on it (foot fungus). AC condensation dripped on carpet. There was initially no safe, which was then brought in afterwards and simply placed on the shelf of the wardrobe, brief briefing, that was it.  The food for breakfast & dinner was below average. Unlovingly presented and manufactured. Scoop dishes such as ragouts or goulash with bones on the meat, food, vegetables and side dishes were pushed cold from the kitchen (not hygienic with HACCP, food must be heated to at least 65°C, also in Tunisia) and only warmed in the edition !!!!. Every morning we had the same white bread, we had different in Tunisia. There wasn't even toast. For an omelette you had to wait in line for 20 minutes. The worst part was the placemats, disgusting. Absolutely unhygienic, dirty, because in the plastic net still the remains of the predecessor. From Friday to Sunday, the hotel was packed with locals, where we don't mind in principle, but the eating habits just made us shake our heads and feel uncomfortable. The food selection and preparation was also underground on those days. Hotel has a top location, beach, loungers and umbrella good. Pool is in need of renovation. Annimation not with passion. All in all a total bust, except top location and beach

We are here now and having the best time. For any doubters, forget the negative reviews, we absolutely love it. Rooms are adequate, food is good as are the drinks. Entertainment is fantastic and everyone of more than friendly. Still 7 days left and loving every minute. Well recommended.

2/3 things very good: the beach and pool as well as the entertainment team. Unlimited water bottles during the day  The rest very average, to put it simply: Dismal welcome on arrival at night (not even a glass of water for welcome after 2 hours bus) Very old bathroom Pool/beach bar staff and unpleasant deckchair (tipping only counts) Sunbeds booked very early in the morning (not allowed) Hall decoration and interior rather rustic / outdated) Internet very difficult to access (only from the lobby, in good weather) and impossible from the rooms Meals/buffet correct but cooks waiters not pleasant

5 Star Pension Very Big Scam  Pension to escape, where to start, restaurant ..... No choice (chicken, veal, beef) well spiced  Meal that is cold or very little warm No water and sometimes no glass, when we sometimes ask for water we do not have a very dry meal. Tables that are not cleared and sometimes eaten with the cart of dirty dishes. Belly ball when meal time arrives.  Rooms ..... Bed made as they can  1 shower towel for 2 (large lack of staff, respect for poor ladies) Beach Bar...... Non-existent and the waiter so friendly that we ended up not going there  The staff.... Lovely as a prison door but still some exceptions The only positive the bar inside, friendly, smiling And the Mr of security at the beach, exceptional because he is so kind, very kind.

name: Hotel Royal Tulip Korbous Bay Thalasso & Springs

reviews.review_text: I would like to express my sincere thanks to the entire hotel team, especially to Ala at the reception, whose warm welcome and professionalism were outstanding throughout my stay.  A huge thank you also to Athem, the concierge chef, for his great availability, his precious advice, and for organizing such delicate attention on my birthday. This gesture touched me deeply and made my stay even more memorable.  Thank you all for this unforgettable experience.

reviews.review_title: We are very dissatisfied with our stay, far from the standards expected for a 5 star hotel.
reviews.review_text: We are very dissatisfied with our stay, far from the standards expected for a 5 star hotel.  No kettle or tap in the room. When we called the front desk, they checked twice looking in the room, instead of just apologizing. Not at all professional.  Few choices for dinner and breakfast. The spa pool was not clean. As for the view, it was very disappointing because of the outdoor pool, completely empty, when the weather was nice and we could have enjoyed it.  How can a 5-star hotel accommodate its guests with an empty pool, especially when it’s supposed to be the highlight of the property? The whole experiment was ruined.  Frankly, either you are a real 5-star hotel and you rise to the occasion, or you assume a 4- or 3-star rating. I don’t know who awards the stars in Tunisia, but clearly it’s not justified here.  We left very disappointed. One thing is certain: we will not come back.
