The welcome was warm, with a staff with little care, always smiling and professional. Every detail is carefully considered to offer a unique experience. The suite I stayed in was spacious, tastefully decorated and absolutely comfortable. Gastronomy is another highlight of the hotel: Every meal was a real pleasure! Many thanks to the whole team for this memorable experience. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a luxurious and relaxing stay. I can’t wait to go back!

I am staying at a hotel nearby. Their Spa is being renovated and I read about this hotel on Google reviews. I emailed them on Tuesday and Mohamed, the Spa manager emailed me back within the hour offering me an appointment for the Silver package I had read about for 350 TND for the following day. It was just fantastic. It included a 60 min massage, 30 min Hammam, 30 min jacuzzi bath with hot sea water and rose water and a 20 min face massage. Slippers, robe, relaxation area with lots of tisana (herb tea), bottles of water. A large warm indoor seawater pool with hydrojets. I was there for 4 hours. The staff were all so lovely and friendly and good at their job even though it is Ramadan. I saw a poster at Reception for another excellent package  - 275 TND for breakfast, lunch, use of pool, 40 min massage, 30 min facial, and use of a suite room all day. There was a 50 TND single supplement but still a wonderful experience for the price. There was a lovely helpful lady on reception called Ghada who got staff to take me to meals (2 different restaurants - the hotel is like a huge palace - art work and marble everywhere). She also took me to my room. Again, Mohamed had everything perfectly organised in the Spa and was kind enough to change the facial until after lunch. Restaurant staff was excellent too, as was the food. One young waiter (with a long Turkish name) went out of his way to make me a "caffe latte" (I found the cappuccino from the machine a bit too sweet). The rooms are luxurious with extremely comfortable beds. Everywhere was quiet because it is low season which was perfect for me.  This is a uniquely exquisite hotel with a fabulous Spa and wonderful staff who provide outstanding service. I am very grateful to have experienced being here.

reviews.review_title: My new favorite hotel in Hamamet
reviews.review_text: Great experience, I’ve been to several hotels in Hamamet this is become my favorite it , junior suite is spacious , well decorated Tunisian style, the bed is comfortable . I really enjoyed the jacuzzi and Spa pool with Mediterranean Sea water . The staff were very friendly. Just happened to meet the owner in breakfast his  very humble and welcoming.  General manager Samir N’cir came and checked on my experience in the Hotel . The Hotel is well maintained and well decorated with North African Arts..  looking forward to enjoy this hotel in summer.

reviews.review_title: A very nice hotel in Tunisia
reviews.review_text: Coming for a week of thalasso as a couple at the end of September, we discovered a beautiful luxurious hotel, a spacious and comfortable suite, fruit cup, bottle of water, Tunisian cakes, chocolates or dried fruits depending on the day. The thalasso center is well organized, its staff is competent and attentive, as well as reception, cleaning, beach and restaurants. The breakfast buffet is impeccable, good coffee machine and real orange juice, etc. The à la carte restaurant, for us included in the half board offers a Tunisian menu and a European menu, starters, meat, fish and desserts of very good quality. Little downside, prefer the à la carte restaurant to the very hearty buffet and with choice, but a tone below culinary level. In total very little extra expenses, water and wine at table at very reasonable rates. We will definitely come back with friends next time..

reviews.review_title: Award exaggerated for what it is
reviews.review_text: The Award corresponds to a 5 star luxury Parisian or even more! Spacious room but noise all day long even at night with children jumping upstairs, I saw people bathing with their clothes, this same person was at the beach then no shower with his long dress in the pool! Waiter of the evening buffet who adds you 4 drinks and 2 bottles of water on the bill! breakfast 25 min for a pancake.. August when we took the room the Award was 440 euros per night and frankly nothing in the Pension corresponds to that Award! I took a triple because the receptionist told me on the phone that with a baby of 2 years I could not take doubles and that they do not add a cot when it was not true ...

reviews.review_title: This is not the exceptional 5 star that we expected
reviews.review_text: I knew that the 5-star category does not have the same meaning in all countries but when the Award paid equals that of a 5-star Shangri La Barrière or Marriot , you expect equivalent performances. Certainly the rooms are spacious but around despite the efforts of the staff we can not find his account. Bedding is classic hard pillows. The courtesy tray is shameful, cheap kettle that leaks responsible for short circuit, instant coffee when all over the world you find espresso makers. Decent breakfast for a 5 star, already seen better with a neighbor. Not enough material, we wait 45 minutes for a pancake!  No children's club so punished with thalassotherapy if you come with family! The 120 dinars dinner is also not exceptional and children pay as much as adults for 2 slices of pizza and ice cream. No drinks included despite the Award.  In short this is not the luxury 5 star I expected given the fame and especially the Award paid.

Staff prepared, kind, very polite and above all attentive to every detail.  Very nice and clean structure. Both International and local cuisine very good  Spacious and elegant room  Super equipped and well maintained private beach.

I like to go back there. This hotel is unique and the best in Tunisia. Its thalassotherapy is incredible. Fortunately this kind of place existed. The meals served are good, the rooms are clean, beautiful and spacious. Each time I discover an unexplored corner. A little hello to the gentleman from the Moorish café who sings and plays so well. See you soon I hope

Every trip to Tunisia passes through Hasdrubal Hammamet as we appreciate the service, the setting and the services.  The helpful staff are dedicated, friendly and professional. The cuisine is excellent both at the PDJ (whose buffet is rich and varied) and at the Le Gourmet restaurant.  We recommend the Thalasso Center for exfoliation in the traditional hammam, massages... The friendly and professional staff will be able to advise you.

It has been a magnificent experience. All perfect. The rooms are very spacious and clean, the food is very delicious, perfect service from all the staff. A family visit and everyone was happy. He recommended the hotel 💯. Thank you Azdrubal Hotel. We will surely return ;))).

Nice Looking hotel, staff very happy and friendly and spotlessly clean.. If there was another 50 guests it was a lot.due to this food choice extremely poor.only 1 of 5 restaurants open. Pool and pool bar closed, beach area had no beds and no entertainment, no air conditioning in the room so couldn’t sleep

I had a faithful and excellent stay in my favorite hotel: thalassotherapy at the top, reception staff, catering, maintenance, gardens, security, always very friendly and competent✌️  Thank you to the general manager Samir N'CIR for his attentiveness and his kind responsiveness to resolve any possible problem.  Congratulations in particular this evening to the Olivier restaurant in Chokri, to Fouizia and to the clerk present for their kindness,  Wonderful pleasure for the eyes and taste this evening for the flambéing of the beef fillet and the crepes susettes.

reviews.review_title: A charming stay in an inimitable setting
reviews.review_text: Without a doubt, this hotel is the best in terms of high-level services, quality of stay and restaurants. the friendly, attentive staff with very good communication are also among the major strengths of this establishment. This is the fifth time we have stayed at the Hasdrubal Hammamet hotel over a period of 10 years, and it has confirmed our impression that it has managed to maintain its high standard despite changes in the tourism market. Although the hotel is ideally located to access the main tourist areas of the Hammamet region, Sousse or Tunis, there is no need to leave it with what it offers on site such as various services and amenities, s Added to all this is a truly heavenly beach.  Another notable characteristic is the authenticity reflected in the menus. Despite the Mediterranean dimension and diversity in the restaurants, it is pleasant to find real Tunisian dishes with excellent and authentic flavors.

Everything is perfect, we have been going to this hotel for 19 years, in need of a refreshment but nothing urgent, hotel management and thalassotherapy, nothing to envy of the 5 stars, the only downside is the food has deteriorated, why in the morning the omelettes are great and the evening they are not cooked no one learned in a hotel school it's a shame

reviews.review_title: Loyal to this hotel, we have the pleasure of returning there regularly
reviews.review_text: Perfect service in all departments: dedicated, attentive and professional staff. The cuisine is delicious, the dishes and buffets are varied and well presented. The thalassotherapy center is fantastic and the service perfect.

reviews.review_title: Nice hotel but they let people pee under the tree in the restaurant
reviews.review_text: Hasdrubal Thalasso Hammamet is one of the oldest hotels in Hammamet, and while it may show signs of age, I was pleasantly surprised by the overall cleanliness, large room, and charm it offered.  The hotel's aging exterior might not be the most visually appealing due to lack of maintenance, but once inside, I found the interior well-maintained and quite nice. The cleanliness of the rooms and common areas was commendable, which greatly contributed to a comfortable stay. I wanted to add that it was enjoyable but events which happened during my stay destroyed my enjoyment.  Despite its age, this hotel manages to retain a certain charm,unfortunately some staff is  friendly but some other staff's demeanor adds to the negative experience.  My recent visit to the à la carte restaurant was marred by an unfortunate incident that left a lasting negative impression. While I had initially looked forward to enjoying a pleasant dining experience, what I witnessed was completely unexpected and unacceptable.  During my time at the restaurant, someone decided to engage in public urination, which was not only unsanitary but also highly disrespectful to the establishment and its patrons. Such behavior is entirely inappropriate and should not occur in any public setting, especially a place where people come to enjoy their meals.  I believe it is the responsibility of the restaurant staff to maintain a safe and comfortable environment for all customers. In this case, it appeared that the staff either failed to notice or address the situation promptly. This incident significantly detracted from what could have otherwise been an enjoyable meal. Kamel the server was informed and witnessed the incident but didn't do anything.  I hope that the restaurant takes measures to improve its security and staff training to prevent such incidents in the future, ensuring that customers can dine without experiencing such discomfort.  I must say I was quite disappointed with the level of customer service provided by the receptionist Ghada. While the hotel itself had a luxurious ambiance, the receptionist's attitude was much to be desired. I had hoped for a warm and welcoming experience when I was asking for change, but instead, I was met with a receptionist who was not nice at all. She appeared disinterested, and her demeanor came across as unfriendly. It's essential for a hotel of this caliber to have staff who make guests feel valued and appreciated whatever they're wearing or whatever they look like, but unfortunately, that was not my experience, no smile, no eye contact, not even being regarded as a customer.  Yes that was Ghada who forgot the meaning of the word receptionist.  I believe that the front desk staff play a crucial role in setting the tone for a guest's stay, and in this case, it left a negative impression. I hope the hotel management takes note of this and addresses the issue to ensure that future guests have a more pleasant experience with this lady and others like her.  This is a hotel not a funeral home!  At the Thalasso another funeral home  the person sitting there (Mohammed) was lost was not welcoming and was not even smiling very bad service luckily Hedia saved the day when I asked her to help; her genuine smile and service were very appreciated unlike Mohammed who was indifferent, that person should not be facing customers even if he is the person responsible of the Thalasso Center. Working with customers is an art!  I want to acknowledge the hotel director's Mr Ncir as well as the chief receptionist Leila thoughtful gesture of bringing flowers and offering an apology for any inconveniences during my stay. It was a kind and considerate gesture that showed a commitment to guest satisfaction.  However, despite this apology and the goodwill shown, I must express that the service standards at the hotel remained unchanged. While the flowers were a nice touch, they do not address the underlying concerns regarding the service quality.  I believe that true improvement lies in addressing the issues that were initially raised.

We were there at the end of August 2023 Very beautiful luxurious hotel, friendly staff, they are at your disposal at any time, extraordinary buffet at dinner, Simply magnificent and I highly recommend it.

reviews.review_title: Top & Best Luxurious 5 Star  Resort in Africa . Exceptional Service.
reviews.review_text: Big Thank you to Mr Samir Nsir the hotel GM for his passionate service and his great leadership.  Especial Thanks to Samir the Hotel Duty Manager for  His personalised Service. Not sure how he remembers The hotel guests by name ? Brilliant.  We'll done.  Thanks to all Hasdrubal staff for their attention to details and genuine care during my stay at the Resort. Another happy and memorable experience at The Spa. I am not surprised the hotel deliver 7 Star service, since they are a member of Luxury Hotel of The World.(SLH)  Please keep up the Good Work. I will return soon. Philippe

Clean, nice hotel, friendly staff, available and smiling. Beautiful sandy beach, a dynamic animation team. As far as catering is concerned, a diversification of dishes on a daily basis would only benefit this balance sheet.

First stay in this hotel everything is perfect welcome with the surprise of an upgrade to a pool view room on arrival, maid, butler passing by bartenders, waiters, animators, spa staff ++ impeccable cleanliness. Thank you again to the restaurant staff for the attention paid to the birthday of one of our friends  Thanks again to all for this great stay I recommend this Hotel

4th stay in 2 years and still satisfied. if it is true that some parts of the hotel deserve a renovation (bathtub, hallway carpeting,...), the hotel is clean, welcoming. The staff, whatever their profession, are smiling, polite, professional. I could see how quick it was: after a slip near the outside bar, I sprained my left elbow; immediately after my fall, several employees arrived, seated me in a wheelchair to take me back to my room; 15 minutes later, a doctor called by the hotel arrived to examine me and refer me to a clinic. Thank you all. See you later.

reviews.review_title: Decent stay, but past its prime
reviews.review_text: Royal Garden Palace has its charm, but it's clear that its best days are behind it. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful, and the restaurant team – especially the evening shift – was professional and welcoming.  Desserts were top-notch, but beef dishes were a letdown: steaks were overcooked and rubbery, and stews needed much more time to become tender. On the bright side, fish and shrimp were delicious. The Tunisian night and local cuisine were real highlights!  Entertainment options were quite limited, which is a downside considering there isn’t much to do outside the hotel. The crocodile farm is about 3 km away – worth the walk on your own.  The hotel surroundings feel neglected, and while camels and horses on the beach might sound exotic, the mess they leave behind is less appealing.  Overall: a decent one-time experience, but not a place we’d return to.

We stayed in this Hotel waiting to be able to stay in the one of our original booking. We are very disappointed with this hotel, for the Royal Garden Palace, only the Garden is royal. We ate badly, food for Germans and Poles, the staff is cold, no smile, no welcome in all areas. the rooms are obsolete, bathroom with bathtub, we should think of people who have difficulty being able to move easily. Rust on the ceiling of the hall at night, animals in the drawers, refrigerator cooling very little, and so on. We would definitely recommend this hotel to our knowledge.

We had to stay at the Iberostar Eolia and 2 weeks before departure we are informed that it did not open on the scheduled date. Proposal to the royal garden palace , in view of the comments I had a lot of apprehension when at the hotel.....but surprised we had a pleasant stay, the rooms very clean and large garden view...very nice hotel lobby.......the staff very kind and helpful. Very very nice, beach.. good meal, fish every day......

Spacious room, sea view and quiet, very clean (thanks Lamia) large storage space. Establishment surrounded by a beautiful garden, sandy beach and emerald sea, deckchairs with mattresses as well as by the pool. The staff is really helpful and attentive. The only downside is the restoration, we find its happiness because it is varied but very repetitive. Large selection of vegetables, fruits and desserts Grilled meats are not tender and fish are full of bones. The cooks and the quality of the ingredients are not worthy of a 5 star...But that doesn't stop us from having very good times.

reviews.review_title: Simply not good enough for 5 stars.
reviews.review_text: As with many hôtels in Djerba the star rating reflects a distant past and there are a few glaring standards that differentiate this hotel from a truly luxury one. Firstly the dreadful all inclusive package  , limiting the guest to really substandard quality ingredients. All cocktails are bulk premixed stock and when served look nothing like their exotic namesakes. My husband and I don't drink alcohol but enjoy a 0.0 beer. Not available at this 5 star luxury establishment and the management refused to get some in for our stay. Even a shack on the beach had it for sale. And finally the indignity of trying to get a sunlounger around the pool. Forget it after 07.15. Despite the hotel clearly scorning the practice of towel dropping they do nothing to discourage it. In my opinion this alone puts it in a 3 star bracket. We are still at the hotel for another week, so will update as and when.

Very nice hotel. Very clean. Perfect welcome.  The staff is very welcoming. The restaurant is fine. Many fresh and cooked products on site.   The beach is pretty the pool is not heated.   Bemol: plastic waste on the beach and sidewalks. Outside the hotel perimeter.

reviews.review_title: One of the best experiences ever - Now or never :)
reviews.review_text: The hotel has exceptional animation team. You can have aqua aerobic or stretching during a team and unforgettable party every night. I visited quite a few hotels in my life but has not seen such a dedicated a professional animation team, especially Sirine.  The cleaning lady and the reception was perfect. But also the guy in charge of the main restaurant was very helpful. Thank you for the great vacation !  Marcin

We end our stay at this hotel. There's good and bad. This hotel must have been a good 5 stars about 15 years ago but more now. Big renovation to be expected. Carpeting more than aging in the hallways. Paints to refresh.  In May no air conditioning... surely to save money... the restaurant decent food I'm difficult but I ate to my hunger. the organization of catering services should be reviewed. Not all the tables are available because they're already ready for the following services. At the pool if you want a deckchair either early... napkins put on and people spend 10 minutes there during the day.  At 5:00 p.m. the staff is already packing the deckchair rugs. The staff is friendly. The flies are annoying! The spa is not bad and cheap. Good massages and friendly masseuses. Cleanliness of the toilets more cleaning in the day would not be a luxury.  The room is aging but suitable. No air conditioning in low season (May!) Here's a good stay but don't trust the nice photos and video with nice filters.

Pros: Very nice pool, beautiful garden, very neat. Our server Hichem very attentive and smiling. Nice tennis courts, well maintained. Comfortable wooden deckchairs.  Cons: Old hotel, far from the 5 islands. Old and poorly cleaned rooms. After 3 days we changed the room following the nuisance of a nightclub next to the hotel (room 3356). Then we were quiet but we had to insist on making this change. The meals are correct but not very diversified. We eat the same thing every day. Sometimes lacks a little freshness especially at the pool restaurant.  Despite these many negative points we had a great family stay but we will not go back.

reviews.review_title: Pleasantly surprised by this hotel , quiet, rest, cleanliness, impeccable services.
reviews.review_text: One of the ones that we have not yet chosen from many Tunisian hotels visited so far allows us to give it a rating of excellence. Calm and rare comfort. All old in a sumptuous decoration of marbles and flower gardens.Flawless services especially in the kitchen.  Really a big bravo.

reviews.review_title: Bof bof bof. Can do better
reviews.review_text: Dirty hotel. Carpets are worn out, showers black  The bedding, on the other hand, is good   Moreover, it is sad to note that in 2025 tourists continue to book their deckchair for fear of running out. They drop off a towel in the morning early, go for a walk and come back in the afternoon by the pool quietly. Honest people find themselves struggling to find a place.  See the photo.... It is representative of the whole pool. Dozens and dozens of reserved deckchairs and nobody in the water   This is abnormal and the hotel does nothing which is even more serious. Many hotels have started to hunt for the debiles.   In short, the hotel will leave us no memorable memories.

Beautiful hotel with large pool and very nice beach very child friendly. Very friendly staff and care. Good food.  Great entertainment team with Mini club at the top. Special mention to Mimi and Cyrine!! We recommend

Hotel very good value for money. Yes sometimes a little old but for the price and quality of service it is great. Various, good and diverse meals. Staff attentive. Great massages. Gym deserves an Air Conditioning is my only downside. I'll be right back.

reviews.review_title: This hotel no longer corresponds to a 5-star hotel.
reviews.review_text: An ageing hotel that requires a serious renovation,  - Large room with terrace, sea and pool view, bedding much too firm, old bathroom, old bathtub that does not make you want to take a bath, ventilation is non-existent. Quick cleaning. Separate toilets are fine provided that the flushing system works despite various maintenance interventions.  Carpeting in the floors marks signs of wear, deserves a new hit.   - The indoor restaurant lunch and evening at will: clean, white tablecloth, fabric towel, the buffet very varied but tasteless, except the excellent Tunisian buffet on Saturday evening,  ( 1 correct meal over a week!) If, in the evening, you dine at the first service you will have to forget your aperitif at the piano bar, there is the bar but no musician, (musician will be there when you are at the restaurant)  I hold breakfast with fresh juice minute, boiled egg, various appetizing preparations. Thank you, Murad. - The outdoor restaurant swimming pool open at lunch: impossible to lunch because there are flies. The different pool and indoor bars are very good: the staff recognize the guests and always have a friendly word.  - A special mention and a big THANK YOU in general to all the staff who are extremely kind, friendly, from the reception, to the waiters, pool, maid, passing by the animators:   The welcome with a smile, the nice little word, is what makes this hotel strong but unfortunately it does not replace the shortcomings. I don't forget the massages we probably wouldn't come back to this hotel without

The hotel has lots of potential, but in its current condition, I would rate it 3*, not 5*. Beautiful building and surroundings - just very outdated. The gym is horrible everything is extremely old floor dirty linoleum, no proper mats no water no AC

Very good infrastructure  Decoration (everything) deserves renewal  Restaurant: Breakfast very good, the rest average  Service: reception top   Spa therapists: excellent quality price service Activities: very good  Carriage to go golfing in front a plus

5-star hotel that was awarded to us due to work at the Iberostar EOLIA which was our initial drop-off point. Large and beautiful park very well maintained and very flowery.  Reception hall and interior quite classy despite the age of the hotel.  Three small shops present and Moorish coffee with free mint tea. Sellers of outside activities not insistent. Welcoming and very pleasant staff. WIFI throughout the hotel even at the beach.  Large unheated outdoor pool. Wooden deckchair with insufficient mattress.  Heated indoor pool with jacuzzi that triggers with motion detector. Very little sunbed in it.  Very spacious room with good bedding but soundproofing is non-existent.      Separate toilet.  Bathroom with a bathtub which is very high making it difficult to access. Quid for the elderly who are in majority.  Television with French channels via satellite but which picks up regularly. Bathrobe available in the room. Safe and refrigerator stocked daily. Necessary to make coffee or tea. Cleaning done every day.  Main restaurant room on a human scale. 2 services scheduled for the evening at 6:30 p.m. and 8:30 p.m. Table numbered and allocated for the entire stay for evening meals only. Rigorous pants. Lunch from noon to 1 p.m. Nice waiters. Very good food but not much variety. Fresh juice at breakfast which is increasingly rare. Fresh bread every day. Outside restaurant next to the pool opens at 12:30.   At that time not open at night and beach bar always closed. Pancakes in the afternoon. Beautiful beach cleaned every day. Sufficient number of sunbeds.  Presence of dogs that are not aggressive but bark regularly. Basic day and evening entertainment without atmosphere. Virtually non-existent animators.   SPA and TUNISIAN restaurant not tested but very frequented.  In summary, this hotel is very quiet but with some charm. Suitable for older people who want to rest. Not suitable for families with teens as this is not a club hotel.

This hotel is 5 stars not 3.It was incredible, I loved it the staff were so nice and carm.The food was brilliant.The acctiverts were great I loved it.The beach was perfect.Definitely comming again and I give thanks to  my friend aymen because amazing person he și the best

We enjoyed a few days at the resort. The atmosphere was very pleasant, the food delicious, and the staff very friendly. There's always something to do. The rooms were very clean. The pool area is a lovely place to relax. Everything was spotlessly clean. I recommend staying here for a few days to relax.

If you want the butter but without the butter money, go ahead this hotel is for you. We stopped there one night in May 2025. The hotel is very clean. The rooms are clean and the restaurant meals are varied.  The staff is kind and at the service of the guests.  We recommend this hotel for its excellent value. Demanding travelers who can only criticize. abstain.

reviews.review_title: DO NOT BOOK UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES - especially if you are a woman!!
reviews.review_text: DO NOT GO HERE.  This hotel made me so uncomfortable I booked another hotel and left in under 24 hours. Do not under any circumstances book this hotel especially if you are a woman.  After the bus breaking down and it taking 5 6 hours to get to the hotel when we are checked in the room is dirty with no towels, ants and a coating of filth on the bath. Additionally, the balcony door shudders when “locked”, the room is so old and dated looks nothing like the pictures.   I complain to the front desk, we are accompanied by three different men into the room asking what is wrong with it which was very uncomfortable and meant I just said “oh okay my bad”   We decide to just ignore the state of the room and go to get food, it was outside of the usual meal times. We tell the lady on reception that travel took 6 hours from the airport and were hungry. She says there is pizza, and directs us towards a corner of the main reception area, no pizza in the hour we were around. So we hadn't eaten since our 5am pre-flight breakfast and it was 5:30pm.   The main reception area was very outdated. The front desk was sticky and dirty. There was no aircon so the room was incredibly stuffy and hot, it was the only place you could get wifi which was agonising as you had to sit in the heat with no breeze to have any signal. No wifi by the pool or in any of the rooms.   The reception area was primarily filled with men. These men (we later realised) worked for the hotel. They were congregated at the tables, bar, the pool table and always staring. It made the reception area even more uncomfortable.   We then go to get a drink and are chatted to by who I assume is the owner, trying to flog various things to us to spend extra money. We decline. He then walks us outside, gestures to another staff member pointing at us. We sit down, the man he gestured to approached us. He is the hotel's trip salesman. He introduces himself and spends more time looking at my breasts than my face, I then covered myself with my shirt very obviously and he does not stop eyeing me up. He then asks if me and my brother are a couple, I say no, he then insists we are a couple. I say "that would be illegal, no" he then insists that by the end of the trip we would be a couple which made us VERY uncomfortable. We walk away refusing to buy anything saying we will find him if we are interested   ⁠I go to reception and ask for towels for the pool. You have to put a cash deposit- I have no cash- they refuse to give me an alternative option or direct me to an ATM so no towels (we still do not even have towels in the room at this point)   The salesman then returns again an hour later. He continues to stare at my breasts I tell him that we are not interested to buy anything he then says he just wants to be my friend. He then insists to be careful here and watch out not to trust anyone because "it’s not safe here but you can trust me of course." We then leave freaked out and hide in our room.  We left for another hotel first thing the next day.

Very good stay.  Animation at the height of its performance.  The kids are very nice.  Happy continuation!  The right food. The rooms need a new look The staff bar reception is very nice.  The pool is very clean. The beach too.

We really liked it here. Overall, the hotel would need renovation, but for less demanding people this is not a problem. We liked the food, there wasn't a day when we couldn't eat. But maybe it could be a problem for more demanding and picky people. Special thanks must go to the animators, who made our vacation even more enjoyable and were able to entertain people despite the not always favorable weather. Apart from the hotel, the beach was perfect, that one was one of the main reasons why we chose this hotel. However, this hotel is definitely not suitable for people who prefer a more "luxurious" vacation. But we were extremely satisfied and we will certainly be happy to come back when there is an opportunity. However, we consider it a disadvantage that time passes much faster here, and out of a 7-day stay, we felt that we were only here for 3 days. haha :)

Awful hotel Worst I've ever stayed in  Check in was dia Eventually got a room 4 hours after arrival Food repetitive everyday same thing Salad minimal Breakfast like a cattle market very little options Customer services horrendous Reception staff very rude Some bar staff good others by passed serving and picked who they wanted to serve Always running out of various alcohol drinks Rooms most of anything in the room doesn't work Had to constantly ask for toilet roll and towels Was told on morning of leaving and being picked up at 3.50am not able to have a drink  tea/coffee as breakfast closed until morning  Most sunbeds are broken I would never stay at this hotel again Poor everything   Good points  Beach Weather Animation team work hard Pool

Me and my partner stayed at this hotel for a week in the beginning of September, we enjoyed our time here as it was a very cheap hotel. However our time we had there, the hotel lacks its basics, we had to keep going up and down to reception for either towels or toilet rolls, and we had to tell reception multiple times about our sink in our and none of them really seem bothered. It’s more of a 1 star than a 3 star. When we arrived our room wasnt ready yet however this was ok considering check in isn’t until 3pm, but the most annoying thing was the 2 sales men trying to sell excursions and also massages, these were both very over priced and they really hassle you coming up to you everyday, at one point before we got our room we had them both sat with us, luckily the customer relation lady who was thankfully English saved us, her name i think is sophia, very lovely! The hotel is about a 2 and half hour transfer, so dont book if you want something closer to the airport. There fore there is some good things about this hotels which was the food which we enjoyed everyday, we just didnt enjoy breakfast as its like a cattle market in there. The animation team are great, always getting you involved! Unfortunately though we wont back.

Excellent guests from Serbia and an even better animation team that made our vacation unforgettable. Thank you... and a big heartfelt greeting.  Special thanks to the amazing animators: Khouloud, Oumayma, Chipo, Kiky, Aymen, Soupa, Houssem, and Rico.

The best vacation and an unforgettable experience! Excellent service and amazing entertainers who went above and beyond to enhance and enrich our stay. The entire staff was friendly and professional, making us feel welcomed every step of the way. All praise from the heart.

This hotel is excellent, good program, animation people is verry good, food and playa is very good. Most think animation its very funny, and we love this place and people who work in this hotel. Especially Kiki, Shibo, Stou, Ricco  See ya next year guys

reviews.review_title: Very bad hotel or rather university hostel
reviews.review_text: Hotel tres enciens, picine narrow and does not make you want to swim, rooms very dirty and bad air conditioning and especially soundproofing, passing to the big black spot c the restaurant ..few choices with dishes without flavor or taste, chicken very hard .. grill very cooked and without flavor ..tjrs merge with meli7a freeze or kuika or little poignant that has no value ..restaurant downgraded especially after the change of chef restaut ..a new chef (asla3 w twil w nhar keml i7ot f osa7na taht cheweya w mekla kol mechia lijme3a eli teb3ino....),hotel downgraded ..I Rating 3/10

A peaceful hotel, the service is very nice  the food was ok but what embellished the hotel and gave it more life was the entertainment team, which is very serious and dedicated, in particular the entertainer AYMEN who made my stay and that of my family warmer, a very serious person, good comedian, good dancer, and we enjoyed playing pétanque with him   I recommend

reviews.review_title: A peaceful Inn with lots of charm
reviews.review_text: A very pleasant stay  The Pension was opened in 1986 but completely renovated. This gives it a charm typical of Tunisia.  The beach is very quiet and the sea beautiful.  The staff is attentive and very helpful.  We will gladly return

reviews.review_title: Good Inn but it Makes more novation
reviews.review_text: If you have a room in good condition. air conditioned and with a balcony .... So your day will be great If not Make a claim to solve the problem or change the room. Air conditioning at reception is low just during the day is   Thank you.

A horrible Pension on all sides. Normally it should be rated 2 stars. Cleanliness 0 food 0 service 0...0000 no comment very disappointed to have chosen it. Rooms not well maintained  Humidity in the rooms no mini TV bar to my grandmother's old life apparently they haven't discovered plasma yet, safe or put our expensive stuff out of stock In total hotel 0 stars

reviews.review_title: Vacation rest and relaxation between cousin
reviews.review_text: Stay with my cousin.Hotel nice, quiet , small structure. From breakfast to dinner everything was perfect. Very clean, Fresh fish twice / day. Delicious cakes and fresh fruit every day small flat (fruit is missing for breakfast). The rooms are clean , they have just been redone .  We felt confident and especially not harassed as we could have been from other hotels. Very good massages practiced by two very professional masseuses. To do! Little point to improve: wifi accessible in the rooms as on the beach 🙏🏻 is essential to be able to return and reconcile: work and relaxation in your beautiful environment. I highly recommend this beautiful place if you want to recharge with family or friends in peace. Value for money top 👍  See you soon 👋

reviews.review_title: A week in Mahdia with cousins
reviews.review_text: We spent a great week with my cousin in this hotel. We really liked the average size and family atmosphere of the establishment which makes it easy to find a place on the beach, enjoy the pool and not have a rush at the buffets and bar. We feasted on grilled fish and delicious pastries. All the staff is adorable at the reception, animation, beach, maintenance, restaurant everywhere very pleasant discreet and considerate. The rooms are simple and very clean with air conditioning. The only improvement would be to have wifi everywhere and not only in the lobby but otherwise do not change anything we will come back for sure!!!

For any comments or complaints made, they listen to you and make the necessary arrangements to resolve the problem or complaint as soon as possible.  I congratulate them on their collaborations with each other so that everyone goes to perfection.  Good for value for money.

reviews.review_title: from five to ten is also ten, everyone tried their best to make the tourists' holiday more beautiful, well done team
reviews.review_text: The visit to Tunisia was excellent and I decided to spend time in your hotel. The hotel looks old but very nice and clean. The rooms are not modern, but they are clean, the bed linen is fresh and the bathrooms are very clean. The selection of food was really large but also tasty, sweet cakes, fresh fruits and cold juices contributed to my meal. The hotel staff, from the reception to the waiters, are very kind and nice. Special praise for the not good but the best waiter who was always available is Chiheb Eddin, smiling, cheerful and always at the service of the guest. Also, in addition to clean rooms, wonderful staff and workers in the hotel, there are also stars of the hotel, the animation group Schibo, Kiki, Ayman, Chef, Hossem, Mimi, Soula and Khoulound. They made my vacation better, taught me a lot of dances and kept my attention the whole time and no they are not good they are the best team. I will return to Tunisia again for them.See you son 🫶.

reviews.review_title: Best times in this hotel  fun and good vibes
reviews.review_text: Absolutely fantastic hotel can't praise it enough I had a nice time here, food, entertainment, cleanliness all 10/10. The staff are all nice and friendly especially Mino he is a pleasure to be around full of posative energy and good vibes Mino is very helpful and a very hard worker and will go above and beyond to help you. Fantastic hotel I'm booking this year again ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

I went there with my family in mid-May and it's a very friendly hotel; there's a lot of animation (a very large team all nicer than the others ),❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❝�️❝�️❝

I had a very good stay with super very nice entertainment is welcoming, a nice buffet with lots of nice food. There are several swimming pool heated to good temperature facing the sea a good atmosphere of disco evenings full of activity for children I spent a week great I highly recommend it.

Early holidays great, the rooms are very well located and very clean. The staff is very welcoming, the entertainment team is very friendly and offers plenty of activities for young and old. The bar is very good too however the restaurant may not offer enough Tunisian but remains more than suitable. In general the hotel is very clean.

Well received by staff and facilitators.  The meals are varied and well presented.  The waiters and cooks are very kind and helpful.  The beach which is close and private is a plus.  Specious and well appointed room.

First time in Tunisia. The hotel is very good for 3 stars. The food is varied. The animation team is great, smiling. The Tunisians welcomed us very well at the hotel. Very friendly. I recommend this hotel for a nice trip with friends or family
Great, animation top! 👍🏻 Good food, nice clean nikel room. Slide available 🏊🏊 Beautiful hotel in general🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰😝🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰

Very good stay, very clean hotel, swimming pools and beach at the top, very dynamic and friendly entertainment team, super welcoming professionals, very good cuisine, really not disappointed with the stay., we will come back if the opportunity arises!

Very good stay with a great animation team.  I highly recommend go there. Restaurant very good and varied the rooms are very good with a very nice view.  The hotel is very clean and the staff very nice.   You will be welcomed no matter what.

The hotel is very nice very clean very well maintained  Very varied catering very good table service  The big plus of the hotel is the great animation team to recommend 😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁😁

A very good hotel all services are very good  Restaurant , bar, cleanliness of the rooms and furniture renewal and above all manga the entertainment chef and his team at the top!!!! Mini club with a slide And an aquapark  Big change this year  I advise you to come

reviews.review_title: I like eden club and i will come agin with my family please its very good every think about hotel its very nice and cool
reviews.review_text: About hotel very good place very clean good food animation friendly and funny people thank for animation time and bar i will come agin ❤️  withe my family  I have 15 days its the best in monastire they have water playground for kids  and adults  ❤️❤️❤️

reviews.review_title: I liked it, I'll go back
reviews.review_text: Very nice hotel, by the sea, it feels like home. The atmosphere is familiar. Don't hesitate to go there to have a good holiday. Warm welcome, good service, very correct catering, friendly animation.

Hotel very average very remarkably lack of organization food not good and not varied restore very poorly organized animation almost absent without any effort rooms just decent clean only strong point the slides and location on the sea.

reviews.review_title: This is the worst hotel i've ever seen
reviews.review_text: When you enter the hotel , the receipt room is very hot , the swimming pool is filled with agressive tourist , no space. The beach is dirty and the room was messy just after they moved us after a long discussion on another room still small , Also the service here is terrible , the restaurant is hot , they won't bring you a cold bottle of water , the people here are arrognant and not welcoming , even the kids are liars , one kid was about to steal my sit . the only best things here are the water /slides and the animation at night or you can seat ainfront of the beach at night , but the hotel is terrible im not lying don't waste your money here!

Eden Club Skanes Monastir , a good plan for family and vacation , I stayed three nights from 20 June to 23 June at the hotel in All inclusive mI was surprised by the good level of the hotel restaurant overlooking the beach and by the level of food and other services of the hotel.

a big congratulations to the whole team of “Eden club skanes monastir” Clean room. Excellent animation. varied food. Two swimming pools and slide for adults and children, as I said, a very good value for money choice. 🎯💯☑️🇹🇳

Hotel to avoid especially in September I strongly advise you not to go to this hotel, we wanted to rest during the month of September and we found ourselves having an endless wait from morning to evening, there were crazy people in the restaurant, sometimes we stayed without dinner at note that the food is very spicy so impossible for a baby to eat anything including pasta! the hotel unfortunately receives more than its capacities, the rooms are tiny without forgetting the maid who does not do her job properly no towels, sheets, you had to go to reception each time to make complaints. Without forgetting of course the invasion of tiger mosquitoes whether in rooms, swimming pools, gardens and even restaurants, so bring a powerful repellent. only positive point is the beach.

reviews.review_title: Hotel i7moum i7moum i7moum it9ol youth center
reviews.review_text: o9sem belh el3athim kol chey iji ken hotel house of young yesser fih 1-la parking inti byeit fi monstir wi karhabtek fi sousse 2-El byout o9sem belh el wkayeil ili fi downtown tunis 5ir menhom:el wase5-el balcony it9ol toilet 3arbi -la mnin bar (9alek tekriha 10d lila) la champion-la Manchef la Chey 3-el makela walh bi dhrab el bounia it9ol fi 7ena ou fi 3res .wi hak el makela la3ziza el ghalia nefes el menu 4-el pscine it9ol jabia sghira wi fiha 500 ra9eba 3bed itnguez it9ol fi sidi ali el meki -wi wa7ed hez marto 3la ra9abto i9ol fi ba7ar 5-the annimation hhhhhhhhh akber ketheba itswaro hotel fih two person wi fi lil i7eli channele it9ol witia imte3 mra 6-foot in the water o9sem belh lab7ar imte3o it9ol ba7ar rades imsab imte3 zebla mouch iba7er chnia it7beni in9ol or na7ki mel le5er imchit 3la 5 nuit 3adit 3 wi hrabet wi kol wa7ed mouch ya3mel review i9ol fih l hotel hatha behi mouch inguez 3liha 3la 5ater reviews hathouma houma ili da5louni fi 7it 9alo hotel o9sem belh kachefa

reviews.review_title: One week stay at Safira Palms Zarzis
reviews.review_text: Stayed one week at the end of May 2025. Nice and very clean outdoor pool. Cold indoor swimming pool. Spacious and clean room. Very hard mattress. Lots of pigeons around the rooms. Safe paying 1€/day. Tourist tax very expensive 28€ / person for a week. All the staff at the hotel are very helpful and kind. Beach at the foot of the hotel, not very large. Lots of seaweed. Hotel located about 50 minutes from the airport. Zarzis small town where there is not much and where we are docked all the time to buy. Food at the hotel of medium quality and not very diversified, my friend caught the tourista after 2 days. Nice but medium animations. Change of euro in dinars possible at the hotel reception. Beach/swimming pool towels available for 10€ deposit per towel.  We won’t come back to that.

The hotel could really use a good construction! Our bathtub was moldy and we had ants walking around the sink...  The all-you-can-eat buffet was not great, not much choice. The outdoor space was nice though, nice pool, nice terrace... the animators and waiters all were very nice!! Thank you to them!!

Stay top  Perfect Hotel  Animation food cleanliness top I recommend  Everything was fine beach pool  Comfortable well-kept rooms  Responsive and attentive staff  Large selection of drinks and food  Frankly come you won't be disappointed

A superb team of smiling and dynamic animation... a beautiful place to relax... a service a spa at the top... a varied restaurant.... the children are delighted... a beautiful place to disconnect from everyday life.... ♡♡♡♡♡♡♡

On top! Super nice host and the kids are happy!  The meals are very good  The rooms are clean clean every day  The spa the massages offered by the hotel are very good too We recommend this hotel  Thank you for these 10 days to everyone

Friendly staff, person El d animation at the top! Aging structure, very structured schedule! Nice swimming pool, very medium room.Philomenon our atomic bomb ....favorite .....kali and Murad ❤️ in short good stay in a not quite 4 star hotel!

I just spent 18 unforgettable days it's with a heavy heart and full of emotions that I leave tonight if I could stay again I would stay with great pleasure it's my 6th trip that I make in this hotel in 2 years and I would come back again and again all the animation team is adorable always there to entertain us the staff and amazing always at the little care , I feasted at the restaurant every day , currently by the pool facing the sea the scenery is beautiful quiet relaxing , I can't wait to come back ❤️❤️❤️ a very big thank you to all the people who work in this hotel you made my stay a real happiness see you very soon, Melanie 😘😘😘😘✈️

We stayed 9 days at the Safira Palms Hotel. We had a very good stay. We were very well received. The hotel staff is very nice and very pleasant. The animation team is at the top as well as the photographers <3 we had a very good stay partly thanks to all these very friendly, smiling and pleasant people. Thank you <3 We also ate well and slept well. The buffets are international and there is always a Tunisian side. Thank you very much for this holiday!! We will not hesitate to share the hotel link with our loved ones!!

Very good hotel with entertainment all day  The animators are great and so is the chef Swimming pool well and direct beach access very appreciated Bedding to simply review Simple but not too varied catering  I recommend Good value for money

Beautiful clean and well maintained hotel, the restoration is good but repetitive, so medium, the room well maintained but aged, the bath towels have from years of flight, it is time to change them, nice animation, Too bad this hotel is lost in the countryside!! the deckchairs are getting tired. In short I would not come back to this hotel, I often go to Djerba, many hotels are much better than this one. The beach is small with seaweed!!.

Very nice hotel to stay. An animation team listens , very friendly. The rooms are comfortable.  The animations are varied. The animation manager and his team of people with a big heart  We plan to come back. The staff is very welcoming  I recommend this hotel

Very welcoming hotel, great animation the animators are pleasant smiling awesome the animations of the day are fun and that of the sister are pleasant we advise you to go to this hotel for their professionalism whatever the hotel staff and the animators

We had an absolutely unforgettable week of vacation. The room with sea and pool views was simply magical; waking up to this paradisiacal landscape is a real joy.  The aquatic area is vast and perfectly maintained, offering relaxation and entertainment. We also participated in very well organized excursions, supervised by Mourad, whom we thank warmly. Many thanks also to Kali, the manager of Coralia, for his availability and constant attention.  The entertainment team also deserves special mention: dynamic, professional and always smiling, they contributed greatly to the success of our stay.  The diet is good and varied, we do not eat the same thing twice.  The servers are at your disposal to offer you the best possible service.  And it is without counting on the team of the spa area that has been great too.  Everything was perfect. If you are planning a trip to Tunisia, we highly recommend this property.   Value for money , difficult to do better.

reviews.review_title: Hotel and staff at the top!
reviews.review_text: A real favorite for this beautiful hotel. 2nd stay made and surely more to come... We had a very good holiday with beautiful meetings and wonderful memories. An animation team at the top! All the staff as much animators (Don chiro, Ninho, Daddi, Pikachu, Jamaica, Ali, Mimi...) as waiters (Mohsen, Abdallah...) and photographers (Dhiaa and Ilyes...) are kind, adorable and very professional. They are present to make you have a great holiday. Hotel that I highly recommend for its beautiful setting as well as for all the staff and catering.

reviews.review_title: Beautiful hotel, and an entertainment team at the top
reviews.review_text: Beautiful hotel, very clean we liked the superb outdoor pool and amenities, SPA, shop and diversity of always very good dishes and succulent desserts. We loved the atmosphere.All members of the animation team are very nice. Thanks to Nino, Pikachu, and the dancers who set a great atmosphere.

I had a great time in Zarzis at this hotel. The setting is beautiful, between beach and palm trees, ideal for relaxing. But what really made the difference was the animation team: always smiling, motivated, and full of energy. They know how to create a warm atmosphere from morning until evening with varied activities for young and old.  Special mention to the hotel photographers, very professional and friendly. They knew how to capture very beautiful moments of our stay, with a real sense of detail. The souvenir photos are beautiful!  Thank you to the whole team for these beautiful moments. I recommend this hotel to anyone looking to combine relaxation, fun and beautiful memories.

Super family stay equipped with animation at the top and especially adorable!!  Food level we find everything for everyone. Level bedding point to improve especially mattresses.  On the other hand plan if baby plan his food and complicate to change them nothing is planned.  We strongly recommend going there

Animators on vacation are a real treasure! Always full of energy and smiles, able to crank up any device. Their ingenuity in organizing games for children and adults is acceptable. They can create an unforgettable atmosphere, and their participation makes the vacation even more successful. Thanks to them, we say a firm "no" to boredom! Animators are not only people who organize games and fun, but also friends who make sure that everyone feels good and has something to do. Their creativity and are contagious, and a vacation with them is a guarantee of great fun and lots of memories. With joy They always involve everyone in their activities, from morning gymnastics to evening performances. They are the ones who make the vacation an unforgettable adventure, full of energy. The hotel is fine, the rooms are fairly clean, which is a big plus. The staff tries to keep things tidy, and cleaning is done regularly. The food at the hotel is good. Breakfasts are tasty and varied, lunches and dinners are also at a good level, with a varied menu. Overall, the stay is pleasant, and the value for money is appropriate.

The hotel is super beautiful, the sea at the foot of the pool, the food is good and the entertainment team does everything possible to set the mood. They're super invested. Must do in the Zarzis area. Thanks to Ninho and the whole team.

I was lucky enough to stay in a simply beautiful hotel, where every moment spent will remain etched in my memory. Upon arrival, I was seduced by the exceptional setting and the warm welcome. I had great meetings there, both among the holidaymakers and the staff, which contributed greatly to making my stay unforgettable.   The animation was at the top: a team of incredibly invested animators, always smiling, dynamic and close to the holidaymakers. They know how to set the mood, make people laugh and create a friendly and festive atmosphere from morning until evening. A real plus that makes all the difference!  I would like to make a special mention to the team of photographers, Dhia and Elias, for their remarkable professionalism. Always present, but never intrusive, they managed to capture the most beautiful moments with talent and good humor. Thanks to them, I leave with lasting memories, both in the heart and in the photos.   I recommend this hotel with my eyes closed to anyone looking for an authentic holiday full of joy, laughter and beautiful encounters.

Our Private Guide Alain Jordy took us to this quiet and very nice establishment for a drink and it was very nice. Beyond that, we recommend the services of Alain without whom we would have kept a nasty image of Djerba and the islands. We had the chance to visit many sites in his company and in authentic and privileged conditions, Djerba hood, ghelala museum, ksar ghilane. We now only want to return to Djerba with Alain, meet real people and wonderful places with him. We recommend its services without any hesitation

I spent a week in this Pension; Plus: spacious room with living room and kitchen care. Nice little pool.  The least: poor wifi quality. No wifi in the room.  I had half board: breakfast and dinner. The first day, the waiter asks you: do you want a fresh lemon juice or strawberry (without telling you that it’s for a fee) and he does it with all foreign tourists but not the locals. So you find yourself paying for a drink full of sugar at 10 dinars (a fortune there). So beware, if you are offered this in the morning you will know that it is 10 dinars. I have seen scenes where foreign parents take juice for the whole family while it is included in breakfast, they then find themselves paying 40 or 50 dinars.   Unpleasant reception (a man in his fifties with glasses) he takes people from above and shouts at customers. Just surreal scenes.  Private beach away from the Inn. We have to walk and especially find her...   I'm not coming back to this Pension.

Djerbian Masfouf in the dry! I had the chance and privilege to test it in preview and what a great culinary adventure! Particularly delicious to find the words that would describe the flavor of this dish ...  the masfouf is far from being provocative, he challenges you with finesse especially the pepper that overloads the masfouf with a lot of confidence and grants him an authentic visual. The heart of the matter is a journey into a universe of flavors from which one cannot detach: delicacy, an amazing dosage of spices so well balanced: a feat! As for the dry ones, they are in total fusion with the masfouf ... you close your eyes and it is the sea that immediately settles in your imagination ....presumably the Masfouf aux secs is evocative and crystallizes everything that Djerba can offer to its visitors: a unique alloy and without equal of authenticity and openness. Congratulations Chief, Congratulations to the entire Toumana Gardens team!

Magnificent hotel and warm welcome. The room is clean and spacious. The restaurant was average for our first night but afterward it was very delicious and very varied. Very clean swimming pool and the hotel was very quiet for relaxing

reviews.review_title: How in this earth did they get so many stars?
reviews.review_text: This in one of the places where ravishing reviews depart from personal experience.   The good: a beautiful pool yard   The bad: my room was derelict, renovated well over a decade ago. The AC did not work, dampened the floor, everything. The “welcome” desk was the coldest in my 50 years travelling, no courtesy.   The ugly: in Tunez there are no private beaches, but the government rents them all the way up to 3 meters from the water. We seated in the beach with the same name as the hotel, we were expelled by 5 guards. The hotel reception never gave us direction on which was their beach, when I told them what happened, no apologies, they did not care.   Summary, one of my worst experiences as a tourist in over 148 countries.

Maybe I live on another planet, but I really didn't like this hotel. The rudest staff ever especially Jamal at the front desk who charged me the local tax for an extra night when I wasn't staying there and kept the money for himself. I have been travelling in Tunisia a while and this was the worst hotel so far. Yes, my previous two hotels were luxury 5-star but I had stayed in other 3-star hotels during my trip. The positives. Nice grounds and setting. Clean. Huge room like an apartment with a kitchen area if you want to cook anything. WIFI worked well. Now, why I didn't like it. The room was like an oven. There is air conditioning but this didn't work well and mainly flowed in the lounge area rather than the bedroom. I struggled to sleep. It was cooler outside! The bathroom was very basic. No complimentary water provided. There is a small supermarket opposite the hotel and what appeared to be a coffee shop but other than that, the area is pretty dead with nothing around. You need a car or a taxi to move around. My room rate did not include any meals but suggest adding them. As I said, there is not much around. I included breakfast and had the buffet dinner twice during my stay. Breakfast was a basic buffet, but adequate with breads, pastries, an egg station and more. Not huge at all but enough. Coffee was awful. The dinner buffet was fine. Again not a huge selection but enough. The food was nice but skip the desserts, too sickly sweet. Drinks are not included. Cheap. They have an à la carte menu too for dinner which mainly includes Western dishes. I got a little bit annoyed with the waiters as they kept hovering over you when eating, watching and all I wanted was to be left in peace. On my first night, I was encouraged to have something from the à la carte menu but why do I want to have pizza and pasta when I can have that at home? Go for the buffet. Reception staff were unfriendly and never greeted you. My stay was meant to be for 4 nights but I checked out after 2 and went to another nicer hotel. There is a small swimming pool as well. Not for me.

reviews.review_title: Charming hotel and exceptional Djerbien Couscous
reviews.review_text: A site with incredible charm. For lunch, the Couscous Djerbien is fantastic. The rooms are spacious and the service is excellent

Very friendly hotel with pleasant staff. The calm is appreciable, the apartments are well equipped and clean. thank you for your welcome I recommend this hotel where calm and kindness reign. The charm of Tunisia 🇹🇳 🇹🇳🇹🇳

Catastrophic! No consideration for customers. They left us in the cold all night In the morning a guy watches us to see if we put anything in our pockets! Total disrespect! We almost got into a fight with him. We left straight away. To avoid completely. Of unparalleled mediocrity. To flee !!!

Very good stay in this very quiet hotel. Don't expect atmosphere or entertainment, there is nothing but this was clearly specified when booking. The meals are simple but very good and the catering staff are adorable (special mention to Aziz and the evening service manager whose name I forgot at the restaurant and to Ahmed at reception). Very spacious accommodation and cleaning is done every day. However, the paints in the bathrooms should be refreshed. We were full board and that doesn't include any drinks (not even water). I just find it a shame that a bottle of water was not offered when we arrived with the heat. We had to go to the bar to buy some. You can easily get around by taxi for very little money and go to the Géant to do your shopping. I also recommend the Tataouine excursion with Omar (who you will find every day at the swimming pool) much cheaper than that offered by the Tour operator (FTI concerning us) and exactly the same thing (we found the Tour Operator bus at each stop...). However, we heard people complaining about the other excursions offered by Omar, to see... We booked a tour of the island by taxi with FTI: very friendly driver but who stopped us in shops where he received commissions in Houmet Souk... In short, if you want to relax, you've come to the right place, even if personally, I would have appreciated a little atmosphere in the evening from time to time without it being a big fiesta.

Very poor hotel Unmaintained swimming pool, no filtration. People bathing fully dressed. Wc out of service..ignorant welcome no comments. Hotel to avoid. All the same meals Drinks not included in full board. Exorbitant drink prices

Probably the nicest hotel on Djerba, medium size (most are huge), above average food for the area, very friendly and helpful staff (excursions and rentals), clean, very nice 20m pool, price somewhat negotiable.

Wow. Our unit was huge— bedroom, sitting area and kitchen (minimally equipped)but with refrigerator and microwave) A patio made for good sitting in the early morning or evening.  The food was great, both the buffet and when ordering from the menu. The waitstaff were friendly and efficient. We enjoyed the pool for late afternoon swims. The beach where there were chairs and umbrellas is a short walk.  Daily maid service.  This is a resort to which customers, mostly French and German return to year after year. While it may be a little warm around the edges, for the price and spaciousness of the accommodation it earns our 5.

I was there during corona outbreak. Services were limited. Meaning every day clean towels, once a week they supposed to clean the apartment and we had to take our own plates away after eating. Not so bad. However. Apartment when I arrived was dirty. In the kitchen were all over black spots of humidity. Certainly on and in the freezer. It was very noisy. I had the bad luck to have a neighbour who couldn’t lift her feet and had no control over her hands while closing doors and windows. Moving all the time the furnisher which made terrible noise. I asked for another room and although everything was free as there were no much guests they offered me a room next to 3 people. I didn’t move and asked to at least talk to that woman. They did not.  The food was delicious. Excellent cook. Excellent kitchen team. But : the man who served, Kamel, was awful. Breakfast supposed to be till 10.00 o’clock. When I came around 09.00 I had to wait till he wanted to serve as because of corona, you were not allowed to serve yourself. Understandable. However in the 4 weeks I was there I only have had maybe 7 times a croissant as they were already taken by the other guests (we were only 8 in the morning). Then around 09.10 the waiter started to be nervous. He wanted to go. Once I said to him that it supposed to be open till 10.00 and the answer was “Madame, we can’t stay open for only 1 client”. Even a second cafe in the morning was not possible as everything from the buffet was gone at 09.15. Obviously he decided to close at 09.30hrs so he could walk along the beach. I felt very uncomfortable and after a couple of days I decided not to come at all anymore for breakfast. Telling it was too early for me. From then war was signed. He served reluctantly in the evening and didn’t speak to me at all anymore. I supported that for another 3 days and decided to leave.  Yes I had a very bad experience there.  I wouldn’t have written this if I didn’t hear from workers there that I wanted to have a vip treatment. That I wanted to have breakfast from 10 till 12 which is not true.  As I have severe long and heart problems I only asked to not smoke in the dining room which they did every evening. The answer I got was “but it’s my friend the doctor “. If that makes any difference. Then the cats. They were all over the place. They jumped on the dining tables, were sitting next to guests asking for food, we had to take our own plates away and the cats were licking them. I took pictures to proof all that. When the kitchen was closed during the day the cats were playing on the sinks. With my own eyes I saw that. When I said something about that, again the same server, responded “but those are our house cats”. Unbelievable !! And in fact very sad that a man like that server has a year contract there l He’s lazy and doesn’t want to do anything more than obliged. Ahmed ? He knows too and he said it was allowed to smoke at the reception and apparently also in the dining room. Cats are allowed too. Jumping also out of the garbitch bag (which gives you a heart attaque) next to the place you have to put your plates.  I wanted to have a VIP treatment ??  Shame on you to tell that everyone of a client !!  Signed : Madame Corona (then every time I tried to talk or say something Kamel said “mais Madame, Corona...”

reviews.review_title: Fantastic service, great location, great deals!
reviews.review_text: We got away to Djerba paradise in August, and paid for half-board (buffet breakfast and buffet dinner, no drinks). The experience overall was great. The rooms were spacious, clean. The buffet food quality varied from ok-to-great. The front desk service from Ahmed was exceptional - he helped us out with any questions, swiftly. Ahmed connected us to a local tours guide who got us great deals on a dromedary tour and a dune buggy drive. The spa had fantastic deals on massages as well, which was great for spoiling the whole family. Lovely pool. The only real frustration was that the Wifi was unreliable in our room. We recommend that you visit here with your family!

It’s a nice place if you want to relax by the pool. That area is clean and the food from the restaurant is mostly good (skip the pizza). It would be nice if there were more local dishes on the snack menu.   I was told they have a private beach, yet when I followed the signs to Toumana Beach it’s just a dirty beach at the end of a road. There’s quite a bit of garbage and animal poo. The resorts on either side do a better job at keeping their beach clean. This area also has A LOT of seaweed in the water and on the beach. It’s definitely not the beautiful turquoise water I saw in pictures. I found the beach by La Marsa (near Tunis) to be much nicer.   As for the hotel, on first presentation, everything looks nice - reception area, pool, room. ...but upon closer inspection is when you find flaws. The walls in the room had yellow and brown stains. The towel and bed sheets had stains. Room WiFi had no internet access because the network jack wasn’t active. Lights outside room didn’t work. There’s a kitchen in room but few utensils and no dish soap. The reception staff didn’t seem to care and often seemed slightly annoyed at having to help you. The guy who worked the evening shift was particularly bad. I asked about getting a bowl to use in the kitchen and he said probably not but he’d check. I knew he wasn’t going to bother checking. I also asked about getting the lights outside my room fixed. Similar response - he’d check, but I knew he couldn’t be bothered. No one working there knew the password for the outdoor WiFi (it had a different password than reception WiFi).   If I were to go back, I think I’d try to find somewhere by a nicer stretch of beach.

We were looking for a last minute alternative after realising that the desert would be far too hot in July. Les jardins de Toumana was perfect. Five minute walk to the beach, fun and attentive staff, stunningly clean pool, air conditioned apartments, amazing skyline, delicious food, incredible value. We stayed for three nights, initially thought about making trips around the island and out for dinner but the pool, beach and food couldn't be beaten. The kitchens are well equipped if you want to make your own food, but we didn't because the restaurant food is so good and such great value.

reviews.review_title: Do not waste your money on this low-class facility that tries to pass itself off as an any-star hotel
reviews.review_text: This is the most unprofessional hotel I’ve stayed in. I payed for their most expensive room and they kept denying me access to their amenities. They charged us for services we never used, and kept pressuring us to pay in cash. Our credit card was rendered useless here. The private beach was inaccessible. The reception staff was rude and childish. The parking was horrendous (only a small stretch in front of the door that could fit two cars maximum). The massages sent me to my chiropractor. The food made street food look like five star cuisine. The cleaning crew used so much bleach it would give a passerby a migraine.  I would have rather slept on the street.   Absolutely would not recommend!

Jardins de Toumana is the best place to stay on the island for the authentic traveller wanting to enjoy comfort, authenticity and quality without all the noise and distrbance of a lowcost all-in available elsewhere in the area. You feel at home in your own appartment with own kitchen and garden if you like, but you can also enjoy the qualituy of a very nice menu or buffet. Very kind people and dedicated service.

+ Big and clean appartment  + Very friendly staff   + Lovely pool. 500m from nearest beach.  + reasonable prices at bar  + Location (all towns are are close)   - Wifi only in lobby and pool area.  - Dinner could be better

A fake 4 stars: - Limited offer of fruit at breakfast: a soup of strawberries, oranges, tamars and bananas cut in half to oxide and serve as landing place for flies; - The restaurant knives don't cut, zero! - One night and one morning without hot water; - Very weak shower pressure; - Internet in the room with very weak signal; - Alcatifa along all the corridors, dirty and loaded with dust (because we are in a zone of many dust); it also serves to leave the dead and crawlers there sticked; - Unhelpful, antipathetic and incompetent reception service (only the third can fit the final bill, in more than one guest).  Positive:  - Large and comfortable room; - Sympathy and education of the employees of the restaurant area.  Final balance sheet: negative!

An employee named Ghada, who works at the front desk, has repeatedly expressed her dissatisfaction with the French. This kind of remark is inappropriate, especially since we have always been courteous.  This is a sign of a real lack of professionalism, and whatever you think of the French, it reveals your personal opinion.  But that's not the main topic.  We believe that you were not completely honest, as we had paid a deposit before being forced to pay the entire stay. What is even more disturbing is that we have all the evidence to support this payment. It seems that at Hotel Nour, the money goes in easily....but never comes out.  We are still waiting for the refund of the deposit paid........

We had paid a deposit, which is said not to have been received by the hotel yet our bank assured us of the transfer with supporting evidence... No feedback from our various emails... This was not the first time I visited this hotel.

reviews.review_title: Top and quiet... maybe a little too quiet
reviews.review_text: Pros: The restaurant was a real 5 star, Chef Mohamed prepared a Mlokheya especially for my mother and me. We have feasted  Cleanliness: Very nice rooms, a bit distant (for the one we had 3019) but otherwise very comfortable and clean. Same for the beach it was clean and it neither had many people  Calm: we spent a week (end of September) in the Pension. It is perfect if you want a peaceful and quiet holiday.   Animals: at the end of September there are horses and camels that rest in front of the Inn that can be stroked. It’s too mimic  Cons: Too quiet: no animation or music (only quiet background music), no activities or excursions offered.   No safety in swimming, swimming pool or beach

I had dinner in Le Pilau restaurant, but the service really disappointed me. The owner of the restaurant, dressed in a shirt and tie, sweated big drops in his shirt. At one point, he even stuck his finger in the nose while serving the dishes. Seriously? Too bad, because the food was really delicious, but this behavior ruined the whole experience.

A beautiful place, very good welcome, clean room, varied buffet, staff at the height I recommend this place, for my part I will definitely come back. Thank you to aicha smiling courteous and available. Clean beach, impeccable pool

reviews.review_title: 2 nights at Pension Nour in August 2024
reviews.review_text: The stay went very well. A good room as requested on the ground floor. complaints were quickly processed. The staff and young facilitators are friendly and respectful. We still had to wait to pick up Room Rating around 2:30 or a little more. Another thing, I don't know what the dress code is in pool/beach but there was thong in pool which was very close to the rooms. It was invasive especially when you're with your family.

reviews.review_title: Be aware you risk to get a nightmare
reviews.review_text: Attention nightmare / be aware of nightmare: Nightmare hotel, where I had the worst experience of my life in a hotel: - after booking on site and validation, reception refused to welcome me on the pretext that there was no availability in the rooms. - no solution offered after hours of waiting. - no immediate refund or apology, I had to contact the booking site with great difficulty to trigger a very painful refund procedure. - zero logistics service Absolutely avoid

To avoid absolutely  Hotel does not deserve 4 stars, its services leave something to be desired: -Lack of professionalism -Requires a major renovation -Lack of creativity -We feel like we’re disturbing. -Insecurity Bad experience.

Awesome ! Very clean hotel, nice room! Truly impeccable! The swimming pools are clean and maintained. Breakfast is ok, with multiple choices. We only stayed there for one night but we loved the charm of this hotel. We will gladly come back.

We come back regularly for a thalassotherapy stay (5-day treatment) and tourism. The thalassotherapy team is very pleasant. The treatment is adapted with a medical interview. The hotel team is welcoming. A big thank you to YASSINE our server. Competent, available, he takes care of customers and it's very pleasant. A table decorated for a birthday, and a wedding anniversary. However, the evening entertainment is rubbish and boring. Apart from making hellish noise until 11:00 p.m. and disturbing people who come to rest, no point. Go to a nightclub. Visit the Mahdia market on Friday morning and take the train in front of the hotel. Go see El Jem, Sousse and M Sakem, 50km around. We rented a car, be careful, people over 75 are not allowed to drive.
Very poor welcome, the security guards are poorly polite, incompetent and ask for money, the service is poor, you have to go to the counter to get served, you have to park outside sometimes.

Air conditioning did not work. No ammenities in room, 1 chair. Good beach and great pool. Hours for restaurant are not conducive for early dinner. Reception was great but everybody else was just doing their job, not great service. Lamp was broken and should have been checked byhousekeeping. Sliding glass door broken and would not lock completely. Breakfast buffet was descent.
