Check other places to stay before booking as we moved to Residence Ain Meriem Bizerte, much more and more relaxed than Nour.

reviews.review_title: Average hotel at steep prices €300 per night
reviews.review_text: Firstly, the hotel is clean, spotless. However we had issues during our three night stay: the first night we went for dinner and the couscous, the potatoes and the pizza were all cold. The next morning we went for breakfast 30 minutes before it stopped being available, 9.30, and there was an empty container which had once offered scrambled egg and just one croissant. Food was generally very average. Our room was lovely, a suite overlooking the pool, but we had issues with towels: they took them away when they cleaned the room but didn’t replace them with clean ones unless I went to reception to ask; on the penultimate day they also removed the dressing gowns and I had to ask for these to be replaced. The pool was often crowded in an after as it seems they sell daily access for 60TND which many locals take advantage of. The room was listed as all inclusive on booking.com but only soft drinks are included so it clearly is not all inclusive. All in all, we didn’t think we got value for money at €300 per night. If you have a sweet tooth there is an abundance of choice every meal

Overall, a great hotel.  Clean rooms, excellent food, and service all around.  Stayed for 3 nights and the hotel is a short walk away from the center of Bizerte.  It also has a gateway to the beach which is really convenient for those staying.  Very much recommended.

We organised a training last week at Hotel Residence Nour in Bizerte. The hotel is located directly on the beach which makes it perfect for summer. The hotel features a pool with a lounge and all day dining. I visited in Feb so couldn’t benefit from the pool or the beach.  Staff is helpful in general, some need bit of reiteration but good all in all. Rooms are clean with basic amenities.  Minibar is empty which is not helpful for someone coming on a long journey especially if the hotel has no sundries or vending machines to buy few stuff.  Housekeeping service is on though they cleaned up my room despite putting a don’t disturb sign on my door.  Food is ok, not the greatest.

Hotel has been renovated Summer 2018 really worth the visit rooms are decorated with taste  My wife and I are regular clients the Hotel Nour has a good family atmosphere and the Kids enjoy the swimming pool  the Hotel has a private beach and with direct access  We eat and sleep well we will definitely comeback next year

reviews.review_title: Nice to look at but very cleanliness very unpleasant !
reviews.review_text: The hotel looks very good from the outside. We were given a suite for five people when really it is suitable for Four. The rugs have not been hoovered, not even brushed. The dirty bed mattress cover does not get replaced by new clean ones just covered with new sheets. Beware of the bed bugs!!! The towels do leave a lot to be desired. The cleaners are very poorly trained and do the minimal to clean a room. The food is adequate. The beach behind is fantastic.

Promising when entering hotel as clean and smart. Booked two double rooms but because one of us travelling own they decided to move to a single room with no reduction in Price. AIrcon, tv and wifi not working in either of the rooms and staff not very helpful in rectifying. One towel in the rooms, old soap left from previous person, food expensive. Staff not particularly helpful. So in short - avoid!

I stayed one night here on a recent trip to Tunisia. The rooms were very spacious and more of a small apartment. Whilst there was a cooker there were no pans? The room was very plain and the decor very tired. Since the revolution, times have been hard in Tunisia and are only just recovering, unfortunately the Nour was suffering as the resort was very quiet. There was no AC on in the reception, bar or dining room, which made it very uncomfortable. A request for a beer was declined at the outside bar in the afternoon but I am unsure why. It may have been Ramadan or just closed but food was available. As we finished our meal, the table next to us received beer and wine! This review is based on the situation in August 2012 and things may well improve as the country gets back on its feet and the tourist return. The other aspect is that this resort is predominately French, so take that as you find it.

name: Calimera Delfino Beach Resort And Spa

reviews.review_text: Bread in the morning mouldy!! A paying day visitor was treated terrible asked to leave because he had shorts on when so did 99% of people member of staff ripped jeans.. room lovely clean comfortable, loved it . Would i stay again only as a bed or even bed and breakfast ,not friendly enough for me. Smiled and spoke but nothing back grand daughters birthday as well guess you have to tell them the cards and email wasnt enough ..

This hotel is a nightmare. The food was the worst I’ve ever had—especially the olives, which were dumped on the plate and clearly not fresh. This place deserves no more than a 2-star rating. I won’t be returning to Tunisia.  Beach and people are nice

Very comfy Pillows ,food was a bit hit and miss but was always something to eat,  entertainment staff were absolutely amazing nothing  was too much trouble for them all. All day long there was something for all ages to do.  The rooms are kept very clean and tidy maids we're in every day with clean towels and toilet rolls . Heated pool was amazing especially for my daughter who never usually gets in the water so good idea for that .

reviews.review_title: One of the best family holidays
reviews.review_text: Had the best time, came with my mum and my little sister. Rooms are cleaned everyday, the whole place is spotless  Went to the beach one day and the water is so clear and just an amazing view to wake up to in the morning. The food was amazing  Day time entertainment, there is a lot to do at all times and then the night time entertainment, just as good!! The staff are amazing and are very kind  Can’t say much more but recommend to anyone!!

I highly recommend this hotel & this is mainly due to staff. All staff at the hotel were so friendly & really made our holiday, they couldn’t be anymore accommodating. Entertainment staff really work so hard and there are so many activities for everyone to get involved in. I would say for food this is one of the best hotels I’ve stayed at for the choices of food , loved the BBQ at the beach. So many things to do there is no need to leave the hotel. Thank you all for such a lovely stay.

Just arrived back from the Delfino hotel could not fault anything,everything was100%.It was our 43rd wedding anniversary and we were made a fuss of by fabulous waiter Aziz who made it exra special that day and for the rest of our holiday.Thank you everybody at the Delfino.

To return as soon as possible! You feel pampered upon arrival at the airport and throughout the period of stay. Cleanliness in the rooms and bathrooms is continuous and excellent, the staff always smiling and available to meet the various needs of customers! Animation at the top masterfully managed by the head of animation Armando, who with the support of a wonderful team of young people (Marco Stefano Rebecca Lara jasmine, Michela Som !!) manages to commit the whole day, while never being oppressive or heavy ! The restaurant is suitable for any kind of request, with always fresh food, both Italian and local! Great pizza!!!

We arrived at the hotel and the staff were waiting to take suitcases. We went for lunch first and then back to reception to be taken to our room.(we requested the ground floor in an email) The room was ground floor and in the main building. The room was great, with a large bed and a huge shower. It had a fridge and loads of cupboard space. The staff in the restaurant for breakfast, lunch, and dinner were great and very attentive to our needs. Always there with drinks with a smile. The food was very good, and even someone who's fussy could eat here. The gala night was amazing. The food was so special. Roast beef , potatoes, and prawn cocktails.  The bars were great as well. A different specialised cocktail every day. There are 3 bars. The beach, pool, and lobby. All the staff are amazing in these. The pools are great as well. The quiet pool was great for me. No kids, no music and no mobiles. The pool is cold and very clean. The main pool at the pool bar is good. The top half is warm and the bottom cold. This was the main area for most of the activities. Water polo and aqua aerobics. There had darts and other games. The animation team is fabulous. They always said hi and would always have a kind words to say to you. I have to give a shout out to MoMo he is brilliant and so funny. That man has more energy than anyone i know. I had my birthday here and the restaurant manager did everything to make it so special. I had a beautiful chocolate cake with candles and the staff sang to me. I had lovely sparkling wine(that was pretty ordered by my fiance) chilled waiting for me. This hotel is a fabulous place to go in tunisia. Now for the bad stuff. Some of the equipment could be done with an upgrade. The darts and board. The flights on the archery arrows.  Now for the unsung hero's.  The cleaners this place is spotless, and the cleaners are always about cleaning the restaurant toilets and everything. The gardeners this place has some beautiful scenery.

reviews.review_title: We hope to return as soon as possible
reviews.review_text: Excellent reception and services during your stay, clean and spacious rooms, reception always available, great variety of food and high quality, entertainment service very helpful and friendly with whom there were also many chats with Steve, Willy, Azza, Rebecca, Stefano, Chris, Momo and Siwar.  All the services of this hotel are of high quality, we will return as soon as possible!

Travelled with sisters and nieces May 2025. The best holiday. Hotel is first class.  Cannot fault one thing. Food was delicious, drinks were such good quality, spa first class. Our room was cleaned every day to a high standard. The staff are all amazing. Couldn’t do enough for you. So friendly and helpful. We will definitely return to this hotel

Just had another amazing week at this incredible resort. My 23 year old daughter and I came together two years ago and I had to bring my husband this time for his birthday and celebrate our wedding anniversary.  It’s been so worth coming back.    We’ve had the most incredible time, a massive shout out to the wonderful Mahmoud Bouaoun in bookings, who has made sure every need we’ve had has been more than catered for. The bungalow has been beautiful right on the beach. All the staff from the hotel have been welcoming and extremely helpful.   We have already planned our return for next year. Thank you so much for looking after us like royalty. We can’t recommend you all enough and can’t wait to return.  Thank you so much! 🙏🙏

From when we arrived until we left this hotel and all the staff exceeded our expectations.  We arrived around 9pm where we were greeted with drinks and directed to hot food while our check-in was carried out. Throughout our stay all the staff were really lovely from the front desk,cleaning, Spa,bar staff and animation team were all really friendly and made us feel very welcome. The hotel is spotless and the food is amazing! This is my first time in Tunisia but will certainly not be the last to this hotel!

Lovely, clean hotel with good food and an incredibly hardworking animation team (Az in particular is superb).  Went as a couple out of season but loved every second.   Out of season there is one heated pool.   First time to Tunisia but would come back.

Wow, well it was our first time in Tunisia and can honestly say we would 100% go back to this hotel. The whole experience was fantastic! The food was one of the best we have had at an all inclusive hotel. The drinks were good (although we could not get drunk for love nor money) the bar staff in all three bars were really good. We like to have a drink and relax on the balcony in the evenings and they would even provide us with a tray for us to take our drinks back! The animation team were brilliant and really engaging with everyone! Big shout out to Steve, Azza and kris, i dont know where they get their energy from!!! The waiters in the restaurant were very nice, even by the end of our two week stay getting our drinks on the table ready for us to eat!!  Only side really was no air-con as its seasonal and the same for the bbq restaurant. It would have been nice to experience that. All in all a fantastic 2 weeks.

From the moment we arrived we were just amazed by this beautiful Hotel and its amazing staff! We had not been to Tunisia for many years and this time we were just blown away by what we experienced! An immaculate hotel kept clean by a fantastic housekeeping team. The beach is just like a Caribbean experience,  a big thank you to Mansour Mohammed the life guard and the Security guys on the beach for looking after us, they are really special guys.  The food was some of the best we have experienced on any holiday and we travel on average 3 times a year.  Plenty of choice every single day and a Salad bar which was amazing! The Restaurant team are a fantastic, Mohammed MTIR a waiter on the outside terrace looked after us, this man is credit to the hotel. The Beer, Wine & Cocktails were really good and our men are really fussy with their beer but they said it is the best they have ever had whilst o  holiday.  We only saw 2 shows and found they were not for us and we did not partake in any daytime activities but the show & activities teams were very pleasant. When we arrived we were the last coach transfer to be dropped off so guessed that we would be 1st pick for our return journey which turned out to be correct as they were going to pick us up at 5.20am for a 10.20 flight !, we sourced a private taxi for 100 dinar (£25 approx) which was worth it and we were still the 1st in the airport check in queue! Would we return to the Delfino beach hotel? Absolutely YES!  We love it and are already looking to return later in the year. Just a couple of little negatives: The air conditioning was not on at the hotel as its seasonal,  the A La Carte & bbq restaurants were also not yet open,  I understand that there has to be a cut off date but the option would have been an added bonus but these little niggles do not spoil our experience in any way, a massive thanks to management & staff for a brilliant holiday!

My sister and I are here atm in week 2 of our holiday. From the minute we walked through the front entrance, we were greeted and welcomed by the most amazing staff. From reception (Yasmin) , bar staff (Rached and Sami) , dining room, beach staff (Raffet) , domestics and animation (Willie). We choose not to participate in activities or entertainment but find that Willie goes out of his way to give us a little of his time every single day. He is a true professional and very loyal in his work. The food is always beautiful. We will recommend this hotel as we have found it faultless. Well done to everyone who helps run this amazing hotel.

This is our third visit to the hotel and we will be back. The holiday fulfilled all our expectations. Wonderful varied food. Amazing beach. Exceptional staff in all areas: helpful, cheerful, respectful and caring. Rooms modern and spacious, clean and tidy. We recommend this hotel.

We’ve just spent a week here and honestly had the best time !  The staff were all so lovely and helpful, nothing was too much trouble for them. The grounds of the resort were beautiful and really well maintained. One morning I was sitting in our room’s garden and one of the gardeners picked some flowers and gave them to me. There were also a few cats and kittens on the grounds which we loved ! My husband had a great time at the buffet at breakfast, lunch and dinner and had 4 plates each time. The private beach was nice, and our room also had a sea view which was great. I spent most of my week by the quiet pool, and really appreciated the peacefulness of it. Our room was very clean and spacious.  I always try to write a balanced review, and with that in mind there are a few points I’d like to mention, however these are in no way negatives and wouldn’t stop us from staying here again. I am unfortunately a picky eater, and while there was plenty of food, it was a little limited for me, however I am aware that being a picky eater is my problem, not the resorts ! Our bathroom did at times have a bit of a drain smell, but nothing that opening our door and getting some fresh air into the room didn’t fix. The room was quite western, and I had been hoping for more of a Tunisian theme. One of the spotlights by our bed didn’t work, and the other had fallen out of the socket. Part of the fixture on the bathroom door was loose. The water is obviously treated so has a chlorine taste/smell so some more bottle refill stations around the place wouldn’t go amiss, using so many plastic bottles felt quite wasteful. The resort is quite isolated as my husband found during his walks, there wasn’t much around and the area was quite dirty and smelly - obviously does not affect our opinion of the resort. There is a supermarket and pharmacy about 15 mins away.   All in all, we had an amazing week here, and would definitely recommend staying here !

Had a wonderful stay at Delfino resort. This is our first time visiting. I have stayed at many hotels however the service was impeccable. The entertainment was amazing. I rarely get involved in activities as I tend to keep to myself however the animation staff made me feel so welcome and comfortable that I participated in numerous activities. The black and white dinner was brilliant. Food was as very good. Especially for our very fussy 17 year old who lives off chicken nuggets and chips. We have booked to come back in June/July 25 because we have had such an amazing time! Would 100% recommend!

We had an amazing holiday, every member of the  staff were so lovely. The waiters we're so attentive and friendly but not pushy at all. The food was really good with lots of choice every night and cooked & presented very well. The hotel is so clean and the housekeeping team work really hard.  We had an fantastic spa experience would definitely recommend, the girls at the spa are brilliant and really made us feel special & very spoilt a good price too. The only advice I would give is bring pounds/Euros to change at reception as the card machines are rubbish. 10 dinars work out about £2.50 5 dinars about £1.25 We used to tip waiters/bar staff a couple of times throughout the day.  We had such a relaxing chilled week we are booking again for next year.

vis hotel   When we arrived in the room, my wife and I understood that hygiene was not optimal: hair and dirt present on the floor and on the sheets. The baby cot proposed for our 4-month-old daughter had a broken bar, dirty because of the hair present. The rooms have not cleaned properly: there are always traces left on the sink EVERY time, the sheets are not changed but reused, the bed is not always well made. We ordered breakfast in bed the first morning .. catastrophic: we had a complete assortment of buffet offered downstairs certainly, but everything was mixed (butter, strawberry jam, honey apricot jam on a small plate...), the pastries are poor qualities, the bread is hard. The air conditioning does not work at all: the nights were excessively hot and therefore unpleasant, the only window present barely opens so it was impossible to cool the room. I put a star because it is not possible to put any stars: I do NOT recommend at ALL, the price charged by the hotel for the stay is too high compared to the quality proposed, I strongly advise against: if you want a good stay in Tunis, avoid this hotel and everything will be fine!

3-star hotel but 4 stars for everything. From breakfast to the room to the location and above all to the kindness of all staff.Do not forget that the beds are very comfortable as well as stanza.La breakfast and 'sufficient and even more' with always fresh food.

reviews.review_title: Basic Hotel in Tunis City Center
reviews.review_text: Well this Hotel is secured with a lot of police men and a security guy at the front door. It is located near the Medina, also good located from the Louage Station Moncef Bey. I had a good stay, though the Hotel have seen it's best years as interior is partly outworn. The bed was new, but hard. The bath room was clean. The Breakfast was good enough, otherwise they are a lot of options in the near location. Last to mention the friendliness of the whole staff, including the security guy and the breakfast staff.

reviews.review_title: A Very Good Pension for Urban Tourism
reviews.review_text: I spent two nights with family in this Pension for a sightseeing tour in Tunis. The Inn's location is ideal in the city center next to the famous lahbib Bourguiba street. The reception is very professional  The modern renovated rooms clean and tastefully decorated and especially in the theme of golf. The breakfast very good  The only downside parking that is not available but the solution exists in the parking lot of the Africa Inn right next door but let's pay 20 dinars for the 24 hours

Very good hotel  I ran away from a messon I rented in Tunis that I do not advise anyone to do in the future    I recommend this beautiful Pension  I have 2 communicating rooms  I am on family very welcome the receptionist very welcoming with a good glass of lemonade for welcome  Shades worthy of a 4 Star Pension  And very clean  The location and ideal except that we do not have parking  My 10 mitres ago parking Africa 10 dinar at night correct   I wish you a good continuation

I stayed for one night waiting for my flight transiting for one day in Tunis. I called them from the airport around 10 a.m., asking if I could have an early check-in, and they said yes. I got the room 10 minutes after arriving. The room is spacious, clean, and organised. The bathroom is big as well. It had a mini bar, a kettle, and a TV. In the morning, I had breakfast there. It was varied and tasty. The staff is also friendly and helpful, especially the lady in the restaurant. The location is good and very central. There are plenty of shops, cafes, bars, and restaurants around.  The only bad thing was that there was a horrible smell around 6 am. coming from the air-conditioning. It was so strong that it woke me up.  All in all, the stay for one night was OK, and you get what you pay for, and for that budget, what they are offering is excellent.

A very good hotel , staff listened and room very clean + beautiful location , very helpful staff, varied breakfast + very comfortable bedding , very clean room and fast service and listened to strongly recommend ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️

Great location in the centre, close to the main promenade. Large rooms. Friendly staff. A little difficult to find because it is located in a street near the Ministry of the Interior and the navigator (Google Maps) takes you to the opposite side. To find it you have to walk along the promenade and enter from Rue de Serbie.

On our arrival, we received lemonade as a refreshment. The staff were extremely kind, friendly and helpful at reception and breakfast room. Securities were also very kind. The room was a nice size. It wasn't 100% clean if you properly check the floor. Even though you get a cleaner daily. It seemed, it was not even hovered. The bedsheets and pillow cases smelled like domestos everyday, which bothered us to sleep. I think they use lots of bleach but not fabric conditioner. People were probably smoking in the rooms and smoking was also allowed in the bar so we were smelling it from the 5th floor. Breakfast was good enough. There were same things every day but it was enough for us so I can't complain. The location was perfect, close to the restaurants and old town(medina). It was also very safe as there were so many police officers around 24hrs. Reception contacted me when they couldn't see us until 8pm. It was very nice of them that they cared about us as we were two ladies. Overall we were satisfied with our stay. I can definitely recommend this hotel and if I plan to go to Tunis again, it definitely will be the same hotel in terms of staff and location. Thank you for everything 🙏🏻

Floor staff, housekeepers and kitchen staff good!! From our arrival until our departure the reception staff were more or less passable.  But yesterday I went to pay the tourist tax and I came across a Mr at reception that I had never seen. Very unpleasant and aggressive. He almost yelled at me because I wanted to pay in euros (€50) and I dared to ask him for the equivalent of in Dinard. He literally threw my ticket in my face telling me that it is not a currency exchange office. Let me come back and pay in Dinard. It was one of his colleagues who heard the refusal and came out to apologize and take it from us.  To this Mr if he will read me, when we are racist and we don't like Afro people we avoid working in hotels or public places.

reviews.review_title: Right in the centre. Comfortable and functional
reviews.review_text: Tunisia is decidedly cheap. For eating, refueling, shopping... Hotels, however, are not exactly free. At least, not if you book from Italy, via Booking and looking for a minimum quality/price ratio. This hotel, a ten minute walk from the Porte de France and therefore from the entrance to the Medina, has a good quality/price ratio and is perfect for getting around the city. The rooms - we had a triple - are large and functional. The beds were comfortable. The bathroom is large and well organised. The level of hygiene is also good and the breakfast included in the price is varied. The only thing that could perhaps be improved was the Wi-Fi signal in the rooms. The reception is open 24 hours a day and for those traveling by car there is a secure paid car park not far away. Advised.

i realy had a bad experince with the front office man with no reason who tried to  push us to not stay in the hotel by all ways and  said  to go and search for another hotel by a very bad mannar  and when we asked to meet the manger he said that he is everything  here he is the manger too which we discovered that wasnt true

reviews.review_title: I wouldnt recommend anyone going there.
reviews.review_text: The receptionist was  very rude and he wasnt helpfull at all. He even asked us to leave if we dont pay in cash as he doesnt take money in dollars. He didnt wantvto make more than one transaction as we were 3 friends taking a triple room. Why wouldnt he take more than one transaction!!! And we were so tired and it was 48degrees outsidw and having many luggage he just didnt care at all. And when we asked for the managed ,he aaid that he is the manager which is a lie . And when he knew that we  wrote complaint he didint even apologize.

reviews.review_title: Room without aircondition and wifi in addition to the worst staff attitude ever experienced!
reviews.review_text: The room has NO air condition and no wifi. Aircondition from june on only and the hotel stuff is the most rude ever! I complained to booking.com and the hotel told booking it is 19C in Tunis, while it was 28C yesterday and tou can imagine the heat in the room. And the room has only a small window to open partially.I would not recomend this hotel as they lie in the description, they lie to your face and they have the worst attitude. I travel a lot around the world and this is the first time I have experienced an attitude and lies like this.

reviews.review_title: Hotel refused to give us the room and we were almost stranded in Tunis in the middle of the night!
reviews.review_text: I had booked a double room (double bed) for me and my partner on booking.com. Even though it was a room for a couple and I was in email contact with the hotel after booking, they did not ask me about details of the second guest or a marriage certificate. My partner is Tunisian but as I am European, we have never had any problems with room bookings in Tunisia. The hotel did not mention anywhere in the booking process that marriage certificates have to be provided! But on the day of our arrival they suddenly texted me again and requested this and told us they would not let us stay in the same room. It is outrageous to me that they did not ask about this in advance because I almost wasn't able to find any other accommodation due to the incredibly short notice. I am assuming they wanted to charge for a second room seeing that the hotel was empty at the time and they were offering discounts on booking.com

Good location, near the main shopping area. friendly staff.   Room is clean, isolated from noise and outside clarity.   Breakfast regular, not good, not too bad. Officially starts at 6:30 but in reality starts at 7:00, before then very limited.   Wi fi is poor.   We paid 90 USD, a high price, the regular price is around 60 USD, at this regular price it is a fair deal.

Good position and very clean room. Breakfast It was good nice staff. Negative points it was the reception not helpful with touristic information and the restaurant its smoke free, so there a really strong smell and in my case I could not go to have my child with us.

This was a very nice hotel.  The staff was very friendly and spoke fairly decent English. Arabic was very much different than the dialect in Jordan. French is a great language to use in this city! The rooms and bath were very clean!  Decent breakfast. Great location!!  Would stay again!

I was on the sixth floor and the room was okay, very average really, with no free water or tea making facilities. It was not particularly clean and neither of the two room safes worked.   What was particularly depressing was breakfast. The restaurant is tucked away at the rear of the hotel, a badly lit room with no windows and nothing hot to eat except toast. Very disappointing.  Something to be aware of  at the moment is that the hotel is situated next to a government building of some kind, and taxi's cannot park outside he hotel, and have to take pot luck, which means a considerable struggle if you have heavy luggage. Although not the hotel's fault, they are certainly very quiet about this on the website.   They are also very very reluctant to accept credit cards, and are more than happy to pretend to take payment and 'decline' you card, to force you to produce the cash.

I spend approx 1 week in this Hotel, when you check from internet you are watching new designed rooms .. but It's different.. rooms are very old since 1990.. personel are unpolite.. Last day after check out when I put my luggage to lobby, receptionist didn't care about luggages and someone get my luggage and no one didn't see it After checking cameras o e of the customer & taxi driver take my luggages... with long phone valla finally we found them and they bring back.. That was definately terrible expriment for me ..  I just added real photos..

A very good stay, and I thank Mrs. Nermine at the reception. I would like to extend my stay but I am forced to abandon this beautiful company to return to the motherland, Mali. Inchallah I would come back one day to tell you would only be a hello in memory of this beautiful stay.  Long live Tunisia! Long live Ibis and Long live Nermine.

reviews.review_title: A very good stay and reception
reviews.review_text: Very satisfied with the stay, and especially the reception Nermine and Safa Thanks for the quality , it makes you want to come back for a long stay. In my projections to spend the holidays, view the hotel offers an ideal setting thank you Nermine and Safa and the whole team

This restaurant offers an exceptional culinary experience: tasty dishes, attentive service and warm atmosphere. The authentic flavors and the careful presentation make it a must! A real treat for the taste buds, to recommend without hesitation!!!

The hotel is warm and the staff friendly. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The hotel is well located close to everything. I had a very pleasant stay. The staff is friendly. Breakfast is hearty and tasty.

Everything is fine, cleanliness, service, catering, recommend for a stopover waiting for plane.The staff is friendly treasurer and attentive, the breakfast buffet is great. We stay there whenever we have to stop in Tunis;

reviews.review_title: Between 2010 and 2015 I was with Accord Group since I migrated to HGR Group
reviews.review_text: Too happy to stay at this hotel right now where almost everyone is friendly especially young ladies like Nermine at the Reception and Miss Faten who works night at the Bar. It is very available, as soon as it is called it is always with a radiant smile.

Ibis Tunis is a cheap hotel in the city of Tunis with its own dinner and breakfast, with a more hidden location. The air conditioning in the hotel room is problematic, it stops every few moments and it feels very hot.

reviews.review_title: Good Location with Good Value Award
reviews.review_text: Good value for Award. Clean. There is everything you need in the rooms. Decent staff. Breakfast quite varied.Just the smell of sewers in the shower room. Ideal location to visit the capital. Well-guarded parking

I'm here for several weeks and I can only recommend the IBIS Tunis.  Breakfast is very good and the staff always tries their best👍 The room service is also very good and I'm looking forward to the next few weeks here. Unfortunately, Tunis itself has little to offer

reviews.review_title: Hotel in the city center perfect for business travel
reviews.review_text: Hotel Ibis located in the center of Tunis. A small hotel but very magnificent. Clean room, warm welcome The buffet was very rich and variable. The waiters are very helpful and smiling. I highly recommend this hotel. Resonable price

Fairly clean and comfy, even by western standards. The rooms only have a single double bed. My son and I stayed here for two nights during the Eid weekend. The staff were very accommodating. They called a cab to the airport for us at 3.30am and it was there in minutes. Breakfast selections were fine, including an omelet and meat tray. Dinner was also acceptable, altho there are plenty of restaurants to choose from in the area.

Hotel off the main avenue, gloomy area, completely overpriced at €72+, check-in staff overwhelmed, no room before 12 noon, strange as it's supposedly a business hotel. (Do ALL business people check out in the afternoon?) No fresh air via air conditioning (in winter), only heating, window can only be opened a crack, it's winter, why?! Shower overflows into the bathroom, water pressure a bit weak, shower head/tap blocked, splashes around. Breakfast for €9+ only local products, no oatmeal, the rest is sugary. Check-out worked as it was prepaid and no further transactions. Book a hotel on the boulevard, definitely more welcoming and appropriate.

reviews.review_title: Team commitment at the Top/Service Improvement Needed
reviews.review_text: I would like to thank the Ibis team for their commitment, a special thanks to Hamza and Sameh from the reception. The management of Ibis should repair the second elevator as it takes more waiting time. You also need to improve the quality of the internet signal. The rest of the service was perfect

Perfect ! Central! Cheap ! Friendly staff, decent restaurant and very decent room, with TV with French channels that works. I really recommend it, plus many restaurants close to the hotel and the city center 10 minutes away on foot

Very bad treatment at the reception, I stayed for three nights, the welcome was catastrophic the receptionist treated us in a very bad way the very old room the old supplies, no welcome I chose the hotel as it is part of the Accor chain unfortunately it is not the host of this international chain Dirty and lack of hygiene and no hotel service

reviews.review_title: Standard Ibis, but with added attitude!
reviews.review_text: A standard Ibis hotel close to the City of Culture and Avenue Habib. Rooms were as one would expect and there is ample guest parking. The car park attendant was a lovely, cheery chap, which is more than could be said for some of the bar staff here. We are well aware that alcohol is considered haraam in Islamic countries .. but this hotel serves alcohol, and as such, it should not be served with a sneer.

reviews.review_title: Pleasant Stay at IBIS Hotel in Tunisia with Friendly Staff and Clean Rooms .
reviews.review_text: I recently stayed at the IBIS hotel in Tunisia and I must say that my experience was quite pleasant. Everything was good, from the cleanliness of the rooms to the amenities provided. The staff were also very friendly and always had a smile on their faces. One staff member in particular, Oumayma, was excellent and went above and beyond to make sure that my stay was comfortable.  The only downside to my stay was that the restaurant could be improved a little bit. The food was decent but lacked variety and flavor. However, this did not detract from my overall experience at the hotel.  Unfortunately, there was a power outage during my stay which lasted for a few hours. This was quite inconvenient but it was not the fault of the hotel and they did their best to rectify the situation as quickly as possible.  Overall, I would definitely recommend staying at IBIS hotel in Tunisia. The staff were great, the rooms were clean and comfortable, and despite a few minor issues, I had an enjoyable stay.

Rooms are very small and very basic, like a jail cell with one very tiny window. Rooms temperature is controlled by the management so they choose if you get air conditioning or not. So when it’s hot outside, your room is very very hot too but when you tell them, they act like it is the first time they are hearing it; don’t be fooled, they know exactly what’s going on.   Service in the front desk with the exception of two people is completely non-existent and you have to try very hard to get service and responses. The girl in the front desk with the black hair is usually smoking in the back office and playing on her phone and the restaurant staff have to tell her to come out to serve at the front desk. The other blonde haired girl, her name starts with A, is very mean and rude to most guests Omar and Asma are very nice. Housekeeping is super slow and not organized.   Restaurant staff provide no service at all, not even a greeting. If you ask a question, they clearly are not happy to be disturbed from playing on their cellphones. They hide in the corner and gossip all throughout the meal service and play on their phone.   It is not walking distance to the Old Town, it’s quite a walk so be very prepared to walk or take a taxi. Use Bolt Taxi and drop the price 3 dinars if you want to negotiate a rate.   Airport to hotel from departure area was about 7 dinars but you can get it at about five dinars.   Food is horrible at the hotel but they do serve an overpriced breakfast buffet.   Outside it is very Sandy and dusty.

Good staff professional. moderate clean. reasonable food quality. very good for 1-2 days. close to different utilities. compare to many hotels in teh area i consider it excellent. Novatel is much better although more deer in price

Everything ok, I stayed at this hotel several times, in general is satisfactory in all means.  only two notes: 1) breakfast needs to be a little richer for ex: butter, jam and black tea to be included, 2) a small refrigerator would be of help, is needed in warmer climate hotels.

Hotel always great and the restaurant 👍👍 Animation has been a client of good teams for 15 years but there is no Fortunately there is JUNIOR He does everything. The unfriendly horrible DJ doesn’t take care of the sound nothing to do thank you junior it’s him who hosts lunch games others walk around the pool without looking too much or play table tennis all afternoon  But they do better they are doing well yes well for the evening that's all  And then for those who rally for the noise we do not take a lively hotel y’en mare o stay at home Well otherwise good week anyway but many are complained of the animators except JUNIOR again thank you Deserves a title of chief animator 👍👍

The complex has great potential. On the other hand who experienced the framissima and the Fram service is a disappointment. We were placed in a family room communicating with our friends and asked from the day after our arrival to change rooms.We were promised the change of room within 24 hours and we still wait.We did not force our request too bad for us.  Same for airport transfers to the club you will make many stops to pick up other tourists at various hotels  You can easily check in and take a solo taxi it is easier.  Also no pick up at the airport for our return  We had to be met at the airport for our check-in and again nobody  As for the hotel, air conditioning is in operation mid June, gym closed swimming pool not heated.  You can't change before 10:00 in the morning, not very practical when you go on an excursion at 8:00.  For the positive the catering is good , room staff , housekeeping , our friend Tyson as well as the photographer are on top.  So a big disappointment for FRAM We are still waiting for a call following the changes in flight hours that we will be told we can not help and the same for the room.  Where's our FRAMISSIMA?

reviews.review_title: Very average hotel on a beutiful beach
reviews.review_text: A honest review is a very average 3 to 4 star hotel on the most beutiful beach imaginable .the food is quite average as you get on a buffet anywhere Fresh orange juice at breakfast is definitely a plus point  and the beach terrace to eat and drink .. loved that ..The rooms are fine.. outside pool is freezing cold in may ..not sure why they don't heat it ..staff are not the friendliest I've ever seen but ok..no entertainment atall .only football on tv for mostly French and German..quite disappointing holiday considering the price paid but the beach is definitely the best feature .

We are currently spending our holidays at Sentido Djerba Beach and basically it is a very nice hotel. The complex is well maintained, the beach is fantastically beautiful and the food varied and delicious. We were particularly surprised by the diversity of the buffet.  However, there is one big minus: the noise. Even before 08:00, renovations begin with loud hammering and drilling – it is impossible to think of sleeping in or a relaxed morning routine. Unfortunately, we were not informed in advance that rooms were being renovated. It was not clear at the time of booking or on the website that construction work was taking place.  The hotel itself has a lot of potential, but this lack of transparency regarding the construction work unfortunately significantly clouds the holiday experience. Prior information would have been fair and helpful.

Very good stay where we had a great holiday. Many thanks to Melissa (customer relations) who, following our complaint, took care of arranging another room for us. Indeed, we had a room with garden view but where there was a construction site. Congratulations to the cooks who made exceptional meals! We also recommend massages that were at the top. Only unfortunate thing, uneducated people who allow themselves to book deckchairs early and who often arrive 2 or 3 hours later. Finally, we will definitely return to this hotel.

Seventh time we went to this hotel and always very satisfied with all the amenities. Whether it is the reception, the restaurant, the bar, the cleaning, the security,... the staff is adorable. A new stay at this hotel is already scheduled for October 2025. In addition the good weather was there and the Djerbis are still hospitalized. A good rating also for the new animation team and a special thank you to Picachu who animated pétanque and archery.🤪👍❤️🥰

Hello everyone, I'm going to be as objective as possible in my opinion. The hotel is really superb and really waterfront. Quiet and relaxing, food with a good buffet and lots of choices according to your tastes. New and very nice rooms. The staff is friendly apart from the reception where a little undressed gentleman with blue eyes remains quite unpleasant the whole stay to the point of refusing us change because it is not 7am and my request is at 6:55am before an excursion. All inclusive really complete. Watch out for world trips where The goal is to sell Ahmed to you Services 4x4 with supposedly dunes which are actually only two small sandy hills along the road to go to Tataouine and all this with a guide who speeds you and tells you every two minutes groupir.conclusion take the bus for 25 euros less it is the same"nomadic / beer" you have absolutely no more time in 4x4 than in bus thank you Ahmed for his good advice.(Irony of course) Thank you to the people at the restaurant and cleaning who are themselves very nice and of remarkable kindness. The bar also if you just want a drink because for the smile they surely were trained at the front desk.

Spacious room, clean, well equipped with connected TV Restaurant with varied dishes, many specialties, excellent fish superb swimming pools, including an indoor heated beach access at the foot of the hotel kindness of staff Lush vegetation

2nd stay and all the positive points of September 2024 were confirmed once again. Everything was absolutely perfect. Hotel of impeccable cleanliness, staff with little care, excellent and very varied food, magnificent pool. Just the animation a little weak, maybe because of Ramadan and certainly because still in the off season. We are already looking forward to coming back in September.

We had a relaxing stay at this wonderful hotel.  Everything was perfect, a beautiful beach cleaned every morning, succulent dishes we enjoyed in front of the sea, all the staff is adorable!a little extra for the waiter of the morning terrace 🙂 We will come back for sure!!

First of all, I would like to thank the reception manager of the Sentido Djerba Beach hotel for allocating us a room despite the absence of a reservation from our tour operator. I would also like to express my gratitude to all the hotel staff, including the waiters, for their incredible kindness.  The hotel is beautifully located by the beach, with an outdoor pool offering panoramic sea views, and the heated indoor pool is also spotless. The food is very good and varied, although the menus can become a bit repetitive after more than 7 days. The rooms are very clean, and the staff is very welcoming.  There is no need to book a vehicle to visit the surrounding area, as the hotel offers excursions, and taxis are available just outside the hotel for around 10 dinars (€3), allowing you to reach the end of the island.

The hotel was really nice. The staff are also very friendly. The entertainment team were brilliant. Me and my family enjoyed playing table tennis and tennis in the day time. We also enjoyed the entertainment at night, dancing and karaoke. We were only there for a short period but wished we could have stayed longer. We will definitely be returning in the future Thank you for a great stay.

reviews.review_title: First visit to Djerba...Definitely not our last
reviews.review_text: My first visit to Tunisia since 1988(!), and my wife's first visit ever. Having inadvertently fixated on the Canary Islands in recent years, we fancied doing something a bit different for a long weekend, and as I had read that Easyjet had recently started a new route to Djerba from Manchester, we decided to spend the weekend there!  After an early start on the Friday (up at 2.30am!), we breezed through Manchester Airport (not necessarily always the case!) followed by an uneventful 3-ish hour flight down to Djerba. Upon arrival we were through immigration formalities in minutes, and with only hand luggage (always, it's the only way to travel!) we met our pre-booked private transfer driver in arrivals, and were on our way within 15 minutes of landing.  The main "Zone Touristique" (I'm sure you don't need my help to translate that!) is around 30km from the airport, so at North African taxi speeds that's about a 25-minute transfer.   We arrived at the hotel and were immediately drawn by the impressive architecture. As would be expected in this part of the world, the Moorish influence features heavily, quickly reminding you that you are in a region whith a lot of history and a some interesting stories to tell!  Once we had checked in and received our welcome drink (something sweet and orange, don't think it contained alcohol) and our All-Inclsusive wristband, we were taken to our room, which we found to be of a decent size, well presented, and light and airy. TIP: The Tunisian Dinar is a closed currency, meaning that it is not permitted to take any of it out of the country. As a result, you can't exchange any in the UK before you leave, so if you want any notes for tips etc, you need to use an ATM at the airport on arrival. The exchange rate currently is around 4 Dinars to a UK Pound, so a 5-dinar note is worth just over a pound, 10 about £2.50 and so on. Unfortunately we hadn't factored this in, so we didn't have anything to tip our baggage porter.  Having unpacked, we wandered to the restaurant, where we quickly discovered that the choice of food was huge! Lots of salads, various meat dishes including stews, couscous, curries, as well as a whole section for (whole, occasionally filleted) grilled fish, a pizza station, as well as various unidentifiable bits and pieces. All of it is labelled in 3 languages (French, German and English), but not everything translates directly so sometimes it was a bit of a roulette, especially for myself as a non-meat eater. Quality of the food was excellent, and the desserts were spectacular, and there were SO many different choices. My only gripe with the food was that sometimes it wasn't always as hot as it should have been, but that tends to be a pitfall of any all-inclusive buffet. In the grand scheme of things it certainly wasn't a massive issue.  The waiters were all excellent, very friendly, always happy to help (of course, this is their livelihood, and happy guests tend to be more generous when tipping!). Local beer, wine, water (and soft drinks, if required) were all available at mealtimes and we plentiful. If you asked for 2 glasses of wine the waiters would just bring the bottle anyway, so it was as easy to just ask for that! Each waiter is allocated a small area of the restarant to work, so you quickly get to know who is who. We tipped each waiter that served us, giving 10 Dinars per meal, which seemed to be well-received.  The entertainment was not really our kind of thing, but as it happened in the only bar open in the evening, we became a part of the audience anyway! Again, included drinks were available, including wines. beers and a selection of cocktails (we didn't try any of these). "Premium" drinks, including higher quality wines, were theoretically available, but when I tried to buy a bottle of Cabernet I was told that all the wines on the menu had sold out! So we just stuck with the free Tunisian offering instead!  The hotel grounds were superbly maintained, and the terrace right next to the beach was a great place to sit and enjoy a drink in the sun (in an actual glass, rather than the default of a plastic cup that often happens in All-Inclusive resorts!). The beach itself provided sun loungers and parasols free for hotel guests to use, and was patrolled by a security guard who kept the local salespeople at arm's length. Beach towels are gained via a nominal deposit at reception, via a voucher which you cash in at the hotel shop, where the owner will attempt to sell you whatever he can, although he was never overly pushy and it was all very good-natured.  In conclusion - A really nice hotel, spotlessly clean, staff were all superb, surprisingly good food, the beach was great, the grounds were great, Djerba generally is an excellent place to spend some time. We will definitely be back, and would not hesitate to use this hotel again. 10/10 from me!   Final note: Again, regarding Tunisian Dinars. The security folks at the airport tell you you are not allowed to take Dinars though to departures, where the only cash accepted is Euros (Cards are accepted). Numerous travellers were randomly spot-checked at the gate, including their wallets being checked for Dinars, which were confiscated if discovered. So spend them BEFORE you get to the airport!

Many thanks to Sentido Djerba Beach! The stay was amazing!!! First of all the hotel is just beautiful, thanks to the hotel manager for this welcome and this superb renovated room on the Garden side. Many thanks to the waiters and bartenders who are so kind, smiling , pleasant and have a real sense of service. Thanks to the Animation team , special mention for Luiss, Boubou, Selma, Junior , Diddo and WALID! The rooms are ultra clean , thank you to the housekeepers. The restaurant is just delicious, varied dishes, the cooks are so nice and the food EXCELLENT.  SPA: very good massages and beautiful meetings on site.  In short, everything was perfect for us!  We all love you! See you very soon ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Very welcome, not forgetting the animation.restaurant team, nice staff, clean room. Hotel equipped Hamam, heated pool, gym, outdoor pool, not to mention the entertainment team for some activities.

Hotel in free fall. I stayed here for almost 3 months from the beginning of November 2024 to the end of January 2025. This hotel is located on the beach. The terrace is the most beautiful part of this hotel. Although the service here is ok, the beach bar is ripe for the wrecking hammer. The outdoor pool and indoor pool are also ok. The rest of the building is in need of a total renovation. The rooms are old, everything is worn out, bathroom (shower in bath without handles) is a danger to the many elderly persons staying there. No heating in the rooms in winter. Smoking is allowed inside around reception / bar and in the morning before cleaning it smells like an old cafe. When the weather is, exceptionally, bad, it rains in many places inside, including in the restaurant. The food is decent. There are some hard-working friendly people working here but both in the reception and in the restaurant and just about everywhere there are a lot of misogynistic handsy machos, there is no professionalism here and in some places, such as the animation team where there are a lot of friendly, professional young people working, there are also aggressive people who really should not be in contact with the public! In my case, I was harassed by Ricky, who seemed to get away with everything because you can't count on any help here as a female customer. Nevertheless, mainly due to the sunny weather I had a wonderful time  Although Djerba is a lovely island to spend the winter I can't recommend this hotel for female singles looking for a quiet stay...

I had a great holiday, everything was perfect and the food excellent. Mimo, Louis, Nina and Salma have been exceptional facilitators, always dynamic and involved. However, Riki and Mike, who claim to be animators, are a real disappointment. Their only concern is not to animate but to sell , and harass customers by wanting to sell bingo at 120 dinars (see + at the head of the customer) and personalized items at +80 dinars, especially Mike. Their behavior is shameful and petty. Reki spends her time watching the animators, analyzing and staring at women including my fiancée, which is totally unacceptable. Moreover, he only dances with young people and lets the “interns” take care of the elderly, which is deeply disrespectful. Mike, on the other hand, does nothing constructive except force sales, and openly insult “fat” customers “who will explode” during cooking classes. We were outraged to hear that he was trying to sell his fox scarf (with dangling legs 400€ to a hotel guest).  These two “chefs” are incompetent and behave like opportunistic salespeople, totally disconnected from the role of animator. That doesn't respect customers. Fortunately Mimo, Nina, Louis and Salma are professional, caring and really involved in the well-being of holidaymakers.

reviews.review_title: Typical Tunisian hotel on the beach,
reviews.review_text: Excellent restaurant, grilled gambas buffet, excellent pasta, exquisite lemon pie, friendly animators, restaurant facing the sea, hotel facing the sea but protected from the wind, large heated indoor pool, well maintained buildings and Clean, quality bedding, large beds,, TV with many channels, good Internet connection

Beautiful spacious room. Very clean.Various cuisine. Staff with little care. Special mention to Selma for equipped with animation for his kindness and attention to all and for his willingness to move the boys of animation during the day.  One regret the surroundings not very suitable for walks and a garden of modest size. However, the beach is at the gates of the hotel.

A big congratulations to the animation team at Santido, who are doing an incredible job of making the stay memorable! Selma is an exceptional facilitator, always full of energy and attention, and Louis brings an incredible atmosphere with his good humor and enthusiasm. The activities are varied and well thought out, and the evenings are really entertaining. The hotel is also perfect: clean, comfortable, with a staff with great care. It is the perfect place to relax while having fun. An experience I highly recommend!

It was the first hotel on our trip to Algieria - good only one night. Hotel is next to city center, surrounded by nice park. Sorry to say  without any other superlatives. Hotel is old, without private beach, very small pools, rooms are un-renovated, some parts are even dirty.  However, food was eatable and staff very helpful & friendly - thanks for your hospitality.

reviews.review_title: Behind every dish, a story of courage
reviews.review_text: I highly recommend the Hotel Konta, the first establishment in Kantaoui, for its authenticity, its warm welcome and above all the exceptional quality of its kitchen service. A passionate team, led by Chef Kaoukher, who combines know-how, generosity and transmission.

Hello,  I highly recommend this hotel! The staff are friendly, especially Madame Kaouther, responsible for setting up the mlewi and chichi. I would like to highlight his kindness, his warm welcome and the quality of the delicious meals offered.  Thank you again for this pleasant stay, to the next visit, inchallah!

Good morning everyone. a very good hotel to spend your holidays.really I'm satisfied we were well received everything is perfect (food. service . entertainment ) I revisited it soon  bn continuation to the whole El Kanta team

We had the best time as a family in this hotel ,the hotel staff were amazing, friendly and do any thing to help, it brilliant time with everyone and already thinking about coming back, just amazing the food the drinks .the entertainment team has been great and amazing. All in all a good weeks break ,next time I will try not to over indulge and hopefully come home not feeling that I need another holiday to recover lol!!!

I greatly appreciated the service and the location of the hotel the service is at the top varied catering and wonderful welcoming staff.the room is with panoramic views and always clean.excellent value for money.I recommend.

reviews.review_title: Home from Home The Fantastic Kanta hotel and Kanta Spa. My First Choice Hotel in Port El Kantoui.
reviews.review_text: Another Fantastic Holiday in Hotel Kanta. Just had 2 Weeks lovely relaxing holiday. Hotel Staff are Brilliant Achraf the Manager, Kamel in Bar, reception Team, Muhammad And Fatma housekeeping not forgetting the Restaurant Staff who served lovely hot variety of Food. Bed Rooms are spacious with large Balcony and service is First Class. Rooms cleaned Daily with Fresh clean towels provided. It really is Home from Home. I love it. All in all a lovely Hotel Brilliant Staff in a Peaceful resort with Beautiful pools. Two outside pools and one indoor. The Spa is Fantastic Managed by Najwa and the Team. Highly recommended for Hamam. Hairdressing. Podiatry and Relaxing Massages. The Kanta Hotel and Spa. My second home and always my First choice when on Holiday in Tunisia. 10 out of 10 just Brilliant.

Stayed at Kanta recently and had a really good time. Location fantastic , next to the beach and Port El Kantoui . Hotel staff very all very friendly sociable and helpful especially Fatima who is more like a close friend and couldn't do enough to make us feel very comfortable. Our room was large with great balcony with outstanding views over the sea . Cleanliness , hygiene and services were very high standard especially in housekeeping and in restaurant. Food was very varied and and enjoyable. Walid and restaurant staff all very nice, friendly and helpful. Ouymima was  very  friendly Zumba teacher and we enjoyed the classes very much. Loved also walking around the large gardens and grounds with many beautiful old palm trees contributing to a very peaceful and serene experience.  Looking forward to returning here very soon .Thank you to All at the Kanta

An excellent stay at hotel kanta with family a warm and friendly welcome.very friendly staff,the food is varied and rich and good.the room is always cleaned I had a spacious room that overlooks panoramic sea views.the heated pool is clean and available from morning to evening.the most beautiful is the garden and greenery and the huge number of palm trees.I highly recommend and I come back.

reviews.review_title: Great break in the Kanta -quiet time,Bliss!
reviews.review_text: We like the Kanta because of its mature ,extensive gardens we enjoy walking around and its quietness and privacy..We booked for two and a half weeks -a sea view room ,a very  comfortable large double room with a good size balcony and a fine view of the port and sea from the 5th,floor.We were all inclusive-the friendly staff couldn’t do enough to make us feel comfortable and at home;-e.g.heater and extra quilts and great service in the restaurant.The standard of cleanliness and hygiene was excellent.Fatima (our cleaner )was fantastic and helpful and friendly.Also Oumayma’s  dance-Zumba classes were a blast -she was a great teacher and very sociable.Walid  the restaurant manager couldn’t do enough for us in the restaurant;there is a wide variety and choice.of healthy,good  food.We had some good evenings in the bar with Kemal the barman.We had a fantastic ,tranquil break from London.

reviews.review_title: I come back again soon I enjoy it
reviews.review_text: I really love this hotel because the rooms are nice and comfy I love how big the balcony is. And the beds are big and the room is quite spaceful the food is lovely I love the pasta and cakes the animation girl oumaima are kind helpful the pools are big and nice to swim In and big the indoor pool is nice the hotel restaurant is big I would come back here again

All right.  Very friendly and professional staff  The hotel staff is helpful and friendly the rooms are clean the food very decent restaurant is excellent and vari Bar side very good  Thank you all very soon

Kanta ,back always on top in everything  Cleanliness impeccable  Always warm welcome  Correct room  Food top top no doubt  Great hotel, very well eaten lots of choices and diversity  A very big thank you 😘😘😘😘😘  See you later.

Thank you hotel Kanta , The rooms are large and perfect bathroom. Everyone is clean. The restaurants are very well presented animation top Thank you for the whole team Monsieur dhia ,oumayma ,perfect welcome.pool beach a large parking everything is perfect. Hotel kanta is the best hotel in sousse

Very late in writing this review but better late than never. Stayed here for a week in September after getting a very cheap deal through love holiday. We enjoyed every minute of it. The staff are so lovely and friendly they made you feel so welcome. I am a very fussy eater but never struggled to find something I liked even their is a lot of choice breakfast or by the diner.There was some bad storms while we were there but they kept us entertained in the main reception area. Always kept your drink topped up. Rooms were spotless and maids were lovely. We are looking to go back again same time this year :)

Returned from 2 week's all inclusive and it was top and excellent  The rooms are very big and yes dated but this was not a problem. Beds were very comfortable. Food was excellent, the waiter's was professionnal in the restaurant and in the lobby bar. sunbeds and umbrellas were really good and there were always plenty to choose from. Entertainment in the evenings was good apart from the Karaoke which was painful at times when unknown songs are sang but the team always try and get everyone involved, but we enjoyed all the shows. The reception staff work very hard . The beach is lovely for a walk.we stay when it sunshine by the bigest garden really it's so famous. Finally we recommend this hotel.

A superb stay for a week of vacation. Very friendly and welcoming staff, restaurant reception throughout the hotel. The food is correct and varied sincerely I find a wide choice during breakfast and dinner. The indoor pool is heated and clean.the room on the 4th floor clean and modern sea view and huge palm garden. I highly recommend and will be back soon.

reviews.review_title: Big disappointment, feeling sorry to write this.
reviews.review_text: After a long trip, we were shocked upon entering our room on the third floor. It was dirty, the carpet was torn, there was no light in the bathroom, and although we were two friends, we were given a room with only one double bed. When we showed the video evidence to the reception staff, they offered us a quadruple room on the first floor, explaining that all rooms on the third floor needed renovation (so be cautious when booking). The new room was clean and acceptable for a 4-star hotel. We didn't have a minibar, and despite daily complaints, it wasn’t resolved. Eventually, the staff admitted that many guests had the same issue and there was nothing they could do. The food was varied and hygienic but lacked taste. There were long lines of people waiting to be served as the hotel was overcrowded. The pool was unclean until our last day; it appears they only clean it on Thursdays. The big waterslide was also out of service for our entire stay. The after-dinner entertainment was just music playing, with no dedicated staff or activities like in other hotels. The staff generally lacked hospitality, with the exception of one woman at the reception who was very kind. When we chose this hotel, we expected a better experience. Overall, Tunisia is a beautiful country, and that’s what we really came for.

Thanks hotel kanta  I was in kanta hotel for 1 week half board nice trip for me and my wife. many choices of food breakfast and dinner.room Well cleaned every day and i have sea view and port el kantaoui view. The garden was so fast and look very famous.the manager look arround for every things and he help me for many Times. The staff was helpfull and nice for all my recommandations. Five minutes to be in marina kantaoui to enjoy your stay.

The general atmosphere was very good. The staff welcoming mainly the ladies who prepared the omelets and the one who proposed the donuts (سفنج). The food lacked variety. Spacious and clean rooms.. The staff was discreet and efficient

reviews.review_title: Unable to get our money back: unacceptable!!
reviews.review_text: A very nice, well maintained and clean establishment. The staff, with the exception of the welcome, were very friendly, helpful and professional. The service in general was of very good quality, and the experience could have been excellent.  Unfortunately the spa was a disappointment, the smell in the steam room was very unpleasant, marked by a strong smell of humidity.  The most problematic point remains the exchange of money! At the hotel, we were given a handwritten form supposed to convert our Tunisian dinars into euros at the airport. Once there, the stockbroker refused the document because it was unofficial (the form was filled in by hand). As a result, we were unable to exchange the money we had left – a substantial amount – which is unacceptable, especially since dinars are not exportable.  This is an administrative aspect that the hotel must absolutely consider in order to avoid putting guests in such uncomfortable and penalizing situations.  Too bad, because without these inconveniences, the stay would have been excellent.  ***  A very attractive, well-maintained and clean establishment. The staff, with the exception of reception, were very friendly, helpful and professional. The service in general was of a very high standard, and the experience could have been excellent.  Unfortunately the spa was a disappointment, the smell in the hammam was very unpleasant, marked by a strong smell of damp.  The most problematic point was the exchange of money! At the hotel, we were given a handwritten form that was supposed to allow us to convert our Tunisian dinars back into euros at the airport. Once there, the exchange agent refused to accept this document, as it was not official (the form was filled in by hand). As a result, we were unable to exchange the money we had left - a considerable sum - which is unacceptable, especially as dinars cannot be exported.  This is an administrative aspect that the hotel absolutely must take into consideration in order to avoid putting guests in such uncomfortable and penalising situations.  It's a pity, because without these inconveniences, the stay would have been excellent.

reviews.review_title: My home, my family at heart
reviews.review_text: After my 5th stay at this hotel I only think about booking my 6th stay. The hotel is still beautiful on the outside, the gardeners do a great job...the environment is very soothing. Here everything is huge, so you never feel on top of each other. The restaurant offers a wide choice of dishes, grills, salads, desserts... just a few yogurts are missing at lunch and in the evening. The rooms are very spacious and very well equipped even if the weather starts to do its work, some elements would perhaps need to be renewed and some local decorative objects would be beautiful to immerse us totally in this country. For a 5* it really lacks a wellness area offering various massages or even a hairdressing corner. The immense plus, and most important for me, of this hotel is the staff, that I love them these people! they always take care of me, they pamper me from the first to the last day. This is my second home and my second family. Many thanks to the whole team and especially to Cherif, Nizar, Marwen and Faiten at the reception, Amel, Abnour and Osama at the restaurant, Leilà for the room, Djamel, Sem and Sabre at the pool and the beach....they do a great job very professional, they always have a smile, they are of an extreme kindness, they anticipate the needs of customers and they have their hearts on hand. Here is my oxygen bubble, I feel wonderfully good. I can't wait to see you again and get my gold bracelet with my loyalty card:-)

I originally left this review 3 days ago and wrote it while sitting in reception of hotel. In that review I criticised senior management and the food served within the restaurant, also criticised other areas. Early evening on day I reviewed hotel, we were in our room when we got a phone call inviting us to a meeting with the Manager/ Director of hotel. We sat in his office for 30 minutes where he took notes of all our grievances and promised things would change. To be fair to the Manager he only took up his position 6 days ago.  In the 3 days since original review, we have seen a huge difference in lots of areas, there are more waiters round pool area and service is now excellent, no waiting for over an hour to get a drink.  The food has improved with more variety, it is not perfect but it is definitely a lot better and continues to improve, keep up the good work and improving.  This hotel has some amazing hard working staff, who are very friendly and always welcome you with a warm smile. Hopefully the new management will continue to support the staff and keep improving things.  Finally, I just want to say, that my review was genuinely how I felt at the time, the hotel picked up on it and reacted positively by reaching out and listening to our concerns then decided to do something about it. They have turned a negative into a positive within 3 days.

Very amazed at the super positive comments (fake?) Almost non-existent service, repetitive meals, little choice and no generosity (no local dishes, couscous boils down to semolina plus dry chicken), no butter, no ice cream for the children .. The list goes on! Laborious supply for everything. Identical for room maintenance and towel renewal. 1st bedroom, smells of sewers, second room given super dirty, had to request a cleaning that was most summary. Communication is difficult. Otherwise the hotel is beautiful, the beach is beautiful and allows for long walks.

Had a great time at this hotel. The rooms were kept clean at all times and very spacious. The staff were very attentive and always happy to help. The bar staff were friendly and helpful at all times. Would happily recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Hammamet

The hotel is lovely, spacious and very clean. The staff are very attentive and cannot do enough for you. Rooms are huge and lovely with comfortable bed and pillows which were cleaned daily. There is a lovely sandy beach on the doorstep with camels and horses walking along for rides if wanted, along with jetskis. The 24 hour bar was lovely and relaxing but for more family entertainment then to go to the sister hotel next door where a full animation team worked hard to amuse everyone day and night. The pool was lovely but unfortunately too cold to use as the weather was unusually mixed, but the heated indoor pool was a godsend. Thank you for a lovely stay!

reviews.review_title: We've already come, we'll be back, for sure!!
reviews.review_text: Beautiful rooms, super king size beds 2.50 x 2.50 approx! At the restaurant a staff with little care:  USAMA (...filled the glasses as soon as they are empty)  CHYMNIA and TEDEA (...do everything to satisfy you). Citrus Golf 2x18 holes 5mn.

The hotel is very nice, clean and big, with a beautiful view of the beach, the animators always have very good activities to participate in such as archery and darts, The restaurant had a variety of different cuisines too choose from, also a food truck to go to next to the pool if you get hungry during the day, the staff are very friendly, enthusiastic and kind, every evening there’s entertainment on such as karaoke, quizzes, and a magic show, this is a very nice hotel too stay at and i have had a great time.

reviews.review_title: the best hotel in my last 10 years is here!
reviews.review_text: Excellent services, Tunisian specialities with every meal  infrastructure and sumptuous garden, luxury! super clean hotel friendly and welcoming staff. Housekeeping: no complaints the hotel is running at less than 10% of its capacity, so it is empty (did the Ramadan period scare tourists?), so we are extremely pampered! There are two small comments, though: 1° hammam and sauna not hot enough (incidentally on the 4* beach orange trees nearby, it was the same,  2° to enjoy the entertainment why not post a program in the 5* for sports or evening services of the 4*? which would avoid having to leave the hotel, iron the gates, take a piece of road then enter the second hotel again, this being not practical we could not see what the animators were doing in the evening. The heated indoor pool is certainly more pleasant to 4* (sea view and it is less the oven than in ours, whose water is above 34 °!)  At this time of Ramadan, businesses are closing earlier than usual, which is the one and only drawback.  We took a few excursions: - Hammamet (the old medina): bof... let's say it's the real Tunisia! ....(not the universe of our 5*) - 10 dinars one way or return by taxi, we get a lot of seaweed! - Hammamet Yasmine: a nice clean medina, this one is worth a look (10 dinars one way or return by taxi) - Sidi Bou Said; not to be missed, by privatized taxi 50 euros the half day, a drink with coffees of delights: 2 teas with raw almonds and small piece of cake (12 euros), a good memory! and not excessive. - Nabeul market on Friday morning by privatized taxi 50 dinars: not to be missed, here we are in the authentic! -Show Sheherazade: great and worth it. Thank you all.  Cathy er Eric room 1204 from March 15 to 22, 2025. I will keep a very good memory of this hotel, and will not fail to praise it to colleagues and relatives!

A great experience at this hotel Matches our expectations for a Tunisian 5*, do not be too demanding, the standards are not the same.  Admittedly we feel the "low season" side because some schedules are not respected, the buffet is a little limited and some services uninsured (lunch outside the lunch, no snacks etc ...)  The staff is lovely contrary to what we could read. Special mention to Lamia and the gentleman of the evening shift who pampered us.  Our room was very nice.  The hotel is sublime and promises a heavenly setting for a beautiful holiday

A real disaster this hotel 5*, room of 43 m2 (but which was 30 m2) with extra bed stuck in the curtains at the foot of the double bed , dilapidated bathroom, broken marble, Cable of the hair dryer near the bathtub (very dangerous with a child) , shower wall not waterproof, flow broken bathtub, toilet not separated . damaged mirror .    Service almost non-existent in February and limited buffet. No ice cream, no dates, no fresh mint, no snacks between lunch and dinner. Pool bar closed already before time. Oven off and no pizza for the little one, no cream for on pasta.No table set outside at lunch, forced to eat inside. We tried to have a Mojito in the evening but since it didn't have mint, we couldn't drink one.   Staff at the reception unpleasant. The agency had confirmed that we could enjoy the 4* which is part of the same The Orangers directrion but we were kindly sworn in as it was impossible to have meals in this hotel where we could eat out near the beach.  The PVC slats in the hotel aisles were broken and we could have hurt ourselves.  Access to the panoramic terrace by the beach was not prohibited while slats were missing on the access steps. No mattresses on the beach. It's like the hotel is still closed. It is better to take the 4* hotel cheaper and offers more services than the 5*.  Agencies have no knowledge of the change in the management of the hotel which was taken over by the son and this hotel has lost its prestige from a 5*

It is not possible that this property has 5 stars Rooms poorly soundproofed bedding (i.e. ergonomic and comfortable) a horror for the back  The very limited and repetitive buffet Hamam does operate fitness room with equipment that is old and noisy  As for the staff very few are pleasant with forced hellos A holiday where you are bored

It was a really nice holiday ! Lots of food, very nice well maintained facility!  Great animation program and nice evening shows !
