The room is spacious, and has plenty of storage space. The gym on the upper level beautifully overlooks the Tunis skyline and has one multi-purpose / multi-functional machine, free weights, and few treadmills, elliptical and stationary bicycle. We tried both the L'Onzième Grill and Lounge; the food and service was amazing. There was even a great house music DJ playing that night. The hotel is conveniently located less than 10 minutes from the airport. If you are looking to sight-see, then it is a bit further away from the Medina and Downtown Tunis. The area around this hotel is predominantly business and commercial. Overall, this hotel is a great choice if you need to be close to the airport.

reviews.review_title: My stay started off poorly, but got better.
reviews.review_text: As a Titanium Bonvoy member, my request for a quiet room was completely ignored.  I arrived after 23:00 to check in and was placed in a 6th floor room facing the busy highway.  Vehicle noise made it so I didn't get much sleep the first night.  Also, there was a welcome plate of sweets and a note, but the note was addressed to someone, and not me.    The next day I requested they move me to the other side of the building, and they put me in a quiet room on the 9th floor, which was much better and I was able to sleep peacefully the last four nights of my stay.  Free breakfast in the restaurant was a nice benefit for Titanium members.  There were a variety of tasty Tunisian dishes.  The gym had new equipment and was good.  The M Lounge was nice, with great attendants at happy hour who are happy to bring you wine or beer.  The daytime front desk staff were friendly and helpful.    I would have rated this hotel 5 stars if they hadn't ignored my request and put me in a noisy room my first night, causing me to not get much sleep and to be extremely tired the next day.

I stayed there for the 3rd time, always living up to expectations and more. What a very good stay in a very good hotel would be without excellent Staff and professional excrement, available and smiling, from the entrance to the reception, passing by the restaurant team (breakfast) especially Mrs Abir and Mr ALLALA, not to mention WAW for the Room Service Staff. Good luck with it.

Wonderful hotel and staff, and a perfect stay at this well-operated property. The customer service at this property was especially top notch, making an already comfortable stay that much better!  All throughout the stay, all the front desk receptionists made me feel extremely welcome - special thanks to Amal, Hiba, Aziz, and all the others at the front desk/guest relations team members (wasn’t able to get all the names). The housekeeping team was also absolutely phenomenal in their service throughout our stay, especially Khulood and her team - a really sharp and talented housekeeping team!  Thank you Tunis Marriott team for a wonderful stay - this Titanium Elite is beyond satisfied!

Being a Lifetime Titanium member with over 2200 nights at Marriott properties, we really were looking forward to a 5 night stay at this property but unfortunately we were very disappointed.  From the chaotic breakfast dining every morning to the lack of service in the concierge lounge and lastly while the room was nice, there were 3 days out of 5 where the only water available was hot water and no cold water while trying to shower.  Let's start with the breakfast.  We had breakfast for 5 mornings so this was not an isolated incident.  It was chaotic.  Frequently, they ran out of cups for coffee and hot tea.  The staff could not keep up with cleaning the tables when it was crowded.  Staff would walk around aimlessly or stand in the corner talking to one another.  I use cleaning loosely because I seldom saw people wiping down the tables after someone left.  Tables would be in various states when we arrived, sometimes a fork was missing or a knife or a glass.  There is a juice station but good luck trying find someone to make you fresh juice.  The door was sometimes left open and then you were surrounded by flies.  Most mornings I would just watch and observe the chaos of the staff walking around trying to keep up with the people coming thru.  It isn't rocket science - you go to a vacated table, put all the dirty items on a tray, wipe the table, come back to the table with the clean items.  The Concierge Lounge - we came here for 5 nights.  Every night it was pretty much the same hot item - dry chicken.  You can get beer and wine but not on your own.  They don't keep the beer opener out in the open.  However, good luck with trying to find someone to open it for you.  Expect a long wait.  One night, we came in, sat down at a table and people would see us and walk back and forth.  Back and forth, including 2 guys in suits (assuming manager) and seeing us at a table without any drinks, didn't ask - can I get you something?  Nope.  Just sitting there waiting for you to serve me a drink.  We ordered a pizza to be delivered to the lounge, fully expecting to pay for it.  Manager comes over and says, we are getting you the pizza.  Sure, seemed weird.  Pizza comes, they put it in the common area for everyone.  I said, we ordered that pizza.  They said yes, you don't need to pay for it.  OK so can I have the whole thing?  The Room - while the room itself was nice, 3 days out of 5, the only water that came out was hot, including the shower.  So when shower, expect 3rd degree burns.  I called and talked to the front desk - had MULTIPLE discussions.  They said they would send someone up the 1st time.  No one came.  Water was fine after a period of time.  Next day, I walked down to the Front Desk so I could speak with a person.  I said, is this happening in other rooms because I was willing to move.  No answer, I assume that person did not know.  They said they would send someone up.  That person came after an hour and it was no longer an issue.  I asked if this is happening in all the rooms, he responded he didn't speak much english.  I sent all of this information to Marriott and what did they do?  Give me 15,000 measly points.  I'm not sure if there is a better alternative to stay, it is Tunis after all but most likely I will not be returning to the hotel.

I had a fantastic stay at the Tunis Marriott Hotel everything was perfect, from the delicious food at the restaurant to the exceptional hospitality. The staff were friendly and welcoming, A special thanks to Amal from guest relations, who went above and beyond to ensure my stay was amazing. I highly recommend this hotel.

Great place worth the experience and very excellent service in M Club Their service is better than great, the food is beautiful and special, and M Club has serenity, convenience, match screens, and many benefits  A special thanks to Miss Hope. They have a very nice eleventh-tier restaurant, pool, and beautiful view. The hotel''s location is even better than the airport.

The services are excellent  Excellent residence  Overall cleanliness is excellent  Everyone’s attention to customer treatment is so professional  The professors are sure to welcome  The hotel''s restaurant needs a development in the variety of cuisines  Much depends on the quality of the frequent meals and the quality of the ordinary food that doesn’t match a hotel inthis place

4 nights , chosen hotel x location between airport and work (Ariana). Room on the 6th floor, N8 side, only drawback the soundproofing despite not being on the ground floor the traffic can be heard.  On the other hand, the position has its downsides. The windows, which cannot be opened even to vasistas, although new, could be better. Of the 2 restaurants tried , to prefer the Onzieme, with 130 TND only food is ok. Parking = not used. Breakfast = not included in the room , available only separately, buffet x TND 65.

We left the Tanit spa a first: it was perfect from A to Z, the welcome was smiling and friendly, the place was very clean, the massage is great. A real moment of relaxation. Thank you very much to the whole team. We consider it the best spa in Tunis , we will come back!  Raimbault

I had the opportunity to test the Marriott Pension Tanit Spa on my sister’s wedding, and the experience exceeded all my expectations. The welcome was very warm, especially thanks to Madame Emna, the manager, who ensured that every detail was perfect. His dedication to his work is remarkable.  We started with a hammam scrub, followed by an exceptional massage. I want to thank the whole team for their professionalism and kindness, they really made our day unforgettable.  I assure you that this is the best spa in Tunis (having already tested more than half of the spas in the city, this one exceeds all my expectations). If you are looking for excellence, I strongly advise you to live this experience. A real 5 star.  Many thanks also to the brunch team at the Eleventh restaurant: impeccable service and delicious dishes.  Congratulations to Mariott Pension, I will come back very soon!

The hammam is just splendid, local, team and services everything is excellent. I especially thank Emnah the hammam manager, who organized everything down to the detail for my wedding hammam, kaouther for the scrub and the girls for the massage. Thank you for making this experience unforgettable. I will probably come back to it

The commitment, accuracy, good airport reception, pleasant appearance and commitment to the reception at the hotel by Miss Hope by adding the cleanliness of the room, the variety of food, the well-arranged meeting room, the good hospitality of the guests and the hotel all park the studio, the hotel and especially Miss Hope management.

Beautiful stay at Marriott hotel, great stuff spatially Amal the guest relations manager at the Club and the reception, room is clean, the food is delicious, I highly recommend Marriott Tunis Hotel .the airport is close to hotel 5 min by car, all is perfect

Great experiences in different services such as the restaurants, M lounge (thanks Amel and all other staff in the lounge), receptions, and cafe, etc. Housekeeping staff are also professionals!! I cannot speak French but I did not face any difficulty in communications with the hotel staff.

Pension that you all comidite and available to ropos and to deal what business that outclassed you and any very close convenience for man business that speaks to Pension any team present who work from the bottom of the heart.rooms.raustraustion and thanks the President and CEO and the unbeatable Award other five star Pension I advised them to think all to visit the country Tunisia for business and tourism and family

Had a lovely peaceful time here. Room was lovely and cleaned every day. Ok decor is tired but I don’t go on holiday for Art Deco. I am a very fussy eater and had more or less the same everyday but that is down to me, not hotel. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Cannot comment on animation as did not really meet them but enjoyed evening entertainment.  Have just booked to go back in October 😊

Food is extremely bad I don't know how to further describe this but the food is so bad. I had dinner breakfast and lunch there. The server was rude they cut my boyfriend off several times when he was was asking about the opening times. Fake cheese  again, seems to be be a mouradi thing

We booked a room with breakfast online, as we were not yet sure if we want to use the half board. According to the website, half board would have cost only €9 more – so we thought we could book dinner spontaneously if necessary. Unfortunately, the hotel has charged us an incredible €45 – five times! This is absolutely unjustified and a clear rip-off for us. There was no response at all to our request to adjust the booking accordingly or at least to find a fair solution.  Unfortunately, the hotel also leaves much to be desired: Cleanliness was poor, especially the pool – sandy and unkempt. Overall very disappointing. For us this was the first and last stay.

I highly recommend this  Hotel  The food is delicious  Spacious rooms with and without own balcony  Very nice reception very nice to see A large swimming pool surrounded by a terace  The Soltan bar and the traditional original Maure cafés

An old and abandoned hotel, filthy with slow and unwilling personnel was offered from our tour operator for an one night stay. It’s far and isolated from every town and you need a car or a cab to reach civilization, not that they have to offer something better.  Anyways the offered dinner buffet was quite good but breakfast was a disappointment. Our room 220 was spacious, because was a four bedroom instead of two that we were, little amenities old style blankets with small pillows and filthy towels and sheets. The worn carpet completed the scenery. A pleasant note was the bar in the first floor run by a happy and entertaining bartender with very good drinks.

reviews.review_title: Chain disappointment El Mouradi in Tunisia
reviews.review_text: Today I came back to my beloved hotel chain..say that four stars.More depressing than the previous two.Refrigerator room does not work.Air conditioning very noisy.Welcome water lol...gentlemen worth a few cents, do not be scary..Bathrooms with rusty taps.Floor carpeted rooms deteriorated vo mo all the hotels in this chain.Here at the entrance have a nice dome..but it has nothing to do with the skin of the rooms.You have to carry gps to reach them and carry flashlight.No light in the corridors.Here to access the rooms already give you magnetic card (they modernized a little)

Desert Hotel and basic hotel. We stayed this hotel just over night. The pillow were small and thin. They still use old fashion blanket not duvet.  There is a fridge in the room but no water. (Hotel room in the desert a fridge without complimentary water???). No lighting in the corridor when you came out from lift to your room  Walking in dark is danger!!! The furniture is out of date. The safety box was broken. Thank goodness we only stayed there one night (few hours) because we get up early. The

Excellent stay  Very pleasant setting  A large charming swimming pool two heated and outdoor pools  The restaurant is very delicious   I highly recommend this hotel mouradi douz  Value for money correct  The best is twelve

Incompetent staff, especially the lady at the front desk Poor cleaning, the toilet smells urine Indoor pool not heated, the hotel refused to turn the heat on Poor reactivity from the staff Bad experience, I do not recommend  Hotel to be avoided

reviews.review_title: To be modernized and thoroughly cleaned
reviews.review_text: Quite an old structure, which could also be secondary if there had been cleaning. But the dirt in the rooms and especially the sheets and towels can not be described.  We slept with clothes and dried ourselves with paper towels. Average food

reviews.review_title: Very nice hotel I will return
reviews.review_text: Very nice hotel, clean, very friendly staff, a great choice at the buffet and good. The suite is very spacious thank you m. Gaddour! The pool is big. The Moorish café , quiet place after the evening meal. I'd be happy to come back,

reviews.review_title: the structure is average but the staff is not
reviews.review_text: the structure is quite old and would need some renovation and also greater attention to cleanliness the restaurant was mediocre for both dinner and breakfast especially if compared to the Touzer structure of the same chain but the worst part was the staff who treated us with obvious detachment and sufficiency until they allowed themselves to fool us on the subject of indoor pool. Since the presence of this service was known on the hotel's website, we asked the receptionist who was very annoyed but indicated where the pool was. Arrived in front of the entrance we found it closed with a deadbolt despite being fully functional. We asked for clarification and we were not given any answer except that of an orderly who tried to call the attendants to activate the service but received no answer. The receptionist didn't give a damn and let us know not to insist. If you like indoor pools don't go.

The lobby looks good, but kind of dark. Minimum lights turned on.The pool area was nice. The room was a different story. Definitely needs updating. The heater barely worked. The food served in their restaurant was cold. I don't think I could have stayed here more than overnight.
A discovery for me  The best hotel in Douz Catering is good spacious hotel room  Nice personal reception of warm welcoming hotel  Nice stay at the hotel I highly recommend for this summer period

The best hotel a douz  The rooms are spacious  Qualified hotel staff smiling nice with all guests  A good atmosphere at the Moorish cafe with Ridha indoor pool top of the top  I highly recommend this product the best to this region

One night spent in this hotel on a trip to the South. Hotel with beautiful architectural potential, but very aging and little maintained. The cleanliness of the room is to be reviewed, dirty carpet, antique furniture, bed linen idem. Very average buffet. Indoor swimming pool offline. Outdoor swimming pool that deteriorates. In short for one night it is fair but no more.

just one night spent on a 2-day outing .. many tourists passing through I think during raids in the desert. Not long enough for us to judge this Mouradi. just to report room and very large bed we slept very well there.

The hotel is hard to get old. The equipment is so old, musty and partly also tainted with mold. Due to age alone, cleaners no longer have a chance to prepare a pleasant stay. Wi-Fi is only available in the hotel lobby and the staff is not particularly eager. We slept on the bed dressed. At best, 3 stars with a tendency to 2 stars are attached here.  What was seh positive were dinner and breakfast, both were fine.

Excellent service, kindness, diligence and care with guests. Such an impressive care in detail as the commitment of all the employees I dealt with to make you feel pampered. An example for this chain.

We were passing through Tunisia and fortunately only spent one night in the hotel. The hotel is very old overall. On the beds lie wool blankets as sheets -very unhygienic. The food was poor. The tablecloths from the night before were still on the tables at breakfast in the morning. The hotel employee was supposed to deliberately misappropriate us when paying tourist tax. The restaurant also cheated with the drinks and the money return. Wi-Fi is only accessible in the lobby. Also for the country Tunisia never worth 4 stars.

Clean and personal hotel with little care. The only problem was the bedding. The mattresses were "dead" and worn out. You could feel the springs, so you couldn't sleep.  The bedspreads were old. For a 3 star, we were a little disappointed anyway.

Bathroom is very old and so is the heating system. Showering gets quite complicated.  Staff is NOT great, part from one lady working at reception. First guy at check in was completely unhelpful giving instructions and info on hotel and town. Then we asked for one shampoo and had to wait about 45 mins to then get a shower gel instead. Eventually at breakfast the waiter was EXTREMELY RUDE and made us feel very uncomfortable. We wanted to finish our sandwich in the car as the driver arrived and in front of other hotel guests sitting in the restaurant he screamed at us treating us like criminal and forcing us to sit down to finish it. In my entire life I’ve never experience such an uncomfortable situation and nobody has ever spoken to me like this. We were two young girls on a visit in Tunis and the fact that a man shouted in this was chasing us to the door entrance is something I really do not want to experience anymore. So if you are a group of girls traveling you might want to think twice before booking because there is a VERY STRONG misogynist component here.  Only the lady at the reception was able to understand us and offered later on a snack box but this does not excuse the lack of respect. Thankfully we only stayed one night.

reviews.review_title: Great value for money, ideal location
reviews.review_text: This hotel was a positive surprise. I had booked it mainly for its central location and didn't expect much. However, the staff were amazing, really lovely, all of them, even the security guy. My room was spacious and clean, nice bathroom, too. The breakfast buffet was big and offered a lot of choice.  The only thing that was missing was a view, but what can you expect in the center of town?

Oussama at the reception is a world class receptionist, very genuine and attentive.  Thank you Oussama for all the help if I come back someday it's because of your hospitality.  Hotel is well located and comparing to the price it is a good hotel if you want to be near Hbib Bourgiba St

The staff were so friendly,  kind and welcoming. They could also speak multiple languages!   They had a security guard which made me feel safe as a solo traveller and the wifi worked great in both the bedrooms and downstairs.    The only thing I disliked was that there were no internal locks in the bedroom.

reviews.review_title: If you are looking for a hotel in Tunis, then Hotel El Oumara is the ideal choice.
reviews.review_text: Hotel very well located, Hotel in the city center with a warm welcome and high-end rooms, clean and quiet, friendly staff, reasonable price and I recommend it. And thank you 🙏 Oussema at the reception so If you are looking for a hotel in Tunis, then the Hotel El Oumara is the ideal choice. While staying at Hotel El Oumara, visit Monument to Ibn Khaldoun (0.7 km), a well-known Tunis attraction.  Free wifi is offered to guests, and rooms at Hotel El Oumara offer air conditioning.

Hotel in the city center with a warm welcome and high-end rooms. I had unforgettable days. And also a nostalgic hotel with various renovations. In addition it is a hotel close to all the tourist areas of Tunis, Carthage and Bardo museum, Sidi Bou Said and Lagoulette.

Renovated hotel well located in the city center near Avenue Habib Bourghuiba, clean and comfortable room, pleasant staff, varied buffet breakfast, good wifi connection, reasonable price. I really recommend it.

reviews.review_title: Pleasant stay and thank you to the whole team
reviews.review_text: Clean and quiet hotel in the city center, quiet, very decent breakfast, clean room, friendly staff, I was with my wife, I spent 3 nights I said hello especially to Ousama the receptionist as well as the maid for her kindness

Hello, I stayed in December for a few days, I wanted to thank you for your welcome, kindness, top level cleanliness, very clean, very generous breakfast. Hotel very well located close to everything I highly recommend it and I hope to see you very soon
Renovated hotel and very well located. Warm staff. WIFI is available with a good connection. Very clean comfortable room with very good air conditioning. Tasty breakfast.

Renovated hotel. Clean and comfortable room. The decoration corresponds to the photos on the site. The air conditioning works very well. The staff is pleasant, hearty breakfast. More than 30 TV channels I really recommend it. I will come back there for my next visit to Tunis.

I am checking out now from this hotel, I am really satisfied, I thank all the team for their pleasant services, the rooms are very clean and magnificent, the meals are delicious, the service is perfect, the receptionists welcomed us well and smiling. I recommend this hotel I had a great weekend here..

My flight with Tunisair got cancelled yesterday so I spent last night at Hotel el Oumara on behalf of Tunisair. It was a nice stay. The room was very clean, apparently this hotel just got renovated. The location is Downtown very close to the main station and just a few blocks away from the main avenue in Tunis. The staff was friendly and helpful. Dinner was good, breakfast was excellent. Just be careful with the Taxi Drivers.

reviews.review_title: Don't ever think in this hotel
reviews.review_text: this is my first time sleeping in this hotel, from It's prices I expected high quality rooms' instead rubbish room with mosquito flying around my head all the night. Don't use this hotel unless you'll be homeless !!!!!

Actually its not deserve 1 euro to stay in this hotel,  they should give me a money to stay with them,  the room light is cut 2 times a day and the receptionists never help  I hope no one fall in this trap

I don't have a lot of good to say about this hotel. I stayed there a few nights, found the staff friendly, but not at first. I took breakfast which was mediocre. The room as clean and quiet. The thing that put me off the most was the dirt on the street right in front of the hotel. If I was the owner or manager, I would pay someone to keep the street clean and dry. The immediate area is too dark at night and many drunks sloped around.

reviews.review_title: The worst and dirtiest hotel I have ever seen
reviews.review_text: The hotel is ranked 3 stars it should be one or none even. The blankets were dirty with spots on them still with some crusts. the drawers were broken, the french window doors were not closing properly and extremely. the curtains were not hung properly. one of the bedside lamps was not working same for the room lobby light. No phone service in the rooms (the telephone was there, all sticky but no tonality) the tv was not working (a small broken box was there with half of the buttons missing, and no single channel is there, let alone a remote)I can go on and on and on. And i swear i'm not exaggerating. One and only thing positive i could say about this hotel is how nice and helpful the reception people and all the hotel employees were and that I guess is true for all tunisian people in general. Internet wifi was free in the lobby area so at least that was there. I went through all the reviews and I was extremely surprised how people cld like this hotel, seriously !!! i was even angry coz i relied on those same reviews to accept such a transit hotel by tunisair. So either this hotel has reallly deteriorated since their reviews or its only lies or maybe we are speaking about a different hotel, coz the one and only el oumara at rue ali darghouth looks like to be an abandonned property. Please people be objective and honest in your reviews other are relying on them.

I had to stay in the hotel on behalf of Tunis LAir because of flights delay. The hotel is not bad at all but will never be my first choice. The rooms are OK and not more then that. The room was clean and enough towels,soap, shampoo (although you'll never are able to open the pouches with wet hands) where there. Breakfast was typical north African which means plenty of cake but no bread. Very strong coffee and 2 juices. Not my type of breakfast. Diner was included but not good. Simple... The location was very good in the centre of Tunis. The staff was very helpful and very very friendly. I must stipulate this.  Please be aware that there are two El Oumara hotels in Tunis.

About 7 blocks from Avenue Bourgiba (the main area) and close to the medina and the bus and train stations.  Helpful staff with many speaking English.  Could be cleaner and needs some updating.  Not a fancy hotel but excellent breakfast (included) - the best we had in all of Tunisia, decent sized rooms and parking (if necessary).  I'd rate it slightly higher than average but not above average.

Rooms are very comfortable, animators are very kind and they are smiling all the time, everyone are here friendly, team animation very funny we have fun with Mario ,team jumbo very niceee  The food I like it and the pool too very nice barmen , Nice weekend

I had a very unpleasant experience at this hotel. The room was far from clean and shockingly unprofessional—there were insects in the room, which is completely unacceptable. There was also no laundry service available, which added to the overall inconvenience of the stay.  The level of service and cleanliness was far below what anyone should expect from a hotel. Sadly, this has been one of the worst hotel experiences I’ve ever had. I do not recommend staying here

No understanding of gluten free in the kitchen. They bought organic pasta for my partner saying it was gf. They bought him almond milk. We said he’s ok with cows milk. No concept at all. We even had a card in Arabic to show them which explained the need for gf food.

I stayed at the Rosa Beach Monastir Hotel as part of a seminar. Unfortunately, the experience was half-hearted. The condition of the rooms was very average, especially in terms of health, which is regrettable for an establishment hosting professional events. The staff did not show a particularly warm or attentive welcome, which undermines the overall atmosphere. On the other hand, the food was correct, with varied and well prepared meals. The hotel would benefit from improving the quality of its services and the professionalism of its team to better meet the expectations of guests, especially during such events.

Warm welcome the Personal listens. Room very clean varied meal  Thalassotherapy at Top personal very pleasant manuals  Not to mention the Club at the Top  I will go back with Pleasure I recommend   Everything available  Not to mention the private beach and large swimming pool Top top

Very warm welcome, the team is always listening. The beef is quite varied and very delicious. In short we had a pleasant stay.A special greeting to The star Amine who tireless and full of energy.without forgetting the DJ with his well chosen tracks.

The hotel Very wandfol and Luke Very clining IS wandfil hotel bar Good and eatong Very Good IS like wandfol and wandfol pláče  qnd like the beatch wandfol and animateur super reálný alll days IS samililling and happy many aktivitě  amine wandfol animateur

I stayed a few days, level used they are very kind and endearing. The food, on the other hand, is of average quality, but fair. And unfortunately the rooms are not up to a 4th star.  There are services that should not be paid like ironing or other , but here I am claimed pennies

The hotel very nice eats it well is well the animation very nice is smile always the sea well is the whole activity always well if a very good hotel so first time the hotel very nice is really is the room clean very nice all in the hotel is the bar very really

So hotel Rosa batch is very cleaning the beatch and the food is amazing and like is very wandfol place and the stuff good and the bar good and fast is very good hotel and the room cleaning and         Food good and wandfol animation wandfol and happy and smiling all the time

The hotel is super nice. All very friendly. All clean and super delicious food.  Thank you for the great entertainment of amine.  It is highly recommended.  We would definitely come back. My daughter became friendly and attentive here

Very nice hotel, we got big room with sea view, they are cleaning the room everyday, restaurant and food is delicious. Animator team is fantastic!yoyo,mano ,saif ,momo, mez, chef hamdi are the best<33 I recommend you to visit this hotel and you’ll have pleasant stay

We stayed 1 week with family, it was great! All the staff is lovely, the menus diverse and good, the animation efficient and dynamic , the hotel is always clean and the spa treatments are top! The week was too short!!!! The Tunisians are very welcoming and warm! Thank you!
The hosts and staff are very welcoming and warm. The hotel is very nice. The hotel rooms are spacious and comfortable, the restaurant is diverse. Several activities and excursions offered.

The room is large spacious with a very nice view of the pool.  Amine, the host and all the staff are very friendly and the food is very good!  Accessibility to the beach is very easy. The sea is very pretty.

A magnificent hotel, with a team always at your service. The animation team animated by Amine / Mazen always smiling!  The hotel has a spa/massage/indoor pool. Several activities are offered, quad/camel ride/pirate boat...  One activity / evening.   Thank you again for this experience!

This hotel hotel is very good and wandeful its very cleaning is very good and amazing and the beacth its cleaning and food is very delicious and the room is very  cleaning the bar is good  and amazing and animation and animateur is good mazen and amine is very smiling and like the chef animation hamdi very good and wandfol is smiling allwys  and dj and ans saif wandfol holiday ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️

Nice hotel , full of activities like quad biking, camels , diving , catamaran super interesting to do . Friendly and professional staff. (Amine, Ziko and the others...). Miscellaneous meals and good. Clean rooms with balcony. I'll be back.

Great personal welcome very kind! Complete and quality buffet a spa so inexpensive and yet most pleasant with very soft massages. The beautiful pool. Animation all day the team often invites you to participate. Very comfortable bedding the room deserves a little bit of expense but it does the job! The plugs are sometimes far from the bed though... in short a very good special stay dedication to Muhammed amine

So I think the rooms are very good and the food is just great, The team of animation are great, amine is also great and generally the staff are Very nice, The lobby is very nice, many seating options, The pool is great, you get from the hotel very good everywhere, it's all nice and clean, so I like it

A pleasant surprise. Attentive, warm and extremely kind staff. Many thanks to you all. For the animation, a "magnificent" team as Mirou and his pair Tigana say so well. A big THANK YOU to you. I spent a wonderful week laughing. Once again, a big THANK YOU to all of you.

A wonderful and friendly hotel , very welcoming staff and unparalleled kindness , and team is very helpful . The team of young animators Mirou and Tigana is very friendly and warm.  I had a great time.  Thank you very much. I'll be back...

Arriving at the hotel on the day of reopening (after being closed all winter), we were welcomed like princes! Although not all services were operational, all staff did their utmost. We ate extremely well, fresh and varied products. Special mention to the great animators Mirou and Tigana who took admirably good care of our children (11 and 13 years old) and us!

That was great. Have a nice stay. We eat very well there. Various buffet. The animators are kind at the top. The staff is also great. Hasten the next holiday in zarsis in Zéphir. There's a lot to do with the camel quad. Horse. You can go to the city center by carriage also

I recommend it is a very nice hotel cleanliness nothing wrong with a team with little care there very spacious triple room there very nice bedding there is a well provided buffet there for all tastes my sisters and I had a great stay again thanks to the animators Amirou and Tiguana I really liked their spontaneity and especially the Latin evening 😉

This is the first time for us in ZARZIS with my two sisters we are Tunisian and it was an experience that was just beautiful , the hotel is clean the rooms clean more than it needs , the staff is too kind and professional, the animators too kind and professional , the waiters of the restaurant available and responsive, the meals are majestic, tasty and above all too good . The thermal indoor pool with its too relaxing Jacuzzi, the large outdoor pool with these oases a splendid and relaxing view. The private beach has 1 minute we were lucky to have the good weather. We will return it is certain thank you to the whole team and especially to the animators MIROU and TIGANA for this crazy atmosphere. Thank you.

Air conditioning does not work we are disturbed in the morning by the housekeeper even if the poster is not disturbed she still stays HORRIBLE serious food to AVOID the director does not give a damn and I managed to get the holidaymakers who came to take their reservations on site and all his in front of the director

Nice stay!! Various cuisine for all .. a little more fruit would have been welcome .. really nice staff and always attentive (flowers on the tables, nicely placed towels on the bed, smiles...) Only downside the air conditioning does not work in the rooms and it is really very hot especially on the ground floor .. the young animators (Mirou, Amine, Kimo) are on top of the top!! D an incredible kindness and always in equal mood.. always ready to help!! Really great!!!  In short, a week of vacation filled with beautiful memories. To do again without hesitation!!!  Chrystelle Steph Nadia Pascal et Eric

reviews.review_title: Great place with the best people 😊
reviews.review_text: I was there for 2 weeks and I fell in love with this place! Very nice to take a break and relax. Beautiful nature around the hotel, great swimming pool, beautiful beach and sea just few steps from the hotel.  But the best part are the people in there! I felt very safe. They were smiling all the time to begin with reception manager and cleaning ladies. I've never met so many nice people! Animators were great, so positive and so kind ♥️ There was activities like aqua gym, archery, darts, volleyball, dancing, show every evening and many other. You don't have to leave a hotel because there was also few shops in there. I agree with others that this is 3* hotel, for sure not 4. It needs good renovation. But it is spacious, clean and I saw that whole staff was doing their best. My special thanks to Animators: Miro- the sweetest young man I've ever met, Amine who motivated me to go start to work out again, Mario- best dancer 🫶 and Kimo, Tigana, Youssef, Tchitchou ❤️❤️❤️ Big THANKS to bartender Blaid Ayadi- very kind and good person ♥️ I'll go back there for sure just for this people and the atmosphere! 😊😊😊

Definitely not a 4-star as we hear in Europe. Room and bathroom very clean. Towels and soaps replaced daily. Clean pool but a Karcher hit on mattresses, hot and table would not be a luxury. A decent meal but you can't expect a bleeding steak! Big catch: no wifi in the rooms and only in the entrance hall for payment and especially more air conditioning from 1/10

Very nice staff Beautiful Inn very nice animations and I highly recommend Zephir Inn ♥️the beautiful beach the subways swimmers super the clean pool and beautiful food ♥️♥️ this is the first time I am here but I love everything ♥️♥️

reviews.review_title: Pension very family atmosphere by Pension manager restaurant very small lack of space damage
reviews.review_text: Pension Restaurant very small lack of space very low ceiling of the restaurant put the atmosphere very positive the chef of the restaurant and responsible for the Pension servers very professional and very pleasant listening it is always called faouzi a polite and kind word I go to Tunisia since 2008 I am never seen a restaurant chef of the other Pension so professional and respectful of customers and it is waiters impeccable service at the table thanks to the organization and supervision of faouzi chef of the Pension zephir restaurant spa zarzis again thank you I was not very well at dining at the Pension at the beginning and thanks to the good positive atmosphere and thanks to faouzi chef of the Pension restaurant I felt very well and I even extended my stay at this Pension  Room small damage

Top staff and very responsive very kind. Great pool and talaso. The beach and well warm water The flat the kitchen hyper repetitive day by day. And minimal fruit qualities more than ripe or not ripe. And we're not talking about fries... but the mash is good

I was there for 5 days. It wasn’t bad but I feel 3* is maximum I could give to this hotel. I feel like everything needs some renovation or at least deep cleaning. The staff was not really attentive, I felt quite…anonymous, if you know what I mean.  I had an impression French people were having the most attention and care from staff. During my 5 days stay there was at least one time when I went to a dinner and I could not find a place to sit, I was walking around with my plates and no one cared about this, even if the waiters saw me looking for a table.  Food was okay for me, most of it was quite tasty, I was not hungry. But margarine instead of butter... I’d expect more.  The real highlight of my day was melon served during lunch time - it was the best melon I’ve ate ever.  Room was okay, furniture could be newer, everything could be cleaner. But it wasn’t the worst.  The beach was nice but I feel like it was dirty, I’m not sure what was that but I think there was w lot of camel poop in the sand. Sunbeds should be changed for sure.  AC was working but it was not the strongest.  All in all, I’d like to come back to Tunisia but for sure I’d look for a better hotel.

Sadly I have very few good things to say about this hotel. A faulty door lock required us to ask for the management to open the door six times. It took the bellboy a little time to fiddle with the lock to enter each time.  He was pleasant despite accompanying us several times to unlock it.  Breakfast was ordinary to say the least- like a low budget hotel. I pitied the people with all inclusive meals.  I had one beer - it was flat! Paid wifi??  40 euro for a week - Seriously that deal died years ago.   The pool and the location were nice - the saving grace

Inn announced 4 stars but it is not so!! -the food is poor and not varied - the rooms are catastrophic whether it is mattresses or hygiene it is 0 not to mention the smell - no air conditioning  -the reception, no professionalism, they are not smiling or accommodating and arrogant!   Don't trust the reviews and rating, I'm not difficult but there... there's level.  And tripadvisor I don’t trust you anymore either it’s worth far from 4 stars. Rely on Google reviews.

reviews.review_title: Beautiful relaxing holiday and nice friendly stay
reviews.review_text: Very nice staff especially AZIS. The atmosphere very nice, very nice place with a superb pool. Very hot sea with different Water Things to do.  Too bad even food and drinks not always cold.  Dessert has to go as soon as we get to the restaurant or there's less choice.

Zarzis beautiful destination, a superb Pension with a beautiful pool, perfect restaurant and very friendly staff and especially an entertainment team at the TOP very lively day and evening. The beach next to the Pension which is appreciable

For my part, I don't understand the disastrous reviews with a Rating of 1/5 "to run away" that scared me before Check-out... We had a great family holiday and it would be quite possible that we would return to this Inn in the future!  First, you must remain objective you are in Tunisia not in France! A 4-star there is not a 4-star with us. Then you are on an all inclusive buffet at a reasonable Award so you necessarily have quite simple dishes.  However starting from these two points we enjoyed our meals, the buffet offers a lot of choices and almost homemade. The only downside comes not from the buffet or the staff but from tourists who take incredible amounts to make a lot of mess and who often cut the queue in front of those who wait.. Review for us: Inn clean, appreciable meal with superb surroundings, sea and pool view room, very spacious pool, friendly staff, lots of friendly meetings on and off site. I recommend the small shop of Mohamed and Sami both extremely honest and always available for a nice discussion purchase or not.  Leaving the Inn take the sidewalk in front and on the right "the Mediterranean" on google = Center of natural Tunisian Spices and "Tunisian Crafts". Of course, our review is up to us, it is obvious that everyone's feelings are not the same in our experience and expectations, as can be seen clearly from previous reviews. Nevertheless I take the time to write this review because for us this Inn certainly does not deserve the mention "to flee" and we hope it will reassure other people who may have been afraid to read some reviews like this may have been our case.

I think some 5-star reviews and rave reviews are fake and her people have never set foot in it. The only positive is the swimming pool and well maintained outdoors. Otherwise everything sucks, from very cold reception to Check-out without consideration. I will stop there in the comment, everything is said. I would not recommend it at all.

Wow! This word should capture your attention and the entire holiday impact upon us due to the STAFF. The staff are utterly incredible. Their warm, attentive, helpful, friendly, passionate and dedicated approach to their individual roles at the hotel is a compliment to everyone of them. All animation staff, waiters, cleaning team, bar staff and pool attendants. If your looking for the personal touch, wonderful and creative food with fabulous taste and creative displays, this hotel offers the lot. Accommodation, location to the beach, swimming pool which is like the blue Lagoon, DJ Simo :-) ......of my goodness, where to start and finish. For a true holiday experience, look no further than this hotel. You will not be disappointed at all. The animation team will turn strangers into friends, and that includes you becoming friends with the team. Book now, you will have regrets. Already about to rebook ourselves. Thank you

reviews.review_title: Great holiday and great experience amazing hotel ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
reviews.review_text: Absolutely amazing holiday ❤️ l will definitely back again. Animation team Simo doussa jiji mido nader and amine great, so friendly and funny 😁 Room service amazing. Bar staff great. People so friendly and happy.Love this place 😘😄😘🧡

The service is wonderful. Very good drinks and the service at the bar is very good and friendly. Animation  Mido Simo Doussa Nader Jiji and Amine the are amazing people. The restaurant and food is delicious. We love this place. We’ll came back here next year

The hotel is wonderful. The service is wonderful. Lots of attractions. The restaurant and food is excellent. The pool is clean with beautiful blue water. Very good drinks and the service at the bar is very good.  Beautiful beach with beautiful sand.

reviews.review_title: Amazing hotel, animation staff make your holiday!
reviews.review_text: Great hotel! We spent 11 nights here and can’t fault it, good food, clean rooms, wonderful staff, friendly atmosphere and the animation team are absolutely amazing and go above and beyond for guests, I’ve never been on a holiday and willingly chose to join in on entertainment but these guys make it so easy to get involved and make you feel welcome! Darts, french bowls, yoga, water polo, aqua aerobics, so many activities and the different shows they do in the evenings are brilliant too!   But a massive thank you to Simo, Amine, Doussa, Neder, Gigi and Midou for making our holiday so special! Can’t wait to come back with our baby!   Jamie & Nicole x

A small hotel catering to your every need. Room, food and overall accommodation cannot be faulted. Simo,  Amele and all the 'animation staff' did a wonderful job keeping the poolside guests amused and entertained all day and into the evening .  They went above and beyond. Thanks everyone.

This hotel is fantastic with lots of amazing staff who can’t do enough for you and I know you read that on lots of hotels but here it’s actually true and the hotel is not giant so you are not just another face in the crowd like most large 5 star hotels Iv stayed at, here it’s like Cheers everyone remembers your name from all the staff to people you meet, it’s great. The food in the main restaurant has a wide and It is a wide variety to choose from so everyone no matter what you are you can eat here and the beach snack bar/ restaurant you can book your a la carte or just have a delicious burger.  I must mention the staff on the beach who keep it clean and tidy for you and really can’t do enough for you like Tasnime who is a security guard on the beach but I watched him run into the sea and save a teenage boy who got into trouble and he got to the boy just as the boys head went under the water and as he got to the area the boys head went down he dived under the water for a few seconds and brought the boy back to the surface! Wow I witnessed a hero at work that day and I hope the hotel congratulated Tasnime on his heroic actions when the life guard was at the toilet and I’m not faulting the lifeguard because we all need to go and the beach was safe but as you know it only takes one second for things to go wrong so maybe they should have two lifeguards on the beach. Apart from that It was amazing to witness. 👏 So the staff will literally save your life if needed.  The Animation team like Gigi, Simo and Duda to mention just a few who entertain everyone around the pool from 9am until 11pm it’s a very long day for them doing what they do and I don’t think they get the credit they deserve for all the fantastic work they do. I must mention the fantastic housekeeping staff because they do such fantastic work cleaning your room on a daily basis and the lady who cleaned my room was a lovely lady who always greeted us with a smile saying hello and always left flowers on our bed. I spent 2 weeks there in May 2025 and Iv just book again to go back in October this year and I’m going to book 3 weeks next year. It really is that good and I’m a well traveled man of 51 years of age who has been on every continent on the planet. Book this hotel you will not regret it.

reviews.review_title: Second visit to the Royal Nozha hotel.
reviews.review_text: Our second visit to this wonderful hotel in two years, we were still impressed by all of the staff from the gardener up to the Manager, many who remembered us from last year.  There has been one or two changes which in our mind has spoilt the bar area, it is now like a sports bar, fine if you want to watch football 24/7.  The rooms are a little bit tired but are cleaned with the towels being replaced as necessary. The beds are comfortable but oh dear the  pillows ..... very lumpy they need replacing. The shower, which is very powerful, is over the bath which in itself isn't a problem but would be better off with walk in showers.  The dining room is very good because you are allocated a table which you keep for all of your stay, saves having to search for one.   The food wasn't as good as last year, not as much variety for the main course, lots of chicken (over cooked and dry), the meats were not carved just pulled apart and put on your plate.   Fresh fruit not as plentiful as last year.  In our mind the best meal of the day was breakfast, plenty of variety and omelettes to die for, cooked to perfection.  Waiting staff are very good no complaints at all.  Pool area always kept clean and there always seemed to be sun beds available even after people had put their towels out early.  The beach area is fantastic, with life guards and security in attendance, the security guard will take your towels and find you a sun bed.  The beach bar is a nice touch where you are served by friendly staff, nothing too much trouble for anyone.  Having mentioned the food quality it wouldn't stop us from revisiting as this is a first class hotel.

This hotel is small but very friendly lots of fun with mido and his animation team. Simo the dj is very naughty but fun. Gigi does kids club she’s very good with the children. A few more are Douza and amean all are excellent. Bar staff are lovely in fact everyone is fab from management to cleaners to kitchen staff they will all do their best to make your holiday special. I’ve been here twice now and will be coming back again. There was 10 in our party and all had an amazing time thank you all at Royal nozha see you again soon xxx

We had a very nice two weeks at Royal Nozha. First of all, I would like to mention that the staff are very cordial. We felt very welcome and they were always willing to help.   The atmosphere in the hotel is pleasant, it is a bit smaller which we like. The beach is beautiful, the rooms clean and we found the beach bar and the beach the nicest part to be.   If you like excursions or outings, there are several things to do such as an overnight stay or camel ride in the Sahara, visiting the medina of Hammamet, quad biking, boat trips etc.  We came to chill out so mainly did our own thing, but if you do like entertainment at the hotel there is the fun animation team from Mido who are always committed to making you feel at home. They make daily contact with the visitors making people feel like family of the hotel.   The food was good and varied enough, the service and cooks at the restaurant were very friendly and genuinely happy to see and greet you every time.  Of course there are always some aging and downsides to be found if you start paying attention to that, but we found it a very nice place. I have been to Tunisia before, and this hotel surpasses it in terms of experience. The hardworking, lovely and cordial people who work in this hotel make it an even better place than it already is in my opinion.  Thanks again for that!  Love from Marinka and Amber

Staff were excellent,  very attentive and couldn't do enough to make sure you had a enjoyable holiday.  Food.  There was always something for everyone,  but could be improved.  Entertainment team were excellent and around most of the day, if you wanted to join in activities. At night Entertainment was put on by the Entertainment team and guest acts

reviews.review_title: The best holiday ever! We will be back next year ❤️
reviews.review_text: This was the best holiday I have ever been on!   Me and my partner have just retuned after a 1 week stay at the royal nozha hotel in hammamet. We had the most amazing time.   All of the staff are super friendly and very helpful. We felt at home from the moment we arrived at the hotel to the second we left - we didn’t want to leave!   I’d like to give a special shout out to mido and his animation team for making our holiday experience so enjoyable, they ran activities throughout the day including: darts, bowls, table tennis and water sports  and had great shows and entertainment in the evening for all ages! They are the best team of people and made sure we always had something to do and were always checking in on us.   The food was very good, and the restaurant was a nice calm atmosphere, it was a buffet and had lots of choices for breakfast lunch and  dinner (I am a picky eater and there was always plenty options for me)   The a la carte meal which on coco beach (part of the hotel) was delicious - I have added a photo of the menu for this!   The rooms are clean and spacious too! We didn’t have any complaints - we went as a couple and had a gobble bed as well as 2 single beds in the room with a nice balcony.   Nothing is too much trouble for any of the staff!   There is a bowling alley down the stairs from the hotel - this does cost extra to use as it’s not affiliated with the hotel but it is very cheap! Ans a lot of fun - the animation tam held a bowling competition there on Tuesday and all the holiday makers had a blast!   Amazing hotel 1000/10 me and my partner have already booked to go back next year!

We had a great time at this hotel. Food and snacks good. Plenty of space by the pool and on the beach. Staff very frendly. The entertainment team were great, always helpful and organised lots of fun. Special thanks to Alaa, Mido, Nader and Amin. Highly recommended.

reviews.review_title: A Gem of a Hotel - So Good in so Many Ways
reviews.review_text: As with all hotels there a few niggles but these were overlooked because the 14 night stay here was simply fantastic. The hotel is clean, the staff are amazing, the rooms are comfortable and the quality of the food was far, far better than expected. My wife is coeliac and was well catered for but you can’t get gluten free bread in Tunisia so take some with you if possible. Sure, there were some nights I didn’t fancy most of the food on offer but I always found something good to eat. The pizzas are amazing. Our main waiter, Faycal (Faisal), was exceptional. The facilities are well run and amenable - Bars, pool etc…. The entertainment team are also great, not pushy and like a bit of light hearted fun. The staff in the main bar, brilliant and funny. They say you get what you pay for. With this hotel you get MORE than you pay for. So many guests have stayed here on multiple occasions and I can understand why. Ignore any negative reviews, as this hotel is brilliant. My wife and I travel regularly and this is one of the few hotels that we would seriously consider revisiting.

reviews.review_title: A little gem of a hotel
reviews.review_text: An absolutely fantastic hotel that look after you like family. This was our 4th trip to the Royal Nozha, we just love it here. Staff are amazing especially the animation team that go above and beyond to make you welcome and entertained without any much pressure. Food is generally typically all inclusive but the desserts are fantastic. They are really trying to upgrade the hotel this year and its just made it better there. My only thing is the night reception guy. Never gives you the correct exchange for your money and doesn’t issue a receipt. It wasnt a one off as he did it last year as well. The day reception guy is so helpful and genuinely lovely. There are too many staff that are fantastic to name individually. But the cleaner for room 3045 was amazing and all the little towel animals and flowers she left in our room made our stay extra special. Hopefully see you next year xx

Took my daughter for her 18th n we had such amazing holiday. The staff are so friendly n so helpful. On her birthday they set the table up and made her a cake. The rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. The pudding was so good. There is a beautiful beach with a great snack bar.

reviews.review_title: A really nice place to visit!
reviews.review_text: We've been here 3 times, and enjoyed it every time. The pool area gets really full, so we spent our time down at the beach, where there is a bar/cafe. Staff are very good, although I would count your change if you exchange money at reception! Food is excellent, with loads of choice and variety

The hotel is very clean and all the staff from the gardener to the manager are professional, polite and nothing is too much trouble. We were 3 friends visiting and we were disappointed with our room, so a quick visit to reception and the brilliant manager moved us to a pool view room at no extra charge. Brilliant service. You are allocated a table for the duration of your visit which is great and saves time searching for an empty table, your waiter will get to know what you like to drink and bring it over. I needed soya milk in the mornings and this was quickly arranged and then bought to me daily. Thank you. Security on the beach was great, it just stopped the sellers coming up to you, police patrol on quad bikes as well. The whole beach area from the bar, cocco beach are kept spotless. I recommend the pizzas, made to your request.. we didn’t really partake in the entertainment, choosing to sit in the bar talking. The only downside for us were the drinks. The cocktails were weak. Great if you drink wine, beer, gin and vodka, but it did not spoil the holiday.  We got a taxi to the market. 20 Dinar each way and worth a visit. Remember to barter as they like you to.  A tip. Change your Dinar BEFORE you go through security as we thought we could spend ours in duty free but had ours confiscated.  I would recommend this hotel and would visit again. Well done to all the staff

reviews.review_title: Great family holiday to Tunisia Royal Nohza
reviews.review_text: The hotel is clean the staff from the cleaners to the porters and the gardener are friendly and helpful. The bar staff and restaurant staff can't do enough to help you. The security on the beach keep you safe from the sellers on the beach bothering you.  The animation team Mido, Doussa, Simo, Naser, Gigi and Amine are friendly and welcoming. They work so hard to keep everyone entertained from first thing in the morning til last thing at night. The entertainment is great fun and suitable for everyone. These guys really do make your holiday. Nothing is too much trouble. They are funny and entertaining all through the holiday. We have been here 4 times and can't wait to come back next year.

Me and my family stayed here for a week as a little getaway. We had a great time! The animation team really made our stay 100x better especially Simo, Mido, and Nader.  Would love to come back and see them again! Entertainment is also really worth a watch too.

reviews.review_title: As Robinson experts... Djerba surprised us a lot!
reviews.review_text: For a long time we have visited two Robinson clubs every year. We feel very comfortable there... and our son much more. Our club, our home is the Robinson Esquinzo. We also liked other clubs like Pamfylia very much... and others – although also good (some we have even visited repeatedly) – are not quite as excellent... like Cala Serena.  This year, after our visit to Esquinzo for Carnival, we went to Djerba Bahiya for Easter... and from the first moment we realized how special this club is. It is very compact, which means that you can reach everything quickly and easily.  Let's start with the only point that could be improved: For a club with a lot of sports and a lot of guests washing their clothes, the washers and dryers should be industrial – like Cala Serena (or formerly Esquinzo – that should be improved there too). The duration of a wash cycle with normal machines is too long, and the three dryers stopped working just 13 days after the start of the season.  Positive? Everything else. Rooms are spacious and functional. The mattresses very comfortable and the sleep quality excellent. Café Maure is one of our favourite places to have an Arabic coffee (as good as Damascus or Aleppo) or a “thé à la menthe”. Very quiet... and especially beautiful on days with music. The pool is pleasant for a swim... but actually we used to swim on the beach every day – 400 meters south of the hotel. Wonderful water temperature. Speaking of sea: Mahoui (who we knew from Esquinzo) and his team are doing a great job. WellFit and the sauna are also top (Vady and Tomas are the sauna masters... but also Yannick did a very good job in one day). Fantastic work by Pepi – very professional and motivating. Anna leads the entire team with great competence.  At the pool bar, all staff are very attentive and friendly – they know what you like to drink after a short time. Even the evening parties at the pool bar are very atmospheric. The tennis courts are in very good condition. And they are made of sand – perfect for my knees. Our son participated in the tennis camp at Mirko, which was also of very high quality.  Dining room/restaurant: We really liked that the chef was present at the dinners – very friendly. The quality of the food was excellent, especially the variety of dishes served. In the dining room, one person made us especially happy – on the terrace, to the right of the entrance: Waiter Cupid. Excellent and very friendly.  And finally, the most important thing for us: Especially this year, when the Robs at the Esquinzo was not in his best shape in March, we would like to highlight the Robs in Djerba. A Robs group lives off the work of its leaders, and in this case Malin and Gianna did an excellent job. Our son was happy. The two of them got involved. Our son told us they were part of the group. Congratulations, Mahmud, for having such professional, friendly, sympathetic and dedicated staff as Malin and Gianna.  Clearly: Djerba Bahija is part of our Robinson Club podium. We will come back!

I spent a wonderful time at Robinson Djerba Bahia - it was perfect all around. The complex is very nice and clear, located on a wide sandy beach - ideal also for families with children. Special praise goes to the entire team on site. They are all in a great mood and highly motivated. The positive energy is really contagious. I would particularly like to highlight the guest relations Pauli, Steffi and Veronika, who really live their job and try to read the wishes from the lips of all guests. The food is very good to sensational - always fresh and varied. There is something for every taste. Very good also the barbecue in the beach restaurant (for a fee) a very special atmosphere. My highlight of the sundowner at Café Maure. Cool live music with delicious cocktails and nice conversations. The evening shows are on a high level and you can feel with how much passion and commitment the participants represent them. Compliment! As a repeat offender, all I can say is: I will definitely be back!!!

reviews.review_title: Very friendly staff nice that everything is within walking distance so quickly to reach great shows Mega Food
reviews.review_text: The restaurant on the beach is mega directly on the sea feast and enjoy almost always freshly fried fish great fruit and much more completely sufficient and the table wine was good for us and free ambience just fantastic also the yoga at the sea in the morning The rooms very nice and clean good cleaning everything available only the hairdryer is weak

We had a great stay.  Perfect room and very nice.  Super nice meals.  Very friendly staff and speak French.  Too bad for the animation (German), a very small effort would be welcome. The DJs set a very good atmosphere.  The shows are very beautiful. Very nice holiday. Thank you.

reviews.review_title: A great holiday for the whole family
reviews.review_text: We were warmly welcomed on arrival. The rooms were neat and well cleaned. The staff was always friendly. The F&B team always took perfect care of a great buffet and you were welcomed to the buffet every night. The children had their fun and the sports offer was top

reviews.review_title: Thank you Mahmut, thank you dear Robinson Djerba Bahia Team!
reviews.review_text: We are currently spending an absolute dream holiday at Robinson Djerba Bahia that exceeds our expectations in every respect. And as long-time Robinson vacationers, they are naturally very high. Since this is the most cost-effective club by the sea, we thought we might have to cut corners. All the more astonished we were that in many places we even see the club in front of others. Here the very special Robinson spirit still reigns (or again?).   Even our arrival was as we only know it “from before” and what Robinson always stood for. As soon as our (very old) taxi pulled up, several employees came laughing to greet us with a flag-waving and soft drink (with fresh mint and lemon). We briefly thought that two suitcases were missing and possibly had stopped at the airport. Thanks to the nimble staff, they were already standing in the pretty, typical hotel lobby in bright cream colours. You have to smile unconsciously when you enter them. Maybe it's also because you're lit up from all sides by the employees. At the reception everything was perfectly prepared. The check-in was relaxed and cheerful: Our room cards were already ready and the rooms (although just 12 o'clock at noon) were ready to move into. Speaking of rooms: we had read a lot about these before, but little good. All the bigger our surprise when we entered this (family room superior - two double rooms with connecting door with sea view). Everything bright, clean, new furniture, freshly painted. A handwritten greeting card from club boss Mahmut (thank you!). And then this incredible view outside. Sea “view” is almost an understatement. Because you don't just see it. It is literally tangible. The rooms are located directly on the white sandy beach. To wake up in the morning and immediately see the turquoise water: priceless.  Reaction from home to our first photos: “Wow! Are you in the Maldives? This is supported by the beautiful colour scheme throughout the club: white-blue or white-turquoise. The beach restaurant, the beach bar, the daybeds all look bright blue, Caribbean and welcoming here. And from all these places you are as close to the sea as we have ever experienced before. This is also great at lunchtime, when you enjoy your lunch in the beach restaurant and the waves reach almost to this one. Regardless of the fresh fish, the great salads and grilled dishes, every lunch will be a highlight.   In general, we found the food great. Rarely have we seen such elaborately decorated buffets at Robinson's. From breakfast to dinner: art objects “carved” from melons and pineapple, herbal ornaments, tomato-cucumber creations, carrot-zucchini flowers. A true feast for the eyes and palate. Breakfast is one of the best we've had at Robinson's so far, in our opinion. The table wine in white and rosé are really good to drink (which is not the case in all clubs). And we enjoy amazing Tunisian red wines from the wine list in the evening thanks to the great advice (including from Habib). Yesterday’s gala dinner was as much a culinary highlight for us as the gourmet menu in the specialty restaurant on Wednesday evening, when the great four-person team around Ahmid took care of the guests in a very special way. He asked us for our names and now always addresses us with them as soon as we meet him at the club. Overall, we are pampered and looked after by everyone in all restaurants and at every meal. That may sound exaggerated. But it actually feels like being a guest here is very special. The level (professionalism, friendliness, language skills, commitment, attention) of the employees is really remarkably high.   That is certainly also because Mahmut himself, as club boss, is exemplary every minute. We knew and liked him very much in Robinson Fleesensee. He learned Robinson «from the ground up», his talent was aptly recognised and promoted by the Robinson's own leadership programme. Our impression: This approach simply produces the best club bosses. Because they live the spirit of Robinson, know the quite special needs of Robsinson guests and at the same time understand those of employees at all levels. You used to be a bar employee or sports entertainer yourself, know what it means to be in the restaurant or on the show stage after a long day at work and what it takes to motivate each other in a team, yet still give everything. Here on Djerba Mahmut seems to be even more in his element than in Mecklenburg-Western Pomerania. Well, who can blame him? ;-) (no offense Fleesensee, we've been there over 30 times, but as I write this I'm looking at the beautiful sea, a cloudless sky, two camels and a mile-long white sand beach...). What Mahmut created here, how he built a young, dedicated team, is impressive. He shines, is always present, inspires guests and motivates employees. Great to watch as he gathers his department heads in a circle around him in the morning and addresses them. You can see them listening to him, respecting him and being proud to be part of this fantastic team.   Guests notice and celebrate. Standing at the bar, at the chessboard and when they applaud incredibly good dance shows in the theatre, after which the employees happily congratulate each other afterwards and lie in each other's arms. There is no question: there is a great atmosphere in this team. And that then also rubs off on the mood of the guests. If even we celebrate until midnight after the mega gala show, at the chessboard with brilliant live music (which is fortunately often found here!), then this testifies to the fact that both the atmosphere at the atmospherically lit pool and bar area, as well as the conversations with other exciting guests and nice employees, inspire us and make us forget time.   Because actually we are morning people, which you will find mainly in the many sports courses. What Anna has already set up at the start of the season as a Wellfit department manager is just as great as her dance performance with the great Thomas on stage Thursday night. Also the courses at Yannis and Heidi were absolutely top. Heidi is here right now as one of many external so-called experts, and she actually deserves the name, both in terms of her own fitness, expertise and her enthusiastic way of running classes.  We also have nothing against temporary offers, as there are some in the club right now (for example for creative crafts for children). These also bring variety and inspiration to a team and enable many and varied courses to be offered, especially during peak times.   Last but not least, I would like to mention something Mahmut emphasized in his small, moving speech after the gala show: many thanks to all the more than 400 employees - even to those you don't see as a guest so often: the gardeners, chefs, dishwashers, technicians, craftsmen, securities, beach chair pad bringers (always mega-nimble and so nice!) and of course maids (we had the very, very best!).   Shukran lak, sawf naeud. Thank you, dear ones, we will be back!

This time I was lucky enough to witness the club opening – the staff greeted us at the entrance with music and small delicacies so you immediately felt at home! The club offers first-class service, a dedicated and highly trained team and a diverse gastronomic offer. Whether vegans, vegetarians or meat lovers – everyone will find something delicious here. Every day new culinary highlights await guests, prepared with great love and creativity.  The sports and entertainment programme is versatile and leaves nothing to be desired: Whether body workout, Zumba, stretch & relax, yoga, fitness, boxing, cycling, tennis, beach volleyball, football, archery, golf or water sports – there is something for everyone. The courses are led by professional and motivated trainers so that both beginners and advanced students are supervised.  Another highlight is of course the sea – turquoise blue, clean and simply fantastically beautiful. On some days, the water may be a little murkier; then water shoes are recommended. If you like, you can walk a bit to the left or right along the beach and be rewarded with a Caribbean-like bathing paradise.  Our stay was relaxed from start to finish and completely successful. The Robinson Djerba Bahiya exceeded our expectations – we can fully recommend it and are already looking forward to our next visit!

Positive things were: - beautiful and well-kept grounds - Staff very friendly - Beach restaurant for lunch - Beach bar with wonderful sea views - We noticed the live music very positively. We have never experienced so much live music in all the Robinson clubs we have visited. - cool day beds (free of charge) directly at the pool - good sports offer - Rooms are nicely decorated and clean. - Guest laundry - super Rob Store - available board games, table football, table tennis  Cons: - The main restaurant inside is quite uncomfortable and bare. - The food is rather average. - There is no comfortable seating in the club. All chairs are equipped with plastic cushions that stick to the butt and mostly high chairs. - The drinks, including wines, are all terrible. - The shows are fine, but we've seen much better at other Robinson clubs. Luhana was especially weak. - The Hawaiian evening meal had nothing to do with Hawaii. - The mattresses were quite hard. - The archery field is not usable in summer. There are hardly any shadows.

Located in a beautiful location right on the beach. It is clean, idyllic and the staff is mega friendly ! The animation is outstandingly great ! There are great food in a huge offer ! All in all a Recommendation !

reviews.review_title: Well-equipped Club with Excellent Restaurants and Things to Do
reviews.review_text: Very nice Pension, excellent catering with a large selection of well cooked and presented dishes. All sorts of sports and outing Things to do, there is something for everyone. The rooms are minimalist, no storage drawers, no decoration and tristounet furniture. On arrival the receptionist did not speak a word of French, she was German and the exchange was therefore made in English... I had booked a sea view room, but the one we were assigned overlooked the inside of the blocks. At the reception I was informed that they had not had the information from the tour operator... Another receptionist (who spoke to him French...) found us a room with sea view, but as the Pension was supposedly complete, we were on the ground floor, in a family room which was certainly larger, but whose sound insulation leaves to be desired. We could hear our neighbors when they were in their bathroom, as if they were in our own room!! Nevertheless the facilities whether beach or pool are up to the standard, I recommend the beach restaurant and the beach bar (special mention for Mabruk, efficient and friendly waiter). The only really negative point was the 99% German customer base, if we had known that we would not have chosen this Pension. We have been to Djerba several times and generally the clientele is cosmopolitan, but this club is not to be recommended to the French, some German clients do not seem to appreciate our presence and make no effort to speak, even in English. Even the manager, German, did not seek to discuss with me in English. Fortunately the Tunisian staff were happy to speak to us in French! The very few French or Belgian speakers we met felt the same way and told us that they would not come back either, despite the quality of the Pension. I submit this review so that tour operators selling stays at this Pension mention that it is a German club for German family customers.

reviews.review_title: I'm not going back to this Pension. Dinner hours are late.
reviews.review_text: The architecture of the main building is weird.l welcome is in German,like all Things to do besides.  The rooms are simple (no shower cap, no shower after bath, 1 single product for hair, body. No drawers available. Fee-paying fridge. The beach is clean, the entire Tunisian staff is very friendly and dedicated.  Wines (white, pink or red) are mediocre. The pools are beautiful.

Very bad experience: 4 cockroaches over 10 nights and no proposal for change of rooms from the reception Things to do and information are exclusively in German. This will be the first but especially the last time I frequent this hotel

It's probably the worst Robinson in the whole chain. The rooms are rather simple, uncomfortable, dark and full of ants. The food is always buffet, although almost everything is rather tasteless. At 7:20 p.m., everyone storms into the dining area and secures the tables. If you arrive at 7:30 p.m. on time, you won't find room. When we decided to book wine and dine places, we were presented with the wine list. Consistently Tunisian wines for 30-50€. All were created from the vinegar category. This situation is intolerable! Every evening the party music resounds from the bar into the rooms. Sleep is unthinkable until 1 a.m. The whole thing then culminates in the arrogance of the reception, who doesn't care.  What was outstanding: the Nautic School for sailing and childcare, where Ellen and Anne are to be mentioned. At Letizia's and others' house, my child wanted to be picked up. Employees generally only move against regular tips. Robinson really needs to think about whether they want to keep this club going. Apart from the Roby Club and the sailing school, the whole hotel needs a new coat of paint and a change of management. In no case is this club worth a Recommendation

reviews.review_title: Arrive - feel at home - relax and enjoy!!!
