reviews.review_text: A place where your wishes are read from your eyes! An insanely nice, friendly and courteous service staff and a very varied and delicious cuisine complete a perfect holiday in the 1001 night feeling!

The club is super nice and very close to the beach. The food was unique, the water sports with the catameran was very fun. I also took advantage of the sports facilities in particular. I especially liked the courses at Lea!  Thank you for this wonderful relaxing holiday:)

Through out all in all it was a really nice vacation. I do hope that the resort will get a deep clean, restaurant and rooms well needed,  in there winter closing.   Staff in the kids club is very friendly. Restaurant staff not so... sadly.  Location is super, beach is nice.

I went to September 2. This time at Robinson Club Djerba Bahiya. Whether with friends or as a family with 2 children in July, this facility continues to be just perfect and by far the best hotel on Djerba. Cleanliness is the most important thing for us and we were never disappointed. Even the delicious and varied food has always pleased the children and us. There are always Things to do for young and old But you can also take it easy and just chill. In short, Robinson Club Djerba Bahiya has the ideal conditions for an unforgettable holiday. Thanks for everything and hopefully see you next year!

We stayed 12 days at the club it was the second time. We were very satisfied again. The club is super well maintained, the rooms functional and very clean. The system is kept in great shape. The beach is beautiful you can sit wonderfully in the beach bar and enjoy a drink overlooking the sea.  The food is top and varied.  The pool is huge and invites you to swim.  Great staff and great entertainment. We will definitely come back

reviews.review_title: Not a typical Robinson club but a great holiday!
reviews.review_text: We have been avid Robinson travelers for many years and were as a family with our 15-year-old son in August 2024 on a summer vacation in Djerba Bahiya.   We noticed that there was no usual "coming home" at this club. I.e. it took us longer at this club to arrive and arrive. Until the end, we missed the classic Robinson charm. Whether we will go to this club again, we do not know today.  But there were also many POSITIVES: But what we can say: As always, we met great people and enjoyed special moments.   What you really have to give the club is the varied sports offer with really TOP coaches.  A special thanks goes to:   Tennis coach "Emmy" -> Always in a good mood, top organized + attentive and courteous. If you want to make progress in tennis, you must book a coaching lesson with her. Or 2 or 3 :-). Emmy is a coach with a passion for this sport.  Water sports coach "Mirja": Daily changing program with a changing music playlist and a lot of good mood + motivation. It has been clearly noticed that Mirja gives qualified lessons and has a lot of experience in this area. And best of all: All exercises were also feasible and effective in the water. Highlight was aqua jogging in the sea. One of those Robinson moments :-)  Mindfulness trainer "Janin Stötzner": A special experience for the mindset, your own attitude... A coach with experience and a lot of sensitivity and an incredible charisma. Thank you for this experience that even our 15 year old son loved.  And what stands out very positively are the very striving and courteous staff in the service + the small, beautifully assorted Robinson shop with a great special offer. Worth a visit!

“A stay ruined by poor security management”  I am a loyal guest of the Robinson Bahia Pension in Jerba, where I visit every year for a three-week stay. Until now, I have always been satisfied with the establishment. The Pension offers a pleasant setting with all the necessary amenities, a quality restaurant and a wide range of Things to do for every taste.  However, this year my experience was quite different. Victim of its success, the Pension was fuller than usual, and unfortunately I noticed a number of incivilities from other guests. I even had the unpleasant surprise of having my flip-flops stolen by another customer. The absence of surveillance cameras did not confirm the facts and, despite my efforts to report the incident, the Pension staff were not very helpful.  But the most regrettable was an event at the very end of the stay. A friend of my daughter’s entered the Pension 5 minutes to charge her phone, which triggered a disproportionate reaction from security and especially supervisor Karim.Not only was the police called for a case I didn’t even understand, but I was barred from my own room and my daughter’s room by disabling our keys. All this while I had paid my 21-day stay at the highest rate. My daughter’s friend had to pay 200 dinars for allegedly consuming something, a situation as absurd as it is unfair.  I find this particularly regrettable as I have always enjoyed this Inn, but this last experience completely changed my point of view. Despite my many years of loyalty, I will not go back. I will now spend my €5000 on other establishments, where incident management is hopefully more appropriate and respectful of customers.  Too bad it ended this way.

We had a wonderful stay in this beautiful dar in the heart of the medina. Indeed, I cannot imagine that you will find better lodging in Tunis. I've stayed in many places in many countries, and this is among the very best.  Room: I believe there are four rooms altogether, one of which is an apartment. We made a point of reserving the blue room well in advance, and were glad we did. Gorgeously appointed and embarrassingly spacious, we felt like royalty. The bed was firm (which I prefer) and very comfortable. The shower is small but adequate, and the water pressure and temperature were excellent. There were plenty of electrical outlets. The room was well insulated from noise overall, although, it being spring, at times one could hear the sounds of cats wooing in the alley below.  Location: Perfect for exploring the medina, with several cafés and sandwich stalls nearby. Personally, I would strongly recommend staying in the medina, which is atmospheric and surprisingly peaceful. Though it was pretty easy to locate via GPS, we were glad we booked our taxi through the B & B, as the medina is a bit of a maze and most drivers won't take your directly to the door.  Staff: The owner, his wife and the staff were unfailingly cheerful and friendly. I texted the owner several times with questions, and his responses were prompt and helpful. My wife developed a medical problem, and he was kind enough to arrange to have a doctor/acupuncturist come to our room. Thank you, Marouane.  Food: Breakfasts were spectacular, with different options every day, most of them homemade. We were given access to bottled water as needed, and were able to buy glasses of wine.

Really beautiful, very, very large room. Comfortable bed in a sweet alcove and two sitting areas and a desk. 5 windows overlooking the alley. Very cool domed ceiling with groovy chandelier Lovely bathroom, ample linens, tons of blazing hot water and great water pressure. Some sewage smell on and off (pretty typical in these ancient homes) solved by keeping the bathroom door closed. The breakfast is unbelievably ample, delicious and varied. The husband and wife hosts and the two ladies who work with them are all completely lovely, attentive and helpful. Great location inside the car free medina. I cannot say enough good things about our stay and would give 10 stars if I could. Thank you!

reviews.review_title: Truly a luxury stay in Tunis
reviews.review_text: Tunisia offers the most beautiful of guesthouses!  Located in the heart of the world famous Tunis Médina, this extravagant guesthouse felt like royalty. For 2 nights, we enjoyed true Tunisian hospitality 💙   Breakfast was prepared - and it was heavenly. An authentic homemade Tunisian breakfast which really whetted our appetites.   Truly a luxury 👑

Romantic and well-managed accommodation in the middle of the old town. We loved every minute of it. Access on foot only, but without worries. Personal and warm welcome by Marouan and his team. Bedroom with stone vault and column, beautiful shower and skylight. Complete change of scenery. Hearty and varied breakfast. I want to come back...
Magical room, always a pleasure to return. Quiet, excellent breakfasts, the right place to discover the Medina. Thank you Marouane for your availability and hospitality. Odile and Jackie

reviews.review_title: Best Small Bed and Breakfast in Tunis!!!
reviews.review_text: Le Chambre Bleue was an excellent bed and breakfast located just outside of the Northwestward edge of the Tunis Medina. The owner and his wife were just so incredibly kind to us and really made us feel as part of their family during our stay. Any issues were handled with hast and they were so helpful arranging transportation for us. Beer and wine was available for purchase as well as free bottle water! Will recommend Le Chambre Bleue to our Friends! Breakfast may have been the highlight though, every morning being a little different than the previous. Homemade jams and bread were a highlight!

Marouane, Shiraz, and their staff were wonderful hosts! We enjoyed our time with them very much. Marouane took care of anything we needed, from dinner reservations to summoning drivers to walking us where we needed to go! He even helped us navigate with Bolt and was eager to please us throughout our 4 days with them. Our only problem was that they had no air conditioning and it was very hot. But they provided a fan that helped a lot. The room was also very dark, but we managed just the same! The location is great if you want to be inside the Medina.

Very beautiful place in Tunis in a dream setting, beautifully renovated Extraordinary breakfast, delicious homemade served with a smile Central place to discover Tunis and its souk and very enriching advice from the owner who takes the time to help you discover his city, thank you again..

An incredibly beautiful hotel with thoroughly friendly hosts. I stayed here for four nights on my first visit ever to Tunisia. The rooms are unlike anything I've ever seen in a hotel. Large rooms making me feel as if I'm living in an old North African movie by Bertolucci. Breakfast also beautifully served in addition to being delicious. I'm a fan.

We had a fantastic stay at Le Chambre Bleue. Our room was super clean and full of character. Well situated in the Medina, we had lots of restaurants and street food options within a few minutes walk. Each morning we were treated to a selection of local breakfast dishes which were super tasty. A big big thank you to Marouane, Shiraz and Apollinaire for there hospitality - they are fantastic hosts!

I recently spent 3 nights at La Chambre Bleue. A charming guesthouse in the heart of Tunis medina.  The owner Marouane arranged a taxi for me and the driver brought me to the door. You'd struggle to find it alone.  My room was one of those pictured with an arched ceiling. Very pleasant and atmospheric. Complete with it's own patio. Note that the bottle of water provided is from the tap and whilst it won't kill you, I wouldn't have drank it had I known in advance.  Communication in advance was excellent. Marouane speaks excellent English and was quick to respond. So I was surprised on arrival to be greeted by a woman who did not speak a word. Marouane does not live there. This was not a big problem but if you speak zero French then you might not be entirely comfortable. But then if you speak zero French then you're going to struggle to travel independently in Tunisia. M was almost always available on whatsapp and came and had breakfast with me on the first and last mornings.  The house is super charming. He's refurbished it and wants to have cultural events there. Breakfast was varied with traditional type items. I would perhaps have preferred eggs, cream cheese etc (which I got other places). The lady running the place was very nice, despite the language barrier we got by on a combination of my bad French and google translate.  It's worth noting that food options in the medina are a bit limited, and they close pretty early. I survived on the snacks I'd brought with me on the first night as everything was closed. It was only around 6pm. Even worse on Sundays. It's not the most tourist friendly medina (thinking of Marrakech, for example). Make sure and save the location of the guesthouse on google maps. When the shops close and the lights go out you might struggle to find your way home.  La Chambre Bleue is undoubtedly a top choice for your stay in Tunis medina.

This beautiful guesthouse is superb.  It is in a lovely location in the middle of the Medina, next to great restaurants and beautiful old streets.  The lady of the house makes traditional breakfast every morning and she is so very kind, generous and welcoming.  The owner Maroane is amazing, he speaks perfect English and is so kind and hospitable.  He went above and beyond all expectations and was very helpful in helping me plan my trip beforehand and offered me great advice when I arrived.  I highly recommend this place, it's beautiful, authentic and charming. Thank you very much for everything!

We were fortunate that when we contacted Sondos that she had the Makhazen room (with the cross-vault soaring ceilings and a column) available.  The room has a private courtyard and is very spacious.  The bathroom is quirky (no door) but functional.  The walk-in shower is a small alcove but as there is no shower door or screen it does not feel cramped (nor did the bathroom get wet!).  Breakfast is served upstairs in the dining room.  There were significant changes every day but constant were an outstanding juice (prune, peach and banana), yoghurt, black bread toast, ricotta and a large array of jams and honey plus coffee/tea.  The girl service breakfast and making our room was so delightful!  Breakfast was served from 08:30 and we never had any appetite for lunch afterwards!  Sondos arranged an airport pick-up for us which was nice as La Chambre Bleu is located in the Medina.  However, the Medina is compact and we never had any issues finding our around.  Be aware that the shops close early 17:00-17:30: then the souks and the Medina are dark - phone flashlights are useful as rubbish goes into the centre of the ‘street’ for removal but is likely still there when you are walking back to your room at night.  We never heard any external noise when we were in the room which made for excellent rest.  Sondos provides us with a great map of the Medina with restaurants, cafes, and sights to visit which simplified getting around.  A fabulous base in a wonderful, underrated city/country.  Highly recommend.

It was a very nice hotel. Beautiful design and interior. I really liked the atmosphere and the service was great! If I go to Tunisia next time, this hotel will be my destination for sure. Thank you so much for a great opportunity!

reviews.review_title: The Best Place to Stay in Tunis, on ANY Budget!
reviews.review_text: La Chambre bleue is an absolutely wonderful bed and breakfast in the heart of the Medina of Tunis. Sondos, the gracious Hostess, makes you feel right at home in every way possible. She really goes the extra mile. Incredibly friendly, patient, and multilingual, she will give you one of the best breakfasts is you'll have in your life!  Does anyone else love home made jam?    Not only that, but she will also give you an infinite amount of recommendations for Tunis as well as the rest of Tunisia. I actually had many questions for her during the day while out.  So, via WhatsApp, I asked her about many things many times. She always got back to me incredibly quickly!  Even after we had checked out, her response time was super quick whenever we had a question for her.    Also, the room itself was fantastic. Two of us stayed in her apartment, which to me resembled an ancient Roman villa. With a bit of Old World Arabic charm thrown in as well.    It was wintertime, and probably as cold as Tunis can get (surprising cold at night!). But the room was nice and toasty warm. I'm sure it would be nice and cool in the hot summer months as well. Plenty of hot water, and the tap water is even drinkable, (at least according to Sondos).  I drank it every day when I was there, and it tasted fine (plus I has no problems).    If you're Backpacker on a budget, but you want to Splash out on an experience where you really get your money's worth, I would recommend this one. You won't regret it.    And, if you have a bit of a higher budget, I can't imagine any amenity that you have in a hotel that you would not have at la chambre bleue. The breakfast, attentive service answering any questions, the Wi-Fi in the room was also fantastic, and the breakfast was amazing.  Plus, this is a renovated old house, and the atmosphere was great.  Almost like living in one of these beautiful museums!  Not a sterile "Trying to be Trendy and Modern" blah pretentious hotel.  Oh, I almost forgot to mention, she stored a bit of luggage for me while we were traveling around Tunis for a couple of weeks. Even though we didn't end up staying there on our way out of the country, she said it was no problem.   How great is this place!?!?    Thank you very much Sondos! You made our stay in Tunis exceptional, and I can't wait to go back and try out your other rooms!

After reading all the positive TripAdvisor reviews, I decided to stay at La Chambre Bleue located in the Tunis Medina. My expectations were high and overall, the place did not disappoint.   After reading all the positive reviews , one might expect the place to blow your mind and knock your senses off completely - i.e create expectations of complete perfection.   My advice is to keep your expectations realistic when visiting this place and staying at La Chambre bleue. All in all , I thoroughly enjoyed my time in Tunis - La Chambre Bleue certainly did not disappoint but it was not spectacular either, as some other reviews may suggest. Hence , I am keeping this review as realistic and factual as possible.  The location of La Chambre bleue is spectacular - it is in the heart of the Tunis Medina - a vibrant place full of energy, color and character. At night , some of the bars and coffee places near the Dar El Jeld at the Kasbah liven up and offer great entertainment. Getting lost in the labyrinth of shops in the Medina and finding you way back to La Chambre bleue owned by Mrs Sondos Ben Miled is an experience in itself.   Everyone talked about the breakfast in the reviews. All items ( the main entree - either pancake with ricotta cheese or sweet couscous served along with bread and jam , fruits, yogurt , and coffee ) were fresh and well presented. In my opinion, items tend to be on the sweeter side , especially the main entree ( sweet couscous or the pancake with ricotta) and maybe it would be good to have something to neutralize this with a salty or savory item ( eggs, tofu or some other hot item) would be a good addition. Overall , breakfast was a good, family style experience. I enjoyed it.  Overall , the room itself - la Chambre bleue - was comfortable. I stayed for three nights and had a good nights sleep. As the other reviews state , there is character and uniqueness in the decor.   But please do not expect perfectness in the decor. If you do so, this is not the place for you. As an example, you will find broken tiles, unfinished decor, torn seats, torn carpets in some places both in the main room - la Chambre bleue - as well as the small adjoining room - sitting area. If you are a person who can see and appreciate the beauty by ignoring a few blemishes and wear and tear , you will be fine. After all , this is an old restored house that Mrs Sondos has been tying to restore.  During the time of my stay, the WiFi was spotty and did not work in the main room i.e. la Chambre bleue. I had to sit in the smaller adjoining room to get my work done. This issue with the Dlink router may have been fixed already now, hopefully.  During the time of my stay, there was a small leakage in the bathroom pipe because of which I was told to close it after usage.  This did not cause much of an issue or trouble to me. Hopefully, this is also addressed now. Bathroom tiles need to be added in one layer - was not a big issue. There were no issues with hot water during my stay.   You will see a small patio with lovely colorful furniture in some pictures. Note that this does not come as a part of the room - this is a private patio for Mrs Sondos and she would love to show it to you if you desire to view it.  Upon arriving , Mrs Sondos will welcome you and provide you a map with good details on suggested places to visit , eat etc. This is indeed helpful, as many reviewers have pointed out.   In my case, I followed Mrs Sondos’ advice , walked via the Medina to the new city and Habib  Bourghiba Avenue ,  took the TGM to Carthage and Sidi Bou Said. I got a bit lost on the first day as there were three train stations for the Carthage and I did not know where to get off. The next day , Sondos provided further clarity on which of the three stations to get off for visiting Punic Port, Antonian Baths etc. Personally, I enjoyed Sidi Bou Said the most - it was spectacular and much affordable than similar destinations in Greece like Santorini.  I also visited places like Gammarth , took a hamam at the Golden Tulip Carthage in Gammarth ( highly recommended)  , had dinner at Calcutta restaurant ( excellent Indian food.).  Overall , Mrs Sondos’ advice was helpful. She also advised me to visit the market at the entrance of the new city - this was an interesting place as well as I had never seen something like this before.   There is  a bottle of hot water provided and refilled during your stay. If tasted a bit strange - I would not recommend drinking it and would opt for sealed and bottled water instead - my humble opinion.  I booked my stay via hotels.com and paid 270 euros for a three night stay at la Chambre Bleue. Upon booking , I got a message from Mrs Sondos asking for my passport information so that she could “prepare for my stay”. I did not provide it initially as I was not comfortable providing these before my stay began - Sondos provided directions for the place, added me to WhatsApp and wrote an email saying that although she did not receive the passport details , she will collect them later. I subsequently provided the details before my stay began.   There is nothing fishy about this although it was a bit strange to me initially. While I understand that this is needed to provide to the authorities in Tunis and to provide a quick and convenient check in experience , for security and privacy reasons , I feel it is better to provide this information at the time of the stay rather than before your stay. This is of course my humble opinion and in accordance with standards in most hotels and airbnbs  I have stayed at.  Despite being vigilant on collecting passport details during check in, the only experience of my stay that was somewhat unpleasant was the check out experience - Mrs. Sondos forgot to ask me to pay cash upon checkout and I was under the impression that the payment was already made under the credit card that I submitted to Hotels.com upon booking.  Clearly , I should have been vigilant in asking Mrs Sondos if she got the money and Mrs Sondos should have asked me as well to pay.  This was an inconvenience for me as I had to arrange a bank wire transfer to Mrs Sondos after my stay and pay a fees to my bank for the same. Hence , instead of Euros 270, I paid euros 240 to Mrs Sondos and 30 euros for the bank transfer to my bank. I did not appreciate the dealings with Mrs Sondos in this situation - she got a bit panicky, mentioned that she need not “ support the charges”, wrongly stated that “ i forgot to pay” and asked me to “pay at least half”. Mrs. Sondos probably felt that I would not pay and completely misunderstood - which explains the panic situation. After I explained, I think she understood later and said that my responses were “ well received”.  Mrs Sondos’ reaction to the above situation may be one off. I feel she could have handled it better , especially with a guest who stayed at her house for three nights . Sadly, It all boiled down to money in the end. Situations such as the above tend to happen - what matters most is how you react to it and get out of it. According to her, all her guests pay cash upon checkout and they do not accept credit cards. As an improvement opportunity, this should be published in their website clearly.   All in all , I would still recommend staying at La Chambre Bleue if you are looking for an unique experience. Again , please do not expect perfection. From a value for money standpoint, improvement is needed in my humble opinion. Sondos is a hard working person and I found her usually very diligent and helpful in the three days that I knew her. If you can focus on the positive during your stay , you should be fine and will not be disappointed.

I really enjoyed my experience in this intimate guest house, located in the heart of the Medina of Tunis.  The owner and host is a charming woman who was exceptionally helpful, served a delicious, home-cooked breakfast and stayed for excellent conversation. The place was clean, comfortable, and the internet service worked very well.  I hope to return!

An excellent location in the midst of the medina. Rooms were clean and full of character. Our host was enormously helpful in helping us plan to make the most of our two short days in Tunis, gave us a tutorial and annotated map which were indispensible for navigating the medina, and she made dinner reservations for us as well which was quite helpful. The breakfast was prepared from scratch and featured an array of homemade jams which were superb. We enjoyed meeting other travelers around the breakfast table and the house was quiet in the evening.d

We stayed here 3 nights. The place is a renovated old building with some interesting features. The lady running it is pleasant and helpful with information about the surrounding area. The breakfast is also quite interesting, with numerous jams and fruit juices. The room got quite hot, despite having a dehumidifier.

This hotel is in a great location right in the heart of the medina, perfect for exploring the historic center of the city. Additionally, the rooms are very comfortable and beautifully decorated. The host is friendly and has a lot of advice on what to do around the city and what to do nearby. The breakfast is excellent and features delicious Tunisian food. Highly recommended!

We had a great experience at Omar Al-Khayyam in Tunisia! The hotel was really nice, with several swimming pools and a beautiful sea view. The food was good and there was plenty of variety every day. What made our stay truly special was the animation team – they were amazing! Every member of the team was full of energy and so friendly. A special mention to Mucha, who really made us feel welcome and kept the vibe fun from morning to night. We would definitely come back again. Highly recommended!

Very good hotel and very clean food at the top animation team super to recommend. Very good work of the housekeepers. very friendly and smiling staff at our disposal. Great location. A beautiful beach.  The only downside is that the rooms are obsolete.

reviews.review_title: Super stay with matches and Sam and simo
reviews.review_text: I thank all the animators on scooter Moutcha and Sam and simo very nice and the hotel is amazing 💕😍 thank you to all and thank you for neighbors read my comment 💬    Baille thank you I love you cough and had a good day  Thanks again to all the animators I love you kisses

Very satisfied it was a good stay I will return immediately again Super Animation The restaurant very well we ate well  We have the beautiful view to the sea A very good welcome  We've been coming to this hotel for 15 years and everything's still going well

Superb hotel  Everything is great  Super animators and animator  To be repeated very quickly  A very good time spent I highly recommend  Very nice room  Very clean  Come back to have fun  A huge thank you to all  Looking forward to seeing you again

reviews.review_title: Superb host especially Moutcha a great girl, big kisses to you Moutcha
reviews.review_text: Moutcha a great girl, go to this hotel, a team at the top, I think you wouldn't be above, Tunisia is great, I've been there since 2014, I love country, I hope to go back soon  . Congratulations to the team soon 😚

Just got home from this hotel with my 2 daughters 11 and 8 years old and we had the over the best holidays ever. The food and rooms were great. But the best this about it was the staff. Especially Moutcha one that of the entertainers she was a lovely person and she was amazing with the children. We are going to book and go back because of her. 10/10 must go   Aaron from England.

A top hotel and a great team. Especially moutcha who is a top manager. We'll be back with some friends next time. Because really well received and very clean rooms.and staff with little care. Very varied meals.

We came in early May as a family , we had a great stay, this hotel is very welcoming , the animators and all the staff are super kind and kind to the guests .. the animations at the top. I recommend for your family holiday..

Great staff and great animation team. In June there were few guests at the hotel which was great for us. The whole staff was super friendly and helpful. A TV room was specially set up for the European Championship. The food was delicious and varied. The rooms are functional and clean. We felt very comfortable and will definitely come back. Thank you to everyone

We spent a holiday with friends at this hotel. We definitely do not recommend this facility. Although we managed to find an attractive price offer, there are some things that you should not turn a blind eye to. Cleanliness in the room, in the canteen and toilets does not exist. The pool bar is located right next to the stinking public bathrooms, from which a terrible stench is extracted. I feel sorry for the bartenders who spend their days there. Despite leaving tips in the room, it was never cleaned anyway. Food is a failure, monotonous and tasteless, sometimes with a strange, disturbing taste. Whether we came to the opening of the canteen or later - it was always cold. In the cafeteria, mess, sticky tables, leftover food on the floor and tables, all in all everywhere. Sometimes at lunch there were still those from breakfast. Great chaos in the queues for meals, sometimes even fighting for priority. As for the beach at the hotel, it is wide and sandy, with a gentle descent to the sea but unfortunately littered and could easily be cut. The water in the sea was extremely clean but it could not be perfect here either, because on the shore there is a lot of rubbish, probably thrown by the sea. Lots of flip-flops, bottles, filters, foils, etc. Sunbeds on the beach free of charge, if you succeed you can also put a metarac on them, but you have to hunt them because there are fewer of them than sunbeds. The pool at the hotel is a little too small for such a large number of people who can be in the hotel at the same time. Animations mainly for children, we will not judge because we were a group of adults themselves. Plus for the reception staff - very helpful both during the problems with air conditioning and organizing a taxi to a nearby town.

2 weeks holiday. First week hotel overcrowded with local families with lots of children. The restaurant food was good and varied. The main problem was the dining room with the floor always greasy and slippery like an ice rink. Dirty, greasy tables and chairs. Buffets stormed with no politeness and no respect for queues by local tourists. You had to fight and scramble like in the Far West to reach the food, raided in absurd quantities by local families, who then abandoned it on the tables without being able to consume it because taken in quantities truly beyond imagination. The staff was constantly bringing in new pans of food, but a couple of local customers were enough to empty the whole pan. Small local children ran around the room without any parental control, touching and licking the food and tongs of the buffets. Some local children tasted the sweets and then put them back in the buffet. The European clientele was stunned and could not believe that they had ended up in such a hogwash. The staff, always kind, witnessed what was happening, made us realize that they agreed with us that the situation was crazy, but did not intervene in any way and just watched. After a complaint from us and other Italian customers, the management and the chef admitted that they were not able to cope with the situation, but they gave us their personal willingness to let us have the food personally, which was not necessary because in the second week, probably thanks to the start of school, local families drastically decreased and this made the situation much better and we finally managed to eat with peace of mind managing to access all the available foods. We have been visiting Tunisian hotels for over 30 years, we have always enjoyed it, but we have never been in a similar situation!!! The local customers sitting on the lobby chairs (often soaked in water by those who sat in their costumes still wet) with their bare feet resting on the tables we had never seen them anywhere. I would say that this is an unsuitable structure for European customers if that is always the case.

reviews.review_title: Horrible lots of room for improvement.
reviews.review_text: Where do I even begin, previously tried to gain contact with the hotel multiple times to find out if they had travel cots available but still didn’t receive any contact, so we arrived to the hotel after a 2hr 13 minute coach journey which we were told it would be 45 minutes max, terrible driver was speeding and had to slam on on a roundabout causing us all to fly forward even my daughter (7months old) which she was left with a bruise at the side of her head, no apology or nothing he knew something was wrong as I shouted and he could hear my daughter cry but when we arrived he had the cheeky to keep asking for a tip. To then I told he would not receive because of his driving. (EasyJet’s driver) (Not the hotels fault but share my experience) we went to the lobby and asked to fill out some forms (I.e address, profession, passport information) and pay holiday tax to stay at the hotel which worked out to be £7.03 for 7 nights pp which we was never made aware off.  Got to the room to find out they are dusty and smell musty, cot it’s self was dirty as we clean it with antibacterial wipes turned black( pictured). Light in the bathroom are very dull and needs more, tiles have been destroyed and put back together like a child has done it.   There is no kettle or mini fridge in the rooms, shower was broken till the 3rd day of our stay, Ants are literally everywhere in the room place you wouldn’t think they could get too. The rooms need a small pan and brush as the floor is always full of sand and crap. In the rooms you can hear everything next door, upstairs,  in the corridor and even the entertainment which is really loud   The hotel was good and okay till the 3rd when the 900 Arab locals over the week (This is what the staff called them) turned up. I have never met so many rude, dirty guests in my life, they walk and barge into you even tho we had a pram with a 7 month old, look you up and down in discuss and literally leave no food for anyone else they stack there plates high and waste so much food plates was placed on the floor, food was everywhere. (Pictured). High chair was very dirty and not cleaned once whilst we were there. The staff honestly did their best to help us but it was a struggle. I think the hotel should let other guests know when they are staying and put a maximum scoop allowance, as this literally ruined the holiday  Food is pretty good until you realise the menu doesn’t change on dinner and tea we got sick of eat the same stuff over and over, also they do not cater for the English which is understandable as we was the only English family in the hotel at the time.  We also seen staff filling up water bottles by the “beach bar” (shed) with the sand wash down, no I don’t think that is drinking water, after this we didn’t want to risk getting ill or having D&V and had to buy our own bottled water. (We went all inclusive)  Kids play area/ park had sharp knives objects in we believe these are thorns (see picture) these made our feet bleed and I am an adult never mind a child that run/crawl,roll around this is definitely not acceptable. Only wanted to take my daughter on the swings and I ended up with pinpricks in my foot.  Power cuts & hot water if you came in around 17:30 to 20:00 you would get luke warm water as the pool closed and everyone was getting ready for tea. Power cuts happened a couple of times as we was getting sorted, not a big problem if we didn’t have our daughter.  Beach is really nice apart from fag butts everywhere even though there is a bin 6foot away from every sun lounge (not the hotels fault but machine to sort this would help) and there is a shaft/tent with paragliding, jet skis, dingy and much more prices are reasonable.  There is a bank/exchange and a shop with the hotel complex so you do not have to leave which is great but I would recommend bring your own currency as you would have to travel out the hotel to a cash machine (5 minutes car journey)  Camel ride guy within the hotel sold us tickets which cost us roughly 30 quid each we got picked up from the hotel to the camels and literally went in a big circle (can still see where we got on the camels) waited an hour on top on hill to look at “views” then back down to have naan bread and spicy sauce as food. I honestly would say it’s not worth over £15 quid max especially when 10 of us did it. Just be careful as he does mix with the truth.  The Entertainment is really REALLY good here honestly can’t fault them at-all even though we was the only English there and the locals wanted nothing to do with us, they tried their best to get us involved as much as possible. No matter what they would always have activities on every 2 hours (water sports, kids club, mini disco) you just can’t fault them, honestly if it wasn’t for the entertainment and the team it would seriously ruin the holiday, This is the only really reason why I would ever visit again.  Staff are very kind and friendly, work very hard.  Overall I’d say this is more like a 2 star on the other hand its sister hotel definitely gets all the money as it was so much more nicer, more staff, cleaner and more Modern. I am only sharing my experience and just to help others know before traveling out and being disappointed.

Mediocre food no taste the same dishes .water distributed with bitter taste .swimming pool dirty .tail in the restaurant .the only positive is the bustle .room very average . Pension archi full .we smell pee everywhere next to the snack .

Inn mediocre side restaurant pool very dirty room much umidite service null no mini bar to room all in soft not water in plastic glasses not a bottle c prohibited inc obliged to buy a bottle buffet lunch even in the evening a Inn zero zero

POSITIVE:  Beachfront Pension  Professional and school reception staff   NEGATIVES:  Hotel sale in green spaces  Pools rooms Room and toilet rooms on arrival  Poor animation Insufficient food: repetitive dishes and bad taste especially Breakfast where you have to queue 30 minutes to help yourself 2 pancakes  No water bottles    Disappointed with my stay

Pension Very warm .. we had very good fun.. very good staff warm welcome.. The house is clean but a little old, restaurant very clean the chefs was very nice .. A day and evening entertainment program

I am staying in this village and honestly there can only be positive notes since the cleanliness of the rooms is impeccable, the staff is polite, kind and professional, the entertainment team is very nice, not intrusive and always propose you different activities and evening shows, the restaurant in my opinion is very nice and as an Italian I can say that the food is good and you can find everything for all tastes, the cleaning ladies rooms are very kind is very efficient, the sea and beach are beautiful and the only thing where the village is not to blame is the rudeness of tourists who leave everything around and do not care to keep the environment clean. So I can only say that it is a very good property and I highly Recommendation!!

We left the parking lot... Bandits at the door... we booked 2 nights and on arrival we are asked to leave the car outside almost 500m... We refused and we decided to leave and nobody cared about us. Very disappointed

**Disappointing Experience**  My stay at this hotel was disappointing on all levels. The rooms were poorly maintained and extremely dirty, with cleanliness clearly not being a priority. The food was not only subpar but also appeared dangerous to consume, raising serious health concerns. The amenities were inadequate, and the overall service was lacking. The staff seemed disinterested and unhelpful, making the experience even more frustrating. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone seeking a comfortable and pleasant stay. Improvements are desperately needed in all areas.

reviews.review_title: A cost all inclusive hotel on the beach front of madia, 8 min drive from the town centre and markets.
reviews.review_text: A cute, all inclusive hotel right on the beach front. There's many activities throughout the day and night such as volleyball, archery and bowling or water sports in the pool. There's also beach sports on the beach. The food is exotic and there are many cocktails to choose from.

The food is good has plenty of options, kitchen staff are approachable and helpful. Rooms are clean and tidy. Rooms are cleaned everyday. Hotel staff is very friendly. Bar has plenty of option for drink and very friendly. Pool clean and tidy.

Best hotel ever! Comfy rooms with great view, lovely food and great staff! So many excursions and things to do, booking weather and you never get bored, would 100% come back again. Entertainment staff is the best!’ So lovely and chat with you at nighy

Excellent hotel, friendly staff, great food,  great entertainment day and night. Plenty of activities to keep everyone busy. Very clean and tidy. Located right on beach so can have time by pool or sea. Great water sports & boat trips 🌞🌞🌞🌞🌞🌞

Fantastic hotel food great and staff amazing - definitely come again! 😊😊 the beach was great with loungers that were always available - sea is stunning and water sports cheap - would recommend a visit - Tunisia is stunning and if never visited I would say to stay here 😊😊😊

The rooms and service were great. Would of neen nice to have a small fridge in room, but otherwise amazing. Entertainmet staff were fantastic especially Chico and Mario who made the experience even better and always took time to have a chat.

The entertainment team are fantastic, the evening shows are brilliant and overall the atmosphere is very good in general, The food is lovely aswell and the on site sports are great, the room is very cozy and we had a nice view from our balcony. Would definitely come back next year.

reviews.review_title: Highly recommend we will be returning ⭐️
reviews.review_text: I recently visited this hotel for a family holiday. We were met by a very friendly and welcoming team of staff. Service and cleanliness are of a very high standard. Animation team are amazing, entertainment all through day and evening. I highly recommend visiting

In my experience at El Borj the entertainment staff have been the highlight of my holiday with their high energy and funny jokes. They have a very relatable sense of humour and they make me want to schedule another trip just so I can get the same service as before. They are very polite and respectable and never fail to make me laugh with their kind regards such as saying good morning and good night and always making sure my day is the best.

Here with family and we’ve had a great time - our favourite family holiday to date! The hotel, animation team, cleaners, all staff are fantastic. Amazing service all round, lots of activities - we can’t wait to come back here next year, we’ll be booking before we go home! 🌟

Here with family and we love this hotel the animation team and staff are all amazing it,a really nice here we really enjoy our times thanks for everyone we really happy here . Thanks for everyone and we will back soon . The best hotel❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️

Food was brilliant, entertainment staff very fun and helpful, nothing is ever to much for any of the staff brilliant service throughout the day and lots of beach activities. Beach bar is amazing, great food selection. Lots of things to do all day long. Amazing will be back all so friendly.

Brilliant entertainment. Great selection of food. All so friendly like home from home will definitely be back. Lots of entertainment for kids no waits for drinks they bring them to you whilst sunbathing. Beach attached to hotel with an amazing beach bar. Nothing to complain about what so ever. Amazing!

We was visiting Tunisia and this hotel for the first time. It was amazing experience everyone was very friendly and welcoming. We spend brilliant 7 nights in this hotel and looking forward to visiting again in the future. Highly recommended.

Hotel is based about 1.5 hrs from Airport so not a problem for us. Just be aware of that when you go there as different times are given by easyjet and also on the bus on way there.   Food is fine however can be very repetitive. Drinks are not good at all. Cocktails are not nice, too sweet.   We stayed a week which was enough as weather was not great last few days and nothing much to do in hotel. Activities are more organised for outside so they should plan inside stuff for the rainier / dull days as can be boring. I got massage for £25 for 45 mins. It was very good.   Overall when we got there I found hotel very clean. You pay tourist tax on arrival which is 8 dinar per day (£2 per day. ) Free WiFi is only really available in reception although I was lucky to get it in my room. Most of the staff are lovely but talking to some reception staff can be hard as felt like I was bothering them. Start of holiday was fine but when italians came the show at 9.30pm was mainly in Italian and barely any English compared to start of week when it was 95% English. I understand that you cater for guests but there were so many English spoken people there and barely any English was spoken at shows. The water was too rough at beach to do anything but beach area was nice along with beach bar for snacks. The pool is freezingggg lol but once you eventually get in, it's absolutely fine and a great pool. Good size. Rooms were comfy but sometimes music from a different hotel goes on to 2/3am and was hard to sleep. The walls are very thin so can hear everything also (even woman snoring in room next to me) . The shower is excellent. Upon check out make sure everything is still in room as one of the glass tumblers was missing from my mums room and they made a fuss of it as we were waiting for our bus to go home. My mum accidentally left it on side table outside with her other glasses she took to room and it was collected. The entertainment team.. My daughter loved them and enjoyed the dancing etc. The shows at night are really good but when weather was bad they should do the shows inside because it was so cold! They moved the show outside when italians came but even had it outside when it was very cold at night. The team did keep energy up every day but when weather was bad they sat round a lot talking to everyone, went around to all tables sitting at least 30 mins each time when they could be arranging things to do indoors and sometimes people just don't want to talk on holiday especially for me as I am introverted and just want to relax.  The area has a few bars and restaurants. The souvenir shop outside security place of hotel is handy to go to, to use leftover dinar and get some snacks.  This is my honest review and I know loads have given it 5 stars this year compared to last year and I do think it is a great hotel and I had a nice time but I just like to be left alone and do my own things and just think energy didn't match mine and that's OK.

EXCELLENT HOTEL!!  As we my partner and I have previously stayed at this hotel we knew it was a good place to stay...but upon arrival this year the refurbishment of reception area with new lighting and seating was fantastic it's really lightened up the surroundings there.   Then we can talk about the restaurant refurbishment.. again it's been done to very good standard with bright furniture colours and paint  throughout and all new cooking facilities, bain Marie pots ,soup pots ect. Food great and something for all...if you like any sort of egg for breakfast like us ..we took a bottle of hp brown sauce which others liked us to share haha. During our stay we had large cooler cups which were filled when required but a couple of days before our departure signs went on bars stating no large cups could be filled.. but if you order 2 beers and pour your own in its ok... this is not to get drunk before anyone says anything..this is something we've done on other holidays but it wasn't an issue.   There has been a lot of comments with regards to this being an Italian biased hotel.. so here it is for English or other europeans who visit this fabulous hotel.. the Italian bias as people call it is something that guests need to understand.. yes there is an ITALIAN ANIMATION TEAM...this hotel has been selected by an an Italian tourist company called BRAVO.. they are there to ensure there guests are catered for.. Alice and Roberto run there animation team and are good with English..maybe some of younger team are not ...but a couple of simple words bonjorno or ciao will help cross that barrier as they are a great team..then when you are lucky enough to stay here there is an international animation team.. so after Italian presentation of acts or entertainment you get told in English, Dutch, French German by the international animation manager who is also good.. the animation team's in this hotel are brilliant  so come with open mind get involved in darts,  archery, boules ect and have a brilliant time at El borj

So although it’s not my first time in Tunisia it was my first time at this hotel so far my impressions are great. I arrived at lunchtime on Friday and did my usual thing go straight to the spa to have a hammam seaweed scrub  and a massage to get my skin ready for the sun the best 45 English pounds I’ve spent on  a long time my skin feels great. The massage was amazing, and I would highly recommend that you all give it a go. Steam room was awesome  staff attentive and having had massages all over the world this was lovely I asked for relaxing and not to hard as I’ve had medium before and felt like a lump of over kneaded  dough - This one almost sent me to sleep  and I felt amazing after

Really great hotel, fabulous staff. Entertainment at night was great and everyone is a great laugh. Really nice food with good vegetarian options and different Tunisian foods to try for the adventurous and lots of chicken nuggets and chips for the not-so-adventurous. All in all great value for money and a lovely place. (Pictured: two of the lovely team) :)

The hotel was fantastic and I can only recommend it. The food was delicious and the staff were all super friendly! There was a different show on every evening, so there was a lot of variety. Our favourite was the Brazilian Carneval show, which seemed to go down really well with all the other guests too!

reviews.review_title: Amazing time for our first time in Tunisia felt very welcome by all
reviews.review_text: Rooms are really nice & clean, cleaned daily with fresh bedding if you would like, food good lots of selection. Service is amazing from the staff & the entertainment team! Always making sure you have drinks! We had a really great time would definitely recommend!

reviews.review_title: I would return! Enjoyed solo holiday 👌🏾
reviews.review_text: Amazing hotel, amazing staff, pool and location beautiful!   Easy jet rep was fantastic  Only thing i would say was wrong is that I booked thinking it was an adults only hotel, and there was teenagers and kids in the hotel!   Food was ok   I would return

Hotel very lively thanks to the animation team thank you to the boss who offers you activities from morning to night thank you for giving us the smile of DJ Ramy to the animators and to site some thanks to Mr Toti animator roudayna and of course animator macha ( maryrm ) See you next if God wants

Just returned from a week's solo holiday. Great experience. Lovely hotel and the staff were all excellent. They couldn't do enough for you. The food was varied and enjoyable. The rooms were spacious with huge beds. I was at the front of the hotel with a great sea view. Bathrooms need updating. The pool area is beautiful and sunbeds were always available. The hotel is in a great spot. I met some lovely people and would definitely return. Thanks for a great holiday.

reviews.review_title: If you want Hilton service pay Hilton prices
reviews.review_text: This is going to be a long one  On arrival was greeted with a big smile and a warm welcome, then a £46 holiday tax, which we were not made aware. The hotel foyer was very spacious and comfortable seats all around, the bar area was at the back of the foyer, with doors out on to the veranda Drinks are limited local variety if you wanted anything else there was a small charge, and not self service and small glasses. The veranda had more comfortable seats and tables with large sun umbrellas over, The pool was large with sun-beds all around on the grass (ants were a pain) could always get a sun bed. The rooms were large, and clean ours had a balcony that looked out to the sea and road below, only moan about this is that the balcony had a board that run around the inside that obscured your view when sitting out, yes rooms are dated and need a bit of TLC, floor by bathroom lifted due to bathroom flooding, towels were a bit grey but they were changed daily and clean, we had a fridge but no kettle, Restaurant was clean and service from waiters amazing,  Adam for breakfast and wajdi for our evening meal both were fantastic and looked after us well,  We always found something to eat, not many English dishes but plenty of chicken,  salad, and chips, Breakfast was typical continental hams and cheeses, there was a lady making omelettes, pancakes, fried eggs or doughnut rings, my partner asked for boiled eggs and these were done daily no problem at all Shopping we found a mall with items already labelled and you could go into the shop with no hassle ( right out hotel, first right, left and a little way along also opposite) you could browse and were left alone, found smaller local shops aggressive and rude if you did not buy anything.  Would be return yes for what we paid it was a very relaxed break away

reviews.review_title: Average hotel okay for a cheap, relaxing holiday
reviews.review_text: Generally the hotel was average, food was average did not have many vegetarian options and very limited options for all. Bottled water is only given in the evening. During the day they have big water areas where you can get water. No kettles in the rooms. The entertainment team are very friendly and helpful and always trying to make effort with all. Mariem was great always got us involved and made us feel welcomed however the hotel needs to spend more money for entertainment. No live evening performances and during the days limited entertainment. Ramy was also great, very welcoming too and always came to see if we needed anything. Thank you both for making us feel so welcome.

The hotel is very good but why not talk about the spa we made a hammam offered by promos stays and 3 massages really excellent len responsible is called kabil very nice is the masseuses really super nice I got 10 years younger it made me feel good again thank you to all this team location full center of Hammammet the rooms correct superb atmosphere

Paradise decor, hotel with beautiful architecture and beautiful services, very attentive staff, coralia team very well, we will surely come back and recommend this place. Thank you Hamed issa and marame. See you soon

Good little stay, welcoming and pleasant hotel team. Animators of the coralia club at the top, very available and friendly! Little atmosphere on this period because few people have the hotel. The quality of meals remains to be improved.......

Great place to stay been twice. Food is good, I always found something to eat. Convenient to get to other places. Felt safe. Staff are excellent helpful. Rooms are basic, but the beds are comfy. My only criticism is I wish rooms had kettle, breakfast went on a bit later

reviews.review_title: Would stay here again. Staff were amazing!!
reviews.review_text: Just got back from 7 days All Inclusive. This is our honest review based on the price we paid £350pp.   Hotel Very nice,  basic and quiet. Beautiful lobby. Nice pool.  Always found a sun-lounger no problem. Yes the rooms/toilets could do with an upgrade… but… for the price we paid, we didn’t mind and nothing was dangerous or broken. From what we gather, the hotel was taken over a few years ago and they are gradually doing it up.   Staff Probably the best thing about the hotel. All the staff went above and beyond and were absolutely amazing.  All bar staff, petri, slim, Ahmed…. Chefs… waiters…  they even brought drinks over to our sunbeds Lifeguards! They brought the bed toppers over to our sunbeds for us and lovely to chat too. The cleaners left us pretty designs int he bed and with flowers etc  The bell-man, can’t remember his name but he helped take our suitcases up to our room and we saw him every day, always with a smile, he was so lovely!   Massage The man on the massage booking (can’t remember his name) was lovely.  Had a hot oil massage (smelt like bubblegum) cost £35 for 50mins was really nice !   Food For a 4* hotel this was probably the holiday with the least choice of food we have ever been too. And we were a bit worried after the first dinner. However,, we always found something to eat, big shout out to the pasta man,, we had pasta every night for dinner and he knew exactly how we liked it and cooked it fresh for us. Would’ve liked a bit more of selection for breakfast eg different cereals/strawberry jam and a bigger fruit selection perhaps. But overall was ok :-) The pancakes at the bar at snack time with chocolate and strawberries were AMAZING!!   Entertainment (Tmk) We aren’t ones for joining in daytime activities, we only done darts once. But everyday  the team seemed to do boules & darts.  The tmk entertainment staff were really nice and pleasant and made an effort to talk to us. There seemed to be another entertainments team there aswell (club something) I don’t really know what it was but think it was for the French.   Not much evening entertainment, personally would’ve liked a bit more, but I remember in Morocco they didn’t have much of an evening entertainment line-up either so maybe it’s just they don’t really do much.   Excursions  Can’t remember his name, but the guy in the hotel booked our excursions for us and he was very nice and helpful.  Paid £150 for 2 of us to do quad biking (highly recommend!!!) and horse-riding on the beach (I’d never been on a horse in my life, but loved it)   We also managed to get a camel ride on the beach, we had no money to give him so we just asked to have a photo, and next thing u know.. we were both having a ride on the camel. He asked for money after, I said I told him we had no money and he said don’t worry but then demanded some after.  We only had 20 diner on us so we just  gave him that.   Shopping The medina 5 mins away was great!  The rovers return had great filler steak and the best Sunday roast dinner (pre-book the roast)  A taxi to hammamet city was 15 diner (£3.50) worth a visit and the shop prices here were so much cheaper than the ones near the hotel!  Always haggle prices!  We averagely paid £8-30 for a bag depending on quality  Got lots of goodies cheap. Sunglasses £5 Got a taxi to the Nabeul  Friday market at 8:30am, cost 30 diner , really good!  If you love cats as much as I do, I’d probably recommend not looking down the side streets , I saw tiny day old kittens getting stood on and kicked by people and it was heart breaking, I had to take time out of the market to compose myself as I just couldn’t stop crying, it was heart breaking! We also saw chickens get picked and about to be.. well.. you know… and also cows heads.. so definitely not for the faint hearted.  But definitely an eye opener as to how they live in Tunisia.  Overall, would we stay here again. Yes!  (If we got it for the same price again) it was worth the price we paid for a cheap getaway where everyone was so nice and everything was good.

food in restaurant a lot to be desired.more variety of English food .Hotel very clean staff very good can't do enough for you .Ahmed and slim are excellent behind main bar. Pool area is very big and lots of beds and umbrellas .Animation team very good thanks for chef khayam oussama and maryem

We spent a wonderful week with family , excellent hotel very well located , we had the room sea view very nice view of the port of Hammamet , varied buffet and very good , I thank all the animation team who did an excellent work very good atmosphere thank you to chef khayam as well as Osama and mariem .

Beautiful hotel on all sides , nice location , pleasant family stay , the food was very good and varied we had new dishes every day , I thank all the entertainment team to their head khayam , Osama and mariem .

This is an extraordinary wonderful hotel  The staff is great welcome and very helpful The food is very good  The room very nice and clean  The very formidable animation team  Thank you for chef khayam Osama and Mariam

We got here in time for lunch, standard fayre for A/I, (buffet style) which was fine for us, as we can eat just about anything. And if you like liver and fish, you will be in heaven. The food could be a little warmer. It was all cooked well, just not as hot as we would prefer it to be. Omelettes/crepes and dough nuts made fresh in the morning.  Always something on the griddle for lunch and dinner.  **Try and use the same waiter as they will make sure you have a table with your drinks at meal times. It did get a little busy as the week went on.** Shown to the room by a bell boy, who was knowledgeable and saw to our needs.  Room was fine with our sea view. Although the street/road noise was audible, can put that down to being on the 1st floor. The housekeeping ladies were in every day to change towels and make up room.  Our smoke alarm in the room was faulty, and after 3 goes at trying to fix this, ended up being disconnected. (I had to sign a waiver stating that this would be OK). There are notices saying they are 'upgrading the alarms' and to notify reception if your alarm isn't working, or working too much.  **Lobby/Terrace bar and staff were just the best and in no way could we fault them, and went over and above to accommodate us. These guys were engaging, took interest and are a credit to the hotel.** Pool bar was fine, we didn't use it that much.  Snack bar in the afternoon was a bit hit and miss, when we did use it everything was freshly made and tasty.  Although the animation team were out and about, we weren't that interested, they did seem to be busy enough and they did try to engage us in their activities. Night time entertainment, we didn't go to. So can't comment on that.  **Now the Spa - JUST GO + BOOK IT! It may be a bit more expensive than what you're used to paying, but boy is it worth it! Was so good we went back on the last day! The girls are professional and took notice if you had an area that was tender.**  Photographers were around the hotel most days and nights, if that's your thing.  The WiFi was a bit hit and miss in our room, although speaking to others, theirs was fine. In the lobby/pool areas the signal was better.  Would I go back? Most definitely!

reviews.review_title: Not worthy of a 4 star with dirt and dilapidated rooms!
reviews.review_text: To escape if you like cleanliness!! Dilapidated rooms and cleaning not done, we arrived in a dirty room! We changed rooms three times. An embarrassment to a so-called 4-star hotel! Very strong bleach smell mixed with moisture, many return trips to the reception with slow elevators because the room card does not work after a while (forced to go back through the reception to re-magnetize it). The food was not up to our taste, but it remains subjective! Others liked it, it takes something for everyone. Non-subjective reviews: dilapidated rooms and shameful cleaning. The facilitators are very kind and do what they can, but we haven’t seen any daytime entertainment. Maybe in May it is quieter... We arrived on the wrong weekend because many locals were there and it was clearly a mess! It’s not the hotel’s fault, though. What is the fault of the hotel is the cleanliness, the problems of elevators, room cards, the handle of the door of our room that remained in the hand, the rust in the bathroom, the flooring horribly laid, the simply disgusting floor in our room! The hotel has not been sufficiently renovated for a 4 star! A slice of pizza as a taste for all inclusive is very light too... A review remains subjective, people less looking at cleanliness will tell you that it is a superb hotel and other people like us will really not be happy! It’s up to you to see but big downside on the cleanliness of the rooms and the renovation of the rooms that is far from finished! The hosts and Ahmed very nice, the hostess of the reception very nice at first, but in the end it got worse... We will not go back to this hotel!

I love the hotel very good location, impeccable cleanliness, varied food, very good atmosphere all the employees are friendly and smiling, animation at the top always at the rendezvous thanks to the chef khayam, Osama and Meriem you are at the top of the top thanks to you we had a pleasant stay again thank you

Very good hotel, the service was top, the employees all smiling and very professional, good food varied menu, a big crush for a housekeeper named Amel and especially for the animators Meriem and Osama, the atmosphere was top not to mention activities, bravo and good continuation ❤️

Very good hotel, all inclusive with beautiful sea view rooms.The team is at the top, always available. Pool very clean and large. Location well with the sea right in front, nearby port and souk not far. Be careful not to be fooled by different types of scams at the souk like the fake hotel server.

Its my first time in this hotel . I like the foods and the rooms are so clean bar service is professional chef abd satar big respect for the animation team they are so freindly and respectfully. I will come back so soon for this paradise . Thanks to all

What can you say about this hotel? First impressions are lovely. We got there had to wait two hours for our rooms. The rooms are very old and dirty. Me and my friends stayed here for two weeks. We had one lot of clean towels and our beds was changed once  the whole time we were there my room never got cleaned but they cleaned the balcony which I could never understand. it had one bar open and are limited drinks I asked for bottled water to take to my room on many occasions. I was told no. There was no snack bar in the day they put a tray of food by the bar. there’s no fridges hairdryers in the rooms. It is nothing like the pictures on the Internet all entertainment is done in the nightclub where people are smoking and children do their mini disco. It’s absolutely disgusting. It’s not disabled friendly and if you find steps hard to go up and down this place is full of them and if you complain about anything, you don’t get anywhere it says all inclusive but it’s not because you’ve got to pay extra mattresses for the sunbeds are five dinar a day that’s by the pool and on the beach the bar by reception, you have to pay for drinks if you want to have a drink there. Most of the staff are nice some of them are really rude they asked you for cigarettes. Even the guards on the gates asked you to get them cigarettes when you go out of the gates to go to the shop. We were sat by the pool there was work going on they were painting doing things round the pool. It wasn’t a relaxing holiday. The entertainment team are really good. The only thing is there’s a few of them that spend all their time pestering young girls which isn’t very nice to see. I would not recommend this hotel. It’s the worst hotel I’ve been to in Tunisia.

Good value for money for a three star. Friendly and smiling staff at all times with a sense of customer service. Good quality and varied food. Animators at the top and pleasant  Friendly and with direct access to the sea  Both pools are clean

reviews.review_title: Always a pleasure to come back. A warm welcome , nice staff, clean , meals are good, a team of animators
reviews.review_text: Always a pleasure to come back. A warm welcome , pleasant staff, clean , meals are good, a team of animation at the top and an exceptional chef. I recommend this hotel. Thanks to the whole team I'll be back. Good value for money
Friendly staff and always available and helpful  Quality food for a three star  Family friendly and warm club  Ideal location with pool and sea  Team of facilitators at the top All staff are smiling

We arrived at 10.35pm and as all inclusive closed at 11 they told us to go for a drink so we didn't miss the bar. We checked in just after 11pm and was taken to our room we have 4 bed and a flat screen to with a balcony. Room was clean only had to ask for towels. Next morning went for breakfast and the omelette was amazing. Coffee machine was awsum. The staff in restaurant was always on the go any wanted to please everyone. They set up a lovly table and made a cake for my hubby's bday which was lovly  Pool side always clean The beach was amazing Food was good Staff polite If only 2 things I think they should improve on would be more variety of drink on the all inclusive And more entertainment especially around pool area.   Also think there should be free ice cream for people during the day.   Other than that had an amazing time would decfo recommend for a budget holiday. I will deffo be re visiting.   Thanks caren and Charlie

There was 8 in our party one being a 2 year child !! When we arrived they couldn’t find our booking !! So they told us to go get something to eat !! We are all tired & stressed by this time !! When we came back they had sorted out rooms for us 🤣 well if that’s what you can call them !! They were dark and dingy smelled of smoke and damp we were all split up all over the complex!! No wifi in any rooms only the club !! Which was an inconvenience as we couldn’t contact anyone!! We complained about the rooms and miraculous they found us 4 rooms all together!! They we expecting a 2 year old to sleep on a bunkbed with a hard tiled floor no offer of a cot !! No fridges in rooms to keep drinks cold !! And the rooms & tvs very dated and didn’t work properly nothing like the brouchures  advertising the hotel !! The food was diabolical it was meant to be multiple choice it was repetitive and vile !! We asked for water on more then on occasion and got refused until we complained!! Especially as you have to use the water to clean your teeth etc !! We got told we were drinking to much !! The whole complex was a disaster from start to finish !! The entertainment of an evening was in a carpeted room and you could smoke in there it was disgusting 🤢 all inclusive means you offer food throughout the day this was not the case !! There was a limited bar too !! Beer wine of vodka nothing else unless you complained!! Definitely a waste of money we will not be going back!!!

The worst holiday we have had!  To start when we arrived it took over an hour to check in to then be told they need to find the rooms we booked. We were then told to go eat while they did this.   We go to our rooms where we were far away from each other. When going into the room it smelt of damp, they were filthy. It hadn’t been cleaned it looked like someone had used the bath, the pictures when booking look nothing like what we was given, in one of our friends rooms there was mould in a bedside table. We then got given rooms as near each other after complaining. In the new rooms one of the showers was broke and was still filthy.   The food choice is very limited and repetitive. Barely edible and always cold.   We paid for all inclusive and was refused water on more than one occasion after complaining and telling them I will be posting this all online they have basically tried to bribe us they made us a table with a birthday cake and on another night they made us a table with a bottle of vodka and nibbles as one of our party posted a poor review.   Half of the amenities were closed, the ‘club’ where they did the entertainment was filthy and just smelt of smoke. There was live light wires just hanging out the wall. We asked for our rep to come to the hotel and he didn’t even bother showing up.   On one of the evenings a 2 year old shut himself in a room and they didn’t want to know, it took them over 30 mins to even open the door.   In one of the rooms there were bugs in the beds and all over the floor.  There is no wifi in the rooms, only in the reception.  They ran out of glasses and were giving drinks out in small paper coffee cups. There’s live wires sticking out the ground and walls. They have slides here and told us they are under construction but another worker told us they don’t even have a license for them.  Management really needs to look into the poor reviews as it is diabolical here.  It really is not worth the money to come here.  I’m awaiting a response on getting a refund.

First thing we see in the room was the toilet leaking always making noise, the tv didn’t work and the balcony door didn’t close all the way.  So they moved us to a different room and this room was not much better. The rooms in the photos on the website are completely different to the rooms we have seen. They say it’s all inclusive but you have to pay for icecream and sunbeds. And if you want to play football in the courts you have to pay.  The bar there was so poor that you had to walk all the way down to the main bar just to get a drink, because they don’t want to open the bar up at the pool yet. And the drinks you have come in a little plastic cup like I’m a kid.  The food here was not the best, most nights we had to eat out, just so we could eat. We fully understand traditional food, but there’s kids and people with various allergies etc, typical simplistic food would have safised.  When the cleaner come in to clean the room they moved all of are clothes around. Like don’t touch my stuff.  Overall, not satisfied and won’t be returning the pictures used on various holiday websites of the hotel/rooms etc  are very deceiving.  Slides aren’t open due to not having a license for it which isn’t stated prior to coming, why show them if you cannot use them?

reviews.review_title: great all-inclusive stay with friendly staff and fun activities
reviews.review_text: we had an amazing stay, all the people of the staff were very friendly and helpful. they were very welcoming, which is always nice. the check-in went smoothly. the room was clean and had everything we needed. the area by the pool and the beach was nice and relaxing. there were also a lot of activities to do during the day and evening thanks to the entertainment team.  Overall, it was a very enjoyable and stress-free holiday. would definitely recommend and go again!

reviews.review_title: Enjoyable experience and would visit again
reviews.review_text: Just come back from a solo holiday to Club Selima, from the moment I checked in to the moment I checked out all the staff were very friendly and welcoming. The cleaners came every day and the food was good. Entertainment staff were excellent and made my holiday very enjoyable. The hotel is located right on the beach which I loved. Overall the hotel was excellent value for money and I wouldn’t hesitate on visiting again.

Hello      This is my first visit to the hotel, and I deliberately kept my expectations modest to avoid disappointment—especially since I have traveled to several countries including France, Germany, Switzerland, and Japan.      However, to my pleasant surprise, the interior of the hotel and its overall ambiance were truly exceptional. As the saying goes, "Don't judge a book by its cover," and that certainly proved to be true in this case.  The staff’s treatment was wonderful starting from the reception to the security personnel. A particularly outstanding aspect was the presence of Miss Amira, who is in charge of guest relations. She possesses a refined cultural, marketing, and social sensibility that clearly distinguishes her in her role.  I highly recommend everyone to visit this elegant hotel without hesitation.  Best regards, Dr. Bakhouche Bilal

This was our second visit to Club Selima, when we visited last year we had a great experience and returned again this year.  This year the food although traditional Tunisian as always was by far better than last year which is great. The hotel rooms are basic but perfectly suitable, the water is hot and the rooms cleaned everyday.  The whole hotel is constantly being cleaned and maintenance staff always doing stuff within the grounds. The activities available tennis courts, basketball, beach volleyball etc. The animation team are pleasant and very engaging ask people to get involved with activities of which they try and do things all day.  The evening entertainment was the same as last year everyday something different but after 7 days they repeat again and it hasn’t changed a lot since last year which was a little disappointing but won’t stop us visiting again. The staff of the hotel are second to none always looking to please, the bar staff are great and we have made a few holiday friends for life in a lot of the staff.  We will definitely be returning next year. It may be a 3 star hotel but has 5 star elements
