I highly recommend this hotel , from the moment we arrived everyone was so nice and smiley ,polite and friendly any concerns or question we had would always be addressed , the rooms were okay 4 beds in the room lovely balcony , shower and was even provided complimentary shower gels & soaps too , the cleaners were lovely always checking all was okay if anything else needed doing , the animation team was amazing and friendly always getting everyone involved, the animation manager was lovely always translating if any problems for us ,the bar staff were always polite and helpful , receptionist lady were wonderful , restaurant staff were so lovely and any concern with food or anything they would always help , overall all the staff are amazing , for my first time in Tunisia , me & my daughter & my mum had an amazing time , my daughter loved mini club & the mini disco , we will be returning soon overall I loved my time and experience there , they have shops on site , restaurant and pizzeria , beach is a 2 minute walk out the back of the hotel , 2 big pools & a baby pool , lifeguards by pool always and security 24/7 in the hotel I haven’t felt so safe in my life will definitely be returning with the rest of my family soon !!! Another thing my daughter kept going on about Mickey Mouse coming so two of the animation team  dressed up for her (Mario & Mexi) , a big shout to the  Aynar  who does mini club made my daughter feel safe and very entertained and to the rest of animation team everyone was amazing and made my experience amazing ! Can’t wait to return again soon

CLUB SELIMA in August 2024, we all liked the service, the food is good, the staff very welcoming, clean room, secure private parking, private beach. Animation TOP.  Big thank you to the whole team, I booked again for the month of June 2025 inchallah.

Goood hotel and good food and serves We stayed as a family of 3 adults. From when we arrived at the hotel we were hungry and they told us to go into the restaurant to eat before we checked in. Check in was quick and we were helped with our luggage into our room. The room was outdated which for us it didn't matter as rooms were cleaned each day and hot water we weren't in the room for much of the day so it didn't bother us. The resort is big and the pools are great! The beach is beautiful and sandy. The animation team are really nice and really involve you to take part in activities. There is a guy called Mr Banana man who sells excursions if your looking to do some activities outside the hotel.

We stayed as a family of 3 adults. From when we arrived at the hotel we were hungry and they told us to go into the restaurant to eat before we checked in. Check in was quick and we were helped with our luggage into our room. The room was outdated which for us it didn't matter as rooms were cleaned each day and hot water we weren't in the room for much of the day so it didn't bother us. The resort is big and the pools are great! The beach is beautiful and sandy. The animation team are really nice and really involve you to take part in activities. There is a guy called Mr Banana man who sells excursions if your looking to do some activities outside the hotel. There are shops that are a 5 minute walk from the hotel if needing essentials etc. We got a tunisian sim card which was 42 dinar for 25gb of data so you don't need to use your UK sim as can be costly. The bar staff will bring your drinks to you whilst your at the pool which I thought was great! The staff are very helpful and polite including the waiters etc. Food here for us was excellent and reached above my expectations for a 3 star. If your looking for chips, chicken nuggets then don't book here as everything is traditional food. They have a pasta station and a pizza station if you can't find anything to eat. Desserts are lovely and for us we enjoyed the food. I can't fault this place and I'm sad to leave. Alot of the guests we met have booked 9-10 days here. There are jet skis and paragliding on the beach if you want to do some water sports. We went out for dinner a couple of times to the hard rock cafe which is a bit like TGIS and have entertainment there also. Its a 10 minute walk from the hotel. No issues or problems whilst we have been here and I would definitely recommend if your looking for a cheap getaway. Please do not book if your looking for 5 star with a 3 star budget! Good value for money!

Very pleasant stay  I spent a family stay at EL MOURADI CLUB SELIMA in August 2024, we all liked the service, the food is good, the staff very welcoming, clean room, secure private parking, private beach. Animation TOP.  Big thank you to the whole team, I booked again for the month of June 2025 inchallah.   I hope you keep the same level of service.  See you soon

Not anything like advertised pictures, the place is filthy. No clean towels in the room. That’s after a 5 hr wait to get in it. Rooms dirty and broken furniture .Food and beverages recycled from other guests leftovers and  served again. All inclusive ???? Vodka, whiskey or beer that’s it and again recycled soft drinks poured into Fanta or coke bottles. If you are just looking at reviews before you book then go elsewhere and if you have booked phone your agent now and change. There is no pool bar as advertised and snacks are non existent.  Pool area filthy and broken.  I have been to Tunisia a few times and the place and people are lovely, please don’t let this be your first experience. I see all replies to negative reviews has been copy and paste so I fully expect that also.  Please don’t waste your money or risk your health, book a different hotel. This place in all honesty should be shut down

Please don't go to this place.. rooms are disgusting, we were shown 5 rooms before got one clean enough. To stay in. We went with love holidays and tried to contact rep, trying to get him was impossible.. so we had to stay. WiFi only available in reception so this added to issues getting rep. Never seen him the whole holiday. Food was mostly inedible.. and mostly not warm. The cleanliness of the dinning room was not great, out of date hygiene certificate on display. Staff , it was a 50/50 split between nice and grumpy. I know id deffo be grumpy working there. Even shop keepers in near by shops said it was the worst place, that they only open for season and close again, they don't put money back into the hotel or area. Has totally put me off the country and dont think I will return. Which if every body done this would not be good for tourism in Tunisia. Only good bit was the beach, it was beautiful

reviews.review_title: The setting was very beautiful but just I kept a bad memory of the staff
reviews.review_text: I have a bad memory of a person who presented himself as in charge of the control department his name is khouloud She was harassing me to help her because her family was in need I was naive and finally it was a scam  It ruined my stay  Tunisian hotels should better control their staff

Pension afue! The reception staff is arrogant.the security guards are noisy at late or very early hours.The rooms are not soundproof.old and uncomfortable bedding not to mention bedbugs.the catering is null, very limited in choice and repetitive not to mention the poor quality of food. No wifi and air conditioning in the rooms.to go to the beach you have to cross houses and a puddle of sewers to get to rocks that I will not call a beach at all. This Inn does not deserve a star!!

Very friendly hotel if it was maintained what a pity...because lovely staff throughout the Inn little wink at Sam (restaurant) and Nabil ( secu ) great people ... The rooms are in very bad condition and the cleaning is very very minimal dirty and stained bath sheets broken and rusty just like the taps, completely different from the lobby of the Inn where everything is very nice. The Pension is perfect. The food is good but always the same especially when you stay 15 days. The private beach is really not possible the same on the whole coast around the Pension you have to go further on Nabeul. Big black spot when you are with children, really a shame especially when you see that some employees throw their cigarettes on the sidewalks when they should respect the place for their customers. Really hard to have clean places around. Suitable for the Award.

The pictures from the offer do not correspond to reality. The pool is small, the beach is not like the pictures, there is no beach bar either. The beach is as dirty as a garbage dump. The offer states that there is a Fitness Club and animations, but none of these things are available. The rooms are very dirty, the cleaners do not clean as they should. The air conditioning is moldy, they only speak English in the hotel, the Internet does not work. The view from the window is of garbage cans.

reviews.review_title: Excellent stay and very good address
reviews.review_text: Despite the 3 stars of the establishment the staff is very welcoming, the receptionist houcem is attentive and very responsive, the waiter and lifeguard team are of great professionalism, the meals are plentiful, and the chef very attentive, the location is well located and a big thank you to all the staff.

I stayed 3 weeks at the hotel, warm welcome and great care. Nabil and the rest of the staff were friendly and attentive to customers. Very clean room, hearty and very good meal, very kind manager and employees.

Noise  Hotel too noisy, especially the dog who barks all night and the housekeeper on the 3rd floor who is unpleasant and rude who makes too much noise by shouting loudly in the corridor. The cleaning ladies violently slam the doors.  Restaurant  Late opening of dinner 8 p.m. always 15 minutes late The meats are not cooked: they look like plastic. Very little choice and lack of taste  The dishes are cold even the soup is cold   Household   Can do better   Security  A very senior security officer is not very friendly with customers: his other colleagues are more friendly with customers  Beach filled with pebbles and rocks  A nice swimming pool  Hotel that has aged badly and some unpleasant people who ruined our vacation.  Reception  You have to call him several times for the same technical problem because he doesn't call the technical service, so you wait for nothing. Service that leaves something to be desired, especially in the afternoon and evening.

This human-scale hotel by the sea is undergoing renovation of the rooms. The staff is friendly, the medium sized swimming pool is very pleasant. Breakfast offers a wide choice and the dinner dishes are very good. Given the deterioration of hotels in Tunisia, the management of this one seems efficient and selects its customers. It is hoped that this will continue over time. A small downside however: The wifi is almost non-existent in the rooms and works irregularly in the common areas.

The hotel Great location Very pretty hotel with clean reception and corridors. Except in the bedrooms there are bathtubs without stoppers so with children it's complicated.  The bed sheets were all stained pretty hard to sleep in such circumstances... Very unfortunate because apart from the room it is a good hotel. The little extra is the bar where you can enjoy the evening by the pool.

Very good stay in this magnificent hotel. Hotel that would be nothing without the presence of its fabulous staff. Very difficult to write a review when everything is so perfect that you would have to invent words to describe the kindness, presence and professionalism of the team. Special mention for the delicious cuisine of the restaurant and its staff. I'll be back !

reviews.review_title: Honest review! It's not worth 3 stars
reviews.review_text: My opinion is without fuss or exaggeration. So the cleanliness leaves much to be desired (dirty floors and traces of stools in the toilets) after this is Tunisia, nevertheless our sheets were clean and the bed comfortable (note: double bed = 2 beds pushed together) The night guards were great, the poor ones don't have a lot of fun even though they are just employees, the problem is the managers who don't really care about customer reviews, the swimming pool is pleasant when there is no too many people, the breakfast is not great, the orange juice is sachets diluted in water, the milk is the same.. the rest is correct. In terms of parking, don't expect us to have space easily, the popular places are reserved for the boss's colleagues who come to drink in the evening ;).. No wifi in the rooms, that’s true! And French channels yes but only 4 or 5. A LOT of noise, people don't respect anything, speak loudly, slam doors violently and often and we were extremely lucky to have work done above our room! 👍🏻 It's a 3 shooting star hotel, I've spent better nights in ibises in France which don't have any stars..

Avoid, cleanliness needs to be reviewed in this hotel. There is no shower in the toilets. The hotel has potential but I find that it is not highlighted. It deserves to be renovated, the breakfast needs to be reviewed Personally I will never return to this hotel unless after renovation.

Regarding the staff they are very nice and very helpful, regarding the hotel and its infrastructure, it looks like it dates from the 70s, vitus air conditioning does not work properly, no safe in the rooms or at the reception, Wi-Fi non-existent in the rooms but remains correct at the reception level, and no fridge in the rooms, this hotel deserves a general reflection

Disgusting and dirty. The cleaners sat in my balcony while I was down in the pool. My credentials were in the room and anything could have been taken. Not recommended! When you talk to the manager, he says that they would clean and then I said that it was my check-out in about an hour and it was not professional to sit in my balcony and look out at the pool.

Nice hotel with a nice view on the sea and on a beautiful sunset. Great service even with the current circumstances.  Thank you !   Très bon hôtel, belle vue sur la mer et sur le coucher de soleil. Très bon service. Merci !

This hotel is filthy and run down. The staff are very friendly and want to make you feel welcome, but they have nothing to work with. The pictures are not representative of what is there. The patio door was unlockable, clearly been forced. The bedding dirty. Some sheets had blood on them. Cracked tiles on the floor and in the bathroom and the tap ran brown water. The beach was desolate, dirty and the beach hut a now broken down uncared for shell, to get to it you would have to cross a stretch of land littered with rubbish and occupied by stray dogs. There is more, but this should be enough to stop you going.

Good services for a 3*, a little hotel and the personnel are making a real effort to satisfy their clients, guys don’t forget that you get what you pay for, when you pay a little amount of money in a 3* hotel don’t wait to have a vacation like you get in 5* hotels...  un bon rapport qualité prix.

Visited fore 1 night We was upgraded by Mohammed  in the reception to the suite on 3 floor. Very nice   BUT..it was not cleaned Aircon not working the persienne in the room not working..the waterpressure in Deutsch nearly not existing. Lock to room not working proper.1 sheet to all guest Bad smell, also in the hall and staircase of old smoke.and so on. Escalater not working old people climping 3 stores..in hot condition. The service at the pool was not polite OR educated...serving old whitewin tasting eddike... The reception was good.

lots of people are really critical but you get what you pay for yes the hotel needs a bit of tlc but the food is plentiful the staff work really hard and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. We had a brilliant holiday here in august 2018

I stayed at the Byzance in May of this year for 6 nights. I arrived late at night and was shown my room, it was a sea facing room which I thought was ok.  Until daylight hit and I could see the mess. The land behind the hotel was not very picturesque but looked more like a dumping ground. A few locals lived here but didn't seem to keep it tidy.  The only good thing about the view was the stray cats, 13 in total that I counted, to which I ended up spending my days feeding and watering them.  They made my holiday, as there was literally nothing else to do here.  The hotel pool was freezing cold and to uncomfortable to swim in, so sitting on the edge was as far as I managed lol.  Luckily only had a couple of really hot days whilst there.   The hotel itself wasn't up to much, nothing like the pictures it advertises, nothing to do in the evenings, no entertainment as such, a man and a keyboard playing the same songs every night.  Nothing i wanted to sit and listen to night after night and he played late into the night which was loud and annoying when trying to sleep. My room was on the 1st floor, which luckily got changed on the night I arrived from the 3rd floor, the night time manager was kind enough to give me the choice of rooms, which I was grateful for.  Even back in May the lift wan't working so after reading recent reviews I don't believe it ever has worked. I used the hamman whilst there I had a lovely massage from the lady who was lovely, she was friendly and tried her hardest to speak english, we managed to have a laugh at least.   The food, what can I say, it was mostly edible, chicken n fish almost every meal, and liver, blurrrrrrr, hate the stuff and it was served most days, but at least the cats liked it haha.   For some reason this hotels bar/cafe was very popular with the local men, who would sit for hours with their coffee n cake smoking and watching the female guests, very unnerving.  But the lobby bar was clean n tidy at all times. The All-Inclusive bar however was not, it was run down and dirty behind the bar, could do with a good clean up and maybe some new fridges. The Wifi however was only accessible from the lobby, it barely reached the rooms or out by the pool. Apart from all the above I had a pleasant stay, I was looking for a relaxing holiday and thats what I got, simply because there was nothing to do there. no trips where offered to me, some people went on a boat trip which they said was ok but the sea was freezing cold.  Would have liked to have gone into Hammamet but never got round to it. All in all I wouldn't recommend Nabeul as a holiday destination, or The Byzance hotel. Go to Hammamet or Yasmine Hammamet as I've heard their more geared up for the traveller.  This is not my first visit to Tunisia, I've been to Port El Kantaoui before and loved it there, the Tunisian people are wonderful and friendly I hope the country can recover from the past atrocity that happened that very sad day on the beach.    Last but not least anyone travelling to The Byzance Hotel please look after the cats out the back, they rely on the holiday makers to feed them, some are brave enough to even come into the hotel grounds and restaurant looking for food, the others however live in the tree out back and never come down. I found if I threw food from my balcony onto the roof of the house they actually got fed.

reviews.review_title: Absolutely horrible! You do not get what you pay for. Terrible hotel.
reviews.review_text: This hotel is horrible, It matches nothing to the description. The spa for the hamam was closed during the full two weeks of staying there. As soon as we landed we had to wait 1and half hours to get our family room. We weren’t shown around the hotel no one assisted us with taking our luggage up. The lift had gotten stuck whilst inside it. We finally got used to getting around the hotel. The only good thing about the hotel was the cleanliness around, the cleaners were good at doing there jobs. Some of the staff were lovely. However some of the staff were very very rude...I mean I’ve been to better three star hotels. We requested a fridge and paid for it and received it a whole week after renting it out. We then received it and the plug wouldn’t fit due to the size of the fridge. The fridge was absolutely disgusting. The rooms are not child friendly there are many health and safety hazards. The electrics are hanging down from the phone there’s cracks in the floor tiles. The door has no lock on the terrace. I can not stress how much of a rubbish hotel this place is!!! If your going on holiday with children this is not the place to stay. Tunisia is a beautiful place and in fact it’s my 7th time staying in Tunisia but this hotel is absolutely disgusting. There’s no entertainment for the children. It’s just not a hotel you’d want to stay at. The food is terrible everything about it is just horrible.
